﻿ [JOHN GALSWORTHY THE MAN]162-john galsworthy the man OF PROPERTY PART I CHAPTER [I]0-i - ' AT [HOME]436-home ' AT [OLD JOLYON]163-old jolyon 'S [Those privileged to be present at a family festival of the Forsytes]437-those privileged to be present at a family festival of the forsytes have seen that charming and instructive sight - [an upper middle - class family in full plumage]438-an upper middle - class family in full plumage . But whosoever of [these favoured persons]439-these favoured persons has possessed the gift of psychological analysis a talent without monetary value and properly ignored by [the Forsytes]164-soames , has witnessed a spectacle , not only delightful in itself , but illustrative of an obscure human problem . In plainer words , [he]162-john galsworthy the man has gleaned from a gathering of [this family]440-this family - [no branch of which had a liking for the other]441-no branch of which had a liking for the other , between [no three members of whom existed anything worthy of the name of sympathy]442-no three members of whom existed anything worthy of the name of sympathy - evidence of that mysterious concrete tenacity which renders [a family so formidable a unit of society , so clear a reproduction of society in miniature]443-a family so formidable a unit of society , so clear a reproduction of society in miniature . [He]162-john galsworthy the man has been admitted to a vision of the dim roads of social progress , has understood something of patriarchal life , of the swarmings of [savage hordes]444-savage hordes , of the rise and fall of [nations]445-nations . [He]162-john galsworthy the man is like one who , having watched a tree grow from its planting - a paragon of tenacity , insulation , and success , amidst the deaths of a hundred other plants less fibrous , sappy , and persistent - one day will see it flourishing with bland , full foliage , in an almost repugnant prosperity , at the summit of its efflorescence . On June 15 , eighteen eighty - six , about four of the afternoon , [the observer who chanced to be present]446-the observer who chanced to be present at [the house of [old Jolyon Forsyte]165-old jolyon in [Stanhope Gate]1-stanhope gate]447-the house of old jolyon forsyte in stanhope gate , might have seen the highest efflorescence of [the Forsytes]164-soames . This was the occasion of an ' at [home]436-home ' to celebrate the engagement of [Miss June Forsyte]166-june , [[old Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's granddaughter]449-old jolyon 's granddaughter , to [Mr. Philip Bosinney]168-bosinney . In the bravery of light gloves , buff waistcoats , feathers and frocks , [the family]450-the family were present , even [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann , who now but seldom left the corner of [[her]169-aunt ann brother]451-her brother [[Timothy]170-timothy 's green drawing - room]452-timothy 's green drawing - room , where , under the aegis of a plume of dyed pampas grass in a light blue vase , [she]169-aunt ann sat all day reading and knitting , surrounded by the effigies of [three generations of [Forsytes]164-soames]453-three generations of forsytes . Even [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann was [there]454-there ; [her]169-aunt ann inflexible back , and the dignity of [her]169-aunt ann calm old face personifying the rigid possessiveness of the family idea . When [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte was engaged , married , or born , [the Forsytes]164-soames were present ; when [a Forsyte]166-june died - but [no Forsyte]456-no forsyte had as yet died ; [they]456-no forsyte did not die ; death being contrary to [their]456-no forsyte principles , [they]456-no forsyte took precautions against it , the instinctive precautions of [highly vitalized persons who resent encroachments on [[their]457-highly vitalized persons who resent encroachments on their property property]458-their property]457-highly vitalized persons who resent encroachments on their property . About [the Forsytes]164-soames mingling that day with [the crowd of other guests]459-the crowd of other guests , there was a more than ordinarily groomed look , an alert , inquisitive assurance , a brilliant respectability , as though [they]456-no forsyte were attired in defiance of something . The habitual sniff on the face of [Soames Forsyte]171-soames had spread through [their]456-no forsyte ranks ; [they]456-no forsyte were on [their]456-no forsyte guard . The subconscious offensiveness of [their]456-no forsyte attitude has constituted [[old Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's ' home]460-old jolyon 's ' home ' the psychological moment of the family history , made it the prelude of [their]456-no forsyte drama . [The Forsytes]164-soames were resentful of something , not individually , but as [a family]461-a family ; this resentment expressed itself in an added perfection of raiment , an exuberance of family cordiality , an exaggeration of family importance , and - the sniff . Danger - so indispensable in bringing out the fundamental quality of any society , group , or individual - was what [the Forsytes]164-soames scented ; the premonition of danger put a burnish on [their]456-no forsyte armour . For the first time , as [a family]461-a family , [they]456-no forsyte appeared to have an instinct of being in contact , with some strange and unsafe thing . Over against [the piano]463-the piano [a man of bulk and stature]464-a man of bulk and stature was wearing two waistcoats on [his]464-a man of bulk and stature wide chest , two waistcoats and a ruby pin , instead of the single satin waistcoat and diamond pin of more usual occasions , and [his]464-a man of bulk and stature shaven , square , old face , the colour of pale leather , with pale eyes , had its most dignified look , above [his]464-a man of bulk and stature satin stock . This was [Swithin Forsyte]172-swithin . Close to the window , where [he]464-a man of bulk and stature could get more than [his]464-a man of bulk and stature fair share of fresh air , [the other twin]465-the other twin , [James]173-james - [the fat and the lean of it]466-the fat and the lean of it , [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon called [these brothers]467-these brothers - like [the bulky Swithin]172-swithin , over six feet in height , but very lean , as though destined from [his]464-a man of bulk and stature birth to strike a balance and maintain an average , brooded over the scene with [his]464-a man of bulk and stature permanent stoop ; [his]464-a man of bulk and stature grey eyes had an air of fixed absorption in some secret worry , broken at intervals by a rapid , shifting scrutiny of surrounding facts ; [his]464-a man of bulk and stature cheeks , thinned by two parallel folds , and a long , clean - shaven upper lip , were framed within Dundreary whiskers . In [his]464-a man of bulk and stature hands [he]464-a man of bulk and stature turned and turned a piece of china . Not far off , listening to [a lady in brown]468-a lady in brown , [[his]464-a man of bulk and stature only son]469-his only son [Soames]164-soames , pale and well - shaved , dark - haired , rather bald , had poked [his]469-his only son chin up sideways , carrying [his]469-his only son nose with that aforesaid appearance of ' sniff , ' as though despising an egg which [he]469-his only son knew [he]469-his only son could not digest . Behind [him]464-a man of bulk and stature [[his]464-a man of bulk and stature cousin]470-his cousin , [the tall George , son of [the fifth Forsyte]472-the fifth forsyte]471-the tall george , son of the fifth forsyte , [Roger]317-roger , had a Quilpish look on [his]471-the tall george , son of the fifth forsyte fleshy face , pondering one of [his]471-the tall george , son of the fifth forsyte sardonic jests . Something inherent to the occasion had affected [them]473-them all . Seated in a row close to [one another]474-one another were [three ladies]475-three ladies - [Aunts Ann]175-aunts ann , [Hester]476-hester [the two Forsyte maids]477-the two forsyte maids , and [Juley short for Julia]176-juley , who [not in first youth]478-not in first youth had so far forgotten [herself]479-she as to marry [Septimus Small]177-soames , [a man of poor constitution]480-a man of poor constitution . [She]479-she had survived [him]480-a man of poor constitution for many years . With [[her]479-she elder]481-her elder and [younger sister]482-younger sister [she]479-she lived now in [the house of [Timothy]170-timothy]483-the house of timothy , [[her]479-she sixth and youngest brother]484-her sixth and youngest brother , on [the Bayswater Road]485-the bayswater road . [Each of [these ladies]487-these ladies]486-each of these ladies held fans in [their]486-each of these ladies hands , and each with some touch of colour , some emphatic feather or brooch , testified to the solemnity of the opportunity . In the centre of [the room]488-the room , under the chandelier , as became [a host]489-a host , stood [the head of [the family]450-the family]490-the head of the family , [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon [himself]167-young jolyon . Eighty years of age , with [his]167-young jolyon fine , white hair , [his]167-young jolyon dome - like forehead , [his]167-young jolyon little , dark grey eyes , and an immense white moustache , which drooped and spread below the level of [his]167-young jolyon strong jaw , [he]167-young jolyon had a patriarchal look , and in spite of lean cheeks and hollows at [his]167-young jolyon temples , seemed master of perennial youth . [He]167-young jolyon held [himself]167-young jolyon extremely upright , and [his]167-young jolyon shrewd , steady eyes had lost none of their clear shining . Thus [he]167-young jolyon gave an impression of superiority to the doubts and dislikes of [smaller men]492-smaller men . Having had [his]167-young jolyon own way for innumerable years , [he]167-young jolyon had earned a prescriptive right to it . It would never have occurred to [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon that it was necessary to wear a look of doubt or of defiance . Between [him]167-young jolyon and [the four other brothers who were present]493-the four other brothers who were present , [James]173-james , [Swithin]172-swithin , [Nicholas]178-nicholas , and [Roger]317-roger , there was much difference , much similarity . In turn , [each of [these four brothers]495-these four brothers]494-each of these four brothers was very different from the other , yet [they]495-these four brothers , too , were alike . Through the varying features and expression of those five faces could be marked a certain steadfastness of chin , underlying surface distinctions , marking a racial stamp , too prehistoric to trace , too remote and permanent to discuss - the very hall - mark and guarantee of [the family]450-the family fortunes . Among [the younger generation]497-the younger generation , in [the tall , bull - like George]498-the tall , bull - like george , in pallid strenuous [Archibald]179-archibald , in [young Nicholas]178-nicholas with [his]178-nicholas sweet and tentative obstinacy , in the grave and foppishly determined [Eustace]180-eustace , there was this same stamp - less meaningful perhaps , but unmistakable - a sign of something ineradicable in the family soul . At one time or another during the afternoon , [all these faces , so dissimilar and so alike]499-all these faces , so dissimilar and so alike , had worn an expression of distrust , the object of which was undoubtedly [the man whose acquaintance [they]501-they were thus assembled to make]500-the man whose acquaintance they were thus assembled to make . [Philip Bosinney]168-bosinney was known to be [a young man without fortune]502-a young man without fortune , but [Forsyte girls]503-forsyte girls had become engaged to such before , and had actually married [them]503-forsyte girls . It was not altogether for this reason , therefore , that the minds of [the Forsytes]164-soames misgave [them]501-they . [They]501-they could not have explained the origin of a misgiving obscured by the mist of family gossip . A story was undoubtedly told that [he]168-bosinney had paid [his]168-bosinney duty call to [Aunts Ann]175-aunts ann , [Juley]176-juley , and [Hester]181-aunt hester , in a soft grey hat - a soft grey hat , not even a new one - a dusty thing with a shapeless crown . " So , extraordinary , [[my]181-aunt hester dear]2282-my dear - so odd , "[181-aunt hester] [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester , passing through [the little , dark hall]504-the little , dark hall [she]181-aunt hester was rather short - sighted , had tried to ' shoo ' it off a chair , taking it for a strange , disreputable cat - [Tommy]182-tommy had [such disgraceful friends]505-such disgraceful friends ! [She]181-aunt hester was disturbed when it did not move . Like [an artist]506-an artist for ever seeking to discover the significant trifle which embodies the whole character of a scene , or place , or [person]507-person , so [those unconscious artists]508-those unconscious artists - [the Forsytes]164-soames had fastened by intuition on this hat ; it was [their]508-those unconscious artists significant trifle , the detail in which was embedded the meaning of the whole matter ; for each had asked [himself]168-bosinney : " Come , now , should [I]168-bosinney have paid that visit in that hat ? "[168-bosinney] and [each]509-each had answered " No ! "[509-each] and [some]510-some , with more imagination than others , had added : " It would never have come into [my]510-some head ! "[510-some] [George]183-george , on hearing the story , grinned . The hat had obviously been worn as a practical joke ! [He]183-george [himself]183-george was [a connoisseur of such]511-a connoisseur of such . " Very haughty ! "[183-george] [he]183-george said , " [the wild Buccaneer]2283-the wild buccaneer . "[183-george] And [this mot]512-this mot , the ' Buccaneer , ' was bandied from mouth to mouth , till it became the favourite mode of alluding to [Bosinney]168-bosinney . [[Her]181-aunt hester aunts]513-her aunts reproached [June]166-june afterwards about the hat . " [We]513-her aunts do n't think [you]166-june ought to let [him]168-bosinney , [dear]2284-dear ! [Phil]168-bosinney never knows what [he]515-a man 's got on ! "[166-june] [No one]514-no one had credited an answer so outrageous . [A man]515-a man not to know what [he]515-a man had on ? No , no ! What indeed was [this young man]516-this young man , who , in becoming engaged to [June]166-june , [[old Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's acknowledged heiress]517-old jolyon 's acknowledged heiress , had done so well for [himself]516-this young man ? [Dangerous]184-dangerous - ah , dangerous ! [June]166-june , of course , had not seen this , but , though not yet nineteen , [she]166-june was notorious . Had [she]166-june not said to [Mrs. Soames]177-soames - who was always so beautifully dressed - that feathers were vulgar ? [Mrs. Soames]177-soames had actually given up wearing feathers , so dreadfully downright was dear [June]166-june ! These misgivings , this disapproval , and perfectly genuine distrust , did not prevent [the Forsytes]164-soames from gathering to [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's invitation . An ' At [Home]436-home ' at [Stanhope Gate]1-stanhope gate was a great rarity ; none had been held for twelve years , not indeed , since [old Mrs. Jolyon]185-young mrs. jolyon had died . Never had there been so full an assembly , for , mysteriously united in spite of all [their]523-they differences , [they]523-they had taken arms against a common peril . Like cattle when a dog comes into [the field]524-the field , [they]523-they stood head to head and shoulder to shoulder , prepared to run upon and trample [the invader to death]525-the invader to death . [They]523-they had come , too , no doubt , to get some notion of what sort of presents [they]523-they would ultimately be expected to give ; for though the question of wedding gifts was usually graduated in this way : ' What are [you]526-you givin ' ? [Nicholas]178-nicholas is givin ' spoons ! ' - so very much depended on [the bridegroom]527-the bridegroom . If [he]527-the bridegroom were sleek , well - brushed , prosperous - looking , it was more necessary to give [him]527-the bridegroom nice things ; [he]527-the bridegroom would expect them . In the end each gave exactly what was right and proper , by a species of [family]528-family adjustment arrived at as prices are arrived at on [the Stock Exchange]529-the stock exchange - the exact niceties being regulated at [[Timothy]170-timothy 's commodious , red - brick residence in [Bayswater]3-bayswater]530-timothy 's commodious , red - brick residence in bayswater , overlooking [the Park]531-the park , where dwelt [Aunts Ann]175-aunts ann , [Juley]176-juley , and [Hester]181-aunt hester . The uneasiness of [the Forsyte family]532-the forsyte family has been justified by the simple mention of the hat . How impossible and wrong would it have been for [any family]533-any family , with the regard for appearances which should ever characterize [the great upper middle - class]534-the great upper middle - class , to feel otherwise than uneasy ! "[183-george] This ' ve [ry singular - looking man]537-ry singular - looking man , ' as [Mrs. Small]177-soames afterwards called [him]537-ry singular - looking man , was of medium height and strong build , with a pale , brown face , a dust - coloured moustache , very prominent cheek - bones , and hollow checks . [He]537-ry singular - looking man had sherry - coloured eyes , disconcertingly inattentive at times . [A tall woman]544-a tall woman , with a beautiful figure , which [some member of [the family]450-the family had once compared to [a heathen goddess]547-a heathen goddess]545-some member of the family had once compared to a heathen goddess , stood looking at [these two]548-these two with a shadowy smile . [Her]544-a tall woman hands , gloved in French grey , were crossed one over the other , [her]544-a tall woman grave , charming face held to one side , and the eyes of [all men near]549-all men near were fastened on it . [Her]544-a tall woman figure swayed , so balanced that the very air seemed to set it moving . There was warmth , but little colour , in [her]544-a tall woman cheeks ; [her]544-a tall woman large , dark eyes were soft . But it was at [her]544-a tall woman lips - asking a question , giving an answer , with that shadowy smile - that [men]550-men looked ; [they]551-they were sensitive lips , sensuous and sweet , and through [them]551-they seemed to come warmth and perfume like the warmth and perfume of a flower . [The baby of [the family]450-the family]564-the baby of the family , [a publisher by profession]566-a publisher by profession , [he]170-timothy had some years before , when business was at full tide , scented out the stagnation which , indeed , had not yet come , but which ultimately , as [all agreed]567-all agreed , was bound to set in , and , selling [his]170-timothy share in a firm engaged mainly in the production of religious books , had invested the quite conspicuous proceeds in three per cent . consols . By this act [he]170-timothy had at once assumed an isolated position , no other [Forsyte]171-soames being content with less than four per cent . for [his]170-timothy money ; and this isolation had slowly and surely undermined a spirit perhaps better than commonly endowed with caution . [He]170-timothy had become almost a myth - a kind of incarnation of security haunting the background of the Forsyte universe . [He]170-timothy had never committed the imprudence of marrying , or encumbering [himself]170-timothy in any way with [children]568-children . [She]594-the old lady ought to be very happy . ' Amongst the throng of [people by the door]604-people by the door , [the well - dressed throng]605-the well - dressed throng drawn from [the families of [lawyers and doctors]607-lawyers and doctors]606-the families of lawyers and doctors , from [the Stock Exchange]529-the stock exchange , and all the innumerable avocations of [the upper - middle class]609-the upper - middle class - there were only some twenty percent of [Forsytes]164-soames ; but to [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann [they]610-they seemed [all Forsytes]611-all forsytes - and certainly there was not much difference - [she]169-aunt ann saw only [her]169-aunt ann own flesh and blood . It was [[her]169-aunt ann world]612-her world , [this family]440-this family , and [she]169-aunt ann knew [no other]614-no other , had never perhaps known any other . All [their]610-they little secrets , illnesses , engagements , and marriages , how [they]610-they were getting on , and whether [they]610-they were making money - all this was [her]169-aunt ann property , [her]169-aunt ann delight , [her]169-aunt ann life ; beyond this only a vague , shadowy mist of facts and [persons of no real significance]615-persons of no real significance . This it was that [she]169-aunt ann would have to lay down when it came to [her]169-aunt ann turn to die ; this which gave to [her]169-aunt ann that importance , that secret self - importance , without which none of [us]616-us can bear to live ; and to this [she]169-aunt ann clung wistfully , with a greed that grew each day ! If life were slipping away from [her]169-aunt ann , this [she]169-aunt ann would retain to the end . [She]169-aunt ann thought of [[June]166-june 's father]576-june 's father , [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon , who had run away with [that foreign girl]618-that foreign girl . And what a sad blow to [[his]163-old jolyon father]559-his father and to [them]620-them all . [Such a promising young fellow]621-such a promising young fellow ! A sad blow , though there had been no public scandal , most fortunately , [[Jo]190-jo 's wife]622-jo 's wife seeking for no divorce ! A long time ago ! And when [[June]166-june 's mother]623-june 's mother died , six years ago , [Jo]190-jo had married [that woman]624-that woman , and [they]625-they had [two children]626-two children now , so [she]169-aunt ann had heard . Still , [he]163-old jolyon had forfeited [his]163-old jolyon right to be [there]454-there , had cheated [her]169-aunt ann of the complete fulfilment of [her]169-aunt ann family pride , deprived [her]169-aunt ann of the rightful pleasure of seeing and kissing [him]163-old jolyon of whom [she]169-aunt ann had been so proud , such [a promising young fellow]628-a promising young fellow ! The thought rankled with the bitterness of a long - inflicted injury in [her]169-aunt ann tenacious old heart . A little water stood in [her]169-aunt ann eyes . With a handkerchief of the finest lawn [she]169-aunt ann wiped them stealthily . " Well , [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann ? "[171-soames] said a voice behind . [Soames Forsyte]171-soames , flat - shouldered , clean - shaven , flat - cheeked , flat - waisted , yet with something round and secret about [his]171-soames whole appearance , looked downwards and aslant at [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann , as though trying to see through the side of [his]171-soames own nose . " And what do [you]169-aunt ann think of the engagement ? "[171-soames] [he]171-soames asked . [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann 's eyes rested on [him]171-soames proudly ; of all [the nephews]629-the nephews since [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon 's departure from [the family nest]630-the family nest , [he]171-soames was now [her]169-aunt ann favourite , for [she]169-aunt ann recognised in [him]171-soames a sure trustee of the family soul that must so soon slip beyond [her]169-aunt ann keeping . " Very nice for [the young man]2291-the young man , "[169-aunt ann] [she]169-aunt ann said ; " and [he]2291-the young man 's [a good - looking young fellow]2310-a good - looking young fellow ; but [I]169-aunt ann doubt if [he]2291-the young man 's quite the right lover for [dear June]166-june . "[169-aunt ann] [Soames]171-soames touched the edge of a gold - lacquered lustre . " [She]169-aunt ann 'll tame [him]2291-the young man , "[171-soames] [he]171-soames said , stealthily wetting [his]171-soames finger and rubbing it on the knobby bulbs . " That 's genuine old lacquer ; [you]169-aunt ann ca n't get it nowadays . It 'd do well in a sale at [Jobson]191-jobson 's . "[171-soames] [He]171-soames spoke with relish , as though [he]171-soames felt that [he]171-soames was cheering up [[his]171-soames old aunt]631-his old aunt . "[171-soames] " [You]171-soames 're so clever with all those things , "[169-aunt ann] said [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann . " And how is dear [Irene]186-irene ? "[169-aunt ann] [Soames]171-soames 's smile died . " Pretty well , "[171-soames] [he]171-soames said . " Complains [she]186-irene ca n't sleep ; [she]186-irene sleeps a great deal better than [I]171-soames do , "[171-soames] and [he]171-soames looked at [[his]171-soames wife]558-his wife , who was talking to [Bosinney]168-bosinney by the door . [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann sighed . " Perhaps , "[169-aunt ann] [she]169-aunt ann said , " it will be just as well for [her]186-irene not to see so much of [June]166-june . "[172-swithin] The position of [[their]635-their houses]636-their houses was of vital importance to [the Forsytes]164-soames , nor was this remarkable , since the whole spirit of [their]635-their success was embodied therein . [[Their]635-their father]637-their father , of farming stock , had come from [Dorsetshire]9-dorsetshire near the beginning of the century . ' [Superior Dosset Forsyte]192-superior dosset forsyte , as [he]192-superior dosset forsyte was called by [[his]192-superior dosset forsyte intimates]638-his intimates , had been [a stonemason]639-a stonemason by trade , and risen to the position of [a master - builder]640-a master - builder . Towards the end of [his]192-superior dosset forsyte life [he]192-superior dosset forsyte moved to [London]2-london , where , building on until [he]192-superior dosset forsyte died , [he]192-superior dosset forsyte was buried at [Highgate]10-highgate . [He]192-superior dosset forsyte left over thirty thousand pounds between [[his]192-superior dosset forsyte ten children]641-his ten children . ' [The second generation of Forsytes]643-the second generation of forsytes felt indeed that [he]192-superior dosset forsyte was not greatly to [their]643-the second generation of forsytes credit . [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester , [an authority on family history]644-an authority on family history , described [him]192-superior dosset forsyte thus : " [I]181-aunt hester do n't recollect that [he]192-superior dosset forsyte ever did anything ; at least , not in [my]181-aunt hester time . "[192-superior dosset forsyte] [James]173-james once went down to see for [himself]173-james what sort of place this was that [they]645-their had come from . [He]192-superior dosset forsyte found [two old farms]646-two old farms , with [a cart track rutted into the pink earth , leading down to [a mill]648-a mill by [the beach]649-the beach]647-a cart track rutted into the pink earth , leading down to a mill by the beach ; [a little grey church]650-a little grey church with a buttressed outer wall , and [a smaller and greyer chapel]651-a smaller and greyer chapel . [The stream which worked [the mill]653-the mill]652-the stream which worked the mill came bubbling down in a dozen rivulets , and pigs were hunting round [that estuary]654-that estuary . A haze hovered over the prospect . Down this hollow , with [their]645-their feet deep in the mud and [their]645-their faces towards [the sea]2321-the sea , it appeared that [the primeval Forsytes]164-soames had been content to walk Sunday after Sunday for hundreds of years . Whether or no [James]173-james had cherished hopes of an inheritance , or of something rather distinguished to be found down there , [he]192-superior dosset forsyte came back to [town]656-town in a poor way , and went about with a pathetic attempt at making the best of a bad job . " There 's very little to be had out of that , "[192-superior dosset forsyte] [he]192-superior dosset forsyte said ; " [regular country little place , old as [the hills]2323-the hills]2322-regular country little place , old as the hills .... "[192-superior dosset forsyte] Its age was felt to be a comfort . "[163-old jolyon] Yet [he]163-old jolyon would repeat the word ' yeomen ' as if it afforded [him]163-old jolyon consolation . [They]645-their had all done so well for [themselves]645-their , [these Forsytes]658-these forsytes , that [they]645-their were all what is called ' of a certain position . ' [They]645-their had shares in all sorts of things , not as yet - with the exception of [Timothy]170-timothy - in consols , for [they]645-their had no dread in life like that of 3 per cent . for [their]645-their money . [They]645-their collected pictures , too , and were [supporters of such charitable institutions as might be beneficial to [[their]645-their sick domestics]660-their sick domestics]659-supporters of such charitable institutions as might be beneficial to their sick domestics . From [[their]645-their father]637-their father , [the builder]662-the builder , [they]645-their inherited a talent for bricks and mortar . [Some of [them]645-their]670-some of them paid for pews , thus expressing in the most practical form [their]645-their sympathy with the teachings of [Christ]195-christ . [The train]2336-the train coming in a minute later , [the two brothers]2337-the two brothers parted and entered [their]2337-the two brothers respective compartments . [Each]509-each felt aggrieved that [the other]2339-the other had not modified [his]2339-the other habits to secure [his]2339-the other society a little longer ; but as [Roger]317-roger voiced it in [his]0-i thoughts : ' Always [a stubborn beggar]2340-a stubborn beggar , [Nick]189-nicholas ! ' And as [Nicholas]189-nicholas expressed it to [himself]189-nicholas : ' [Cantankerous chap Roger]317-roger - always was ! ' There was little sentimentality about [the Forsytes]164-soames . In [[that great London]2341-that great london , which [they]2337-the two brothers had conquered and become merged in]2342-that great london , which they had conquered and become merged in , what time had [they]2337-the two brothers to be sentimental ? CHAPTER II - [OLD JOLYON]163-old jolyon GOES TO [THE OPERA At five o'clock]2343-the opera at five o'clock the following day [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon sat alone , a cigar between [his]163-old jolyon lips , and on a table by [his]163-old jolyon side a cup of tea . [He]163-old jolyon was tired , and before [he]163-old jolyon had finished [his]163-old jolyon cigar [he]163-old jolyon fell asleep . A fly settled on [his]163-old jolyon hair , [his]163-old jolyon breathing sounded heavy in the drowsy silence , [his]163-old jolyon upper lip under the white moustache puffed in and out . From between the fingers of [his]163-old jolyon veined and wrinkled hand the cigar , dropping on the empty hearth , burned itself out . [The gloomy little study]2344-the gloomy little study , with windows of stained glass to exclude the view , was full of dark green velvet and heavily - carved mahogany - [a suite of which [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon]2345-a suite of which old jolyon was wo nt to say : ' Should n't wonder if it made a big price some day ! ' It was pleasant to think that in the after life [he]163-old jolyon could get more for things than [he]163-old jolyon had given . In the rich brown atmosphere peculiar to [back rooms in [the mansion of [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte]2347-the mansion of a forsyte]2346-back rooms in the mansion of a forsyte , the Rembrandtesque effect of [his]163-old jolyon great head , with its white hair , against the cushion of [his]163-old jolyon high - backed seat , was spoiled by the moustache , which imparted a somewhat military look to [his]163-old jolyon face . An old clock that had been with [him]163-old jolyon since before [his]163-old jolyon marriage forty years ago kept with its ticking a jealous record of the seconds slipping away forever from [its old master]2349-its old master . [He]163-old jolyon had never cared for [this room]2350-this room , hardly going into [it]2350-this room from one year 's end to another , except to take cigars from [the Japanese cabinet in the corner]2351-the japanese cabinet in the corner , and [the room]488-the room now had [its]488-the room revenge . [His]163-old jolyon temples , curving like thatches over the hollows beneath , [his]163-old jolyon cheek - bones and chin , all were sharpened in [his]163-old jolyon sleep , and there had come upon [his]163-old jolyon face the confession that [he]163-old jolyon was [an old man]2353-an old man . [He]163-old jolyon woke . [June]166-june had gone ! [James]173-james had said [he]163-old jolyon would be lonely . [James]173-james had always been a poor thing . [He]163-old jolyon recollected with satisfaction that [he]163-old jolyon had bought [that house over [James]173-james 's head]2354-that house over james 's head . Serve [him]163-old jolyon right for sticking at the price ; the only thing [the fellow]2355-the fellow thought of was money . Had [he]163-old jolyon given too much , though ? It wanted a lot of doing to - [He]163-old jolyon dared say [he]163-old jolyon would want all [his]163-old jolyon money before [he]163-old jolyon had done with this affair of [June]166-june 's . [He]163-old jolyon ought never to have allowed the engagement . After that [she]166-june 'd been always running after [him]163-old jolyon ; and when [she]166-june took a thing into [her]166-june head there was no stopping [her]166-june . [She]166-june was continually taking up with ' lame ducks ' of one sort or another . [This fellow]2361-this fellow had no money , but [she]166-june must needs become engaged to [him]163-old jolyon - [a harumscarum , unpractical chap , who would get [himself]163-old jolyon into no end of difficulties]2362-a harumscarum , unpractical chap , who would get himself into no end of difficulties . [She]166-june had come to [him]163-old jolyon one day in [her]166-june slap - dash way and told [him]163-old jolyon ; and , as if it were any consolation , [she]166-june had added : "[722-he] [He]722-he 's so splendid ; [he]722-he 's often lived on cocoa for a week ! " "[722-he] And [he]722-he wants [you]723-you to live on cocoa too ? " "[722-he] Oh no ; [he]722-he is getting into the swim now . " [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon had taken [his]163-old jolyon cigar from under [his]163-old jolyon white moustaches , stained by coffee at the edge , and looked at [her]166-june , that little slip of a thing who had got such a grip of [his]163-old jolyon heart . [He]163-old jolyon knew more about ' swims ' than [[his]163-old jolyon granddaughter]2363-his granddaughter . But [she]166-june , having clasped [her]166-june hands on [his]163-old jolyon knees , rubbed [her]166-june chin against [him]163-old jolyon , making a sound like a purring cat . And , knocking the ash off [his]163-old jolyon cigar , [he]163-old jolyon had exploded in nervous desperation : "[722-he] [You]724-you 're [all alike]725-all alike : [you]724-you wo n't be satisfied till [you]724-you 've got what [you]724-you want . If [you]724-you must come to grief , [you]724-you must ; [I]0-i wash [my]0-i hands of it . "[0-i] Perhaps this What's - [his]0-i - name will provide the cocoa . " [He]163-old jolyon had hardly seen anything of [her]166-june since it began . A bad business ! [He]163-old jolyon had no notion of giving [her]166-june a lot of money to enable [a fellow [he]163-old jolyon knew nothing about to live on in idleness]2365-a fellow he knew nothing about to live on in idleness . [He]163-old jolyon did n't see where it was to end . [They]2364-they must cut [their]2364-they coat according to [their]2364-they cloth . That [June]166-june would have trouble with [the fellow]2355-the fellow was as plain as a pikestaff ; [he]163-old jolyon had no more idea of money than a cow . As to this rushing down to [Wales]7-wales to visit [[the young man]2291-the young man 's aunts]2369-the young man 's aunts , [he]163-old jolyon fully expected [they]2369-the young man 's aunts were old cats . Like [[his]2370-that young cub father]559-his father , [he]2370-that young cub was always nosing out bargains , [a cold - blooded young beggar]2377-a cold - blooded young beggar ! [He]163-old jolyon rose , and , going to the cabinet , began methodically stocking [his]163-old jolyon cigar - case from a bundle fresh in . That was a cigar ! Difficult to believe it was so long ago ; [he]163-old jolyon felt young still ! [He]163-old jolyon had worked at that business ! [Men]550-men did work in those days ! [these young pups]2397-these young pups hardly knew the meaning of the word . Not a career for [a man of [his]163-old jolyon ability]2400-a man of his ability . [He]0-i ordered dinner , and sat down in the very corner , at the very table perhaps ! things did not progress much at the ' Disunion , ' a Club of almost Radical principles at which [he]0-i and [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon used to sit twenty - five years ago , when [he]0-i was taking [the latter]2450-the latter to [Drury Lane]32-drury lane , during [his]0-i holidays . [The two]2453-the two had not met for fourteen years . And not for the first time during those fourteen years [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon wondered whether [he]0-i had been a little to blame in the matter of [[his]0-i son]2441-his son . And in four years the crash had come ! To have approved [[his]0-i son]2441-his son 's conduct in that crash was , of course , impossible ; reason and training - that combination of potent factors which stood for [his]0-i principles - told [him]0-i of this impossibility , and [his]0-i heart cried out . The grim remorselessness of that business had no pity for hearts . There was [June]166-june , the atom with flaming hair , who had climbed all over [him]0-i , twined and twisted [herself]166-june about [him]0-i - about [his]0-i heart that was made to be the plaything and beloved resort of tiny , helpless things . With characteristic insight [he]0-i saw [he]0-i must part with one or with [the other]2339-the other ; no half - measures could serve in such a situation . In that lay its tragedy . And [the tiny , helpless thing]2459-the tiny , helpless thing prevailed . [He]0-i would not run with the hare and hunt with the hounds , and so to [[his]0-i son]2441-his son [he]0-i said good - bye . That good - bye had lasted until now . [He]0-i had proposed to continue a reduced allowance to [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon , but this had been refused , and perhaps that refusal had hurt [him]0-i more than anything , for with it had gone the last outlet of [his]0-i penned - in affection ; and there had come such tangible and solid proof of rupture as only a transaction in property , a bestowal or refusal of such , could supply . [His]0-i dinner tasted flat . [His]0-i pint of champagne was dry and bitter stuff , not like the Veuve Clicquots of old days . Over [his]0-i cup of coffee , [he]0-i bethought [him]0-i that [he]0-i would go to the opera . In the Times , therefore - [he]0-i had a distrust of other papers - [he]0-i read the announcement for the evening . It was ' [Fidelio]214-fidelio . ' Mercifully not one of those new - fangled German pantomimes by [that fellow Wagner]2461-that fellow wagner . Putting on [his]0-i ancient opera hat , which , with its brim flattened by use , and huge capacity , looked like an emblem of greater days , and , pulling out an old pair of very thin lavender kid gloves smelling strongly of Russia leather , from habitual proximity to the cigar - case in the pocket of [his]0-i overcoat , [he]0-i stepped into [a hansom]2462-a hansom . [The cab]2463-the cab rattled gaily along [the streets]2464-the streets , and [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon was struck by [their]2463-the cab unwonted animation . ' [The hotels]2465-the hotels must be doing a tremendous business , ' [he]163-old jolyon thought . A few years ago there had been [none of [these big hotels]2467-these big hotels]2466-none of these big hotels . [He]0-i made a satisfactory reflection on [some property [he]0-i had in [the neighbourhood]2469-the neighbourhood]2468-some property he had in the neighbourhood . It must be going up in value by leaps and bounds ! What traffic ! But from that [he]0-i began indulging in one of those strange impersonal speculations , so uncharacteristic of a Forsyte , wherein lay , in part , the secret of [his]0-i supremacy amongst [them]2463-the cab . What [atoms men]2470-atoms men were , and what [a lot of [them]2470-atoms men]2471-a lot of them ! And what would become of [them]2470-atoms men all ? [He]0-i stumbled as [he]0-i got out of [the cab]2463-the cab , gave [the man]2473-the man [his]0-i exact fare , walked up to [the ticket office]2474-the ticket office to take [[his]0-i stall]2475-his stall , and stood there with [his]0-i purse in [his]0-i hand - [he]0-i always carried [his]0-i money in a purse , never having approved of that habit of carrying it loosely in the pockets , as [so many young men]2476-so many young men did nowadays . [The official]2477-the official leaned out , like an old dog from [a kennel]2478-a kennel . "[0-i] Why , " [he]2477-the official said in a surprised voice , "[165-old jolyon] it 's [Mr. Jolyon Forsyte]165-old jolyon ! So it is ! Have n't seen [you]165-old jolyon , [sir]730-sir , for years . Dear [me]0-i ! Times are n't what [they]731-they were . Why ! [you]165-old jolyon and [[your]165-old jolyon brother]732-your brother , and [that auctioneer]733-that auctioneer - [Mr. Traquair]207-traquair , and [Mr. Nicholas Treffry]206-nicholas treffry - [you]165-old jolyon used to have [six or seven stalls]734-six or seven stalls [here]735-here regular every season . And how are [you]165-old jolyon , [sir]730-sir ? [We]737-we do n't get younger ! " The colour in [old Jolyon]165-old jolyon 's eyes deepened ; [he]165-old jolyon paid [his]165-old jolyon guinea . [They]737-we had not forgotten [him]165-old jolyon . [He]165-old jolyon marched in , to the sounds of the overture , like an old war - horse to battle . Folding [his]165-old jolyon opera hat , [he]165-old jolyon sat down , drew out [his]165-old jolyon lavender gloves in the old way , and took up [his]165-old jolyon glasses for a long look round [the house]2326-the house . Dropping them at last on [his]165-old jolyon folded hat , [he]165-old jolyon fixed [his]165-old jolyon eyes on the curtain . More poignantly than ever [he]165-old jolyon felt that it was all over and done with [him]165-old jolyon . Where were all [the women]2480-the women , [the pretty women]2481-the pretty women , [the house]2326-the house used to be so full of ? Where was that old feeling in the heart as [he]165-old jolyon waited for one of [those great singers]2483-those great singers ? Where that sensation of the intoxication of life and of [his]165-old jolyon own power to enjoy it all ? [The greatest opera - goer of]2484-the greatest opera - goer of [his]165-old jolyon day ! There was no opera now ! [That fellow Wagner]2461-that fellow wagner had ruined everything ; no melody left , nor [any voices to sing it]2486-any voices to sing it . Ah ! [the wonderful singers]2487-the wonderful singers ! Gone ! [He]165-old jolyon sat watching the old scenes acted , a numb feeling at [his]165-old jolyon heart . From the curl of silver over [his]165-old jolyon ear to the pose of [his]165-old jolyon foot in its elastic - sided patent boot , there was nothing clumsy or weak about [old Jolyon]165-old jolyon . [He]165-old jolyon was as upright - very nearly - as in those old times when [he]165-old jolyon came every night ; [his]165-old jolyon sight was as good - almost as good . But what a feeling of weariness and disillusion ! [He]165-old jolyon had been in the habit all [his]165-old jolyon life of enjoying things , even imperfect things - and there had been many imperfect things - [he]165-old jolyon had enjoyed them all with moderation , so as to keep [himself]165-old jolyon young . But now [he]165-old jolyon was deserted by [his]165-old jolyon power of enjoyment , by [his]165-old jolyon philosophy , and left with this dreadful feeling that it was all done with . Not even [the Prisoners]215-the prisoners ' Chorus , nor [Florian]216-florian 's Song , had the power to dispel the gloom of [his]165-old jolyon loneliness . If [Jo]190-jo were only with [him]165-old jolyon ! [The boy]2442-the boy must be forty by now . [He]165-old jolyon had wasted fourteen years out of the life of [[his]165-old jolyon only son]469-his only son . And [Jo]190-jo was no longer [a social pariah]2490-a social pariah . [He]165-old jolyon was married . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon had been unable to refrain from marking [his]165-old jolyon appreciation of the action by enclosing [[his]165-old jolyon son]2441-his son a cheque for L500 . The cheque had been returned in a letter from the ' [Hotch Potch]217-hotch potch , ' couched in these words . ' [[MY]165-old jolyon DEAREST FATHER]2492-my dearest father , ' [Your]2492-my dearest father generous gift was welcome as a sign that [you]2492-my dearest father might think worse of [me]165-old jolyon . [I]165-old jolyon return it , but should [you]2492-my dearest father think fit to invest it for the benefit of [the little chap]2493-the little chap [we]2494-our call [him]2493-the little chap [Jolly]218-jolly , who bears [our]2494-our Christian and , by courtesy , [our]2494-our surname , [I]165-old jolyon shall be very glad . ' [I]165-old jolyon hope with all [my]165-old jolyon heart that [your]2492-my dearest father health is as good as ever . ' [[Your]2492-my dearest father loving son]2495-your loving son , ' [Jo]190-jo . ' The letter was like [the boy]2442-the boy . [He]2493-the little chap had always been [an amiable chap]2497-an amiable chap . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon had sent this reply : ' [MY]165-old jolyon DEAR [JO]190-jo , ' The sum L500 stands in [my]165-old jolyon books for the benefit of [[your]190-jo boy]2498-your boy , under the name of [Jolyon Forsyte]165-old jolyon , and will be duly - credited with interest at 5 per cent . [I]165-old jolyon hope that [you]190-jo are doing well . [My]165-old jolyon health remains good at present . ' With love , [I]165-old jolyon am , ' [[Your]2492-my dearest father affectionate [Father]219-father]2499-your affectionate father , ' [JOLYON FORSYTE]165-old jolyon . ' And every year on the 1st of January [he]165-old jolyon had added a hundred and the interest . The sum was mounting up - next New Year 's Day it would be fifteen hundred and odd pounds ! And it is difficult to say how much satisfaction [he]165-old jolyon had got out of that yearly transaction . But the correspondence had ended . In spite of [his]165-old jolyon love for [[his]165-old jolyon son]2441-his son , in spite of an instinct , partly constitutional , partly the result , as in [thousands of [[his]165-old jolyon class]2502-his class]2501-thousands of his class , of the continual handling and watching of affairs , prompting [him]165-old jolyon to judge conduct by results rather than by principle , there was at the bottom of [his]165-old jolyon heart a sort of uneasiness . [[His]165-old jolyon son]2441-his son ought , under the circumstances , to have gone to the dogs ; that law was laid down in all the novels , sermons , and plays [he]165-old jolyon had ever read , heard , or witnessed . After receiving the cheque back there seemed to [him]165-old jolyon to be something wrong somewhere . Why had [[his]165-old jolyon son]2441-his son not gone to the dogs ? But , then , who could tell ? [He]165-old jolyon had heard , of course - in fact , [he]165-old jolyon had made it [his]165-old jolyon business to find out - that [Jo]190-jo lived in [St. John 's Wood]33-st. john 's wood , that [he]165-old jolyon had [a little house in [Wistaria Avenue]34-wistaria avenue with [a garden]2506-a garden]2505-a little house in wistaria avenue with a garden , and took [[his]165-old jolyon wife]558-his wife about with [him]165-old jolyon into society - a queer sort of society , no doubt - and that [they]2508-they had [two children]626-two children - the little chap [they]2508-they called [Jolly]218-jolly considering the circumstances the name struck [him]165-old jolyon as cynical , and [old Jolyon]165-old jolyon both feared and disliked cynicism , and a girl called [Holly]220-holly , born since the marriage . Who could tell what [[his]165-old jolyon son]2441-his son 's circumstances really were ? [He]165-old jolyon had capitalized the income [he]165-old jolyon had inherited from [[[his]165-old jolyon mother]2511-his mother 's father]2512-his mother 's father and joined [Lloyd]221-lloyd 's as [an underwriter]2513-an underwriter ; [he]165-old jolyon painted pictures , too - water - colours . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon knew this , for [he]165-old jolyon had surreptitiously bought them from time to time , after chancing to see [[his]165-old jolyon son]2441-his son 's name signed at the bottom of a representation of [the river Thames]2515-the river thames in a [dealer]2516-dealer 's window . [He]165-old jolyon thought them bad , and did not hang them because of the signature ; [he]165-old jolyon kept them locked up in a drawer . In [the great opera - house]2517-the great opera - house a terrible yearning came on [him]165-old jolyon to see [[his]165-old jolyon son]2441-his son . [He]165-old jolyon remembered the days when [he]165-old jolyon had been wo nt to slide [him]2441-his son , in a brown holland suit , to and fro under the arch of [his]165-old jolyon legs ; the times when [he]165-old jolyon ran beside [the boy]2442-the boy 's pony , teaching [him]2441-his son to ride ; the day [he]165-old jolyon first took [him]2441-his son to [school]2520-school . [He]165-old jolyon had been [a loving , lovable little chap]2521-a loving , lovable little chap ! After [he]165-old jolyon went to [Eton]35-eton [he]165-old jolyon had acquired , perhaps , a little too much of that desirable manner which [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon knew was only to be obtained at such places and at great expense ; but [he]165-old jolyon had always been companionable . Always [a companion]2522-a companion , even after [Cambridge]36-cambridge - a little far off , perhaps , owing to the advantages [he]165-old jolyon had received . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon 's feeling towards [[our]2523-our public schools]2524-our public schools and ' [Varsities]222-varsities never wavered , and [he]163-old jolyon retained touchingly [his]163-old jolyon attitude of admiration and mistrust towards a system appropriate to the highest in [the land]2525-the land , of which [he]163-old jolyon had not [himself]163-old jolyon been privileged to partake .... Now that [June]166-june had gone and left , or as good as left [him]163-old jolyon , it would have been a comfort to see [[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son again . Guilty of this treason to [[his]163-old jolyon family]2527-his family , [[his]163-old jolyon principles]2528-his principles , [[his]163-old jolyon class]2502-his class , [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon fixed [his]163-old jolyon eyes on [the singer]2530-the singer . [A poor thing]2531-a poor thing - [a wretched poor thing]2532-a wretched poor thing ! And [the Florian a perfect stick]2533-the florian a perfect stick ! It was over . [They]2534-they were easily pleased nowadays ! In [the crowded street]2535-the crowded street [he]163-old jolyon snapped up [a cab]2536-a cab under the very nose of [a stout and much younger gentleman]2537-a stout and much younger gentleman , who had already assumed it to be [his]163-old jolyon own . [[His]163-old jolyon route]2538-his route lay through [Pall Mall]37-pall mall , and at the corner , instead of going through [the Green Park]2539-the green park , [the cabman]2540-the cabman turned to drive up [St. James 's Street]38-st. james 's street . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon put [his]163-old jolyon hand through the trap [he]163-old jolyon could not bear being taken out of [his]163-old jolyon way ; in turning , however , [he]163-old jolyon found [himself]163-old jolyon opposite the ' [Hotch Potch]217-hotch potch , ' and the yearning that had been secretly with [him]163-old jolyon the whole evening prevailed . [He]163-old jolyon called to [the driver]2541-the driver to stop . [He]163-old jolyon would go in and ask if [Jo]190-jo still belonged [there]454-there . [He]163-old jolyon went in . [The hall]2543-the hall looked exactly as [it]2543-the hall did when [he]163-old jolyon used to dine [there]454-there with [Jack Herring]208-jack herring , and [they]2545-they had [the best cook in [London]2-london]2546-the best cook in london ; and [he]163-old jolyon looked round with the shrewd , straight glance that had caused [him]163-old jolyon all [his]163-old jolyon life to be better served than [most men]2547-most men . "[165-old jolyon] [Mr. Jolyon Forsyte]165-old jolyon still [a member [here]735-here]738-a member here ? " "[730-sir] Yes , [sir]730-sir ; in [the Club]2302-the club now , [sir]730-sir . What name ? [He]167-young jolyon was no longer young , with hair going grey , and face - a narrower replica of [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father 's , with the same large drooping moustache - decidedly worn . [He]167-young jolyon turned pale . This meeting was terrible after all those years , for nothing in [the world]2286-the world was so terrible as a scene . [They]2553-they met and crossed hands without a word . " And as though in the habit of taking [each other]2556-each other [home]436-home every night [they]2553-they went out and stepped into [the cab]2463-the cab . To [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon it seemed that [[his]167-young jolyon son]2441-his son had grown . ' More of [a man altogether]2560-a man altogether , ' was [his]167-young jolyon comment . Over the natural amiability of [that son]2561-that son 's face had come a rather sardonic mask , as though [he]167-young jolyon had found in the circumstances of [his]167-young jolyon life the necessity for armour . The features were certainly those of [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte , but the expression was more the introspective look of [a student]2563-a student or [philosopher]2564-philosopher . [He]167-young jolyon had no doubt been obliged to look into [himself]167-young jolyon a good deal in the course of those fifteen years . To [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon the first sight of [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father was undoubtedly a shock - [he]559-his father looked so worn and old . But in [the cab]2463-the cab [he]559-his father seemed hardly to have changed , still having the calm look so well remembered , still being upright and keen - eyed . "[0-i] [You]745-you look well , [Dad]223-dad . " "[223-dad] Middling , " [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon answered . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon turned the key softly in the lock , pushed open the door , and beckoned . [[His]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son saw [him]163-old jolyon gravely hanging up [his]163-old jolyon coat , with an expression on [his]163-old jolyon face like that of [a boy who intends to steal cherries]2575-a boy who intends to steal cherries . The door of [the dining - room]2449-the dining - room was open , the gas turned low ; a spirit - urn hissed on a tea - tray , and close to it a cynical looking cat had fallen asleep on the dining - table . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon ' shoo'd ' [her]747-her off at once . " several times , as though assisting the cat 's departure , till by some strange coincidence [the butler]542-the butler appeared below . "[747-her] [You]748-you can go to bed , [Parfitt]224-parfitt , " said [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon . "[0-i] [I]0-i will lock up and put out . " When [he]163-old jolyon again entered [the dining - room]2449-the dining - room the cat unfortunately preceded [him]163-old jolyon , with [her]747-her tail in the air , proclaiming that [she]747-her had seen through this manouevre for suppressing [the butler]542-the butler from the first .... A fatality had dogged [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's domestic stratagems all [his]167-young jolyon life . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon could not help smiling . [He]167-young jolyon was very well versed in irony , and everything that evening seemed to [him]167-young jolyon ironical . The episode of the cat ; the announcement of [[his]167-young jolyon own daughter]2583-his own daughter 's engagement . So [he]167-young jolyon had no more part or parcel in [her]166-june than [he]167-young jolyon had in the Puss ! And the poetical justice of this appealed to [him]167-young jolyon . "[0-i] What is [June]166-june like now ? " [he]167-young jolyon asked . "[166-june] [She]166-june 's a little thing , " returned [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon ; "[749-they] [they]749-they say [she]166-june 's like [me]0-i , but that 's [their]749-they folly . [She]166-june 's more like [[your]0-i mother]2307-your mother - the same eyes and hair . " "[166-june] Ah ! and [she]166-june is pretty ? " [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon was too much of [a Forsyte]166-june to praise anything freely ; especially anything for which [he]163-old jolyon had a genuine admiration . [I]0-i wish to goodness .... " [He]0-i checked [himself]0-i , and added : "[0-i] The question is , what had [I]0-i better do with [this house]752-this house ? " [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon looked round [the room]488-the room . [It]488-the room was peculiarly vast and dreary , decorated with the enormous pictures of still life that [he]167-young jolyon remembered as [a boy]2586-a boy - sleeping dogs with [their]2587-their noses resting on bunches of carrots , together with onions and grapes lying side by side in mild surprise . [The house]2326-the house was a white elephant , but [he]167-young jolyon could not conceive of [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father living in [a smaller place]2590-a smaller place ; and all the more did it all seem ironical . In [his]0-i great chair with the book - rest sat [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon , [the figurehead of [[his]0-i family]2527-his family and class and creed , with [his]167-young jolyon white head and dome - like forehead , [the representative of moderation , and order]2593-the representative of moderation , and order , and love of property . As lonely [an old man]2353-an old man as there was in [London]2-london]2591-the figurehead of his family and class and creed , with his white head and dome - like forehead , the representative of moderation , and order , and love of property . as lonely an old man as there was in london . There [he]167-young jolyon sat in the gloomy comfort of [the room]488-the room , [a puppet in the power of great forces that cared nothing for family or class or creed]2596-a puppet in the power of great forces that cared nothing for family or class or creed , but moved , machine - like , with dread processes to inscrutable ends . This was how it struck [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon , who had the impersonal eye . [The poor old Dad]2597-the poor old dad ! So this was the end , the purpose to which [he]0-i had lived with such magnificent moderation ! To be lonely , and grow older and older , yearning for a soul to speak to ! In [his]0-i turn [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon looked back at [[his]167-young jolyon son]2441-his son . [He]0-i wanted to talk about many things that [he]0-i had been unable to talk about all these years . It had been impossible to seriously confide in [June]166-june [his]0-i conviction that property in [the Soho quarter]2599-the soho quarter would go up in value ; [his]0-i uneasiness about that tremendous silence of [Pippin]225-pippin , [the superintendent of [the New Colliery Company]2601-the new colliery company , of which [he]0-i had so long been [chairman]2602-chairman]2600-the superintendent of the new colliery company , of which he had so long been chairman ; [his]0-i disgust at the steady fall in [American Golgothas]39-american golgothas , or even to discuss how , by some sort of settlement , [he]0-i could best avoid the payment of those death duties which would follow [his]0-i decease . Under the influence , however , of a cup of tea , which [he]0-i seemed to stir indefinitely , [he]0-i began to speak at last . A new vista of life was thus opened up , [a promised land of talk]2603-a promised land of talk , where [he]0-i could find a harbour against the waves of anticipation and regret ; where [he]0-i could soothe [his]0-i soul with the opium of devising how to round off [[his]0-i property]2604-his property and make eternal the only part of [him]0-i that was to remain alive . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon was a good listener ; it was [his]167-young jolyon great quality . [He]167-young jolyon kept [his]167-young jolyon eyes fixed on [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father 's face , putting a question now and then . The clock struck one before [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon had finished , and at the sound of its striking [his]167-young jolyon principles came back . [He]0-i took out [his]0-i watch with a look of surprise : "[0-i] [I]0-i must go to bed , [Jo]190-jo , " [he]0-i said . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon rose and held out [his]167-young jolyon hand to help [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father up . [The old face]2607-the old face looked worn and hollow again ; the eyes were steadily averted . "[190-jo] Good - bye , [[my]0-i boy]744-my boy ; take care of [yourself]744-my boy . " A moment passed , and [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon , turning on [his]167-young jolyon , heel , marched out at the door . [He]167-young jolyon could hardly see ; [his]167-young jolyon smile quavered . Never in all the fifteen years since [he]167-young jolyon had first found out that life was no simple business , had [he]167-young jolyon found it so singularly complicated . CHAPTER III - DINNER AT [SWITHIN]233-swithin 'S In [[Swithin]172-swithin 's orange and light - blue dining - room]2608-swithin 's orange and light - blue dining - room , facing [the Park]531-the park , the round table was laid for twelve . A cut - glass chandelier filled with lighted candles hung like a giant stalactite above [its]2608-swithin 's orange and light - blue dining - room centre , radiating over large gilt - framed mirrors , slabs of marble on the tops of side - tables , and heavy gold chairs with crewel worked seats . Everything betokened that love of beauty so deeply implanted in each family which has had its own way to make into Society , out of the more vulgar heart of Nature . [Swithin]172-swithin had indeed an impatience of simplicity , a love of ormolu , which had always stamped [him]172-swithin amongst [[his]172-swithin associates]2610-his associates as [a man of great , if somewhat luxurious taste]2611-a man of great , if somewhat luxurious taste ; and out of the knowledge that [no one]514-no one could possibly enter [[his]172-swithin rooms]2613-his rooms without perceiving [him]172-swithin to be [a man of wealth]2614-a man of wealth , [he]172-swithin had derived a solid and prolonged happiness such as perhaps no other circumstance in life had afforded [him]172-swithin . Since [his]172-swithin retirement from [land agency]2615-land agency , a profession deplorable in [his]172-swithin estimation , especially as to [its]2615-land agency auctioneering department , [he]172-swithin had abandoned [himself]172-swithin to naturally aristocratic tastes . The perfect luxury of [his]172-swithin latter days had embedded [him]172-swithin like a fly in sugar ; and [his]172-swithin mind , where very little took place from morning till night , was the junction of two curiously opposite emotions , a lingering and sturdy satisfaction that [he]172-swithin had made [his]172-swithin own way and [his]172-swithin own fortune , and a sense that [a man of [his]172-swithin distinction]2616-a man of his distinction should never have been allowed to soil [his]172-swithin mind with work . [He]172-swithin stood at the sideboard in a white waistcoat with large gold and onyx buttons , watching [[his]172-swithin valet]2617-his valet screw the necks of three champagne bottles deeper into ice - pails . Between the points of [his]172-swithin stand - up collar , which - though it hurt [him]172-swithin to move - [he]172-swithin would on no account have had altered , the pale flesh of [his]172-swithin under chin remained immovable . [His]172-swithin eyes roved from bottle to bottle . [He]172-swithin was debating , and [he]172-swithin argued like this : [Jolyon]167-young jolyon drinks a glass , perhaps two , [he]167-young jolyon 's so careful of [himself]167-young jolyon . [James]173-james , [he]167-young jolyon ca n't take [his]167-young jolyon wine nowadays . [Nicholas - Fanny]226-nicholas and [he]226-nicholas would swill water [he]226-nicholas should n't wonder ! [Soames]164-soames did n't count ; [these young nephews]2618-these young nephews - [Soames]164-soames was thirty - one - could n't drink ! But [Bosinney]168-bosinney ? Encountering in the name of [this stranger]2619-this stranger something outside the range of [his]172-swithin philosophy , [Swithin]172-swithin paused . A misgiving arose within [him]172-swithin ! It was impossible to tell ! [June]166-june was only [a girl]2620-a girl , in love too ! [Emily Mrs. James]173-james liked a good glass of champagne . It was too dry for [Juley]176-juley , [poor old soul]2621-poor old soul , [she]173-james had no palate . As to [Hatty Chessman]227-hatty chessman ! The thought of [this old friend]2622-this old friend caused a cloud of thought to obscure the perfect glassiness of [his]172-swithin eyes : [He]172-swithin should n't wonder if [she]2622-this old friend drank half a bottle ! But in thinking of [[his]172-swithin remaining guest]2623-his remaining guest , an expression like that of a cat who is just going to purr stole over [his]172-swithin old face : [Mrs. Soames]177-soames ! [She]2622-this old friend might n't take much , but [she]2622-this old friend would appreciate what [she]2622-this old friend drank ; it was a pleasure to give [her]2622-this old friend good wine ! [A pretty woman]718-a pretty woman - and sympathetic to [him]172-swithin ! The thought of [her]718-a pretty woman was like champagne itself ! A pleasure to give a good wine to [a young woman who looked so well , who knew how to dress , with charming manners , quite distinguished]2625-a young woman who looked so well , who knew how to dress , with charming manners , quite distinguished - a pleasure to entertain [her]718-a pretty woman . Between the points of [his]172-swithin collar [he]172-swithin gave [his]172-swithin head the first small , painful oscillation of the evening . "[228-adolf] [Adolf]228-adolf ! " [he]172-swithin said . "[228-adolf] Put in another bottle . " [He]172-swithin [himself]172-swithin might drink a good deal , for , thanks to that prescription of Blight 's , [he]172-swithin found [himself]172-swithin extremely well , and [he]172-swithin had been careful to take no lunch . [He]172-swithin had not felt so well for weeks . Puffing out [his]172-swithin lower lip , [he]172-swithin gave [his]172-swithin last instructions : "[228-adolf] [Adolf]228-adolf , the least touch of the [West India]41-west india when [you]228-adolf come to the ham . " Passing into [the anteroom]2626-the anteroom , [he]172-swithin sat down on the edge of a chair , with [his]172-swithin knees apart ; and [his]172-swithin tall , bulky form was wrapped at once in an expectant , strange , primeval immobility . [He]172-swithin was ready to rise at a moment 's notice . [He]172-swithin had not given a dinner - party for months . This dinner in honour of [June]166-june 's engagement had seemed a bore at first among [Forsytes]164-soames the custom of solemnizing engagements by feasts was religiously observed , but the labours of sending invitations and ordering the repast over , [he]172-swithin felt pleasantly stimulated . And thus sitting , a watch in [his]172-swithin hand , fat , and smooth , and golden , like a flattened globe of butter , [he]172-swithin thought of nothing . [A long man , with side whiskers , who had once been in Swithin]2627-a long man , with side whiskers , who had once been in swithin 's service , but was now [a greengrocer]2628-a greengrocer , entered and proclaimed : "[229-mrs. chessman] [Mrs. Chessman]229-mrs. chessman , [Mrs. Septimus Small]177-soames ! " [Two ladies]2629-two ladies advanced . [The one in front , habited entirely in red]2630-the one in front , habited entirely in red , had large , settled patches of the same colour in [her]2630-the one in front , habited entirely in red cheeks , and a hard , dashing eye . [She]2630-the one in front , habited entirely in red walked at [Swithin]172-swithin , holding out a hand cased in a long , primrose - coloured glove : "[177-soames] Well ! [Swithin]172-swithin , " [she]2630-the one in front , habited entirely in red said , "[172-swithin] [I]0-i have n't seen [you]172-swithin for ages . How are [you]172-swithin ? Why , [[my]0-i dear boy]754-my dear boy , how stout [you]172-swithin 're getting ! " The fixity of [Swithin]172-swithin 's eye alone betrayed emotion . A dumb and grumbling anger swelled [his]172-swithin bosom . It was vulgar to be stout , to talk of being stout ; [he]172-swithin had a chest , nothing more . Turning to [[his]172-swithin sister]2631-his sister , [he]172-swithin grasped [her]2631-his sister hand , and said in a tone of command : "[176-juley] Well , [Juley]176-juley . " [Mrs. Septimus Small]177-soames was [the tallest of [the four sisters]2633-the four sisters]2632-the tallest of the four sisters ; [her]177-soames good , round old face had gone a little sour ; an innumerable pout clung all over it , as if it had been encased in an iron wire mask up to that evening , which , being suddenly removed , left little rolls of mutinous flesh all over [her]177-soames countenance . Even [her]177-soames eyes were pouting . It was thus that [she]177-soames recorded [her]177-soames permanent resentment at the loss of [Septimus Small]177-soames . [She]177-soames had quite a reputation for saying the wrong thing , and , tenacious like [all [her]177-soames breed]2634-all her breed , [she]177-soames would hold to it when [she]177-soames had said it , and add to it another wrong thing , and so on . With the decease of [[her]177-soames husband]2635-her husband the family tenacity , the family matter - of - factness , had gone sterile within [her]177-soames . [A great talker]2636-a great talker , when allowed , [she]177-soames would converse without the faintest animation for hours together , relating , with epic monotony , the innumerable occasions on which [Fortune]230-fortune had misused [her]177-soames ; nor did [she]177-soames ever perceive that [[her]177-soames hearers]2637-her hearers sympathized with [Fortune]230-fortune , for [her]177-soames heart was kind . Having sat , [poor soul]2638-poor soul , long by the bedside of [Small a man of poor constitution]2639-small a man of poor constitution , [she]177-soames had acquired , the habit , and there were countless subsequent occasions when [she]177-soames had sat immense periods of time to amuse [sick people]2640-sick people , [children]568-children , and [other helpless persons]2642-other helpless persons , and [she]177-soames could never divest [herself]177-soames of the feeling that [the world]2286-the world was [the most ungrateful place [anybody]2303-anybody could live in]2644-the most ungrateful place anybody could live in . Sunday after Sunday [she]177-soames sat at the feet of [that extremely witty preacher]2646-that extremely witty preacher , [the Rev. Thomas Scoles]182-tommy , who exercised a great influence over [her]177-soames ; but [she]177-soames succeeded in convincing [everybody]601-everybody that even this was a misfortune . [She]177-soames had passed into a proverb in [the family]450-the family , and when [anybody]2303-anybody was observed to be peculiarly distressing , [he]2303-anybody was known as [a regular ' Juley]2650-a regular ' juley . ' The habit of [her]177-soames mind would have killed anybody but [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte at forty ; but [she]177-soames was seventy - two , and had never looked better . And [one]2652-one felt that there were capacities for enjoyment about [her]177-soames which might yet come out . [She]177-soames owned three canaries , [the cat Tommy]2653-the cat tommy , and half a parrot - in common with [[her]177-soames sister]2654-her sister [Hester]181-aunt hester ; - and [these poor creatures]2655-these poor creatures kept carefully out of [Timothy]170-timothy 's way - [he]170-timothy was nervous about animals , unlike [human beings]2656-human beings , recognising that [she]177-soames could not help being blighted , attached [themselves]2656-human beings to [her]177-soames passionately . [She]177-soames was sombrely magnificent this evening in black bombazine , with a mauve front cut in a shy triangle , and crowned with a black velvet ribbon round the base of [her]177-soames thin throat ; black and mauve for evening wear was esteemed very chaste by nearly every [Forsyte]172-swithin . Pouting at [Swithin]172-swithin , [she]177-soames said : "[176-juley] [Ann]169-aunt ann has been asking for [you]755-you . [You]755-you have n't been near [us]756-us for an age ! " [Swithin]172-swithin put [his]172-swithin thumbs within the armholes of [his]172-swithin waistcoat , and replied : "[755-you] [Ann]169-aunt ann 's getting very shaky ; [she]169-aunt ann ought to have [a doctor]757-a doctor ! " "[758-mr.] [Mr.]758-mr. and [Mrs. Nicholas Forsyte]189-nicholas ! " [Nicholas Forsyte]189-nicholas , cocking [his]172-swithin rectangular eyebrows , wore a smile . [He]172-swithin had succeeded during the day in bringing to fruition a scheme for the employment of [a tribe from [Upper India]42-upper india in [the gold - mines of [Ceylon]43-ceylon]2658-the gold - mines of ceylon]2657-a tribe from upper india in the gold - mines of ceylon . A pet plan , carried at last in the teeth of great difficulties - [he]172-swithin was justly pleased . It would double the output of [[his]172-swithin mines]2659-his mines , and , as [he]172-swithin had often forcibly argued , all experience tended to show that [a man]515-a man must die ; and whether [he]515-a man died of a miserable old age in [[his]515-a man own country]2661-his own country , or prematurely of damp in the bottom of [a foreign mine]2662-a foreign mine , was surely of little consequence , provided that by a change in [his]172-swithin mode of life [he]172-swithin benefited [the British Empire]2663-the british empire . [His]172-swithin ability was undoubted . Raising [his]172-swithin broken nose towards [[his]172-swithin listener]2664-his listener , [he]172-swithin would add : "[189-nicholas] For want of [a few hundred of [these fellows]760-these fellows]759-a few hundred of these fellows [we]761-we have n't paid a dividend for years , and look at the price of the shares . [I]0-i ca n't get ten shillings for [them]760-these fellows . " [He]172-swithin had been at [Yarmouth]6-yarmouth , too , and had come back feeling that [he]172-swithin had added at least ten years to [his]172-swithin own life . [He]172-swithin grasped [Swithin]172-swithin 's hand , exclaiming in a jocular voice : "[0-i] Well , so here [we]761-we are again ! " [Mrs. Nicholas]189-nicholas , [an effete woman]2665-an effete woman , smiled a smile of frightened jollity behind [his]172-swithin back . "[762-mr.] [Mr.]762-mr. and [Mrs. James Forsyte]231-mrs. james forsyte ! [Mr.]763-mr. and [Mrs. Soames Forsyte]232-soames ! " [Swithin]172-swithin drew [his]172-swithin heels together , [his]172-swithin deportment ever admirable . "[232-soames] Well , [James]231-mrs. james forsyte , well [Emily]173-james ! How are [you]231-mrs. james forsyte , [Soames]232-soames ? How do [you]231-mrs. james forsyte do ? " [His]172-swithin hand enclosed [Irene]186-irene 's , and [his]172-swithin eyes swelled . [She]186-irene was [a pretty woman]718-a pretty woman - a little too pale , but [her]186-irene figure , [her]186-irene eyes , [her]186-irene teeth ! Too good for [that chap Soames]2667-that chap soames ! [The gods]2668-the gods had given [Irene]186-irene dark brown eyes and golden hair , that strange combination , provocative of [men]550-men 's glances , which is said to be the mark of a weak character . And the full , soft pallor of [her]186-irene neck and shoulders , above a gold - coloured frock , gave to [her]186-irene personality an alluring strangeness . The hands of [Swithin]172-swithin 's watch , which [he]2667-that chap soames still held open in [his]2667-that chap soames hand , had left eight behind ; it was half an hour beyond [his]2667-that chap soames dinner - time - [he]2667-that chap soames had had no lunch - and a strange primeval impatience surged up within [him]2667-that chap soames . "[231-mrs. james forsyte] It 's not like [Jolyon]167-young jolyon to be late ! " [he]2667-that chap soames said to [Irene]186-irene , with uncontrollable vexation . " And behind this outburst the inarticulate violence of [primitive generations]2671-primitive generations seemed to mutter and grumble . "[166-june] Tell [me]0-i what [you]765-you think of [my]0-i new star , [Uncle Swithin]233-swithin , " said [Irene]186-irene softly . Among the lace in the bosom of [her]186-irene dress was shining a five - pointed star , made of eleven diamonds . [Swithin]233-swithin looked at the star . [He]233-swithin had a pretty taste in stones ; no question could have been more sympathetically devised to distract [his]233-swithin attention . "[765-you] Who gave [you]0-i that ? " [he]233-swithin asked . "[232-soames] [Soames]232-soames . " "[166-june] [Miss June Forsyte]166-june - [Mr. Jolyon Forsyte]165-old jolyon ! ... [Mr. Boswainey]234-mr. boswainey ! ...
