[He]164-soames walked slowly back towards [the site]935-the site in deep thought . [His]164-soames instinct told [him]164-soames that what [the agent]943-the agent had said was true . [A cheap site]2756-a cheap site . And the beauty of [it]2756-a cheap site was , that [he]164-soames knew [the agent]943-the agent did not really think it cheap ; so that [his]164-soames own intuitive knowledge was a victory over [the agent]943-the agent 's . ' Cheap or not , [I]0-i mean to have it , ' [he]164-soames thought . The larks sprang up in front of [his]164-soames feet , the air was full of butterflies , a sweet fragrance rose from the wild grasses . The sappy scent of the bracken stole forth from the wood , where , hidden in the depths , pigeons were cooing , and from afar on the warm breeze , came the rhythmic chiming of church bells . [Soames]164-soames walked with [his]164-soames eyes on the ground , [his]164-soames lips opening and closing as though in anticipation of a delicious morsel . But when [he]164-soames arrived at [the site]935-the site , [Bosinney]168-bosinney was nowhere to be seen . After waiting some little time , [he]164-soames crossed [the warren]2760-the warren in the direction of [the slope]2761-the slope . [He]164-soames would have shouted , but dreaded the sound of [his]164-soames voice . [The warren]2760-the warren was as lonely as [a prairie]2763-a prairie , [its]2760-the warren silence only broken by the rustle of rabbits bolting to their holes , and the song of the larks . [Soames]164-soames , [the pioneer - leader of [the great Forsyte army]2765-the great forsyte army advancing to the civilization of [this wilderness]2766-this wilderness]2764-the pioneer - leader of the great forsyte army advancing to the civilization of this wilderness , felt [his]164-soames spirit daunted by the loneliness , by the invisible singing , and the hot , sweet air . [He]164-soames had begun to retrace [his]164-soames steps when [he]164-soames at last caught sight of [Bosinney]168-bosinney . [The architect]2700-the architect was sprawling under a large oak tree , whose trunk , with a huge spread of bough and foliage , ragged with age , stood on the verge of the rise . [Soames]164-soames had to touch [him]168-bosinney on the shoulder before [he]164-soames looked up . "[0-i] [Hallo]60-hallo ! [Forsyte]165-old jolyon , " [he]0-i said , "[165-old jolyon] [I]0-i 've found the very place for [[your]165-old jolyon house]2720-your house ! Look here ! " [Soames]164-soames stood and looked , then [he]164-soames said , coldly : "[165-old jolyon] [You]165-old jolyon may be very clever , but [this site]955-this site will cost [me]0-i half as much again . " "[956-man] Hang the cost , [man]956-man . Look at the view ! " Almost from [their]2768-their feet stretched ripe corn , dipping to a small dark copse beyond . A plain of [fields and hedges]2769-fields and hedges spread to [the distant grey - bluedowns]2770-the distant grey - bluedowns . In a silver streak to the right could be seen [the line of [the river]2706-the river]2771-the line of the river . The sky was so blue , and the sun so bright , that an eternal summer seemed to reign over this prospect . [Thistledown]251-thistledown floated round [them]2768-their , enraptured by the serenity , of the ether . The heat danced over the corn , and , pervading all , was a soft , insensible hum , like the murmur of bright minutes holding revel between [earth]2773-earth and heaven . [Soames]164-soames looked . In spite of [himself]164-soames , something swelled in [his]164-soames breast . To live [here]735-here in sight of all this , to be able to point it out to [[his]164-soames friends]850-his friends , to talk of it , to possess it ! [His]164-soames cheeks flushed . The warmth , the radiance , the glow , were sinking into [his]164-soames senses as , four years before , [Irene]186-irene 's beauty had sunk into [his]164-soames senses and made [him]164-soames long for [her]186-irene . [He]164-soames stole a glance at [Bosinney]168-bosinney , whose eyes , the eyes of [the coachman]2776-the coachman 's ' half - tame leopard , ' seemed running wild over [the landscape]2777-the landscape . The sunlight had caught the promontories of [the fellow]2355-the fellow 's face , the bumpy cheekbones , the point of [his]2355-the fellow chin , the vertical ridges above [his]2355-the fellow brow ; and [Soames]164-soames watched this rugged , enthusiastic , careless face with an unpleasant feeling . A long , soft ripple of wind flowed over [the corn]2779-the corn , and brought a puff of warm air into [their]2780-their faces . "[0-i] [I]0-i could build [you]957-you a teaser here , " said [Bosinney]168-bosinney , breaking the silence at last . "[0-i] [I]0-i dare say , " replied [Soames]164-soames , drily . "[0-i] [You]0-i have n't got to pay for it . " "[0-i] For about eight thousand [I]0-i could build [you]0-i [a palace]958-a palace . " [Soames]164-soames had become very pale - a struggle was going on within [him]164-soames . [He]164-soames dropped [his]164-soames eyes , and said stubbornly : "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't afford it . " And slowly , with [his]164-soames mousing walk , [he]164-soames led the way back to [the first site]2781-the first site . [They]2780-their spent some time there going into particulars of [the projected house]2782-the projected house , and then [Soames]164-soames returned to [[the agent]943-the agent 's cottage]2784-the agent 's cottage . [He]164-soames came out in about half an hour , and , joining [Bosinney]168-bosinney , started for [the station]2335-the station . "[0-i] Well , " [he]164-soames said , hardly opening [his]164-soames lips , "[0-i] [I]0-i 've taken [that site of [yours]960-my]959-that site of yours , after all . " And again [he]164-soames was silent , confusedly debating how it was that [this fellow]2361-this fellow , whom by habit [he]164-soames despised , should have overborne [his]164-soames own decision . [CHAPTER V - A FORSYTE MENAGE]252-chapter v - a forsyte menage Like [the enlightened thousands of [[his]164-soames class]2502-his class and generation in [this great city of [London]2-london]2789-this great city of london]2787-the enlightened thousands of his class and generation in this great city of london , who no longer believe in red velvet chairs , and know that groups of modern Italian marble are ' vieux jeu , ' [Soames Forsyte]171-soames inhabited [a house which did what [it]171-soames could]2790-a house which did what it could . [It]171-soames owned a copper door knocker of individual design , windows which had been altered to open outwards , hanging flower boxes filled with fuchsias , and at the back a great feature a little court tiled with jade - green tiles , and surrounded by pink hydrangeas in peacock - blue tubs . Here , under a parchment - coloured Japanese sunshade covering the whole end , [inhabitants]2791-inhabitants or [visitors]2792-visitors could be screened from the eyes of [the curious]2793-the curious while [they]2793-the curious drank tea and examined at [their]2793-the curious leisure the latest of [Soames]171-soames 's little silver boxes . The inner decoration favoured [the First Empire]2794-the first empire and [William Morris]253-william morris . For [its]171-soames size , [the house]2326-the house was commodious ; there were countless nooks resembling birds ' nests , and little things made of silver were deposited like eggs . In this general perfection two kinds of fastidiousness were at war . There lived [here]735-here [a mistress]2797-a mistress who would have dwelt daintily on [a desert island]2798-a desert island ; [a master whose daintiness was , as it were , an investment]2799-a master whose daintiness was , as it were , an investment , cultivated by [the owner]2800-the owner for [his]2800-the owner advancement , in accordance with the laws of competition . This competitive daintiness had caused [Soames]171-soames in [his]171-soames Marlborough days to be [the first boy into white waistcoats in summer]2801-the first boy into white waistcoats in summer , and corduroy waistcoats in winter , had prevented [him]171-soames from ever appearing in public with [his]171-soames tie climbing up [his]171-soames collar , and induced [him]171-soames to dust [his]171-soames patent leather boots before a great multitude assembled on [Speech Day]61-speech day to hear [him]171-soames recite [Moliere]254-moliere . Skin - like immaculateness had grown over [Soames]171-soames , as over many [Londoners]62-londoners ; impossible to conceive of [him]171-soames with a hair out of place , a tie deviating one - eighth of an inch from the perpendicular , a collar unglossed ! [He]171-soames would not have gone without a bath for worlds - it was the fashion to take baths ; and how bitter was [his]171-soames scorn of [people who omitted them]2802-people who omitted them ! But [Irene]186-irene could be imagined , like [some nymph , bathing in wayside streams]2803-some nymph , bathing in wayside streams , for the joy of the freshness and of seeing [her]186-irene own fair body . In this conflict throughout [the house]2326-the house [the woman]2805-the woman had gone to the wall . As in the struggle between [Saxon and Celt]2806-saxon and celt still going on within [the nation]2807-the nation , the more impressionable and receptive temperament had had forced on [it]2326-the house a conventional superstructure . Thus [the house]2326-the house had acquired a close resemblance to hundreds of [other houses with the same high aspirations]2809-other houses with the same high aspirations , having become : ' [That very charming little house of [the Soames Forsytes]164-soames]2810-that very charming little house of the soames forsytes , quite individual , [[my]960-my dear]2282-my dear - really elegant . ' For [Soames Forsyte]171-soames - read [James Peabody]255-james peabody , [Thomas Atkins]256-thomas atkins , or [Emmanuel Spagnoletti]257-emmanuel spagnoletti , the name in fact of [any upper - middle class Englishman in [London]2-london with any pretensions to taste]2812-any upper - middle class englishman in london with any pretensions to taste ; and though the decoration be different , the phrase is just . On the evening of August 8 , a week after the expedition to [Robin Hill]53-robin hill , in [the dining - room of [this house]752-this house]2813-the dining - room of this house - ' quite individual , [[my]960-my dear]2282-my dear - really elegant ' - [Soames]171-soames and [Irene]186-irene were seated at dinner . A hot dinner on Sundays was a little distinguishing elegance common to [this house]752-this house and many others . Early in married life [Soames]171-soames had laid down the rule : ' [The servants]2817-the servants must give [us]2818-us hot dinner on Sundays - [they]2817-the servants 've nothing to do but play the concertina . ' The custom had produced no revolution . For - to Soames a rather deplorable sign - [servants]2819-servants were devoted to [Irene]186-irene , who , in defiance of all safe tradition , appeared to recognise [their]2819-servants right to a share in the weaknesses of human nature . [The happy pair]2820-the happy pair were seated , not opposite each other , but rectangularly , at the handsome rosewood table ; [they]2820-the happy pair dined without a cloth - a distinguishing elegance - and so far had not spoken a word . [Soames]171-soames liked to talk during dinner about business , or what [he]171-soames had been buying , and so long as [he]171-soames talked [Irene]186-irene 's silence did not distress [him]171-soames . This evening [he]171-soames had found it impossible to talk . The decision to build had been weighing on [his]171-soames mind all the week , and [he]171-soames had made up [his]171-soames mind to tell [her]186-irene . [His]171-soames nervousness about this disclosure irritated [him]171-soames profoundly ; [she]186-irene had no business to make [him]171-soames feel like that - [a wife]2821-a wife and [a husband]2822-a husband being [one person]2823-one person . [She]186-irene had not looked at [him]171-soames once since [they]2820-the happy pair sat down ; and [he]171-soames wondered what on earth [she]186-irene had been thinking about all the time . It was hard , when [a man]515-a man worked as [he]171-soames did , making money for [her]186-irene - yes , and with an ache in [his]171-soames heart - that [she]186-irene should sit there , looking - looking as if [she]186-irene saw the walls of [the room]488-the room closing in . It was enough to make [a man]515-a man get up and leave the table . The light from the rose - shaded lamp fell on [her]186-irene neck and arms - [Soames]171-soames liked [her]186-irene to dine in a low dress , it gave [him]171-soames an inexpressible feeling of superiority to [the majority of [his]171-soames acquaintance , whose wives]2827-the majority of his acquaintance , whose wives were contented with [their]2827-the majority of his acquaintance , whose wives best high frocks or with tea - gowns , when [they]2827-the majority of his acquaintance , whose wives dined at [home]436-home . Under that rosy light [her]186-irene amber - coloured hair and fair skin made strange contrast with [her]186-irene dark brown eyes . Could [a man]515-a man own anything prettier than this dining - table with [its]2830-its deep tints , the starry , soft - petalled roses , the ruby - coloured glass , and quaint silver furnishing ; could [a man]515-a man own anything prettier than [the woman who sat at it]2832-the woman who sat at it ? [Gratitude]258-gratitude was no virtue among [Forsytes , who , competitive , and full of common - sense]2833-forsytes , who , competitive , and full of common - sense , had no occasion for it ; and [Soames]171-soames only experienced a sense of exasperation amounting to pain , that [he]171-soames did not own [her]186-irene as it was [his]171-soames right to own [her]186-irene , that [he]171-soames could not , as by stretching out [his]171-soames hand to that rose , pluck [her]186-irene and sniff the very secrets of [her]186-irene heart . Out of [[his]171-soames other property]2834-his other property , out of all the things [he]171-soames had collected , [his]171-soames silver , [his]171-soames pictures , [[his]171-soames houses]2835-his houses , [his]171-soames investments , [he]171-soames got a secret and intimate feeling ; out of [her]186-irene [he]171-soames got none . In [this house of [his]171-soames]2836-this house of his there was writing on every wall . [His]171-soames business - like temperament protested against a mysterious warning that [she]186-irene was not made for [him]171-soames . [He]171-soames had married [this woman]2837-this woman , conquered [her]2837-this woman , made [her]2837-this woman [his]171-soames own , and it seemed to [him]171-soames contrary to the most fundamental of all laws , the law of possession , that [he]171-soames could do no more than own [her]2837-this woman body - if indeed [he]171-soames could do that , which [he]171-soames was beginning to doubt . If [any one]2838-any one had asked [him]171-soames if [he]171-soames wanted to own [her]2837-this woman soul , the question would have seemed to [him]171-soames both ridiculous and sentimental . But [he]171-soames did so want , and the writing said [he]171-soames never would . [She]2837-this woman was ever silent , passive , gracefully averse ; as though terrified lest by word , motion , or sign [she]2837-this woman might lead [him]171-soames to believe that [she]2837-this woman was fond of [him]171-soames ; and [he]171-soames asked [himself]171-soames : Must [I]960-my always go on like this ? Like [most novel readers of [his]171-soames generation]2839-most novel readers of his generation and [Soames]171-soames was [a great novel reader]2840-a great novel reader , literature coloured [his]171-soames view of life ; and [he]171-soames had imbibed the belief that it was only a question of time . In the end [the husband]2841-the husband always gained the affection of [[his]2841-the husband wife]558-his wife . Even in those cases - a class of book [he]171-soames was not very fond of - which ended in tragedy , [the wife]2843-the wife always died with poignant regrets on [her]2843-the wife lips , or if it were [the husband who died - unpleasant thought]2844-the husband who died - unpleasant thought - threw [herself]2843-the wife on [his]2841-the husband body in an agony of remorse . [He]171-soames often took [Irene]186-irene to [the theatre]541-the theatre , instinctively choosing the modern Society Plays with the modern Society conjugal problem , so fortunately different from any conjugal problem in real life . [He]171-soames found that they too always ended in the same way , even when there was [a lover]2846-a lover in the case . While [he]171-soames was watching the play [Soames]171-soames often sympathized with [the lover]863-the lover ; but before [he]171-soames reached [home]436-home again , driving with [Irene]186-irene in a hansom , [he]171-soames saw that this would not do , and [he]171-soames was glad the play had ended as it had . There was one class of [husband that had just then come into fashion]2849-husband that had just then come into fashion , [the strong , rather rough , but extremely sound man , who was peculiarly [successful at the end of the play]2851-successful at the end of the play]2850-the strong , rather rough , but extremely sound man , who was peculiarly successful at the end of the play ; with [this person]2852-this person [Soames]171-soames was really not in sympathy , and had it not been for [his]171-soames own position , would have expressed [his]171-soames disgust with [the fellow]2355-the fellow . But [he]171-soames was so conscious of how vital to [himself]171-soames was the necessity for being a successful , even [a ' strong , ' husband]2854-a ' strong , ' husband , that [he]171-soames never spoke of a distaste born perhaps by the perverse processes of Nature out of a secret fund of brutality in [himself]171-soames . But [Irene]186-irene 's silence this evening was exceptional . [He]171-soames had never before seen such an expression on [her]186-irene face . And since it is always the unusual which alarms , [Soames]171-soames was alarmed . [He]171-soames ate [his]171-soames savoury , and hurried [the maid]2855-the maid as [she]2855-the maid swept off the crumbs with the silver sweeper . When [she]2855-the maid had left [the room]488-the room , [he]171-soames filled [his]171-soames glass with wine and said : "[960-my] [Anybody]2303-anybody been [here]735-here this afternoon ? " "[166-june] [June]166-june . " "[166-june] What did [she]963-she want ? " It was an axiom with [the Forsytes]2857-the forsytes that [people]600-people did not go anywhere unless [they]600-people wanted something . "[963-she] Came to talk about [[her]963-she lover]554-her lover , [I]0-i suppose ? " [Irene]186-irene made no reply . "[0-i] It looks to [me]0-i , " continued [Soames]171-soames , "[963-she] as if [she]963-she were sweeter on [him]554-her lover than [he]554-her lover is on [her]963-she . [She]963-she 's always following [him]554-her lover about . " [Irene]186-irene 's eyes made [him]171-soames feel uncomfortable . "[963-she] [You]0-i 've no business to say such a thing ! " [she]186-irene exclaimed . "[963-she] Why not ? [Anybody]2303-anybody can see it . " "[2303-anybody] [They]2303-anybody can not . And if [they]2303-anybody could , it 's disgraceful to say so . " [Soames]171-soames 's composure gave way . "[0-i] [You]0-i 're [a pretty wife]966-a pretty wife ! " [he]171-soames said . But secretly [he]171-soames wondered at the heat of [her]186-irene reply ; it was unlike [her]186-irene . "[0-i] [You]0-i 're cracked about [June]166-june ! [I]0-i can tell [you]0-i one thing : now that [she]166-june has [the Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer in tow , [she]166-june does n't care twopence about [you]0-i , and , [you]0-i 'll find it out . But [you]0-i wo n't see so much of [her]166-june in future ; [we]968-we 're going to live in [the country]2374-the country . " [He]171-soames had been glad to get [his]171-soames news out under cover of this burst of irritation . [He]171-soames had expected a cry of dismay ; the silence with which [his]171-soames pronouncement was received alarmed [him]171-soames . "[0-i] [You]0-i do n't seem interested , " [he]171-soames was obliged to add . "[0-i] [I]0-i knew it already . " [He]171-soames looked at [her]166-june sharply . "[0-i] Who told [you]0-i ? " "[166-june] [June]166-june . " "[166-june] How did [she]166-june know ? " [Irene]186-irene did not answer . Baffled and uncomfortable , [he]171-soames said : "[166-june] It 's a fine thing for [Bosinney]168-bosinney , it 'll be the making of [him]168-bosinney . [I]0-i suppose [she]166-june 's told [you]0-i all about it ? " "[166-june] Yes . " There was another pause , and then [Soames]171-soames said : "[166-june] [I]0-i suppose [you]0-i do n't want to , go ? " [Irene]186-irene made no reply . "[166-june] Well , [I]0-i ca n't tell what [you]0-i want . [You]0-i never seem contented [here]735-here . " "[0-i] Have [my]0-i wishes anything to do with it ? " [She]186-irene took the vase of roses and left [the room]488-the room . [Soames]171-soames remained seated . Was it for this that [he]171-soames had signed that contract ? Was it for this that [he]171-soames was going to spend some ten thousand pounds ? [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's phrase came back to [him]171-soames : "[0-i] [Women]817-women are the devil ! " But presently [he]171-soames grew calmer . It might have , been worse . [She]166-june might have flared up . [He]171-soames had expected something more than this . It was lucky , after all , that [June]166-june had broken the ice for [him]171-soames . [She]166-june must have wormed it out of [Bosinney]168-bosinney ; [he]171-soames might have known [she]166-june would . [He]171-soames lighted [his]171-soames cigarette . After all , [Irene]186-irene had not made a scene ! [She]186-irene would come round - that was the best of [her]186-irene ; [she]186-irene was cold , but not sulky . And , puffing the cigarette smoke at a lady - bird on the shining table , [he]171-soames plunged into a reverie about [the house]2326-the house . It was no good worrying ; [he]171-soames would go and make it up presently . [She]186-irene would be sitting out there in the dark , under the Japanese sunshade , knitting . A beautiful , warm night .... In truth , [June]166-june had come in that afternoon with shining eyes , and the words : "[817-women] [Soames]171-soames is a brick ! It 's splendid for [Phil]168-bosinney - the very thing for [him]168-bosinney ! " [Irene]186-irene 's face remaining dark and puzzled , [she]186-irene went on : "[168-bosinney] [[Your]168-bosinney new house at [Robin Hill]53-robin hill]972-your new house at robin hill , of course . What ? Do n't [you]168-bosinney know ? " [Irene]186-irene did not know . "[168-bosinney] Oh ! then , [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i ought n't to have told [you]168-bosinney ! " Looking impatiently at [[her]186-irene friend]2861-her friend , [she]186-irene cried : "[168-bosinney] [You]168-bosinney look as if [you]168-bosinney did n't care . Do n't [you]168-bosinney see , it 's what [I]0-i 've ' been praying for - the very chance [he]168-bosinney 's been wanting all this time . Now [you]168-bosinney 'll see what [he]168-bosinney can do ; " and thereupon [she]186-irene poured out the whole story . Since [her]186-irene own engagement [she]186-irene had not seemed much interested in [[her]186-irene friend]2861-her friend 's position ; the hours [she]186-irene spent with [Irene]186-irene were given to confidences of [her]186-irene own ; and at times , for all [her]186-irene affectionate pity , it was impossible to keep out of [her]186-irene smile a trace of compassionate contempt for [the woman who had made such a mistake in [her]186-irene life]2863-the woman who had made such a mistake in her life - such a vast , ridiculous mistake . "[168-bosinney] [He]168-bosinney 's to have all the decorations as well - a free hand . It 's perfect - " [June]166-june broke into laughter , [her]166-june little figure quivered gleefully ; [she]166-june raised [her]166-june hand , and struck a blow at a muslin curtain . "[168-bosinney] Do [you]168-bosinney , know [I]0-i even asked [Uncle James]241-james .... " But , with a sudden dislike to mentioning that incident , [she]186-irene stopped ; and presently , finding [[her]186-irene friend]2861-her friend so unresponsive , went away . [She]186-irene looked back from [the pavement]2865-the pavement , and [Irene]186-irene was still standing in the doorway . In response to [her]186-irene farewell wave , [Irene]186-irene put [her]186-irene hand to [her]186-irene brow , and , turning slowly , shut the door .... [Soames]171-soames went to [the drawing - room]849-the drawing - room presently , and peered at [her]186-irene through the window . Out in the shadow of the Japanese sunshade [she]186-irene was sitting very still , the lace on [her]186-irene white shoulders stirring with the soft rise and fall of [her]186-irene bosom . But about [this silent creature sitting there so motionless , in the dark]2867-this silent creature sitting there so motionless , in the dark , there seemed a warmth , a hidden fervour of feeling , as if the whole of [her]186-irene being had been stirred , and some change were taking place in its very depths . [He]171-soames stole back to [the dining - room]2449-the dining - room unnoticed . CHAPTER VI - JAMES AT LARGE It was not long before [Soames]171-soames 's determination to build went the round of [the family]450-the family , and created the flutter that any decision connected with property should make among [Forsytes]164-soames . It was not [his]171-soames fault , for [he]171-soames had been determined that [no one]514-no one should know . [June]166-june , in the fulness of [her]166-june heart , had told [Mrs. Small]177-soames , giving [her]166-june leave only to tell [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann - [she]177-soames thought it would cheer [her]166-june , [the poor old sweet]2871-the poor old sweet ! for [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann had kept [[her]169-aunt ann room]2872-her room now for many days . [Mrs. Small]177-soames told [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann at once , who , smiling as [she]169-aunt ann lay back on [her]169-aunt ann pillows , said in [her]169-aunt ann distinct , trembling old voice : "[241-james] It 's very nice for [dear June]166-june ; but [I]0-i hope [they]973-they will be careful - it 's rather dangerous ! " When [she]169-aunt ann was left alone again , a frown , like a cloud presaging a rainy morrow , crossed [her]169-aunt ann face . While [she]169-aunt ann was lying there so many days the process of recharging [her]169-aunt ann will went on all the time ; it spread to [her]169-aunt ann face , too , and tightening movements were always in action at the corners of [her]169-aunt ann lips . [The maid Smither , who had been in [her]169-aunt ann service since girlhood]2873-the maid smither , who had been in her service since girlhood , and was spoken of as "[259-smither] [Smither]259-smither - [a good girl]974-a good girl - but so slow ! " - [the maid [Smither]259-smither]2874-the maid smither performed every morning with extreme punctiliousness the crowning ceremony of [that ancient toilet]2875-that ancient toilet . Taking from the recesses of [their]973-they pure white band - box those flat , grey curls , the insignia of personal dignity , [she]2874-the maid smither placed them securely in [[her]2874-the maid smither mistress]2876-her mistress 's hands , and turned [her]2874-the maid smither back . And every day [Aunts Juley]260-aunts juley and [Hester]181-aunt hester were required to come and report on [Timothy]170-timothy ; what news there was of [Nicholas]226-nicholas ; whether [dear June]166-june had succeeded in getting [Jolyon]165-old jolyon to shorten the engagement , now that [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney was building [[Soames]177-soames [a house]689-a house]2877-soames a house ; whether [young [Roger]317-roger 's wife]2879-young roger 's wife was really - expecting ; how the operation on [Archie]179-archibald had succeeded ; and what [Swithin]233-swithin had done about [that empty house in [Wigmore Street]64-wigmore street]2880-that empty house in wigmore street , where [the tenant]2881-the tenant had lost all [his]2881-the tenant money and treated [him]2881-the tenant so badly ; above all , about [Soames]177-soames ; was [Irene]186-irene still - still asking for [a separate room]563-a separate room ? And every morning [Smither]259-smither was told : "[259-smither] [I]0-i shall be coming down this afternoon , [Smither]259-smither , about two o'clock . [I]0-i shall want [your]259-smither arm , after all these days in bed ! " After telling [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann , [Mrs. Small]177-soames had spoken of [the house]2326-the house in the strictest confidence to [Mrs. Nicholas]189-nicholas , who in [her]189-nicholas turn had asked [Winifred Dartie]187-dartie for confirmation , supposing , of course , that , being [[Soames]177-soames 's sister]2884-soames 's sister , [she]189-nicholas would know all about it . Through [her]189-nicholas it had in due course come round to the ears of [James]241-james . [He]976-he had been a good deal agitated . "[2292-nobody] [Nobody]2292-nobody , " [he]976-he said , "[976-he] told [him]976-he anything . " And , rather than go direct to [Soames]177-soames [himself]177-soames , of whose taciturnity [he]976-he was afraid , [he]976-he took [his]976-he umbrella and went round to [Timothy]170-timothy 's . [He]976-he found [Mrs. Septimus]177-soames and [Hester]181-aunt hester who had been told - [she]189-nicholas was so safe , [she]189-nicholas found it tiring to talk ready , and indeed eager , to discuss the news . It was very good of [dear Soames]177-soames , [they]2885-they thought , to employ [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney , but rather risky . What had [George]183-george named [him]978-him ? ' [The Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer ' How droll ! But [George]183-george was always droll ! However , it would be all in [the family]450-the family [they]2885-they supposed [they]2885-they must really look upon [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney as belonging to [the family]450-the family , though it seemed strange . [James]241-james here broke in : "[2292-nobody] [Nobody]2292-nobody knows anything about [him]978-him . [I]0-i do n't see what [Soames]177-soames wants with [a young man like that]979-a young man like that . [I]0-i should n't be surprised if [Irene]186-irene had put [her]186-irene oar in . [I]0-i shall speak to .... " "[177-soames] [Soames]177-soames , " interposed [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley , "[177-soames] told [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney that [he]168-bosinney did n't wish it mentioned . [He]168-bosinney would n't like it to be talked about , [I]0-i 'm sure , and if [Timothy]170-timothy knew [he]168-bosinney would be very vexed , [I]0-i .... " [James]241-james put [his]0-i hand behind [his]0-i ear : "[0-i] What ? " [he]0-i said . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm getting very deaf . [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i do n't hear [people]600-people . [Emily]173-james 's got a bad toe . [We]981-we sha n't be able to start for [Wales]7-wales till the end of the month . There 's always something ! " And , having got what [he]0-i wanted , [he]0-i took [his]0-i hat and went away . It was a fine afternoon , and [he]0-i walked across [the Park]531-the park towards [[Soames]177-soames 's]2890-soames 's , where [he]0-i intended to dine , for [Emily]173-james 's toe kept [her]173-james in bed , and [Rachel]261-rachel and [Cicely]262-cicely were on a visit to [the country]2374-the country . [He]0-i took the slanting path from [the Bayswater side of the Row]2892-the bayswater side of the row to [the Knightsbridge Gate]65-the knightsbridge gate , across a pasture of short , burnt grass , dotted with blackened sheep , strewn with [seated couples]2893-seated couples and strange waifs ; lying prone on [their]2893-seated couples faces , like corpses on a field over which the wave of battle has rolled . [He]0-i walked rapidly , [his]0-i head bent , looking neither to right nor , left . The appearance of [this park]2894-this park , [the centre of [his]0-i own battle - field]2895-the centre of his own battle - field , where [he]0-i had all [his]0-i life been fighting , excited no thought or speculation in [his]0-i mind . These corpses flung down , there , from out the press and turmoil of the struggle , [these pairs of lovers]2896-these pairs of lovers sitting cheek by jowl for an hour of idle Elysium snatched from the monotony of [their]2896-these pairs of lovers treadmill , awakened no fancies in [his]0-i mind ; [he]0-i had outlived that kind of imagination ; [his]0-i nose , like the nose of a sheep , was fastened to the pastures on which [he]0-i browsed . [One of [[his]0-i tenants]2898-his tenants]2897-one of his tenants had lately shown a disposition to be behind - hand in [his]2897-one of his tenants rent , and it had become a grave question whether [he]2897-one of his tenants had not better turn [him]2897-one of his tenants out at once , and so run the risk of not re - letting before Christmas . [Swithin]233-swithin had just been let in very badly , but it had served [him]0-i right - [he]0-i had held on too long . [He]0-i pondered this as [he]0-i walked steadily , holding [his]0-i umbrella carefully by the wood , just below the crook of the handle , so as to keep the ferule off the ground , and not fray the silk in the middle . And , with [his]0-i thin , high shoulders stooped , [his]0-i long legs moving with swift mechanical precision , this passage through [the Park]531-the park , where the sun shone with a clear flame on so much idleness - on so many human evidences of the remorseless battle of Property , raging beyond [its]531-the park ring - was like the flight of some land bird across [the sea]2321-the sea . [He]0-i felt a - touch on the arm as [he]0-i came out at [Albert Gate]66-albert gate . It was [Soames]177-soames , who , crossing from the shady side of [Piccadilly]67-piccadilly , where [he]0-i had been walking [home]436-home from [the office]2902-the office , had suddenly appeared alongside . "[982-your] [[Your]982-your mother]2307-your mother 's in bed , " said [James]173-james ; "[0-i] [I]0-i was , just coming to [you]982-your , but [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i shall be in the way . " The outward relations between [James]173-james and [[his]0-i son]2441-his son were marked by a lack of sentiment peculiarly [Forsytean]263-forsytean , but for all that [the two]2453-the two were by no means unattached . Perhaps [they]2453-the two regarded [one another]474-one another as an investment ; certainly [they]2453-the two were solicitous of [each other]2556-each other 's welfare , glad of [each other]2556-each other 's company . [They]2453-the two had never exchanged two words upon the more intimate problems of life , or revealed in [each other]2556-each other 's presence the existence of any deep feeling . Something beyond the power of word - analysis bound [them]2453-the two together , something hidden deep in the fibre of [nations]445-nations and [families]2910-families - for blood , [they]2453-the two say , is thicker than water - and neither of [them]2453-the two was [a cold - blooded man]2911-a cold - blooded man . Indeed , in [James]173-james love of [[his]0-i children]801-his children was now the prime motive of [his]0-i existence . To have creatures who were parts of [himself]0-i , to whom [he]0-i might transmit the money [he]0-i saved , was at the root of [his]0-i saving ; and , at seventy - five , what was left that could give [him]0-i pleasure , but - saving ? The kernel of life was in this saving for [[his]0-i children]801-his children . Than [James Forsyte]241-james , notwithstanding all [his]0-i ' Jonah - isms , ' there was [no saner man]2914-no saner man if the leading symptom of sanity , as [we]2915-we are told , is self - preservation , though without doubt [Timothy]170-timothy went too far in [all this [London]2-london , of which [he]170-timothy owned so much , and loved with such a dumb love , as the centre of [his]170-timothy opportunities]2916-all this london , of which he owned so much , and loved with such a dumb love , as the centre of his opportunities . [He]170-timothy had the marvellous instinctive sanity of [the middle class]2917-the middle class . In [him]170-timothy - more than in [Jolyon]165-old jolyon , with [his]170-timothy masterful will and [his]170-timothy moments of tenderness and philosophy - more than in [Swithin]233-swithin , [the martyr to crankiness]2918-the martyr to crankiness - [Nicholas]189-nicholas , [the sufferer from ability]2919-the sufferer from ability - and [Roger]317-roger , [the victim of enterprise]2920-the victim of enterprise - beat the true pulse of compromise ; of all [the brothers]708-the brothers [he]170-timothy was least remarkable in mind and person , and for that reason more likely to live for ever . To [James]241-james , more than to any of [the others]2691-the others , was "[2923-the family " significant and dear] [the family " significant and dear]2923-the family " significant and dear . There had always been something primitive and cosy in [his]241-james attitude towards life ; [he]241-james loved the family hearth , [he]241-james loved gossip , and [he]241-james loved grumbling . All [his]241-james decisions were formed of a cream which [he]241-james skimmed off the family mind ; and , through [that family]2924-that family , off the minds of [thousands of [other families of similar fibre]2926-other families of similar fibre]2925-thousands of other families of similar fibre . Year after year , week after week , [he]241-james went to [[Timothy]170-timothy 's]2927-timothy 's , and in [[[his]241-james brother]536-his brother 's front drawing - room]2929-his brother 's front drawing - room - [his]241-james legs twisted , [his]241-james long white whiskers framing [his]241-james clean - shaven mouth - would sit watching the family pot simmer , the cream rising to the top ; and [he]241-james would go away sheltered , refreshed , comforted , with an indefinable sense of comfort . Beneath the adamant of [his]241-james self - preserving instinct there was much real softness in [James]241-james ; a visit to [[Timothy]170-timothy 's]2927-timothy 's was like an hour spent in the lap of [a mother]2931-a mother ; and the deep craving [he]241-james [himself]241-james had for the protection of [the family]450-the family wing reacted in turn on [his]241-james feelings towards [[his]241-james own children]827-his own children ; it was a nightmare to [him]241-james to think of [them]827-his own children exposed to the treatment of [the world]2286-the world , in money , health , or reputation . When [[his]241-james old friend [John Street]264-john street 's son]2935-his old friend john street 's son volunteered for special service , [he]241-james shook [his]241-james head querulously , and wondered what [John Street]264-john street was about to allow it ; and when [young Street]264-john street was assagaied , [he]241-james took it so much to heart that [he]241-james made a point of calling everywhere with the special object of saying : [He]241-james knew how it would be - [he]241-james 'd no patience with [them]827-his own children ! When [[his]241-james son - in - law]2936-his son - in - law [Dartie]187-dartie had that financial crisis , due to speculation in Oil Shares , [James]241-james made [himself]241-james ill worrying over it ; the knell of all prosperity seemed to have sounded . It took [him]241-james three months and a visit to [Baden - Baden]68-baden - baden to get better ; there was something terrible in the idea that but for [his]241-james , [James]241-james 's , money , [Dartie]187-dartie 's name might have appeared in the Bankruptcy List . Composed of a physiological mixture so sound that if [he]241-james had an earache [he]241-james thought [he]241-james was dying , [he]241-james regarded the occasional ailments of [[his]241-james wife]558-his wife and [children]568-children as in the nature of personal grievances , special interventions of [Providence]265-providence for the purpose of destroying [his]241-james peace of mind ; but [he]241-james did not believe at all in the ailments of [people outside [[his]241-james own immediate family]2940-his own immediate family]2939-people outside his own immediate family , affirming [them]984-them in every case to be due to neglected liver . [His]241-james universal comment was : "[984-them] What can [they]984-them expect ? [I]0-i have it [myself]0-i , if [I]0-i 'm not careful ! " When [he]241-james went to [[Soames]177-soames 's]2890-soames 's that evening [he]241-james felt that life was hard on [him]241-james : There was [Emily]173-james with a bad toe , and [Rachel]261-rachel gadding about in [the country]2374-the country ; [he]241-james got no sympathy from [anybody]2303-anybody ; and [Ann]169-aunt ann , [she]169-aunt ann was ill - [he]241-james did not believe [she]169-aunt ann would last through the summer ; [he]241-james had called [there]454-there three times now without [her]169-aunt ann being able to see [him]241-james ! And this idea of [Soames]177-soames 's , building [a house]689-a house , that would have to be looked into . As to the trouble with [Irene]186-irene , [he]241-james did n't know what was to come of that - anything might come of it ! [He]241-james entered [62]2946-62 , [Montpellier Square]8-montpellier square with the fullest intentions of being miserable . It was already half - past seven , and [Irene]186-irene , dressed for dinner , was seated in [the drawing - room]849-the drawing - room . [She]186-irene was wearing [her]186-irene gold - coloured frock - for , having been displayed at a dinner - party , a soiree , and a dance , it was now to be worn at [home]436-home - and [she]186-irene had adorned the bosom with a cascade of lace , on which [James]173-james 's eyes riveted themselves at once . "[985-you] Where do [you]985-you get [your]985-you things ? " [he]241-james said in an aggravated voice . "[985-you] [I]0-i never see [Rachel]261-rachel and [Cicely]262-cicely looking half so well . That rose - point , now - that 's not real ! " [Irene]186-irene came close , to prove to [him]241-james that [he]241-james was in error . And , in spite of [himself]241-james , [James]173-james felt the influence of [her]186-irene deference , of the faint seductive perfume exhaling from [her]186-irene . [No self - respecting Forsyte]2949-no self - respecting forsyte surrendered at a blow ; so [he]241-james merely said : [He]241-james did n't know - [he]241-james expected [she]186-irene was spending a pretty penny on dress . The gong sounded , and , putting [her]186-irene white arm within [his]241-james , [Irene]186-irene took [him]241-james into [the dining - room]2449-the dining - room . [She]186-irene seated [him]241-james in [[Soames]177-soames 's usual place]2951-soames 's usual place , round the corner on [her]186-irene left . The light fell softly there , so that [he]241-james would not be worried by the gradual dying of the day ; and [she]186-irene began to talk to [him]241-james about [himself]241-james . Presently , over [James]173-james came a change , like the mellowing that steals upon a fruit in the sun ; a sense of being caressed , and praised , and petted , and all without the bestowal of a single caress or word of praise . [He]241-james felt that what [he]241-james was eating was agreeing with [him]241-james ; [he]241-james could not get that feeling at [home]436-home ; [he]241-james did not know when [he]241-james had enjoyed a glass of champagne so much , and , on inquiring the brand and price , was surprised to find that it was one of which [he]241-james had a large stock [himself]241-james , but could never drink ; [he]241-james instantly formed the resolution to let [[his]241-james wine merchant]2953-his wine merchant know that [he]241-james had been swindled . Looking up from [his]241-james food , [he]241-james remarked : "[986-you] [You]986-you 've a lot of nice things about [the place]2427-the place . Now , what did [you]986-you give for that sugar - sifter ? Should n't wonder if it was worth money ! " [He]241-james was particularly pleased with the appearance of a picture , on the wall opposite , which [he]241-james [himself]241-james had given [them]2954-them : "[0-i] [I]0-i 'd no idea it was so good ! " [he]241-james said . [They]2954-them rose to go into [the drawing - room]849-the drawing - room , and [James]173-james followed [Irene]186-irene closely . "[0-i] That 's what [I]0-i call a capital little dinner , " [he]0-i murmured , breathing pleasantly down on [her]186-irene shoulder ; "[0-i] nothing heavy - and not too Frenchified . But [I]0-i ca n't get it at [home]436-home . [I]0-i pay [[my]0-i cook]989-my cook sixty pounds a year , but [she]989-my cook ca n't give [me]0-i a dinner like that ! " [He]241-james had as yet made no allusion to the building of [the house]2326-the house , nor did [he]241-james when [Soames]177-soames , pleading the excuse of business , betook [himself]241-james to [the room at the top , where [he]241-james kept [his]241-james pictures]2957-the room at the top , where he kept his pictures . [James]173-james was left alone with [[his]0-i daughter - in - law]816-his daughter - in - law . The glow of the wine , and of an excellent liqueur , was still within [him]0-i . [He]0-i felt quite warm towards [her]816-his daughter - in - law . [She]816-his daughter - in - law was really a taking little thing ; [she]816-his daughter - in - law listened to [you]2959-you , and seemed to understand what [you]2959-you were saying ; and , while talking , [he]0-i kept examining [her]816-his daughter - in - law figure , from [her]816-his daughter - in - law bronze - coloured shoes to the waved gold of [her]816-his daughter - in - law hair . [She]816-his daughter - in - law was leaning back in an Empire chair , [her]816-his daughter - in - law shoulders poised against the top - [her]816-his daughter - in - law body , flexibly straight and unsupported from the hips , swaying when [she]816-his daughter - in - law moved , as though giving to the arms of [a lover]2846-a lover . [Her]816-his daughter - in - law lips were smiling , [her]816-his daughter - in - law eyes half - closed . It may have been a recognition of danger in the very charm of [her]816-his daughter - in - law attitude , or a twang of digestion , that caused a sudden dumbness to fall on [James]173-james . [He]0-i did not remember ever having been quite alone with [Irene]186-irene before . And , as [he]0-i looked at [her]816-his daughter - in - law , an odd feeling crept over [him]0-i , as though [he]0-i had come across something strange and foreign . Now what was [she]816-his daughter - in - law thinking about - sitting back like that ? Thus when [he]0-i spoke it was in a sharper voice , as if [he]0-i had been awakened from a pleasant dream . "[989-my cook] What d'you do with [yourself]990-you all day ? " [he]0-i said . "[989-my cook] [You]990-you never come round to [Park Lane]14-park lane ! " [She]816-his daughter - in - law seemed to be making very lame excuses , and [James]173-james did not look at [her]816-his daughter - in - law . "[990-you] [I]0-i expect the fact is , [you]990-you have n't time , " [he]0-i said ; "[990-you] [You]990-you 're always about with [June]166-june . [They]992-they tell [me]0-i [she]166-june 's never at [home]436-home now ; [[your]990-you Uncle]994-your uncle [Jolyon]165-old jolyon [he]165-old jolyon does n't like it , [I]0-i fancy , being left so much alone as [he]165-old jolyon is . [I]0-i should say the grey mare was the better horse ! " The colour deepened in [Irene]186-irene 's face ; and [James]173-james watched [her]186-irene suspiciously . " "[1000-a first - rate man] Perhaps [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney is first - rate ! " [James]173-james rose , and took a turn with bent head . "[168-bosinney] That 's it ' , " [he]0-i said , "[1000-a first - rate man] [you]1001-you [young people]1002-young people , [you]1001-you all stick together ; [you]1001-you all think [you]1001-you know best ! " Halting [his]0-i tall , lank figure before [her]1001-you , [he]0-i raised a finger , and levelled it at [her]1001-you bosom , as though bringing an indictment against [her]1001-you beauty : "[1000-a first - rate man] All [I]0-i can say is , [these artistic people]1003-these artistic people , or whatever [they]1003-these artistic people call [themselves]1003-these artistic people , [they]1003-these artistic people 're as unreliable as [they]1003-these artistic people can be ; and [my]0-i advice to [you]1001-you is , do n't [you]1001-you have too much to do with [him]1004-him ! " [Irene]186-irene smiled ; and in the curve of [her]186-irene lips was a strange provocation . [She]186-irene seemed to have lost [her]186-irene deference . [Her]186-irene breast rose and fell as though with secret anger ; [she]186-irene drew [her]186-irene hands inwards from their rest on the arms of [her]186-irene chair until the tips of [her]186-irene fingers met , and [her]186-irene dark eyes looked unfathomably at [James]173-james . [The latter]2450-the latter gloomily scrutinized the floor . "[0-i] [I]0-i tell [you]1001-you [my]0-i opinion , " [he]0-i said , "[0-i] it 's a pity [you]1001-you have n't got [a child]2366-a child to think about , and occupy [you]1001-you ! " A brooding look came instantly on [Irene]186-irene 's face , and even [James]173-james became conscious of the rigidity that took possession of [her]186-irene whole figure beneath the softness of its silk and lace clothing . [He]0-i was frightened by the effect [he]0-i had produced , and like most men with but little courage , [he]0-i sought at once to justify [himself]0-i by bullying . "[1001-you] [You]1001-you do n't seem to care about going about . Why do n't [you]1001-you drive down to [Hurlingham]19-hurlingham with [us]1006-us ? And go to [the theatre]541-the theatre now and then . At [your]1001-you time of life [you]1001-you ought to take an interest in things . [You]1001-you 're [a young woman]1008-a young woman ! " The brooding look darkened on [her]1001-you face ; [he]0-i grew nervous . "[1008-a young woman] Well , [I]0-i know nothing about it , " [he]0-i said ; "[2292-nobody] [nobody]2292-nobody tells [me]0-i anything . [Soames]177-soames ought to be able to take care of [himself]177-soames . If [he]1010-he ca n't take care of [himself]177-soames [he]1010-he must n't look to [me]0-i - that 's all . " Biting the corner of [his]0-i forefinger [he]0-i stole a cold , sharp look at [[his]0-i daughter - in - law]816-his daughter - in - law . [He]0-i encountered [her]1001-you eyes fixed on [his]0-i own , so dark and deep , that [he]0-i stopped , and broke into a gentle perspiration . "[1010-he] Well , [I]0-i must be going , " [he]0-i said after a short pause , and a minute later rose , with a slight appearance of surprise , as though [he]0-i had expected to be asked to stop . Giving [his]0-i hand to [Irene]186-irene , [he]0-i allowed [himself]0-i to be conducted to the door , and let out into [the street]2964-the street . [He]0-i would not have [a cab]2536-a cab , [he]0-i would walk , [Irene]186-irene was to say good - night to [Soames]177-soames for [him]0-i , and if [she]186-irene wanted a little gaiety , well , [he]0-i would drive [her]186-irene down to [Richmond]24-richmond any day . [He]0-i walked [home]436-home , and going [upstairs]2967-upstairs , woke [Emily]173-james out of the first sleep [she]173-james had had for four and twenty hours , to tell [her]173-james that it was [his]0-i impression things were in a bad way at [[Soames]177-soames 's]2890-soames 's ; on this theme [he]0-i descanted for half an hour , until at last , saying that [he]0-i would not sleep a wink , [he]0-i turned on [his]0-i side and instantly began to snore . In [Montpellier Square Soames]266-montpellier square soames , who had come from [the picture room]2969-the picture room , stood invisible at the top of the stairs , watching [Irene]186-irene sort the letters brought by the last post . [She]186-irene turned back into [the drawing - room]849-the drawing - room ; but in a minute came out , and stood as if listening . Then [she]186-irene came stealing up the stairs , with a kitten in [her]186-irene arms . [He]0-i could see [her]186-irene face bent over the little beast , which was purring against [her]186-irene neck . Why could n't [she]186-irene look at [him]0-i like that ? " [He]0-i stood aside , and without another word [she]186-irene passed on into [the bedroom]2971-the bedroom . CHAPTER VII - [OLD JOLYON 'S PECCADILLO Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon came out of [[Lord]2972-lord 's cricket ground]2973-lord 's cricket ground that same afternoon with the intention of going [home]436-home . [He]0-i had not reached [Hamilton Terrace]69-hamilton terrace before [he]0-i changed [his]0-i mind , and hailing [a cab]2536-a cab , gave [the driver]2541-the driver an address in [Wistaria Avenue]34-wistaria avenue . [He]0-i had taken a resolution . [June]166-june had hardly been at [home]436-home at all that week ; [she]166-june had given [him]0-i nothing of [her]166-june company for a long time past , not , in fact , since [she]166-june had become engaged to [Bosinney]168-bosinney . [He]0-i never asked [her]166-june for [her]166-june company . It was not [his]0-i habit to ask [people]600-people for things ! [She]166-june had just that one idea now - [Bosinney]168-bosinney and [his]168-bosinney affairs - and [she]166-june left [him]168-bosinney stranded in [[his]168-bosinney great house]2979-his great house , with a parcel of [servants]2819-servants , and not a soul to speak to from morning to night . [[His]168-bosinney Club]2424-his club was closed for cleaning ; [his]168-bosinney Boards in recess ; there was nothing , therefore , to take [him]168-bosinney into [the City]2392-the city . [June]166-june had wanted [him]168-bosinney to go away ; [she]166-june would not go [herself]166-june , because [Bosinney]168-bosinney was in [London]2-london . But where was [he]168-bosinney to go by [himself]168-bosinney ? [He]168-bosinney could not go abroad alone ; [the sea]2321-the sea upset [his]168-bosinney liver ; [he]168-bosinney hated [hotels]2984-hotels . [Roger]317-roger went to [a hydropathic]2985-a hydropathic - [he]168-bosinney was not going to begin that at [his]168-bosinney time of life , [those new - fangled places [we]2987-we 're all humbug]2986-those new - fangled places we 're all humbug ! With such formulas [he]168-bosinney clothed to [himself]168-bosinney the desolation of [his]168-bosinney spirit ; the lines down [his]168-bosinney face deepening , [his]168-bosinney eyes day by day looking forth with the melancholy which sat so strangely on a face wo nt to be strong and serene . And so that afternoon [he]168-bosinney took this journey through [St. John 's Wood]33-st. john 's wood , in the golden - light that sprinkled the rounded green bushes of the acacia 's before [the little houses]2988-the little houses , in the summer sunshine that seemed holding a revel over [the little gardens]2989-the little gardens ; and [he]168-bosinney looked about [him]168-bosinney with interest ; for this was [a district which [no Forsyte]456-no forsyte entered without open disapproval and secret curiosity]2990-a district which no forsyte entered without open disapproval and secret curiosity . [[His]168-bosinney cab]2992-his cab stopped in front of [a small house of that peculiar buff colour which implies a long immunity from paint]2993-a small house of that peculiar buff colour which implies a long immunity from paint . [It]2993-a small house of that peculiar buff colour which implies a long immunity from paint had an outer gate , and a rustic approach . [He]168-bosinney stepped out , [his]168-bosinney bearing extremely composed ; [his]168-bosinney massive head , with its drooping moustache and wings of white hair , very upright , under an excessively large top hat ; [his]168-bosinney glance firm , a little angry . [He]168-bosinney had been driven into this ! "[0-i] [Mrs. Jolyon Forsyte]185-young mrs. jolyon at [home]436-home ? " "[730-sir] Oh , yes [sir]730-sir ! - what name shall [I]0-i say , if [you]730-sir please , [sir]730-sir ? " [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon could not help twinkling at [the little maid]2994-the little maid as [he]168-bosinney gave [his]168-bosinney name . [She]2994-the little maid seemed to [him]168-bosinney such a funny little toad ! And [he]168-bosinney followed [her]2994-the little maid through [the dark hall]2995-the dark hall , into [a small double , drawing - room]2996-a small double , drawing - room , where the furniture was covered in chintz , and [the little maid]2994-the little maid placed [him]168-bosinney in a chair . "[0-i] [They]1014-they 're all in [the garden]1015-the garden , [sir]730-sir ; if [you]730-sir 'll kindly take a seat , [I]0-i 'll tell [them]1014-they . " [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon sat down in the chintz - covered chair , and looked around [him]168-bosinney . [The whole place]2998-the whole place seemed to [him]168-bosinney , as [he]168-bosinney would have expressed [it]2998-the whole place , pokey ; there was a certain - [he]168-bosinney could not tell exactly what - air of shabbiness , or rather of making two ends meet , about everything . As far as [he]168-bosinney could see , not a single piece of furniture was worth a five - pound note . The walls , distempered rather a long time ago , were decorated with water - colour sketches ; across the ceiling meandered a long crack . [These little houses]2999-these little houses were all old , second - rate concerns ; [he]168-bosinney should hope the rent was under a hundred a year ; it hurt [him]168-bosinney more than [he]168-bosinney could have said , to think of [a Forsyte]185-young mrs. jolyon - [[his]168-bosinney own son]3000-his own son living in such a place . [The little maid]2994-the little maid came back . Would [he]168-bosinney please to go down into [the garden]1015-the garden ? [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon marched out through the French windows . In descending the steps [he]163-old jolyon noticed that [they]2999-these little houses wanted painting . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon , [[his]163-old jolyon wife]558-his wife , [[his]163-old jolyon two children]3004-his two children , and [his]163-old jolyon dog [Balthasar]267-balthasar , were all out there under a pear - tree . This walk towards [them]2999-these little houses was the most courageous act of [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's life ; but no muscle of [his]163-old jolyon face moved , no nervous gesture betrayed [him]163-old jolyon . [He]163-old jolyon kept [his]163-old jolyon deep - set eyes steadily on [the enemy]3005-the enemy . In those two minutes [he]163-old jolyon demonstrated to perfection all that unconscious soundness , balance , and vitality of fibre that made , of [him]163-old jolyon and so many others of [his]163-old jolyon class the core of [the nation]2807-the nation . In the unostentatious conduct of [their]2999-these little houses own affairs , to the neglect of everything else , [they]2999-these little houses typified the essential individualism , born in [the Briton]70-the briton from the natural isolation of [[his]163-old jolyon country]3007-his country 's life . The dog [Balthasar]267-balthasar sniffed round the edges of [his]163-old jolyon trousers ; [this friendly and cynical mongrel]3008-this friendly and cynical mongrel - offspring of a liaison between a Russian poodle and [a fox - terrier]3009-a fox - terrier - had a nose for the unusual . The strange greetings over , [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon seated [himself]167-young jolyon in a wicker chair , and [[his]167-young jolyon two grandchildren]3010-his two grandchildren , one on each side of [his]167-young jolyon knees , looked at [him]167-young jolyon silently , never having seen [so old a man]3011-so old a man . [They]2999-these little houses were unlike , as though recognising the difference set between [them]2999-these little houses by the circumstances of [their]2999-these little houses births . [Jolly]218-jolly , [the child of sin]3012-the child of sin , pudgy - faced , with [his]218-jolly tow - coloured hair brushed off [his]218-jolly forehead , and a dimple in [his]218-jolly chin , had an air of stubborn amiability , and the eyes of [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte ; [little Holly]220-holly , [the child of wedlock]3014-the child of wedlock , was a dark - skinned , solemn soul , with [[her]220-holly mother]714-her mother 's , grey and wistful eyes . The dog [Balthasar]267-balthasar , having walked round [the three small flower - beds]3016-the three small flower - beds , to show [his]267-balthasar extreme contempt for things at large , had also taken a seat in front of [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon , and , oscillating a tail curled by [Nature]268-nature tightly over [his]267-balthasar back , was staring up with eyes that did not blink . Even in [the garden]1015-the garden , that sense of things being pokey haunted [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon ; the wicker chair creaked under [his]167-young jolyon weight ; the garden - beds looked ' daverdy ' ; on the far side , under the smut - stained wall , cats had made a path . While [he]167-young jolyon and [[his]167-young jolyon grandchildren]3018-his grandchildren thus regarded [each other]2556-each other with the peculiar scrutiny , curious yet trustful , that passes between [the very young]3020-the very young and [the very old , young Jolyon]3021-the very old , young jolyon watched [[his]167-young jolyon wife]558-his wife . The colour had deepened in [her]558-his wife thin , oval face , with its straight brows , and large , grey eyes . [Her]558-his wife hair , brushed in fine , high curves back from [her]558-his wife forehead , was going grey , like [his]167-young jolyon own , and this greyness made the sudden vivid colour in [her]558-his wife cheeks painfully pathetic . The look on [her]558-his wife face , such as [he]167-young jolyon had never seen there before , such as [she]558-his wife had always hidden from [him]167-young jolyon , was full of secret resentments , and longings , and fears . [Her]558-his wife eyes , under their twitching brows , stared painfully . And [she]558-his wife was silent . [Jolly]218-jolly alone sustained the conversation ; [he]218-jolly had many possessions , and was anxious that [[his]218-jolly unknown friend]3023-his unknown friend with extremely large moustaches , and hands all covered with blue veins , who sat with legs crossed like [[his]218-jolly own father]3024-his own father a habit [he]218-jolly was [himself]218-jolly trying to acquire , should know it ; but being [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte , though not yet quite eight years old , [he]218-jolly made no mention of the thing at the moment dearest to [his]218-jolly heart - a camp of [soldiers]3026-soldiers in [a shop]3027-a shop - window , which [[his]218-jolly father]559-his father had promised to buy . No doubt it seemed to [him]218-jolly too precious ; a tempting of [Providence]265-providence to mention it yet . And the sunlight played through the leaves on [that little party of [the three generations]3030-the three generations]3029-that little party of the three generations grouped tranquilly under the pear - tree , which had long borne no fruit . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon 's furrowed face was reddening patchily , as [old men]3031-old men 's faces redden in the sun . [He]163-old jolyon took one of [Jolly]218-jolly 's hands in [his]163-old jolyon own ; [the boy]2442-the boy climbed on to [his]163-old jolyon knee ; and [little Holly]220-holly , mesmerized by this sight , crept up to [them]3033-them ; the sound of the dog [Balthasar]267-balthasar 's scratching arose rhythmically . Suddenly [young Mrs. Jolyon]185-young mrs. jolyon got up and hurried [indoors]3034-indoors . A minute later [[her]185-young mrs. jolyon husband]2635-her husband muttered an excuse , and followed . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon was left alone with [[his]163-old jolyon grandchildren]3018-his grandchildren . And [Nature]268-nature with [her]268-nature quaint irony began working in [him]163-old jolyon one of [her]268-nature strange revolutions , following [her]268-nature cyclic laws into the depths of [his]163-old jolyon heart . And that tenderness for [little children]3037-little children , that passion for the beginnings of life which had once made [him]163-old jolyon forsake [[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son and follow [June]166-june , now worked in [him]163-old jolyon to forsake [June]166-june and follow these littler things . Youth , like a flame , burned ever in [his]163-old jolyon breast , and to [youth]3039-youth [he]163-old jolyon turned , to the round little limbs , so reckless , that wanted care , to [the small round faces so unreasonably solemn or bright , to the treble tongues , and the shrill , chuckling laughter]3040-the small round faces so unreasonably solemn or bright , to the treble tongues , and the shrill , chuckling laughter , to the insistent tugging hands , and the feel of small bodies against [his]163-old jolyon legs , to all that was [young and young , and once more young]3041-young and young , and once more young . And [his]163-old jolyon eyes grew soft , [his]163-old jolyon voice , and thin - veined hands soft , and soft [his]163-old jolyon heart within [him]163-old jolyon . And to those small creatures [he]163-old jolyon became at once [a place of pleasure]3042-a place of pleasure , a place where [they]3037-little children were secure , and could talk and laugh and play ; till , like sunshine , there radiated from [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon 's wicker chair the perfect gaiety of three hearts . But with [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon following to [[[his]163-old jolyon wife]558-his wife 's room]3044-his wife 's room it was different . [He]163-old jolyon found [her]558-his wife seated on a chair before [her]558-his wife dressing - glass , with [her]558-his wife hands before [her]558-his wife face . [Her]558-his wife shoulders were shaking with sobs . This passion of [hers]558-his wife for suffering was mysterious to [him]163-old jolyon . [He]163-old jolyon had been through a hundred of these moods ; how [he]163-old jolyon had survived [them]3045-them [he]163-old jolyon never knew , for [he]163-old jolyon could never believe they were moods , and that the last hour of [his]163-old jolyon partnership had not struck . In the night [she]558-his wife would be sure to throw [her]558-his wife arms round [his]163-old jolyon neck and say : "[0-i] Oh ! [Jo]190-jo , how [I]0-i make [you]190-jo suffer ! " as [she]558-his wife had done a hundred times before . [He]163-old jolyon reached out [his]163-old jolyon hand , and , unseen , slipped [his]163-old jolyon razor - case into [his]163-old jolyon pocket . ' [I]190-jo can not stay [here]735-here , ' [he]163-old jolyon thought , ' [I]190-jo must go down ! ' Without a word [he]163-old jolyon left [the room]488-the room , and went back to [the lawn]3048-the lawn . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon had [little Holly]220-holly on [his]163-old jolyon knee ; [she]558-his wife had taken possession of [his]163-old jolyon watch ; [Jolly]218-jolly , very red in the face , was trying to show that [he]163-old jolyon could stand on [his]163-old jolyon head . The dog [Balthasar]267-balthasar , as close as [he]267-balthasar might be to the tea - table , had fixed [his]267-balthasar eyes on the cake . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon felt a malicious desire to cut [their]3049-their enjoyment short . What business had [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father to come and upset [[his]559-his father wife]558-his wife like this ? It was a shock , after all these years ! [He]559-his father ought to have known ; [he]559-his father ought to have given [them]3049-their warning ; but when did [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte ever imagine that [his]559-his father conduct could upset [anybody]2303-anybody ! And in [his]559-his father thoughts [he]559-his father did [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon wrong . [He]559-his father spoke sharply to [the children]3054-the children , and told [them]3054-the children to go in to [their]3054-the children tea . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon poured out the tea . "[190-jo] [[My]0-i wife]1017-my wife 's not the thing today , " [he]167-young jolyon said , but [he]167-young jolyon knew well enough that [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father had penetrated the cause of that sudden withdrawal , and almost hated [the old man]3057-the old man for sitting there so calmly .
