[Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon said simply : "[1021-a ramshackle lot] [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i ought n't to have come here , [Jo]190-jo ; but [I]0-i get so lonely ! " At these words [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon got up and put [his]167-young jolyon hand on [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father 's shoulder . In [the next house]3059-the next house [someone]2710-someone was playing over and over again : ' [La Donna mobile]269-la donna mobile ' on an untuned piano ; and [the little garden]3061-the little garden had fallen into shade , the sun now only reached the wall at the end , whereon basked a crouching cat , [her]3062-her yellow eyes turned sleepily down on the dog [Balthasar]267-balthasar . There was a drowsy hum of very distant traffic ; the creepered trellis round [the garden]1015-the garden shut out everything but sky , and [house]3064-house , and pear - tree , with [its]3065-its top branches still gilded by the sun . For some time [they]3066-they sat there , talking but little . Then [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon rose to go , and not a word was said about [his]167-young jolyon coming again . [He]167-young jolyon walked away very sadly . What [a poor miserable place]3067-a poor miserable place ; and [he]167-young jolyon thought of [the great , empty house in [Stanhope Gate]1-stanhope gate]3068-the great , empty house in stanhope gate , [fit residence for [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte]3069-fit residence for a forsyte , with [[its]3068-the great , empty house in stanhope gate huge [billiard - room]3072-billiard - room and drawing - room that [no one]514-no one entered from one week 's end to another]3071-its huge billiard - room and drawing - room that no one entered from one week 's end to another . [That woman]624-that woman , whose face [he]167-young jolyon had rather liked , was too thin - skinned by half ; [she]624-that woman gave [Jo]190-jo a bad time [he]167-young jolyon knew ! And [those sweet children]3075-those sweet children ! Ah ! what a piece of awful folly ! [He]167-young jolyon walked towards [the Edgware Road]72-the edgware road , between rows of [little houses]3076-little houses , all suggesting to [him]167-young jolyon erroneously no doubt , but the prejudices of [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte are sacred shady histories of some sort or kind . [Society]3078-society , forsooth , [the chattering hags and jackanapes]3079-the chattering hags and jackanapes - had set [themselves]3079-the chattering hags and jackanapes up to pass judgment on [his]167-young jolyon flesh and blood ! A parcel of [old women]3080-old women ! [He]167-young jolyon stumped [his]167-young jolyon umbrella on the ground , as though to drive it into the heart of that unfortunate body , which had dared to ostracize [[his]167-young jolyon son]2441-his son and [[[his]167-young jolyon son]2441-his son 's son , in whom [he]167-young jolyon could have lived again]3083-his son 's son , in whom he could have lived again ! [He]167-young jolyon stumped [his]167-young jolyon umbrella fiercely ; yet [he]167-young jolyon [himself]167-young jolyon had followed [Society]3078-society 's behaviour for fifteen years - had only today been false to it ! [He]167-young jolyon thought of [June]166-june , and [[her]166-june dead mother]3085-her dead mother , and the whole story , with all [his]167-young jolyon old bitterness . A wretched business ! [He]167-young jolyon was a long time reaching [Stanhope Gate]1-stanhope gate , for , with native perversity , being extremely tired , [he]167-young jolyon walked the whole way . After washing [his]167-young jolyon hands in the lavatory [downstairs]3086-downstairs , [he]167-young jolyon went to [the dining - room]2449-the dining - room to wait for dinner , [the only room [he]167-young jolyon used when [June]166-june was out]3088-the only room he used when june was out - [it]3088-the only room he used when june was out was less lonely so . The evening paper had not yet come ; [he]167-young jolyon had finished the Times , there was therefore nothing to do . [The room]488-the room faced the backwater of traffic , and was very silent . [He]167-young jolyon disliked dogs , but a dog even would have been [company]3090-company . [His]167-young jolyon gaze , travelling round the walls , rested on a picture entitled : ' Group of [Dutch fishing boats]3091-dutch fishing boats at sunset ' ; the chef d'oeuvre of [[his]167-young jolyon collection]3092-his collection . It gave [him]167-young jolyon no pleasure . [He]167-young jolyon closed [his]167-young jolyon eyes . [He]167-young jolyon was lonely ! [He]167-young jolyon ought n't to complain , [he]167-young jolyon knew , but [he]167-young jolyon could n't help it : [He]167-young jolyon was [a poor thing]2531-a poor thing - had always been [a poor thing]2531-a poor thing - no pluck ! Such was [his]167-young jolyon thought . [The butler]542-the butler came to lay the table for dinner , and seeing [[his]542-the butler master]3096-his master apparently asleep , exercised extreme caution in [his]542-the butler movements . [This bearded man]3097-this bearded man also wore a moustache , which had given rise to grave doubts in the minds of [many members - of [the family]450-the family]3098-many members - of the family - , especially [those who , like [Soames]266-montpellier square soames]3100-those who , like soames , had been to [public schools]3101-public schools , and were accustomed to niceness in such matters . Could [he]3097-this bearded man really be considered [a butler]3102-a butler ? [Playful spirits]270-playful spirits alluded to [him]3097-this bearded man as : ' [Uncle Jolyon]271-old jolyon 's Nonconformist ' ; [George]183-george , [the acknowledged wag]3103-the acknowledged wag , had named [him]3097-this bearded man : ' [Sankey]272-sankey . ' [He]3097-this bearded man moved to and fro between the great polished sideboard and the great polished table inimitably sleek and soft . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon watched [him]3097-this bearded man , feigning sleep . [The fellow]2355-the fellow was [a sneak]3105-a sneak - [he]163-old jolyon had always thought so - who cared about nothing but rattling through [his]3097-this bearded man work , and getting out to [[his]3097-this bearded man betting]3106-his betting or [[his]3097-this bearded man woman]3107-his woman or goodness knew what ! [A slug]3108-a slug ! Fat too ! And did n't care a pin about [[his]3097-this bearded man master]3096-his master ! But then against [his]163-old jolyon will , came one of those moments of philosophy which made [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon different from [other Forsytes]164-soames : After all why should [the man]2473-the man care ? [He]2473-the man was n't paid to care , and why expect it ? In [this world]3111-this world [people]600-people could n't look for affection unless [they]600-people paid for it . It might be different in the next - [he]163-old jolyon did n't know - could n't tell ! And again [he]163-old jolyon shut [his]163-old jolyon eyes . Relentless and stealthy , [the butler]542-the butler pursued [his]542-the butler labours , taking things from the various compartments of the sideboard . [His]542-the butler back seemed always turned to [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon ; thus , [he]542-the butler robbed [his]542-the butler operations of the unseemliness of being carried on in [[his]542-the butler master]3096-his master 's presence ; now and then [he]542-the butler furtively breathed on the silver , and wiped it with a piece of chamois leather . [He]542-the butler appeared to pore over the quantities of wine in the decanters , which [he]542-the butler carried carefully and rather high , letting [his]542-the butler heard droop over them protectingly . When [he]542-the butler had finished , [he]542-the butler stood for over a minute watching [[his]542-the butler master]3096-his master , and in [his]163-old jolyon greenish eyes there was a look of contempt : After all , [this master of [his]542-the butler]3116-this master of his was [an old buffer]3117-an old buffer , who had n't much left in [him]3096-his master ! Soft as a tom - cat , [he]542-the butler crossed [the room]488-the room to press the bell . [His]542-the butler orders were ' dinner at seven . ' What if [[his]542-the butler master]3096-his master were asleep ; [he]542-the butler would soon have [him]3096-his master out of that ; there was the night to sleep in ! [He]542-the butler had [himself]542-the butler to think of , for [he]542-the butler was due at [[his]542-the butler Club]2424-his club at half - past eight ! In answer to the ring , appeared [a page boy with a silver soup tureen]3121-a page boy with a silver soup tureen . [The butler]542-the butler took it from [his]542-the butler hands and placed it on the table , then , standing by the open door , as though about to usher [company]3090-company into [the room]488-the room , [he]542-the butler said in a solemn voice : "[0-i] Dinner is on the table , [sir]730-sir ! " [Slowly old Jolyon]163-old jolyon got up out of [his]542-the butler chair , and sat down at the table to eat [his]542-the butler dinner . CHAPTER VIII - PLANS OF [THE HOUSE Forsytes]3125-the house forsytes , as is generally admitted , have shells , like that extremely useful little animal which is made into Turkish delight , in other words , [they]3125-the house forsytes are never seen , or if seen would not be recognised , without habitats , composed of circumstance , property , [acquaintances]3126-acquaintances , and [wives]3127-wives , which seem to move along with [them]3125-the house forsytes in [their]3125-the house forsytes passage through a world composed of [thousands of other Forsytes with [their]3125-the house forsytes habitats]3128-thousands of other forsytes with their habitats . Without a habitat [a Forsyte]183-george is inconceivable - [he]183-george would be like a novel without a plot , which is well - known to be an anomaly . To [Forsyte eyes Bosinney]273-bosinney appeared to have no habitat , [he]183-george seemed one of [those rare and unfortunate men who go through life surrounded by circumstance , property , [acquaintances]3126-acquaintances , and wives that do not belong to [them]3129-those rare and unfortunate men who go through life surrounded by circumstance , property , acquaintances , and wives that do not belong to them]3129-those rare and unfortunate men who go through life surrounded by circumstance , property , acquaintances , and wives that do not belong to them . [[His]183-george rooms in [Sloane Street]56-sloane street]3131-his rooms in sloane street , on [the top floor]3132-the top floor , outside which , on a plate , was [his]183-george name , ' [Philip Baynes Bosinney]274-baynes , [Architect]3133-architect , ' were not those of [a Forsyte]273-bosinney . - [He]183-george had [no sitting - room apart from [[his]183-george office]3135-his office]3134-no sitting - room apart from his office , but a large recess had been screened off to conceal the necessaries of life - a couch , an easy chair , [his]183-george pipes , spirit case , novels and slippers . [The business part of [the room]488-the room]3136-the business part of the room had the usual furniture ; an open cupboard with pigeon - holes , a round oak table , a folding wash - stand , some hard chairs , a standing desk of large dimensions covered with drawings and designs . [June]166-june had twice been to tea [there]454-there under the chaperonage of [[his]183-george aunt]3139-his aunt . [He]183-george was believed to have [a bedroom at the back]3140-a bedroom at the back . As far as [the family]450-the family had been able to ascertain [his]183-george income , it consisted of two consulting appointments at twenty pounds a year , together with an odd fee once in a way , and - more worthy item - a private annuity under [[his]183-george father]559-his father 's will of one hundred and fifty pounds a year . What had transpired concerning [that father]3143-that father was not so reassuring . It appeared that [he]3143-that father had been [a Lincolnshire country doctor of Cornish extraction , striking appearance , and Byronic tendencies]3144-a lincolnshire country doctor of cornish extraction , striking appearance , and byronic tendencies - [a well - known figure , in fact , in [[his]183-george county]3146-his county]3145-a well - known figure , in fact , in his county . [[Bosinney]273-bosinney 's uncle]3147-bosinney 's uncle by marriage , [Baynes]274-baynes , of [Baynes]274-baynes and [Bildeboy]204-bildeboy , [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte in instincts if not in name , had but little that was worthy to relate of [[his]1024-his brother - in - law]3149-his brother - in - law . "[1023-an odd fellow] [An odd fellow]1023-an odd fellow ! ' [he]1024-his would say : ' always spoke of [[his]1024-his three eldest boys]1025-his three eldest boys as ' good creatures , but so dull ' ; [they]1025-his three eldest boys 're all doing capitally in the Indian Civil ! [Philip]274-baynes was the only one [he]274-baynes liked . [I]0-i 've heard [him]274-baynes talk in the queerest way ; [he]274-baynes once said to [me]0-i : ' [[My]0-i dear fellow]1026-my dear fellow , never let [[your]1026-my dear fellow poor wife]1027-your poor wife know what [you]1026-my dear fellow 're thinking of ! But [I]0-i did n't follow [his]274-baynes advice ; not [I]0-i ! [An eccentric man]1028-an eccentric man ! [He]274-baynes would say to [Phil]274-baynes : ' Whether [you]274-baynes live like [a gentleman]1029-a gentleman or not , [[my]0-i boy]744-my boy , be sure [you]274-baynes die like one ! and [he]274-baynes had [himself]274-baynes embalmed in a frock coat suit , with a satin cravat and a diamond pin . Oh , quite an original , [I]0-i can assure [you]274-baynes ! " [Of Bosinney]274-baynes [himself]274-baynes [Baynes]274-baynes would speak warmly , with a certain compassion : "[274-baynes] [He]274-baynes 's got a streak of [[his]274-baynes father]559-his father 's Byronism . Why , look at the way [he]274-baynes threw up [his]274-baynes chances when [he]274-baynes left [[my]0-i office]1032-my office ; going off like that for six months with a knapsack , and all for what ? - to study foreign architecture - foreign ! What could [he]274-baynes expect ? And there [he]274-baynes is - [a clever young fellow]1033-a clever young fellow - does n't make [his]274-baynes hundred a year ! Now this engagement is the best thing that could have happened - keep [him]274-baynes steady ; [he]274-baynes 's [one of those that go to bed all day and stay up all night]1034-one of those that go to bed all day and stay up all night , simply because [they]1035-they 've no method ; but no vice about [him]274-baynes - not an ounce of vice . [Old Forsyte]275-old forsyte 's [a rich man]1036-a rich man ! " [Mr. Baynes]276-mr. baynes made [himself]276-mr. baynes extremely pleasant to [June]166-june , who frequently visited [[his]276-mr. baynes house in [Lowndes Square]73-lowndes square]3150-his house in lowndes square at this period . "[275-old forsyte] [This house of [[your]1038-your cousin]1039-your cousin 's]1037-this house of your cousin 's - what [a capital man of business]1040-a capital man of business - is the very thing for [Philip]274-baynes , " [he]276-mr. baynes would say to [her]166-june ; "[1038-your] [you]1038-your must n't expect to see too much of [him]274-baynes just now , [[my]0-i dear young lady]1041-my dear young lady . The good cause - the good cause ! [The young man]2291-the young man must make [his]2291-the young man way . When [I]0-i was [his]274-baynes age [I]0-i was at work day and night . [[My]0-i dear wife]1043-my dear wife used to say to [me]0-i , ' [Bobby]277-bobby , do n't work too hard , think of [your]277-bobby health ' ; but [I]0-i never spared [myself]0-i ! " [June]166-june had complained that [[her]166-june lover]554-her lover found no time to come to [Stanhope Gate]1-stanhope gate . The first time [he]554-her lover came again [they]3152-they had not been together a quarter of an hour before , by one of those coincidences of which [she]166-june was [a mistress]2797-a mistress , [Mrs. Septimus Small]177-soames arrived . Thereon [Bosinney]274-baynes rose and hid [himself]274-baynes , according to previous arrangement , in [the little study]3154-the little study , to wait for [her]166-june departure . "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]2282-my dear , " said [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley , "[0-i] how thin [he]1045-he is ! [I]0-i 've often noticed it with [engaged people]1046-engaged people ; but [you]2282-my dear must n't let it get worse . There 's [Barlow]278-barlow 's extract of veal ; it did [[your]2282-my dear Uncle]994-your uncle Swithin a lot of good . " [June]166-june , [her]166-june little figure erect before the hearth , [her]166-june small face quivering grimly , for [she]166-june regarded [[her]166-june aunt]3155-her aunt 's untimely visit in the light of a personal injury , replied with scorn : "[994-your uncle] It 's because [he]1045-he 's busy ; [people who can do anything worth doing]1048-people who can do anything worth doing are never fat ! " [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley pouted ; [she]237-aunt juley [herself]237-aunt juley had always been thin , but the only pleasure [she]237-aunt juley derived from the fact was the opportunity of longing to be stouter . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't think , " [she]237-aunt juley said mournfully , "[0-i] that [you]2282-my dear ought to let [them]1049-them call [him]1045-he ' [The Buccaneer]279-the buccaneer ' ; [people]600-people might think it odd , now that [he]1045-he 's going to build [a house for [Soames]177-soames]1051-a house for soames . " [Her]237-aunt juley heart was as warm as the colour of [her]237-aunt juley hair . On the following Sunday morning , while [Soames]177-soames was shaving , a message was brought [him]168-bosinney to the effect that [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney was below , and would be glad to see [him]168-bosinney . Opening the door into [[[his]168-bosinney wife]558-his wife 's room]3044-his wife 's room , [he]168-bosinney said : "[168-bosinney] [[Bosinney]168-bosinney 's [downstairs]3086-downstairs]1063-bosinney 's downstairs . " [Irene]186-irene looked at [him]168-bosinney , without reply , put the finishing touch to [her]186-irene dress and went [downstairs]3086-downstairs . [He]168-bosinney could not make [her]186-irene out about [this house]752-this house . [She]186-irene had said nothing against it , and , as far as [Bosinney]168-bosinney was concerned , seemed friendly enough . From the window of [[his]168-bosinney dressing - room]3164-his dressing - room [he]168-bosinney could see [them]3165-them talking together in [the little court below]3166-the little court below . [He]168-bosinney hurried on with [his]168-bosinney shaving , cutting [his]168-bosinney chin twice . [He]168-bosinney heard [them]3165-them laugh , and thought to [himself]168-bosinney : "[0-i] Well , [they]1065-they get on all right , anyway ! " As [he]168-bosinney expected , [Bosinney]168-bosinney had come round to fetch [him]168-bosinney to look at the plans . [He]168-bosinney took [his]168-bosinney hat and went over . The plans were spread on the oak table in [[the architect]2700-the architect 's room]3168-the architect 's room ; and pale , imperturbable , inquiring , [Soames]177-soames bent over them for a long time without speaking . [He]168-bosinney said at last in a puzzled voice : "[1065-they] It 's an odd sort of house ! " [A rectangular house of two stories]3169-a rectangular house of two stories was designed in a quadrangle round [a covered - in court]3170-a covered - in court . [This court]3171-this court , encircled by [a gallery on the upper floor]3172-a gallery on the upper floor , was roofed with a glass roof , supported by eight columns running up from the ground . It was indeed , to Forsyte eyes , [an odd house]3173-an odd house . "[1065-they] There 's a lot of room cut to waste , " pursued [Soames]177-soames . [Bosinney]168-bosinney began to walk about , and [Soames]177-soames did not like the expression on [his]168-bosinney face . "[1065-they] The principle of [this house]752-this house , " said [the architect]2700-the architect , "[1065-they] was that [you]1067-you should have room to breathe - like [a gentleman]1029-a gentleman ! " [Soames]177-soames extended [his]0-i finger and thumb , as if measuring the extent of the distinction [he]0-i should acquire ; and replied : "[1029-a gentleman] Oh ! yes ; [I]0-i see . " The peculiar look came into [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's face which marked all [his]168-bosinney enthusiasms . "[1029-a gentleman] [I]0-i 've tried to plan [you]1067-you [a house here with some self - respect of [its]1069-a house here with some self - respect of its own own]1069-a house here with some self - respect of its own . If [you]1067-you do n't like [it]1069-a house here with some self - respect of its own , [you]1067-you 'd better say so . It 's certainly the last thing to be considered - who wants self - respect in [a house]689-a house , when [you]1067-you can squeeze in an extra lavatory ? " [He]0-i put [his]0-i finger suddenly down on the left division of the centre oblong : "[1067-you] [You]1067-you can swing a cat here . This is for [your]1067-you pictures , divided from [this court]3171-this court by curtains ; draw them back and [you]1067-you 'll have a space of fifty - one by twenty - three six . This double - faced stove in the centre , here , looks one way towards [the court]1072-the court , one way towards [the picture room]2969-the picture room ; this end wall is all window ; [You]1067-you 've a southeast light from that , a north light from [the court]1072-the court . The rest of [your]1067-you pictures [you]1067-you can hang round [the gallery upstairs]1075-the gallery upstairs , or in [the other rooms]1076-the other rooms . " "[1067-you] In architecture , " [he]0-i went on - and though looking at [Soames]177-soames [he]0-i did not seem to see [him]0-i , which gave [Soames]177-soames an unpleasant feeling - "[1067-you] as in life , [you]1067-you 'll get no self - respect without regularity . [Fellows]1077-fellows tell [you]1067-you that 's old fashioned . It appears to be peculiar any way ; it never occurs to [us]1078-our to embody the main principle of life in [[our]1078-our buildings]1079-our buildings ; [we]1078-our load [[our]1078-our houses]1080-our houses with decoration , gimcracks , corners , anything to distract the eye . On the contrary the eye should rest ; get [your]1067-you effects with a few strong lines . The whole thing is regularity there 's no self - respect without it . " [Soames]177-soames , [the unconscious ironist]3175-the unconscious ironist , fixed [his]3175-the unconscious ironist gaze on [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's tie , which was far from being in the perpendicular ; [he]168-bosinney was unshaven too , and [his]168-bosinney dress not remarkable for order . Architecture appeared to have exhausted [his]168-bosinney regularity . "[1078-our] Wo n't it look like [a barrack]1081-a barrack ? " [he]168-bosinney inquired . " [Soames]177-soames was alarmed . [He]168-bosinney had really been struck by the plans , and the concealment of [his]168-bosinney satisfaction had been merely instinctive . It was difficult for [him]168-bosinney to pay a compliment . [He]168-bosinney despised people who were lavish with [their]3176-their praises . [He]168-bosinney found [himself]168-bosinney now in the embarrassing position of [one who must pay a compliment or run the risk of losing a good thing]3177-one who must pay a compliment or run the risk of losing a good thing . This grown - up childishness , to which [he]168-bosinney felt so superior , exercised a peculiar and almost mesmeric effect on [Soames]177-soames , for [he]168-bosinney had never felt anything like it in [himself]168-bosinney . "[280-littlemaster] Well , " [he]168-bosinney stammered at last , "[280-littlemaster] it 's - it 's , certainly original . " [He]168-bosinney had such a private distrust and even dislike of the word ' original ' that [he]168-bosinney felt [he]168-bosinney had not really given [himself]168-bosinney away by this remark . [Bosinney]168-bosinney seemed pleased . It was the sort of thing that would please [a fellow like that]3180-a fellow like that ! And [his]168-bosinney success encouraged [Soames]177-soames . " [Soames]177-soames made a deprecating movement ; [he]168-bosinney had been identified with [a gentleman]1029-a gentleman ; not for a good deal of money now would [he]168-bosinney be classed with [manufacturers]1091-manufacturers . But [his]168-bosinney innate distrust of general principles revived . What the deuce was the good of talking about regularity and self - respect ? It looked to [him]168-bosinney as if [the house]2326-the house would be cold . "[1029-a gentleman] [Irene]186-irene ca n't stand the cold ! " [he]168-bosinney said . "[186-irene] Ah ! " said [Bosinney]168-bosinney sarcastically . "[186-irene] [[Your]1089-you wife]1092-your wife ? [She]1092-your wife does n't like the cold ? [I]0-i 'll see to that ; [she]1092-your wife sha n't be cold . Look here ! " [he]0-i pointed , to four marks at regular intervals on the walls of [the court]1072-the court . "[0-i] [I]0-i 've given [you]1089-you hot - water pipes in aluminium casings ; [you]1089-you can get them with very good designs . " [Soames]177-soames looked suspiciously at these marks . "[0-i] It 's all very well , all this , " [he]0-i said , "[0-i] but what 's it going to cost ? " [The architect]2700-the architect took a sheet of paper from [his]0-i pocket : "[0-i] [The house]2326-the house , of course , should be built entirely of stone , but , as [I]0-i thought [you]1089-you would n't stand that , [I]0-i 've compromised for a facing . [It]2326-the house ought to have a copper roof , but [I]0-i 've made it green slate . As it is , including metal work , it 'll cost [you]1089-you eight thousand five hundred . " "[1095-you] Eight thousand five hundred ? " said [Soames]177-soames . "[1095-you] Why , [I]0-i gave [you]1089-you an outside limit of eight ! " "[0-i] Ca n't be done for a penny less , " replied [Bosinney]168-bosinney coolly . "[0-i] [You]1089-you must take it or leave it ! " It was the only way , probably , that such a proposition could have been made to [Soames]177-soames . [He]0-i was nonplussed . [Conscience]281-conscience told [him]0-i to throw the whole thing up . But the design was good , and [he]0-i knew it - there was completeness about it , and dignity ; [[the servants]2817-the servants ' apartments]3187-the servants ' apartments were excellent too . [He]0-i would gain credit by living in [a house like that]3188-a house like that - with such individual features , yet perfectly well - arranged . [He]0-i continued poring over the plans , while [Bosinney]168-bosinney went into [[his]168-bosinney bedroom]2406-his bedroom to shave and dress . [The two]2453-the two walked back to [Montpellier Square]8-montpellier square in silence , [Soames]177-soames watching [him]0-i out of the corner of [his]0-i eye . [The Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer was rather [a good - looking fellow]3192-a good - looking fellow - so [he]0-i thought - when [he]789-the buccaneer was properly got up . [Irene]186-irene was bending over [her]186-irene flowers when [the two men]3193-the two men came in . [She]186-irene spoke of sending across [the Park]531-the park to fetch [June]166-june . "[0-i] No , no , " said [Soames]177-soames , "[0-i] [we]1094-we 've still got business to talk over ! " At lunch [he]0-i was almost cordial , and kept pressing [Bosinney]168-bosinney to eat . [He]0-i was pleased to see [the architect]2700-the architect in such high spirits , and left [him]0-i to spend the afternoon with [Irene]186-irene , while [he]0-i stole off to [his]0-i pictures , after [his]0-i Sunday habit . At tea - time [he]0-i came down to [the drawing - room]849-the drawing - room , and found [them]3193-the two men talking , as [he]0-i expressed it , nineteen to the dozen . Unobserved in the doorway , [he]0-i congratulated [himself]0-i that things were taking the right turn . It was lucky [she]186-irene and [Bosinney]168-bosinney got on ; [she]186-irene seemed to be falling into line with the idea of [the new house]3197-the new house . Quiet meditation among [his]0-i pictures had decided [him]0-i to spring the five hundred if necessary ; but [he]0-i hoped that the afternoon might have softened [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's estimates . It was so purely a matter which [Bosinney]168-bosinney could remedy if [he]168-bosinney liked ; there must be a dozen ways in which [he]168-bosinney could cheapen the production of [a house]689-a house without spoiling the effect . [He]0-i awaited , therefore , [his]0-i opportunity till [Irene]186-irene was handing [the architect]2700-the architect [his]0-i first cup of tea . A chink of sunshine through the lace of the blinds warmed [her]186-irene cheek , shone in the gold of [her]186-irene hair , and in [her]186-irene soft eyes . Possibly the same gleam deepened [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's colour , gave the rather startled look to [his]168-bosinney face . [Soames]177-soames hated sunshine , and [he]0-i at once got up , to draw the blind . Then [he]0-i took [his]0-i own cup of tea from [[his]0-i wife]558-his wife , and said , more coldly than [he]0-i had intended : "[1095-you] Ca n't [you]1095-you see [your]1095-you way to do it for eight thousand after all ? There must be a lot of little things [you]1095-you could alter . " [Bosinney]168-bosinney drank off [his]168-bosinney tea at a gulp , put down [his]168-bosinney cup , and answered : "[1095-you] Not one ! " [Soames]177-soames saw that [his]0-i suggestion had touched some unintelligible point of personal vanity . "[1095-you] Well , " [he]0-i agreed , with sulky resignation ; "[1095-you] [you]1095-you must have it [your]1095-you own way , [I]0-i suppose . " A few minutes later [Bosinney]168-bosinney rose to go , and [Soames]177-soames rose too , to see [him]168-bosinney off [the premises]3201-the premises . [The architect]2700-the architect seemed in absurdly high spirits . After watching [him]168-bosinney walk away at a swinging pace , [Soames]177-soames returned moodily to [the drawing - room]849-the drawing - room , where [Irene]186-irene was putting away the music , and , moved by an uncontrollable spasm of curiosity , [he]0-i asked : "[1095-you] Well , what do [you]1095-you think of ' [The Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer ' ? " [He]0-i looked at the carpet while waiting for [her]186-irene answer , and [he]0-i had to wait some time . "[1095-you] [I]0-i do n't know , " [she]186-irene said at last . "[1095-you] Do [you]0-i think [he]789-the buccaneer 's good - looking ? " [Irene]186-irene smiled . And it seemed to [Soames]177-soames that [she]186-irene was mocking [him]0-i . "[0-i] Yes , " [she]186-irene answered ; "[0-i] very . " CHAPTER IX - DEATH OF [AUNT ANN]169-aunt ann There came a morning at the end of September when [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann was unable to take from [Smither]259-smither 's hands the insignia of personal dignity . After one look at [the old face]2607-the old face , [the doctor , hurriedly sent for]3205-the doctor , hurriedly sent for , announced that [Miss Forsyte]166-june had passed away in [her]166-june sleep . [Aunts Juley]260-aunts juley and [Hester]181-aunt hester were overwhelmed by the shock . [They]3206-they had never imagined such an ending . Indeed , it is doubtful whether [they]3206-they had ever realized that an ending was bound to come . Secretly [they]3206-they felt it unreasonable of [Ann]169-aunt ann to have left [them]3206-they like this without a word , without even a struggle . It was unlike [her]169-aunt ann . Perhaps what really affected [them]3206-they so profoundly was the thought that [a Forsyte]166-june should have let go [her]169-aunt ann grasp on life . If one , then why not all ! It was a full hour before [they]3206-they could make up [their]3206-they minds to tell [Timothy]170-timothy . If only it could be kept from [him]170-timothy ! If only it could be broken to [him]170-timothy by degrees ! And long [they]3206-they stood outside [his]170-timothy door whispering together . And when it was over [they]3206-they whispered together again . [He]170-timothy would feel it more , [they]3206-they were afraid , as time went on . Still , [he]170-timothy had taken it better than could have been expected . [He]170-timothy would keep [his]170-timothy bed , of course ! [They]3206-they separated , crying quietly . [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley stayed in [[her]237-aunt juley room]2872-her room , prostrated by the blow . [Her]237-aunt juley face , discoloured by tears , was divided into compartments by the little ridges of pouting flesh which had swollen with emotion . It was impossible to conceive of life without [Ann]169-aunt ann , who had lived with [her]237-aunt juley for seventy - three years , broken only by the short interregnum of [her]237-aunt juley married life , which seemed now so unreal . At fixed intervals [she]237-aunt juley went to [her]237-aunt juley drawer , and took from beneath the lavender bags a fresh pocket - handkerchief . [Her]237-aunt juley warm heart could not bear the thought that [Ann]169-aunt ann was lying there so cold . [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester , the silent , [the patient]3208-the patient , [that backwater of [the family energy]3210-the family energy]3209-that backwater of the family energy , sat in [the drawing - room]849-the drawing - room , where the blinds were drawn ; and [she]181-aunt hester , too , had wept at first , but quietly , without visible effect . [Her]181-aunt hester guiding principle , the conservation of energy , did not abandon [her]181-aunt hester in sorrow . [She]181-aunt hester sat , slim , motionless , studying the grate , [her]181-aunt hester hands idle in the lap of [her]181-aunt hester black silk dress . [They]3212-they would want to rouse [her]181-aunt hester into doing something , no doubt . As if there were any good in that ! Doing something would not bring back [Ann]169-aunt ann ! Why worry [her]181-aunt hester ? [Five o'clock]282-five o'clock brought [three of [the brothers]708-the brothers]3213-three of the brothers , [Jolyon]163-old jolyon and [James]173-james and [Swithin]233-swithin ; [Nicholas]189-nicholas was at [Yarmouth]6-yarmouth , and [Roger]317-roger had a bad attack of gout . [Mrs. Hayman]199-mrs. hayman had been by [herself]199-mrs. hayman earlier in the day , and , after seeing [Ann]169-aunt ann , had gone away , leaving a message for [Timothy]170-timothy - which was kept from [him]170-timothy - that [she]199-mrs. hayman ought to have been told sooner . In fact , there was a feeling amongst [them]708-the brothers all that [they]708-the brothers ought to have been told sooner , as though [they]708-the brothers had missed something ; and [James]173-james said : "[0-i] [I]0-i knew how it 'd be ; [I]0-i told [you]1097-you [she]1098-she would n't last through the summer . " [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester made no reply ; it was nearly October , but what was the good of arguing ; [some people]3215-some people were never satisfied . [She]181-aunt hester sent up to tell [[her]181-aunt hester sister]2654-her sister that [the brothers]708-the brothers were [there]454-there . [Mrs. Small]177-soames came down at once . [She]177-soames had bathed [her]177-soames face , which was still swollen , and though [she]177-soames looked severely at [Swithin]233-swithin 's trousers , for they were of light blue - [he]233-swithin had come straight from [the club]2302-the club , where the news had reached [him]233-swithin - [she]177-soames wore a more cheerful expression than usual , the instinct for doing the wrong thing being even now too strong for [her]177-soames . Presently [all five]3220-all five went up to look at the body . Under the pure white sheet a quilted counter - pane had been placed , for now , more than ever , [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann had need of warmth ; and , the pillows removed , [her]177-soames spine and head rested flat , with the semblance of their life - long inflexibility ; the coif banding the top of [her]177-soames brow was drawn on either side to the level of the ears , and between it and the sheet [her]177-soames face , almost as white , was turned with closed eyes to the faces of [[her]177-soames brothers]3221-her brothers and [sisters]3222-sisters . In its extraordinary peace the face was stronger than ever , nearly all bone now under the scarce - wrinkled parchment of skin - square jaw and chin , cheekbones , forehead with hollow temples , chiselled nose - the fortress of an unconquerable spirit that had yielded to death , and in its upward sightlessness seemed trying to regain that spirit , to regain the guardianship it had just laid down . [Swithin]233-swithin took but one look at the face , and left [the room]488-the room ; the sight , [he]233-swithin said afterwards , made [him]233-swithin very queer . [He]233-swithin went [downstairs]3086-downstairs shaking [the whole house]3225-the whole house , and , seizing [his]233-swithin hat , clambered into [his]233-swithin brougham , without giving any directions to [the coachman]2776-the coachman . [He]233-swithin was driven [home]436-home , and all the evening sat in [his]233-swithin chair without moving . [He]233-swithin could take nothing for dinner but a partridge , with an imperial pint of champagne .... [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon stood at the bottom of the bed , [his]163-old jolyon hands folded in front of [him]163-old jolyon . [[He]163-old jolyon alone of [those in [the room]488-the room]3229-those in the room]3228-he alone of those in the room remembered the death of [[his]163-old jolyon mother]2511-his mother , and though [he]163-old jolyon looked at [Ann]169-aunt ann , it was of that [he]163-old jolyon was thinking . [Ann]169-aunt ann was [an old woman]2358-an old woman , but death had come to [her]169-aunt ann at last - death came to all ! [His]163-old jolyon face did not move , [his]163-old jolyon gaze seemed travelling from very far . [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester stood beside [him]163-old jolyon . [She]181-aunt hester did not cry now , tears were exhausted - [her]181-aunt hester nature refused to permit a further escape of force ; [she]181-aunt hester twisted [her]181-aunt hester hands , looking not at [Ann]169-aunt ann , but from side to side , seeking some way of escaping the effort of realization . Of all [the brothers and sisters]3233-the brothers and sisters [James]173-james manifested the most emotion . Tears rolled down the parallel furrows of [his]163-old jolyon thin face ; where [he]163-old jolyon should go now to tell [his]163-old jolyon troubles [he]163-old jolyon did not know ; [Juley]237-aunt juley was [no good]3234-no good , [Hester]181-aunt hester worse than useless ! [He]163-old jolyon felt [Ann]169-aunt ann 's death more than [he]163-old jolyon had ever thought [he]163-old jolyon should ; this would upset [him]163-old jolyon for weeks ! Presently [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester stole out , and [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley began moving about , doing ' what was necessary , ' so that twice [she]237-aunt juley knocked against something . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon , roused from [his]163-old jolyon reverie , that reverie of the long , long past , looked sternly at [her]169-aunt ann , and went away . [James]173-james alone was left by the bedside ; glancing stealthily round , to see that [he]163-old jolyon was not observed , [he]163-old jolyon twisted [his]163-old jolyon long body down , placed a kiss on the dead forehead , then [he]163-old jolyon , too , hastily left [the room]488-the room . Encountering [Smither]259-smither in [the hall]2543-the hall , [he]163-old jolyon began to ask [her]169-aunt ann about the funeral , and , finding that [she]169-aunt ann knew nothing , complained bitterly that , if [they]3237-they did n't take care , everything would go wrong . [She]169-aunt ann had better send for [Mr. Soames]171-soames - [he]171-soames knew all about that sort of thing ; [[her]169-aunt ann master]3238-her master was very much upset , [he]163-old jolyon supposed - [he]171-soames would want looking after ; as for [[her]169-aunt ann mistresses]3239-her mistresses , [they]3239-her mistresses were no good - [they]3239-her mistresses had no gumption ! [They]3239-her mistresses would be ill too , [he]163-old jolyon should n't wonder . [She]169-aunt ann had better send for [the doctor]2295-the doctor ; it was best to take things in time . [He]163-old jolyon did n't think [[his]163-old jolyon sister]2631-his sister [Ann]169-aunt ann had had the best opinion ; if [she]169-aunt ann 'd had [Blank]283-blank [she]169-aunt ann would have been alive now . [Smither]259-smither might send to [Park Lane]14-park lane any time [she]169-aunt ann wanted advice . Of course , [[his]163-old jolyon carriage]3242-his carriage was at [their]3239-her mistresses service for the funeral . [He]163-old jolyon supposed [she]169-aunt ann had n't such a thing as a glass of claret and a biscuit - [he]163-old jolyon had had no lunch ! The days before the funeral passed quietly . It had long been known , of course , that [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann had left [[her]169-aunt ann little property]3243-her little property to [Timothy]170-timothy . There was , therefore , no reason for the slightest agitation . [Soames]171-soames , who was [sole executor]3244-sole executor , took charge of all arrangements , and in due course sent out the following invitation to [every male member of [the family]450-the family]3245-every male member of the family : To ........... [Your]3247-your presence is requested at the funeral of [Miss Ann Forsyte]284-ann forsyte , in [Highgate Cemetery]3248-highgate cemetery , at noon of Oct. 1st . [Carriages]3249-carriages will meet at "[0-i] [The Bower]1099-the bower , " [Bayswater Road]74-bayswater road , at 10.45 . No flowers by request . ' R.S.V.P. ' The morning came , cold , with a high , grey , [London]2-london sky , and at half - past ten [the first carriage]3250-the first carriage , that of [James]173-james , drove up . It contained [James]173-james and [[his]163-old jolyon son - in - law]2936-his son - in - law [Dartie]187-dartie , [a fine man]3252-a fine man , with a square chest , buttoned very tightly into a frock coat , and a sallow , fattish face adorned with dark , well - curled moustaches , and that incorrigible commencement of whisker which , eluding the strictest attempts at shaving , seems the mark of something deeply ingrained in the personality of [the shaver]3253-the shaver , being especially noticeable in [men who speculate]3254-men who speculate . [Soames]171-soames , in [his]171-soames capacity of [executor]3255-executor , received [the guests]777-the guests , for [Timothy]170-timothy still kept [his]170-timothy bed ; [he]170-timothy would get up after the funeral ; and [Aunts Juley]260-aunts juley and [Hester]181-aunt hester would not be coming down till all was over , when it was understood there would be lunch for [anyone who cared to come back]3257-anyone who cared to come back . [The next to arrive]3258-the next to arrive was [Roger]317-roger , still limping from the gout , and encircled by [three of [[his]171-soames sons]2687-his sons]3259-three of his sons - [young Roger]317-roger , [Eustace]180-eustace , and [Thomas]256-thomas atkins . [George]183-george , [the remaining son]3261-the remaining son , arrived almost immediately afterwards in a hansom , and paused in [the hall]2543-the hall to ask [Soames]171-soames how [he]183-george found undertaking pay . [They]3263-they disliked [each other]2556-each other . Then came [two Haymans]285-two haymans - [Giles]286-giles and [Jesse]287-jesse perfectly silent , and very well dressed , with special creases down [their]285-two haymans evening trousers . Then [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon alone . Next , [Nicholas]189-nicholas , with a healthy colour in [his]3265-his face , and a carefully veiled sprightliness in every movement of [his]3265-his head and body . [One of [[his]3265-his sons]2687-his sons]3266-one of his sons followed [him]3265-his , meek and subdued . [Swithin Forsyte]172-swithin , and [Bosinney]168-bosinney arrived at the same moment , - and stood - bowing precedence to [each other]2556-each other , - but on the door opening [they]3263-they tried to enter together ; [they]3263-they renewed [their]3263-they apologies in [the hall]2543-the hall , and , [Swithin]172-swithin , settling [his]172-swithin stock , which had become disarranged in the struggle , very slowly mounted the stairs . [The other Hayman]3270-the other hayman ; [two married sons of [Nicholas]189-nicholas]3271-two married sons of nicholas , together with [Tweetyman]288-mrs. tweetyman , [Spender]289-spender , and [Warry]290-warry , [the husbands of [married Forsyte]189-nicholas and [Hayman daughters]3273-hayman daughters]3272-the husbands of married forsyte and hayman daughters . [The company]3274-the company was then complete , twenty - one in all , not [a male member of [the family]450-the family]3275-a male member of the family being absent but [Timothy]170-timothy and [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon . Entering [the scarlet and green drawing - room]3277-the scarlet and green drawing - room , whose apparel made so vivid a setting for [their]3263-they unaccustomed costumes , [each]509-each tried nervously to find a seat , desirous of hiding the emphatic blackness of [his]509-each trousers . There seemed a sort of indecency in that blackness and in the colour of [their]3263-they gloves - a sort of exaggeration of the feelings ; and [many]3279-many cast shocked looks of secret envy at ' [the Buccaneer , ' who had no gloves]3280-the buccaneer , ' who had no gloves , and was wearing grey trousers . A subdued hum of conversation rose , [no one]514-no one speaking of [the departed]3282-the departed , but each asking after [the other]2339-the other , as though thereby casting an indirect libation to this event , which [they]3263-they had come to honour . And presently [James]173-james said : "[0-i] Well , [I]0-i think [we]1100-we ought to be starting . " [They]3263-they went [downstairs]3086-downstairs , and , two and two , as [they]3263-they had been told off in strict precedence , mounted [the carriages]3285-the carriages . [The hearse]3286-the hearse started at a foot 's pace ; [the carriages]3285-the carriages moved slowly after . In the first went [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon with [Nicholas]189-nicholas ; in the second , [the twins]590-the twins , [Swithin]172-swithin and [James]173-james ; in the third , [Roger]317-roger and [young Roger]317-roger ; [Soames]171-soames , [young Nicholas]189-nicholas , [George]183-george , and [Bosinney]168-bosinney followed in the fourth . Each of [the other carriages]3289-the other carriages , eight in all , held [three or four of [the family]450-the family]3290-three or four of the family ; behind [them]3263-they came [[the doctor]2295-the doctor 's brougham]3293-the doctor 's brougham ; then , at a decent interval , cabs containing [family clerks]3294-family clerks and [servants]2819-servants ; and at the very end , one containing [nobody at all]3296-nobody at all , but bringing the total cortege up to the number of thirteen . So long as [the procession]3297-the procession kept to [the highway of [the Bayswater Road]485-the bayswater road]3298-the highway of the bayswater road , it retained the foot's - pace , but , turning into less important thorough - fares , it soon broke into a trot , and so proceeded , with intervals of walking in [the more fashionable streets]3300-the more fashionable streets , until it arrived . In [the first carriage]3250-the first carriage [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon and [Nicholas]189-nicholas were talking of [their]3250-the first carriage wills . In the second [the twins]590-the twins , after a single attempt , had lapsed into complete silence ; [both]3303-both were rather deaf , and the exertion of making [themselves]3303-both heard was too great . Only once [James]173-james broke this silence : "[0-i] [I]0-i shall have to be looking about for some ground somewhere . What arrangements have [you]0-i made , [Swithin]172-swithin ? " And [Swithin]172-swithin , fixing [him]0-i with a dreadful stare , answered : "[0-i] Do n't talk to [me]0-i about such things ! " In [the third carriage]3304-the third carriage a disjointed conversation was carried on in the intervals of looking out to see how far [they]590-the twins had got , [George]183-george remarking , "[0-i] Well , it was really time that [the poor old lady]1101-the poor old lady went . " [He]183-george did n't believe in [people living beyond seventy]3305-people living beyond seventy , [Young Nicholas]178-nicholas replied mildly that the rule did n't seem to apply to [the Forsytes]164-soames . [George]183-george said [he]183-george [himself]183-george intended to commit suicide at sixty . [Young Nicholas]178-nicholas , smiling and stroking a long chin , did n't think [[his]178-nicholas father]559-his father would like that theory ; [he]178-nicholas had made a lot of money since [he]178-nicholas was sixty . Well , seventy was the outside limit ; it was then time , [George]183-george said , for [them]590-the twins to go and leave [their]590-the twins money to [[their]590-the twins children]3307-their children . [Soames]164-soames , hitherto silent , here joined in ; [he]164-soames had not forgotten the remark about the ' undertaking , ' and , lifting [his]164-soames eyelids almost imperceptibly , said it was all very well for [people who never made money to talk]3308-people who never made money to talk . [He]164-soames [himself]164-soames intended to live as long as [he]164-soames could . This was a hit at [George]183-george , who was notoriously hard up . [Bosinney]168-bosinney muttered abstractedly "[1101-the poor old lady] Hear , hear ! " and , [George]183-george yawning , the conversation dropped . Upon arriving , the coffin was borne into [the chapel]3309-the chapel , and , two by two , [the mourners]3310-the mourners filed in behind [it]3311-it . This guard of [men , all attached to the dead by the bond of kinship]3312-men , all attached to the dead by the bond of kinship , was an impressive and singular sight in [the great city of [London]2-london]3313-the great city of london , with [its]3313-the great city of london overwhelming diversity of life , [its]3313-the great city of london innumerable vocations , pleasures , duties , its terrible hardness , its terrible call to individualism . [The family]450-the family had gathered to triumph over all this , to give a show of tenacious unity , to illustrate gloriously that law of property underlying the growth of [their]450-the family tree , by which it had thriven and spread , trunk and branches , the sap flowing through all , the full growth reached at the appointed time . The spirit of [the old woman]3315-the old woman lying in [her]3315-the old woman last sleep had called [them]450-the family to this demonstration . It was [her]3315-the old woman final appeal to that unity which had been [their]450-the family strength - it was [her]3315-the old woman final triumph that [she]3315-the old woman had died while the tree was yet whole . [She]3315-the old woman was spared the watching of the branches jut out beyond the point of balance . [She]3315-the old woman could not look into the hearts of [[her]3315-the old woman followers]3316-her followers . The same law that had worked in [her]3315-the old woman , bringing [her]3315-the old woman up from a tall , straight - backed slip of [a girl]2620-a girl to [a woman strong and grown]3318-a woman strong and grown , from [a woman grown to [a woman old , angular , feeble , almost witchlike , with individuality all sharpened and sharpened]3320-a woman old , angular , feeble , almost witchlike , with individuality all sharpened and sharpened , as all rounding from [the world]2286-the world 's contact]3319-a woman grown to a woman old , angular , feeble , almost witchlike , with individuality all sharpened and sharpened , as all rounding from the world 's contact fell off from [her]3315-the old woman - that same law would work , was working , in [the family [she]3315-the old woman had watched like [a mother]2931-a mother]3322-the family she had watched like a mother . [She]3315-the old woman had seen it young , and growing , [she]3315-the old woman had seen it strong and grown , and before [her]3315-the old woman old eyes had time or strength to see any more , [she]3315-the old woman died . [She]3315-the old woman would have tried , and who knows but [she]3315-the old woman might have kept it young and strong , with [her]3315-the old woman old fingers , [her]3315-the old woman trembling kisses - a little longer ; alas ! not even [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann could fight with [Nature]268-nature . ' Pride comes before a fall ! ' In accordance with this , the greatest of [Nature]268-nature 's ironies , [the Forsyte family]532-the forsyte family had gathered for a last proud pageant before [they]532-the forsyte family fell . [Their]532-the forsyte family faces to right and left , in single lines , were turned for the most part impassively toward the ground , guardians of [their]532-the forsyte family thoughts ; but here and there , [one looking upward]3325-one looking upward , with a line between [his]3325-one looking upward brows , searched to see some sight on the chapel walls too much for [him]3325-one looking upward , to be listening to something that appalled . And the responses , low - muttered , in [voices through which rose the same tone , the same unseizable family ring]3326-voices through which rose the same tone , the same unseizable family ring , sounded weird , as though murmured in hurried duplication by [a single person]3327-a single person . The service in [the chapel]3309-the chapel over , [the mourners]3310-the mourners filed up again to guard the body to [the tomb]3330-the tomb . [The vault]3331-the vault stood open , and , round [it]3331-the vault , [men in black]3332-men in black were waiting . From that high and sacred field , where [thousands of [the upper middle class]3334-the upper middle class lay in [their]3333-thousands of the upper middle class lay in their last sleep last sleep]3333-thousands of the upper middle class lay in their last sleep , the eyes of [the Forsytes]164-soames travelled down across the flocks of graves . There - spreading to the distance , lay [London]2-london , with no sun over [it]2-london , mourning the loss of [[its]2-london daughter]3335-its daughter , mourning with [this family]440-this family , so dear , the loss of [her]3335-its daughter who was [mother and guardian]3337-mother and guardian . A hundred thousand spires and [houses]2315-houses , blurred in the great grey web of property , lay there like [prostrate worshippers]3339-prostrate worshippers before the grave of this , [the oldest Forsyte of [them]440-this family all]3340-the oldest forsyte of them all . A few words , a sprinkle of earth , the thrusting of the coffin [home]436-home , and [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann had passed to [her]169-aunt ann last rest . Round [the vault]3331-the vault , trustees of that passing , [the five brothers]3343-the five brothers stood , with white heads bowed ; [they]3343-the five brothers would see that [Ann]169-aunt ann was comfortable where [she]169-aunt ann was going . [[Her]169-aunt ann little property]3243-her little property must stay behind , but otherwise , all that could be should be done .... Then severally , [each]509-each stood aside , and putting on [his]509-each hat , turned back to inspect the new inscription on the marble of [the family vault]3346-the family vault : SACRED TO THE MEMORY OF [ANN FORSYTE]284-ann forsyte , THE DAUGHTER OF [THE ABOVE [JOLYON]163-old jolyon AND [ANN FORSYTE]284-ann forsyte]3347-the above jolyon and ann forsyte , WHO DEPARTED THIS LIFE THE 27TH DAY OF SEPTEMBER , 1886 , AGED EIGHTY - SEVEN YEARS AND FOUR DAYS Soon perhaps , [someone else]3348-someone else would be wanting an inscription . It was strange and intolerable , for [they]3343-the five brothers had not thought somehow , that [Forsytes]164-soames could die . And one and all [they]3343-the five brothers had a longing to get away from this painfulness , this ceremony which had reminded [them]3343-the five brothers of things [they]3343-the five brothers could not bear to think about - to get away quickly and go about [their]3343-the five brothers business and forget . It was cold , too ; the wind , like some slow , disintegrating force , blowing up [the hill]937-the hill over [the graves]3350-the graves , struck [them]3343-the five brothers with its chilly breath ; [they]3343-the five brothers began to split into [groups]3351-groups , and as quickly as possible to fill [the waiting carriages]3352-the waiting carriages . [Swithin]172-swithin said [he]172-swithin should go back to lunch at [[Timothy]170-timothy 's]2927-timothy 's , and [he]172-swithin offered to take [anybody]2303-anybody with [him]172-swithin in [[his]172-swithin brougham]3355-his brougham . It was considered a doubtful privilege to drive with [Swithin]172-swithin in [[his]172-swithin brougham]3355-his brougham , which was not a large one ; [nobody]2292-nobody accepted , and [he]172-swithin went off alone . [James]173-james and [Roger]317-roger followed immediately after ; [they]3343-the five brothers also would drop in to lunch . [The others]2691-the others gradually melted away , [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon taking [three nephews]3359-three nephews to fill up [[his]163-old jolyon carriage]3242-his carriage ; [he]163-old jolyon had a want of those young faces . [Soames]164-soames , who had to arrange some details in [the cemetery office]3361-the cemetery office , walked away with [Bosinney]168-bosinney . [He]164-soames had much to talk over with [him]164-soames , and , having finished [his]164-soames business , [they]3343-the five brothers strolled to [Hampstead]75-hampstead , lunched together at [the Spaniard 's Inn]3362-the spaniard 's inn , and spent a long time in going into practical details connected with the building of [the house]2326-the house ; [they]3343-the five brothers then proceeded to [the tram - line]3364-the tram - line , and came as far as [the Marble Arch]76-the marble arch , where [Bosinney]168-bosinney went off to [Stanhope Gate]1-stanhope gate to see [June]166-june . [Soames]164-soames felt in excellent spirits when [he]164-soames arrived [home]436-home , and confided to [Irene]186-irene at dinner that [he]164-soames had had a good talk with [Bosinney]168-bosinney , who really seemed [a sensible fellow]3366-a sensible fellow ; [they]3343-the five brothers had had a capital walk too , which had done [his]164-soames liver good - [he]164-soames had been short of exercise for a long time - and altogether a very satisfactory day . If only it had n't been for poor [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann , [he]164-soames would have taken [her]169-aunt ann to [the theatre]541-the theatre ; as it was , [they]3343-the five brothers must make the best of an evening at [home]436-home . "[789-the buccaneer] [The Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer asked after [you]1103-you more than once , " [he]164-soames said suddenly . And moved by some inexplicable desire to assert [his]164-soames proprietorship , [he]164-soames rose from [his]164-soames chair and planted a kiss on [[his]164-soames wife]558-his wife 's shoulder . PART II CHAPTER I - PROGRESS OF [THE HOUSE]2326-the house The winter had been an open one . Things in the trade were slack ; and as [Soames]164-soames had reflected before making up [his]164-soames mind , it had been a good time for building . [The shell of [the house at [Robin Hill]53-robin hill]3372-the house at robin hill]3371-the shell of the house at robin hill was thus completed by the end of April . Now that there was something to be seen for [his]164-soames money , [he]164-soames had been coming down once , twice , even three times a week , and would mouse about among the debris for hours , careful never to soil [his]164-soames clothes , moving silently through the unfinished brickwork of doorways , or circling round the columns in [the central court]3373-the central court . And [he]164-soames would stand before [them]3374-them for minutes ' together , as though peering into the real quality of [their]3374-them substance . On April 30 [he]164-soames had an appointment with [Bosinney]168-bosinney to go over the accounts , and five minutes before the proper time [he]164-soames entered [the tent which [the architect]2700-the architect had pitched for [himself]2700-the architect close to the old oak tree]3375-the tent which the architect had pitched for himself close to the old oak tree . The accounts were already prepared on a folding table , and with a nod [Soames]164-soames sat down to study them . It was some time before [he]164-soames raised [his]164-soames head . "[789-the buccaneer] [I]0-i ca n't make them out , " [he]164-soames said at last ; "[0-i] [they]1104-they come to nearly seven hundred more than [they]1104-they ought . " After a glance at [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's face [he]164-soames went on quickly : "[0-i] If [you]1105-you only make a firm stand against [these builder chaps]1106-these builder chaps [you]1105-you 'll get [them]1106-these builder chaps down . [They]1104-they stick [you]1105-you with everything if [you]1105-you do n't look sharp .... Take ten per cent . off all round . [I]0-i sha n't mind it 's coming out a hundred or so over the mark ! " [Bosinney]168-bosinney shook [his]168-bosinney head : "[0-i] [I]0-i 've taken off every farthing [I]0-i can ! " [Soames]164-soames pushed back the table with a movement of anger , which sent the account sheets fluttering to the ground . "[0-i] Then all [I]0-i can say is , " [he]0-i flustered out , "[1105-you] [you]1105-you 've made a pretty mess of it ! " "[1105-you] [I]0-i 've told [you]1105-you a dozen times , " [Bosinney]168-bosinney answered sharply , "[0-i] that there 'd be extras . [I]0-i 've pointed them out to [you]1105-you over and over again ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i know that , " growled [Soames]164-soames : "[0-i] [I]0-i should n't have objected to a ten pound note here and there . How was [I]0-i to know that by ' extras ' [you]1105-you meant seven hundred pounds ? " The qualities of [both men]3377-both men had contributed to this not - inconsiderable discrepancy . On the one hand , [the architect]2700-the architect 's devotion to [his]2700-the architect idea , to the image of [a house which [he]2700-the architect had created and believed in]3379-a house which he had created and believed in - had made [him]2700-the architect nervous of being stopped , or forced to the use of makeshifts ; on the other , [Soames]164-soames ' not less true and wholehearted devotion to the very best article that could be obtained for the money , had rendered [him]164-soames averse to believing that things worth thirteen shillings could not be bought with twelve . "[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i 'd never undertaken [[your]1105-you house]2720-your house , " said [Bosinney]168-bosinney suddenly . "[1105-you] [You]1105-you come down here worrying [me]0-i out of [my]0-i life . [You]1105-you want double the value for [your]1105-you money [anybody else]1108-anybody else would , and now that [you]1105-you 've got [a house that for [its]1109-a house that for its size is not to be beaten in the county size is not to be beaten in [the county]1110-the county]1109-a house that for its size is not to be beaten in the county , [you]1105-you do n't want to pay for it . If [you]1105-you 're anxious to be off [your]1105-you bargain , [I]0-i daresay [I]0-i can find the balance above the estimates [myself]0-i , but [I]0-i 'm d - - d if [I]0-i do another stroke of work for [you]1105-you ! " [Soames]164-soames regained [his]164-soames composure . Knowing that [Bosinney]168-bosinney had no capital , [he]168-bosinney regarded this as a wild suggestion . [He]168-bosinney saw , too , that [he]168-bosinney would be kept indefinitely out of [this house on which [he]168-bosinney had set [his]168-bosinney heart]3380-this house on which he had set his heart , and just at the crucial point when [the architect]2700-the architect 's personal care made all the difference . In the meantime there was [Irene]186-irene to be thought of ! [She]186-irene had been very queer lately . [He]168-bosinney really believed it was only because [she]186-irene had taken to [Bosinney]168-bosinney that [she]186-irene tolerated the idea of [the house]2326-the house at all . It would not do to make an open breach with [her]186-irene . "[1105-you] [You]1105-you need n't get into a rage , " [he]0-i said . "[1105-you] If [I]0-i 'm willing to put up with it , [I]0-i suppose [you]1105-you need n't cry out . All [I]0-i meant was that when [you]1105-you tell [me]0-i a thing is going to cost so much , [I]0-i like to - well , in fact , [I]0-i - like to know where [I]0-i am . " "[0-i] Look here ! " said [Bosinney]168-bosinney , and [Soames]164-soames was both annoyed and surprised by the shrewdness of [his]0-i glance . "[1105-you] [You]1105-you 've got [my]0-i services dirt cheap . For the kind of work [I]0-i 've put into [this house]752-this house , and the amount of time [I]0-i 've given to it , [you]1105-you 'd have had to pay [Littlemaster]280-littlemaster or [some other fool]1112-some other fool four times as much . What [you]1105-you want , in fact , is [a first - rate man]1000-a first - rate man for a fourth - rate fee , and that 's exactly what [you]1105-you 've got ! " [Soames]164-soames saw that [he]0-i really meant what [he]0-i said , and , angry though [he]0-i was , the consequences of a row rose before [him]0-i too vividly . [He]0-i saw [[his]0-i house]3383-his house unfinished , [[his]0-i wife]558-his wife rebellious , [himself]0-i a laughingstock . "[1000-a first - rate man] Let 's go over it , " [he]0-i said sulkily , "[1000-a first - rate man] and see how the money 's gone . " "[1000-a first - rate man] Very well , " assented [Bosinney]168-bosinney . "[1000-a first - rate man] But [we]1114-their 'll hurry up , if [you]1105-you do n't mind . [I]0-i have to get back in time to take [June]166-june to [the theatre]541-the theatre . " [Soames]164-soames cast a stealthy look at [him]168-bosinney , and said : "[166-june] Coming to [[our]1114-their place]1116-our place , [I]0-i suppose to meet [her]166-june ? " [He]0-i was always coming to [[their]1114-their place]3385-their place ! There had been rain the night before - a spring rain , and the earth smelt of sap and wild grasses . The warm , soft breeze swung the leaves and the golden buds of the old oak tree , and in the sunshine the blackbirds were whistling [their]1114-their hearts out . It was such a spring day as breathes into [a man]515-a man an ineffable yearning , a painful sweetness , a longing that makes [him]515-a man stand motionless , looking at the leaves or grass , and fling out [his]515-a man arms to embrace [he]515-a man knows not what . [The earth]3387-the earth gave forth a fainting warmth , stealing up through the chilly garment in which winter had wrapped [her]166-june . It was [her]166-june long caress of invitation , to draw [men]550-men down to lie within [her]166-june arms , to roll [their]550-men bodies on [her]166-june , and put [their]550-men lips to [her]166-june breast . On just such a day as this [Soames]164-soames had got from [Irene]186-irene the promise [he]164-soames had asked [her]166-june for so often . Seated on the fallen trunk of a tree , [he]164-soames had promised for the twentieth time that if [their]3389-their marriage were not a success , [she]166-june should be as free as if [she]166-june had never married [him]164-soames ! "[1117-he] Do [you]1117-he swear it ? " [she]166-june had said . A few days back [she]166-june had reminded [him]1117-he of that oath . [He]0-i had answered : "[1117-he] Nonsense ! [I]0-i could n't have sworn any such thing ! " By some awkward fatality [he]1117-he remembered it now . What queer things [men]550-men would swear for the sake of [women]817-women ! [He]1117-he would have sworn it at any time to gain [her]166-june ! [He]1117-he would swear it now , if thereby [he]1117-he could touch [her]166-june - but [nobody]2292-nobody could touch [her]166-june , [she]166-june was cold - hearted ! And memories crowded on [him]1117-he with the fresh , sweet savour of the spring wind - memories of [his]1117-he courtship . In the spring of the year 1881 [he]1117-he was visiting [[his]1117-he old school]3393-his old school - fellow and [client]3394-client , [George Liversedge]291-george , of Branksome , who , with the view of developing [his]291-george pine - woods in [the neighbourhood of [Bournemouth]77-bournemouth]3395-the neighbourhood of bournemouth , had placed the formation of the company necessary to the scheme in [Soames]164-soames 's hands . [Mrs. Liversedge]292-mrs. liversedge , with a sense of the fitness of things , had given a musical tea in [his]1117-he honour . Later in the course of this function , which [Soames]164-soames , [no musician]3396-no musician , had regarded as an unmitigated bore , [his]1117-he eye had been caught by the face of [a girl dressed in mourning]3397-a girl dressed in mourning , standing by [herself]3397-a girl dressed in mourning . The lines of [her]166-june tall , as yet rather thin figure , showed through the wispy , clinging stuff of [her]166-june black dress , [her]166-june black - gloved hands were crossed in front of [her]166-june , [her]166-june lips slightly parted , and [her]166-june large , dark eyes wandered from face to face . [Her]166-june hair , done low on [her]166-june neck , seemed to gleam above [her]166-june black collar like coils of shining metal . And as [Soames]164-soames stood looking at [her]166-june , the sensation that [most men]2547-most men have felt at one time or another went stealing through [him]1117-he - a peculiar satisfaction of the senses , a peculiar certainty , which [novelists]3399-novelists and [old ladies]3400-old ladies call love at first sight . Still stealthily watching [her]166-june , [he]1117-he at once made [his]1117-he way to [[his]1117-he hostess]3401-his hostess , and stood doggedly waiting for the music to cease . "[0-i] Who is [that girl with yellow hair and dark eyes]1118-that girl with yellow hair and dark eyes ? " [he]1117-he asked . "[1118-that girl with yellow hair and dark eyes] That - oh ! [Irene Heron]201-heron . [[Her]201-heron father]712-her father , [Professor Heron]293-professor heron , died this year . [She]201-heron lives with [[her]201-heron stepmother]1120-her stepmother . [She]201-heron 's [a nice girl]1121-a nice girl , [a pretty girl]1122-a pretty girl , but no money ! " "[201-heron] Introduce [me]0-i , please , " said [Soames]164-soames . It was very little that [he]1117-he found to say , nor did [he]1117-he find [her]3401-his hostess responsive to that little . But [he]1117-he went away with the resolution to see [her]3401-his hostess again . [He]1117-he effected [his]1117-he object by chance , meeting [her]3401-his hostess on [the pier]3402-the pier with [[her]3401-his hostess stepmother]1120-her stepmother , who had the habit of walking there from twelve to one of a forenoon . [Soames]164-soames made [this lady]3404-this lady 's acquaintance with alacrity , nor was it long before [he]1117-he perceived in [her]3401-his hostess the ally [he]1117-he was looking for . [His]1117-he keen scent for the commercial side of family life soon told [him]1117-he that [Irene]186-irene cost [[her]186-irene stepmother]1120-her stepmother more than the fifty pounds a year [she]186-irene brought [her]186-irene ; it also told [him]1117-he that [Mrs. Heron]201-heron , [a woman yet in the prime of life]3406-a woman yet in the prime of life , desired to be married again . The strange ripening beauty of [[her]201-heron stepdaughter]3407-her stepdaughter stood in the way of this desirable consummation . And [Soames]164-soames , in [his]1117-he stealthy tenacity , laid [his]1117-he plans . [He]1117-he left [Bournemouth]77-bournemouth without having given [himself]1117-he away , but in a month 's time came back , and this time [he]1117-he spoke , not to [the girl]595-the girl , but to [[her]595-the girl stepmother]1120-her stepmother . [He]1117-he had made up [his]1117-he mind , [he]1117-he said ; [he]1117-he would wait any time . And [he]1117-he had long to wait , watching [Irene]186-irene bloom , the lines of [her]186-irene young figure softening , the stronger blood deepening the gleam of [her]186-irene eyes , and warming [her]186-irene face to a creamy glow ; and at each visit [he]1117-he proposed to [her]186-irene , and when that visit was at an end , took [her]186-irene refusal away with [him]1117-he , back to [London]2-london , sore at heart , but steadfast and silent as the grave . [He]1117-he tried to come at the secret springs of [her]186-irene resistance ; only once had [he]1117-he a gleam of light . It was at one of those assembly dances , which afford the only outlet to the passions of [the population of [seaside watering - places]3411-seaside watering - places]3410-the population of seaside watering - places . [He]1117-he was sitting with [her]186-irene in an embrasure , [his]1117-he senses tingling with the contact of the waltz . [She]186-irene had looked at [him]1117-he over [her]186-irene , slowly waving fan ; and [he]1117-he had lost [his]1117-he head . Seizing that moving wrist , [he]1117-he pressed [his]1117-he lips to the flesh of [her]186-irene arm . And [she]186-irene had shuddered - to this day [he]1117-he had not forgotten that shudder - nor the look so passionately averse [she]186-irene had given [him]1117-he . What had made [her]186-irene yield [he]1117-he could never make out ; and from [Mrs. Heron]201-heron , [a woman of some diplomatic talent]3412-a woman of some diplomatic talent , [he]1117-he learnt nothing .
