" CHAPTER II - [JUNE]166-june 'S TREAT Dinner began in silence ; [the women]2480-the women facing [one another]474-one another , and [the men]3441-the men . In silence the soup was finished - excellent , if a little thick ; and fish was brought . In silence it was handed . [Bosinney]168-bosinney ventured : "[1132-you] It 's the first spring day . " [Irene]186-irene echoed softly : "[1132-you] Yes - the first spring day . " "[1132-you] Spring ! " said [June]166-june : "[1132-you] there is n't a breath of air ! " [No one]514-no one replied . The fish was taken away , a fine fresh sole from [Dover]79-dover . And [Bilson]296-bilson brought champagne , a bottle swathed around the neck with white .... [Soames]177-soames said : "[1132-you] [You]1132-you 'll find it dry . " Cutlets were handed , each pink - frilled about the legs . [They]3443-they were refused by [June]166-june , and silence fell . [Soames]177-soames said : "[1132-you] [You]1132-you 'd better take a cutlet , [June]166-june ; there 's nothing coming . " But [June]166-june again refused , so [they]3443-they were borne away . And then [Irene]186-irene asked : "[166-june] [Phil]168-bosinney , have [you]168-bosinney heard [my]0-i blackbird ? " [Bosinney]168-bosinney answered : "[168-bosinney] Rather - [he]1139-he 's got a hunting - song . As [I]0-i came round [I]0-i heard [him]1139-he in [the Square]846-the square . " "[1139-he] [He]1139-he 's such [a darling]1141-a darling ! " "[1141-a darling] Salad , [sir]730-sir ? " Spring chicken was removed . But [Soames]177-soames was speaking : "[730-sir] The asparagus is very poor . [Bosinney]168-bosinney , glass of sherry with [your]168-bosinney sweet ? [June]166-june , [you]168-bosinney 're drinking nothing ! " [June]166-june said : "[166-june] [You]168-bosinney know [I]0-i never do . [Wine]297-wine 's such horrid stuff ! " An apple charlotte came upon a silver dish , and smilingly [Irene]186-irene said : "[297-wine] The azaleas are so wonderful this year ! " To this [Bosinney]168-bosinney murmured : "[297-wine] Wonderful ! The scent 's extraordinary ! " [June]166-june said : "[297-wine] How can [you]168-bosinney like the scent ? Sugar , please , [Bilson]296-bilson . " [Sugar]298-sugar was handed [her]166-june , and [Soames]177-soames remarked : "[296-bilson] This charlottes good ! " The charlotte was removed . Long silence followed . [Irene]186-irene , beckoning , said : "[296-bilson] Take out the azalea , [Bilson]296-bilson . [Miss June]166-june ca n't bear the scent . " "[166-june] No ; let it stay , " said [June]166-june . Olives from [France]81-france , with Russian caviare , were placed on little plates . And [Soames]177-soames remarked : "[166-june] Why ca n't [we]1143-we have the Spanish ? " But [no one]514-no one answered . The olives were removed . Lifting [her]166-june tumbler [June]166-june demanded : "[166-june] Give [me]0-i some water , please . " [Water]299-water was given [her]166-june . A silver tray was brought , with German plums . There was a lengthy pause . In perfect harmony all were eating them . [Bosinney]168-bosinney counted up the stones : "[166-june] This year - next year - some time . " [Irene]186-irene finished softly : "[166-june] Never ! There was such a glorious sunset . The sky 's all ruby still - so beautiful ! " [He]168-bosinney answered : "[166-june] Underneath the dark . " [Their]1143-we eyes had met , and [June]166-june cried scornfully : "[166-june] A [London]2-london sunset ! " Egyptian cigarettes were handed in a silver box . [Soames]177-soames , taking one , remarked : "[166-june] What time 's [your]296-bilson play begin ? " [No one]514-no one replied , and Turkish coffee followed in enamelled cups . [Irene]186-irene , smiling quietly , said : "[166-june] If only .... " "[166-june] Only what ? " said [June]166-june . "[166-june] If only it could always be the spring ! " Brandy was handed ; it was pale and old . [Soames]177-soames said : "[168-bosinney] [Bosinney]168-bosinney , better take some brandy . " [Bosinney]168-bosinney took a glass ; [they]1143-we all arose . "[168-bosinney] [You]296-bilson want [a cab]2536-a cab ? " asked [Soames]177-soames . [June]166-june answered : "[296-bilson] No ! [My]0-i cloaks please , [Bilson]296-bilson . " [Her]166-june cloak was brought . [Irene]186-irene , from the window , murmured : "[296-bilson] Such a lovely night ! The stars are coming out ! " [Soames]177-soames added : "[168-bosinney] Well , [I]0-i hope [you]296-bilson 'll both enjoy [yourselves]296-bilson . " From the door [June]166-june answered : "[0-i] Thanks . Come , [Phil]168-bosinney . " [Bosinney]168-bosinney cried : "[168-bosinney] [I]0-i 'm coming . " [Soames]177-soames smiled a sneering smile , and said : "[168-bosinney] [I]0-i wish [you]0-i luck ! " And at the door [Irene]186-irene watched [them]3446-they go . [Bosinney]168-bosinney called : "[0-i] Good night ! " "[0-i] Good night ! " [she]186-irene answered softly .... [June]166-june made [[her]166-june lover]554-her lover take [her]166-june on the top of [a ' bus]3448-a ' bus , saying [she]166-june wanted air , and there sat silent , with [her]166-june face to the breeze . [The driver]2541-the driver turned once or twice , with the intention of venturing a remark , but thought better of it . [They]3446-they were [a lively couple]3450-a lively couple ! The spring had got into [his]168-bosinney blood , too ; [he]168-bosinney felt the need for letting steam escape , and clucked [his]168-bosinney tongue , flourishing [his]168-bosinney whip , wheeling [his]168-bosinney horses , and even [they]3446-they , poor things , had smelled the spring , and for a brief half - hour spurned the pavement with happy hoofs . [The whole town]3451-the whole town was alive ; the boughs , curled upward with their decking of young leaves , awaited some gift the breeze could bring . New - lighted lamps were gaining mastery , and the faces of [the crowd]3452-the crowd showed pale under that glare , while on high the great white clouds slid swiftly , softly , over the purple sky . [Men in , evening dress]3453-men in , evening dress had thrown back overcoats , stepping jauntily up the steps of [Clubs]3454-clubs ; [working folk]3455-working folk loitered ; and [women]817-women - [those women who at that time of night are solitary - solitary and moving eastward in a stream]3457-those women who at that time of night are solitary - solitary and moving eastward in a stream - swung slowly along , with expectation in [their]817-women gait , dreaming of good wine and a good supper , or - for an unwonted minute , of kisses given for love . [Those countless figures , going [their]3458-those countless figures , going their ways under the lamps and the moving - sky ways under the lamps and the moving - sky]3458-those countless figures , going their ways under the lamps and the moving - sky , had one and all received some restless blessing from the stir of spring . And one and all , like [those clubmen with [their]3459-those clubmen with their opened coats opened coats]3459-those clubmen with their opened coats , had shed something of caste , and creed , and custom , and by the cock of [their]3459-those clubmen with their opened coats hats , the pace of [their]3459-those clubmen with their opened coats walk , [their]3459-those clubmen with their opened coats laughter , or [their]3459-those clubmen with their opened coats silence , revealed [their]3459-those clubmen with their opened coats common kinship under the passionate heavens . [Bosinney]168-bosinney and [June]166-june entered [the theatre]541-the theatre in silence , and mounted to [their]3459-those clubmen with their opened coats seats in [the upper boxes]3461-the upper boxes . The piece had just begun , and [the half - darkened house]3462-the half - darkened house , with [its]3462-the half - darkened house rows of creatures peering all one way , resembled a great garden of flowers turning [their]3459-those clubmen with their opened coats faces to the sun . [June]166-june had never before been in [the upper boxes]3461-the upper boxes . From the age of fifteen [she]166-june had habitually accompanied [[her]166-june grandfather]3464-her grandfather to the stalls , and not [common stalls]3465-common stalls , but the best seats in [the house]2326-the house , towards the centre of the third row , booked by [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon , at [Grogan]300-grogan and [Boyne]301-boyne 's , on [his]3464-her grandfather way [home]436-home from [the City]2392-the city , long before the day ; carried in [his]3464-her grandfather overcoat pocket , together with [his]3464-her grandfather cigar - case and [his]3464-her grandfather old kid gloves , and handed to [June]166-june to keep till the appointed night . And in [those stalls]3469-those stalls - [an erect old figure with a serene white head]3470-an erect old figure with a serene white head , [a little figure]3471-a little figure , strenuous and eager , with a red - gold head - [they]3472-they would sit through every kind of play , and on the way [home]436-home [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon would say of [the principal actor]3474-the principal actor : "[1145-he] Oh , [he]1145-he 's [a poor stick]1146-a poor stick ! [You]1147-you should have seen [little Bobson]302-little bobson ! " [She]166-june had looked forward to this evening with keen delight ; it was stolen , chaperone - less , undreamed of at [Stanhope Gate]1-stanhope gate , where [she]166-june was supposed to be at [Soames ']164-soames . [She]166-june had expected reward for [her]166-june subterfuge , planned for [[her]166-june lover]554-her lover 's sake ; [she]166-june had expected it to break up the thick , chilly cloud , and make the relations between [them]3472-they which of late had been so puzzling , so tormenting - sunny and simple again as [they]3472-they had been before the winter . [She]166-june had come with the intention of saying something definite ; and [she]166-june looked at [the stage]3476-the stage with a furrow between [her]166-june brows , seeing nothing , [her]166-june hands squeezed together in [her]166-june lap . A swarm of jealous suspicions stung and stung [her]166-june . If [Bosinney]168-bosinney was conscious of [her]166-june trouble [he]168-bosinney made no sign . The curtain dropped . The first act had come to an end . "[302-little bobson] It 's awfully hot here ! " said [the girl]595-the girl ; "[0-i] [I]0-i should like to go out . " [She]595-the girl was very white , and [she]595-the girl knew - for with [her]595-the girl nerves thus sharpened [she]595-the girl saw everything - that [he]168-bosinney was both uneasy and compunctious . At the back of [the theatre]541-the theatre an open balcony hung over [the street]2964-the street ; [she]595-the girl took possession of this , and stood leaning there without a word , waiting for [him]168-bosinney to begin . At last [she]595-the girl could bear it no longer . "[0-i] [I]0-i want to say something to [you]1148-you , [Phil]168-bosinney , " [she]595-the girl said . "[0-i] Yes ? " The defensive tone of [his]168-bosinney voice brought the colour flying to [her]595-the girl cheek , the words flying to [her]595-the girl lips : "[1148-you] [You]1148-you do n't give [me]0-i a chance to be nice to [you]1148-you ; [you]1148-you have n't for ages now ! " [Bosinney]168-bosinney stared down at [the street]2964-the street . [He]168-bosinney made no answer .... [June]166-june cried passionately : "[1148-you] [You]1148-you know [I]0-i want to do everything for [you]1148-you - that [I]0-i want to be everything to [you]1148-you .... " A hum rose from [the street]2964-the street , and , piercing it with a sharp ' ping , ' the bell sounded for the raising of the curtain . [June]166-june did not stir . A desperate struggle was going on within [her]166-june . Should [she]166-june put everything to the proof ? Should [she]166-june challenge directly that influence , that attraction which was driving [him]168-bosinney away from [her]166-june ? It was [her]166-june nature to challenge , and [she]166-june said : "[168-bosinney] [Phil]168-bosinney , take [me]0-i to see [the house]2326-the house on Sunday ! " With a smile quivering and breaking on [her]166-june lips , and trying , how hard , not to show that [she]166-june was watching , [she]166-june searched [his]168-bosinney face , saw it waver and hesitate , saw a troubled line come between [his]168-bosinney brows , the blood rush into [his]168-bosinney face . [He]168-bosinney answered : "[168-bosinney] Not Sunday , [dear]2284-dear ; some other day ! " "[168-bosinney] Why not Sunday ? [I]0-i should n't be in the way on Sunday . " [He]168-bosinney made an evident effort , and said : "[0-i] [I]0-i have an engagement . " "[2284-dear] [You]2284-dear are going to take .... " [His]168-bosinney eyes grew angry ; [he]168-bosinney shrugged [his]168-bosinney shoulders , and answered : "[2284-dear] An engagement that will prevent [my]0-i taking [you]2284-dear to see [the house]2326-the house ! " [June]166-june bit [her]166-june lip till the blood came , and walked back to [her]166-june seat without another word , but [she]166-june could not help the tears of rage rolling down [her]166-june face . [The house]2326-the house had been mercifully darkened for a crisis , and [no one]514-no one could see [her]166-june trouble . Yet in [this world of [Forsytes]164-soames]3484-this world of forsytes let [no man]3485-no man think [himself]3485-no man immune from observation . In the third row behind , [Euphemia]303-euphemia , [[Nicholas]178-nicholas 's youngest daughter]3486-nicholas 's youngest daughter , with [[her]303-euphemia married - sister]3487-her married - sister , [Mrs. Tweetyman]288-mrs. tweetyman , were watching . [They]3488-they reported at [[Timothy]170-timothy 's]2927-timothy 's , how [they]3488-they had seen [June]166-june and [[her]166-june fiance]3490-her fiance at [the theatre]541-the theatre . "[2284-dear] In [the stalls]1152-the stalls ? " "[2284-dear] No , not in the .... " "[2284-dear] Oh ! in the dress circle , of course . That seemed to be quite fashionable nowadays with [young people]1002-young people ! " Well - not exactly . In the .... Anyway , that engagement would n't last long . [They]3488-they had never seen [anyone]879-anyone look so thunder and lightningy as [that little June]3493-that little june ! With tears of enjoyment in [their]3488-they eyes , [they]3488-they related how [she]166-june had kicked [a man]515-a man 's hat as [she]166-june returned to [her]166-june seat in the middle of an act , and how [the man]2473-the man had looked . [Euphemia]303-euphemia had a noted , silent laugh , terminating most disappointingly in squeaks ; and when [Mrs. Small]177-soames , holding up [her]177-soames hands , said : "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]2282-my dear ! Kicked a ha - at ? " [she]177-soames let out such a number of these that [she]177-soames had to be recovered with smelling - salts . As [she]177-soames went away [she]177-soames said to [Mrs. Tweetyman]288-mrs. tweetyman : "[0-i] Kicked a - ha - at ! Oh ! [I]0-i shall die . " For ' [that little June]3493-that little june ' this evening , that was to have been ' [her]177-soames treat , ' was the most miserable [she]177-soames had ever spent . [God]304-god knows [she]177-soames tried to stifle [her]177-soames pride , [her]177-soames suspicion , [her]177-soames jealousy ! [She]177-soames parted from [Bosinney]168-bosinney at [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon 's door without breaking down ; the feeling that [[her]177-soames lover]554-her lover must be conquered was strong enough to sustain [her]177-soames till [his]554-her lover retiring footsteps brought home the true extent of [her]177-soames wretchedness . The noiseless ' [Sankey]272-sankey ' let [her]177-soames in . [She]177-soames would have slipped up to [[her]177-soames own room]3498-her own room , but [old Jolyon , who had heard [her]177-soames entrance]3499-old jolyon , who had heard her entrance , was in the dining - room doorway . "[0-i] Come in and have [your]1155-you milk , " [he]163-old jolyon said . "[0-i] It 's been kept hot for [you]1155-you . [You]1155-you 're very late . Where have [you]1155-you been ? " [June]166-june stood at the fireplace , with a foot on the fender and an arm on the mantelpiece , as [[her]166-june grandfather]3464-her grandfather had done when [he]3464-her grandfather came in that night of the opera . [She]166-june was too near a breakdown to care what [she]166-june told [him]163-old jolyon . "[1156-we] [We]1156-we dined at [Soames 's]164-soames . " "[1156-we] H'm ! [the man of [property]1158-property]1157-the man of property ! [[His]1157-the man of property wife]558-his wife there and [Bosinney]168-bosinney ? " "[168-bosinney] Yes . " [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon 's glance was fixed on [her]166-june with the penetrating gaze from which it was difficult to hide ; but [she]166-june was not looking at [him]163-old jolyon , and when [she]166-june turned [her]166-june face , [he]163-old jolyon dropped [his]163-old jolyon scrutiny at once . [He]163-old jolyon had seen enough , and too much . [He]163-old jolyon bent down to lift the cup of milk for [her]166-june from the hearth , and , turning away , grumbled : "[168-bosinney] [You]168-bosinney ought n't to stay out so late ; it makes [you]168-bosinney fit for nothing . " [He]163-old jolyon was invisible now behind [his]163-old jolyon paper , which [he]163-old jolyon turned with a vicious crackle ; but when [June]166-june came up to kiss [him]163-old jolyon , [he]163-old jolyon said : "[168-bosinney] Good - night , [[my]0-i darling]1160-my darling , " in a tone so tremulous and unexpected , that it was all [the girl]595-the girl could do to get out of [the room]488-the room without breaking into the fit of sobbing which lasted [her]166-june well on into the night . When the door was closed , [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon dropped [his]163-old jolyon paper , and stared long and anxiously in front of [him]163-old jolyon . ' [The beggar]3503-the beggar ! ' [he]163-old jolyon thought . ' [I]168-bosinney always knew [she]166-june 'd have trouble with [him]3503-the beggar ! ' Uneasy doubts and suspicions , the more poignant that [he]163-old jolyon felt [himself]163-old jolyon powerless to check or control the march of events , came crowding upon [him]163-old jolyon . Was [the fellow]2355-the fellow going to jilt [her]166-june ? [He]163-old jolyon longed to go and say to [him]0-i : "[168-bosinney] Look here , [[you]0-i sir]1161-you sir ! Are [you]0-i going to jilt [[my]0-i grand - daughter]1162-my grand - daughter ? " But how could [he]163-old jolyon ? Knowing little or nothing , [he]163-old jolyon was yet certain , with [his]163-old jolyon unerring astuteness , that there was something going on . [He]163-old jolyon suspected [Bosinney]168-bosinney of being too much at [Montpellier Square]8-montpellier square . ' [This fellow]2361-this fellow , ' [he]163-old jolyon thought , ' may not be [a scamp]3506-a scamp ; [his]2361-this fellow face is not a bad one , but [he]2361-this fellow 's a queer fish . [I]0-i do n't know what to make of [him]2361-this fellow . [I]0-i shall never know what to make of [him]2361-this fellow ! [They]3507-they tell [me]0-i [he]2361-this fellow works like [a nigger]3508-a nigger , but [I]0-i see no good coming of it . [He]2361-this fellow 's unpractical , [he]2361-this fellow has no method . When [he]2361-this fellow comes [here]735-here , [he]2361-this fellow sits as glum as a monkey . If [I]0-i ask [him]2361-this fellow what wine [he]2361-this fellow 'll have , [he]2361-this fellow says : "[0-i] Thanks , any wine . " If [I]228-adolf offer [him]2361-this fellow a cigar , [he]2361-this fellow smokes it as if it were a twopenny German thing . [I]228-adolf never see [him]2361-this fellow looking at [June]166-june as [he]2361-this fellow ought to look at [her]166-june ; and yet , [he]2361-this fellow 's not after [her]166-june money . If [she]166-june were to make a sign , [he]2361-this fellow 'd be off [his]2361-this fellow bargain to - morrow . But [she]166-june wo n't - not [she]166-june ! [She]166-june 'll stick to [him]2361-this fellow ! [She]166-june 's as obstinate as fate - [She]166-june 'll never let go ! ' Sighing deeply , [he]2361-this fellow turned the paper ; in its columns , perchance [he]2361-this fellow might find consolation . And [upstairs]2967-upstairs in [[her]166-june room]2872-her room [June]166-june sat at [her]166-june open window , where the spring wind came , after its revel across [the Park]531-the park , to cool [her]166-june hot cheeks and burn [her]166-june heart . CHAPTER III - DRIVE WITH [SWITHIN]233-swithin Two lines of a certain song in [a certain famous old school 's songbook]3513-a certain famous old school 's songbook run as follows : ' How the buttons on [his]233-swithin blue frock shone , tra - la - la ! How [he]233-swithin carolled and [he]233-swithin sang , like a bird ! ... ' [Swithin]233-swithin did not exactly carol and sing like a bird , but [he]233-swithin felt almost like endeavouring to hum a tune , as [he]233-swithin stepped out of [Hyde Park Mansions]15-hyde park mansions , and contemplated [his]233-swithin horses drawn up before the door . The afternoon was as balmy as a day in [June]166-june , and to complete the simile of the old song , [he]233-swithin had put on a blue frock - coat , dispensing with an overcoat , after sending [Adolf]228-adolf down three times to make sure that there was not the least suspicion of east in the wind ; and the frock - coat was buttoned so tightly around [his]233-swithin personable form , that , if the buttons did not shine , [they]3514-they might pardonably have done so . [Majestic]305-majestic on [the pavement]2865-the pavement [he]233-swithin fitted on a pair of dog - skin gloves ; with [his]233-swithin large bell - shaped top hat , and [his]233-swithin great stature and bulk [he]233-swithin looked too primeval for [a Forsyte]166-june . [His]233-swithin thick white hair , on which [Adolf]228-adolf had bestowed a touch of pomatum , exhaled the fragrance of opoponax and cigars - the celebrated Swithin brand , for which [he]233-swithin paid one hundred and forty shillings the hundred , and of which [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon had unkindly said , [he]233-swithin would n't smoke them as a gift ; [they]3514-they wanted the stomach of a horse ! "[228-adolf] [Adolf]228-adolf ! " "[306-sare] [Sare]306-sare ! " "[306-sare] The new plaid rug ! " [He]233-swithin would never teach [that fellow]3516-that fellow to look smart ; and [Mrs. Soames]177-soames [he]233-swithin felt sure , had an eye ! "[0-i] The phaeton hood down ; [I]0-i am going - to - drive - [a - lady]1163-a - lady ! " [A pretty woman]718-a pretty woman would want to show off [her]718-a pretty woman frock ; and well - [he]233-swithin was going to drive [a lady]3518-a lady ! It was like a new beginning to the good old days . Ages since [he]233-swithin had driven [a woman]3436-a woman ! The last time , if [he]233-swithin remembered , it had been [Juley]260-aunts juley ; [the poor old soul]3520-the poor old soul had been as nervous as a cat the whole time , and so put [him]233-swithin out of patience that , as [he]233-swithin dropped [her]1163-a - lady in [the Bayswater Road]485-the bayswater road , [he]233-swithin had said : "[0-i] Well [I]0-i 'm d - -d if [I]0-i ever drive [you]1163-a - lady again ! " And [he]233-swithin never had , not [he]233-swithin ! Going up to [his]233-swithin horses ' heads , [he]233-swithin examined [their]3522-their bits ; not that [he]233-swithin knew anything about bits - [he]233-swithin did n't pay [[his]233-swithin coachman]3523-his coachman sixty pounds a year to do [his]233-swithin work for [him]233-swithin , that had never been [his]233-swithin principle . Indeed , [his]233-swithin reputation as [a horsey man]3524-a horsey man rested mainly on the fact that once , on Derby Day , [he]233-swithin had been welshed by [some thimble - riggers]3525-some thimble - riggers . But [someone at [the Club]2302-the club]3526-someone at the club , after seeing [him]233-swithin drive [his]233-swithin greys up to the door - [he]233-swithin always drove grey horses , [you]3528-you got more style for the money , some thought - had called [him]233-swithin ' Four - in - hand [Forsyte]166-june . ' The name having reached [his]233-swithin ears through [that fellow [Nicholas Treffry]206-nicholas treffry , [[old Jolyon]163-old jolyon 's dead partner]3530-old jolyon 's dead partner , [the great driving man]3531-the great driving man notorious for more [carriage accidents]3532-carriage accidents than [any man in [the kingdom]3534-the kingdom]3533-any man in the kingdom]3529-that fellow nicholas treffry , old jolyon 's dead partner , the great driving man notorious for more carriage accidents than any man in the kingdom - [Swithin]233-swithin had ever after conceived it right to act up to it . The name had taken [his]233-swithin fancy , not because [he]233-swithin had ever driven four - in - hand , or was ever likely to , but because of something distinguished in the sound . Four - in - hand [Forsyte]166-june ! Not bad ! Born too soon , [Swithin]233-swithin had missed [his]233-swithin vocation . Coming upon [London]2-london twenty years later , [he]233-swithin could not have failed to have become [a stockbroker]3535-a stockbroker , but at the time when [he]233-swithin was obliged to select , this great profession had not as yet became the chief glory of [the upper - middle class]609-the upper - middle class . [He]233-swithin had literally been forced into [land agency]2615-land agency . Once in the driving seat , with the reins handed to [him]233-swithin , and blinking over [his]233-swithin pale old cheeks in the full sunlight , [he]233-swithin took a slow look round - [Adolf]228-adolf was already up behind ; [the cockaded groom at the horses]3538-the cockaded groom at the horses ' heads stood ready to let go ; everything was prepared for the signal , and [Swithin]233-swithin gave it . [The equipage]3539-the equipage dashed forward , and before [you]3540-you could say [Jack Robinson]307-jack robinson , with a rattle and flourish drew up at [Soames]177-soames ' door . [Irene]186-irene came out at once , and stepped in - [he]233-swithin afterward described it at [Timothy]170-timothy 's - "[0-i] as light as - er - [Taglioni]308-taglioni , no fuss about it , no wanting this or wanting that ; " and above all , [Swithin]233-swithin dwelt on this , staring at [Mrs. Septimus]177-soames in a way that disconcerted [her]177-soames a good deal , "[0-i] no silly nervousness ! " To [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester [he]233-swithin portrayed [Irene]186-irene 's hat . "[1164-your] Not one of [your]1164-your great flopping things , sprawling about , and catching the dust , that [women]817-women are so fond of nowadays , but a neat little - " [he]233-swithin made a circular motion of [his]233-swithin hand , "[308-taglioni] white veil - capital taste . " "[308-taglioni] What was it made of ? " inquired [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester , who manifested a languid but permanent excitement at any mention of dress . "[308-taglioni] Made of ? " returned [Swithin]233-swithin ; "[308-taglioni] now how should [I]0-i know ? " [He]233-swithin sank into silence so profound that [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester began to be afraid [he]233-swithin had fallen into a trance . [She]181-aunt hester did not try to rouse [him]233-swithin [herself]181-aunt hester , it not being [her]181-aunt hester custom . " [They]3542-they had not gone four miles before [Swithin]233-swithin received the impression that [Irene]186-irene liked driving with [him]233-swithin . On Saturday morning [Soames]177-soames had found [her]186-irene at [her]186-irene writing - table with a note written to [Swithin]233-swithin , putting [him]233-swithin off . "[0-i] [He]0-i sat down by the oak tree , in the sun ; square and upright , with one hand stretched out , resting on the nob of [his]0-i cane , the other planted on [his]0-i knee ; [his]0-i fur coat thrown open , [his]0-i hat , roofing with its flat top the pale square of [his]0-i face ; [his]0-i stare , very blank , fixed on [the landscape]2777-the landscape . [His]0-i head fell to the left , [he]0-i jerked it up at once ; it fell to the right . It remained there ; [he]0-i was asleep . And asleep , [a sentinel on the - top of the rise]1184-a sentinel on the - top of the rise , [he]0-i appeared to rule over this prospect - remarkable - like some image blocked out by [the special artist]1185-the special artist , of primeval Forsytes in pagan days , to record the domination of mind over matter ! And [all the unnumbered generations of [[his]0-i yeoman ancestors]1187-his yeoman ancestors]1186-all the unnumbered generations of his yeoman ancestors , wo nt of a Sunday to stand akimbo surveying [[their]1186-all the unnumbered generations of his yeoman ancestors little plots of land]1188-their little plots of land , [their]1186-all the unnumbered generations of his yeoman ancestors grey unmoving eyes hiding [their]1186-all the unnumbered generations of his yeoman ancestors instinct with its hidden roots of violence , [their]1186-all the unnumbered generations of his yeoman ancestors instinct for possession to the exclusion of all [the world]2286-the world - [all these unnumbered generations]1190-all these unnumbered generations seemed to sit there with [him]0-i on [the top of the rise]1191-the top of the rise . But from [him]0-i , thus slumbering , [his]0-i jealous Forsyte spirit travelled far , into [God - knows - what jungle of fancies]1192-god - knows - what jungle of fancies ; with [those two young people]1193-those two young people , to see what [they]1193-those two young people were doing down there in [the copse]1194-the copse - in the copse where [the spring was running riot with the scent of sap and bursting buds]1195-the spring was running riot with the scent of sap and bursting buds , the song of birds innumerable , a carpet of bluebells and sweet growing things , and the sun caught like gold in the tops of the trees ; to see what [they]1193-those two young people were doing , walking along there so close together on the path that was too narrow ; walking along there so close that [they]1193-those two young people were always touching ; to watch [Irene]186-irene 's eyes , like dark thieves , stealing the heart out of the spring . And [a great unseen chaperon]1196-a great unseen chaperon , [his]1196-a great unseen chaperon spirit was there , stopping with [them]1193-those two young people to look at the little furry corpse of a mole , not dead an hour , with [his]1196-a great unseen chaperon mushroom - and - silver coat untouched by the rain or dew ; watching over [Irene]186-irene 's bent head , and the soft look of [her]186-irene pitying eyes ; and over [that young man]1197-that young man 's head , gazing at [her]186-irene so hard , so strangely . Walking on with [them]1193-those two young people , too , across the open space where [a wood - cutter]1198-a wood - cutter had been at work , where the bluebells were trampled down , and a trunk had swayed and staggered down from its gashed stump . Climbing it with [them]1193-those two young people , over , and on to the very edge of [the copse]1194-the copse , whence there stretched [an undiscovered country]1200-an undiscovered country , from far away in which came the sounds , ' Cuckoo - cuckoo ! ' Silent , standing with [them]1193-those two young people there , and uneasy at [their]1193-those two young people silence ! Very queer , very strange ! "[233-swithin] What gave rise to this sudden piece of psychology [he]1207-that young fellow did not state ; possibly [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's , prominent forehead and cheekbones and chin , or something hungry in [his]168-bosinney face , which quarrelled with [Swithin]233-swithin 's conception of the calm satiety that should characterize [the perfect gentleman]1216-the perfect gentleman . "[233-swithin] This celebrated novel - one of the half - dozen [he]233-swithin had read - had produced an extraordinary impression on [his]233-swithin mind . " But [she]181-aunt hester gave [him]2355-the fellow no encouragement , "[233-swithin] went on [Swithin]233-swithin ; [he]233-swithin stopped , and stared for a minute or two in the way that alarmed [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester so - [he]233-swithin had suddenly recollected that , as [they]1219-they were starting back in the phaeton , [she]181-aunt hester had given [Bosinney]168-bosinney [her]181-aunt hester hand a second time , and let it stay there too .... [He]233-swithin had touched [his]233-swithin horses smartly with the whip , anxious to get [her]181-aunt hester all to [himself]233-swithin . But [she]181-aunt hester had looked back , and [she]181-aunt hester had not answered [his]233-swithin first question ; neither had [he]233-swithin been able to see [her]181-aunt hester face - [she]181-aunt hester had kept it hanging down . There is somewhere a picture , which [Swithin]233-swithin has not seen , of [a man]515-a man sitting on a rock , and by [him]515-a man , immersed in [the still , green water]1221-the still , green water , a sea - nymph lying on [her]181-aunt hester back , with [her]181-aunt hester hand on [her]181-aunt hester naked breast . [She]181-aunt hester has a half - smile on [her]181-aunt hester face - a smile of hopeless surrender and of secret joy . Seated by [Swithin]233-swithin 's side , [Irene]186-irene may have been smiling like that . When , warmed by champagne , [he]233-swithin had [her]186-irene all to [himself]233-swithin , [he]233-swithin unbosomed [himself]233-swithin of [his]233-swithin wrongs ; of [his]233-swithin smothered resentment against [the new chef at [the club]2302-the club]1222-the new chef at the club ; [his]233-swithin worry over [the house in [Wigmore Street]64-wigmore street]1224-the house in wigmore street , where [the rascally tenant]1225-the rascally tenant had gone bankrupt through helping [[his]233-swithin brother - in - law]3149-his brother - in - law as if charity did not begin at [home]436-home ; of [his]233-swithin deafness , too , and that pain [he]233-swithin sometimes got in [his]233-swithin right side . [She]186-irene listened , [her]186-irene eyes swimming under their lids . [He]233-swithin thought [she]186-irene was thinking deeply of [his]233-swithin troubles , and pitied [himself]233-swithin terribly . Yet in [his]233-swithin fur coat , with frogs across the breast , [his]233-swithin top hat aslant , driving [this beautiful woman]1228-this beautiful woman , [he]233-swithin had never felt more distinguished . [A coster]1229-a coster , however , taking [[his]1229-a coster girl]1230-his girl for a Sunday airing , seemed to have the same impression about [himself]1229-a coster . [This person]2852-this person had flogged [[his]1229-a coster donkey]1232-his donkey into a gallop alongside , and sat , upright as a waxwork , in [[his]1229-a coster shallopy chariot]1233-his shallopy chariot , [his]1229-a coster chin settled pompously on a red handkerchief , like [Swithin]233-swithin 's on [his]1229-a coster full cravat ; while [[his]1229-a coster girl]1230-his girl , with the ends of a fly - blown boa floating out behind , aped [a woman of fashion]1235-a woman of fashion . [[Her]1228-this beautiful woman swain]1236-her swain moved a stick with a ragged bit of string dangling from the end , reproducing with strange fidelity the circular flourish of [Swithin]233-swithin 's whip , and rolled [his]1236-her swain head at [[his]1236-her swain lady]1237-his lady with a leer that had a weird likeness to [Swithin]233-swithin 's primeval stare . Though for a time unconscious of [the lowly ruffian]1238-the lowly ruffian 's presence , [Swithin]233-swithin presently took it into [his]233-swithin head that [he]233-swithin was being guyed . [He]233-swithin laid [his]233-swithin whip - lash across the mares flank . [The two chariots]1239-the two chariots , however , by some unfortunate fatality continued abreast . [Swithin]233-swithin 's yellow , puffy face grew red ; [he]233-swithin raised [his]233-swithin whip to lash [the costermonger]1240-the costermonger , but was saved from so far forgetting [his]233-swithin dignity by a special intervention of [Providence]265-providence . [A carriage driving]1241-a carriage driving out through a gate forced phaeton and [donkey - cart]1242-donkey - cart into proximity ; the wheels grated , [the lighter vehicle]1243-the lighter vehicle skidded , and was overturned . [Swithin]233-swithin did not look round . On no account would [he]233-swithin have pulled up to help [the ruffian]1244-the ruffian . Serve [him]233-swithin right if [he]233-swithin had broken [his]233-swithin neck ! But [he]233-swithin could not if [he]233-swithin would . [The greys]1245-the greys had taken alarm . [The phaeton]1246-the phaeton swung from side to side , and [people]600-people raised frightened faces as [they]600-people went dashing past . [Swithin]233-swithin 's great arms , stretched at full length , tugged at the reins . [His]233-swithin cheeks were puffed , [his]233-swithin lips compressed , [his]233-swithin swollen face was of a dull , angry red . [Irene]186-irene had [her]186-irene hand on the rail , and at every lurch [she]186-irene gripped it tightly . [Swithin]233-swithin heard [her]186-irene ask : " Are [we]3584-we going to have an accident , [Uncle Swithin]233-swithin ? "[186-irene] [He]233-swithin gasped out between [his]233-swithin pants : " It 's nothing ; a - little fresh ! "[233-swithin] " [I]186-irene 've never been in an accident . "[186-irene] " Do n't [you]186-irene move ! "[233-swithin] [He]233-swithin took a look at [her]186-irene . [She]186-irene was smiling , perfectly calm . " Sit still , "[233-swithin] [he]233-swithin repeated . " Never fear , [I]233-swithin 'll get [you]186-irene [home]436-home ! "[233-swithin] And in the midst of all [his]233-swithin terrible efforts , [he]233-swithin was surprised to hear [her]186-irene answer in a voice not like [her]186-irene own : " [I]186-irene do n't care if [I]186-irene never get [home]436-home ! "[186-irene] [The carriage]2416-the carriage giving a terrific lurch , [Swithin]233-swithin 's exclamation was jerked back into [his]233-swithin throat . The horses , winded by the rise of [a hill]1249-a hill , now steadied to a trot , and finally stopped of [their]1250-their own accord . " When "[233-swithin] - [Swithin]233-swithin described it at [Timothy]170-timothy 's - " [I]233-swithin pulled ['em]186-irene up , there [she]186-irene was as cool as [myself]233-swithin . God bless [my]233-swithin soul ! [she]186-irene behaved as if [she]186-irene did n't care whether [she]186-irene broke [her]186-irene neck or not ! What was it [she]186-irene said : ' [I]233-swithin do n't care if [I]233-swithin never get [home]436-home ? "[233-swithin] Leaning over the handle of [his]233-swithin cane , [he]233-swithin wheezed out , to [Mrs. Small]177-soames 's terror : " And [I]233-swithin 'm not altogether surprised , with [a finickin ' feller like [young Soames]177-soames for [a husband]2822-a husband]3588-a finickin ' feller like young soames for a husband ! "[233-swithin] It did not occur to [him]233-swithin to wonder what [Bosinney]168-bosinney had done after [they]1251-they had left [him]233-swithin [there]454-there alone ; whether [he]233-swithin had gone wandering about like the dog to which [Swithin]233-swithin had compared [him]233-swithin ; wandering down to that copse where the spring was still in riot , the cuckoo still calling from afar ; gone down there with [her]177-soames handkerchief pressed to lips , its fragrance mingling with the scent of mint and thyme . Gone down there with such a wild , exquisite pain in [his]233-swithin heart that [he]233-swithin could have cried out among the trees . Or what , indeed , [the fellow]2355-the fellow had done . In fact , till [he]233-swithin came to [[Timothy]170-timothy 's]2927-timothy 's , [Swithin]233-swithin had forgotten all about [him]233-swithin . CHAPTER IV - [JAMES]173-james GOES TO SEE FOR [HIMSELF]173-james [Those ignorant of [Forsyte]165-old jolyon ' Change]1255-those ignorant of forsyte ' change would not , perhaps , foresee all the stir made by [Irene]186-irene 's visit to [the house]2326-the house . After [Swithin]233-swithin had related at [Timothy]170-timothy 's the full story of [his]233-swithin memorable drive , the same , with the least suspicion of curiosity , the merest touch of malice , and a real desire to do good , was passed on to [June]166-june . " And what a dreadful thing to say , [[my]237-aunt juley dear]2282-my dear ! "[237-aunt juley] ended [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley ; " that about not going [home]436-home . What did [she]186-irene mean ? "[237-aunt juley] It was a strange recital for [the girl]595-the girl . [She]237-aunt juley heard it flushing painfully , and , suddenly , with a curt handshake , took [her]166-june departure . " Almost rude ! "[177-soames] [Mrs. Small]177-soames said to [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester , when [June]166-june was gone . The proper construction was put on [her]237-aunt juley reception of the news . [She]237-aunt juley was upset . Something was therefore very wrong . Odd ! [She]237-aunt juley and [Irene]186-irene had been [such friends]1258-such friends ! It all tallied too well with whispers and hints that had been going about for some time past . Recollections of [Euphemia]303-euphemia 's account of the visit to [the theatre]541-the theatre - [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney always at [Soames 's]164-soames ? Oh , indeed ! Yes , of course , [he]168-bosinney would be about [the house]2326-the house ! Nothing open . Only upon the greatest , the most important provocation was it necessary to say anything open on [Forsyte]303-euphemia ' Change . This machine was too nicely adjusted ; a hint , the merest trifling expression of regret or doubt , sufficed to set the family soul so sympathetic - vibrating . [No one]514-no one desired that harm should come of these vibrations - far from it ; [they]1262-they were set in motion with the best intentions , with the feeling , that [each member of [the family]450-the family]1263-each member of the family had a stake in the family soul . And much kindness lay at the bottom of the gossip ; it would frequently result in visits of condolence being made , in accordance with the customs of Society , thereby conferring a real benefit upon [the sufferers]1265-the sufferers , and affording consolation to the sound , who felt pleasantly that [someone at all events]1266-someone at all events was suffering from that from which [they]1266-someone at all events [themselves]1266-someone at all events were not suffering . In fact , it was simply a desire to keep things well - aired , the desire which animates [the Public Press]1267-the public press , that brought [James]173-james , for instance , into communication with [Mrs. Septimus]177-soames , [Mrs. Septimus]177-soames , with [the little Nicholases]313-the little nicholases , [the little Nicholases with who - knows - whom]1268-the little nicholases with who - knows - whom , and so on . That great class to which [they]1266-someone at all events had risen , and now belonged , demanded a certain candour , a still more certain reticence . This combination guaranteed [their]1266-someone at all events membership . [Many of [the younger Forsytes]164-soames]1269-many of the younger forsytes felt , very naturally , and would openly declare , that [they]1269-many of the younger forsytes did not want [their]1269-many of the younger forsytes affairs pried into ; but so powerful was the invisible , magnetic current of family gossip , that for the life of [them]1269-many of the younger forsytes [they]1269-many of the younger forsytes could not help knowing all about everything . It was felt to be hopeless . One of [them]1269-many of the younger forsytes [young Roger]317-roger had made an heroic attempt to free [the rising generation]1270-the rising generation , by speaking of [Timothy]170-timothy as an ' old cat . ' The effort had justly recoiled upon [himself]317-roger ; the words , coming round in the most delicate way to [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley 's ears , were repeated by [her]237-aunt juley in a shocked voice to [Mrs. Roger]317-roger , whence [they]1266-someone at all events returned again to [young Roger]317-roger . And , after all , it was only [the wrong - doers who suffered]1271-the wrong - doers who suffered ; as , for instance , [George]291-george , when [he]291-george lost all that money playing billiards ; or [young Roger]317-roger [himself]317-roger , when [he]291-george was so dreadfully near to marrying [the girl to whom , it was whispered]1272-the girl to whom , it was whispered , [he]291-george was already married by the laws of Nature ; or again [Irene]186-irene , who was thought , rather than said , to be in danger . All this was not only pleasant but salutary . And it made so many hours go lightly at [[Timothy]170-timothy 's in [the Bayswater Road]485-the bayswater road]1273-timothy 's in the bayswater road ; so many hours that must otherwise have been sterile and heavy to [those three who lived [there]454-there]1275-those three who lived there ; and [[Timothy]170-timothy 's]2927-timothy 's was but [one of [hundreds of such homes in [this City of]1280-this city of [London]2-london]1279-hundreds of such homes in this city of london]1278-one of hundreds of such homes in this city of london - [the homes of [neutral persons of the secure classes , who are out of the battle]1282-neutral persons of the secure classes , who are out of the battle [themselves]1282-neutral persons of the secure classes , who are out of the battle , and must find [their]1282-neutral persons of the secure classes , who are out of the battle reason for existing , in the battles of [others]1283-others]1281-the homes of neutral persons of the secure classes , who are out of the battle themselves , and must find their reason for existing , in the battles of others . But for the sweetness of family gossip , it must indeed have been lonely [there]454-there . Rumours and tales , reports , surmises - were [they]1275-those three who lived there not [the children of [the house]2326-the house]1285-the children of the house , as dear and precious as the prattling babes [the brother and sisters]1287-the brother and sisters had missed in [their]1287-the brother and sisters own journey ? To talk about [them]1275-those three who lived there was as near as [they]1275-those three who lived there could get to the possession of [all those children]1288-all those children and [grandchildren]1289-grandchildren , after whom [their]1287-the brother and sisters soft hearts yearned . For though it is doubtful whether [Timothy]170-timothy 's heart yearned , it is indubitable that at the arrival of [each fresh Forsyte child]1290-each fresh forsyte child [he]170-timothy was quite upset . Useless for [young Roger]317-roger to say , " Old cat ! "[317-roger] for [Euphemia]303-euphemia to hold up [her]303-euphemia hands and cry : " Oh ! [those three]3592-those three ! "[303-euphemia] and break into [her]303-euphemia silent laugh with the squeak at the end . Useless , and not too kind . The situation which at this stage might seem , and especially to [Forsyte eyes]303-euphemia , strange - not to say ' impossible ' - was , in view of certain facts , not so strange after all . Some things had been lost sight of . And first , in the security bred of many harmless marriages , it had been forgotten that Love is no hot - house flower , but a wild plant , born of a wet night , born of an hour of sunshine ; sprung from wild seed , blown along [the road]1291-the road by a wild wind . A wild plant that , when it blooms by chance within the hedge of [[our]1292-we gardens]1293-our gardens , [we]1292-we call a flower ; and when it blooms outside [we]1292-we call a weed ; but , [flower or weed , whose scent and colour are always , wild]1294-flower or weed , whose scent and colour are always , wild ! And further - the facts and figures of [their]1275-those three who lived there own lives being against the perception of this truth - it was not generally recognised by [Forsytes]164-soames that , where , this wild plant springs , [men]550-men and [women]817-women are but [moths around the pale , flame - like blossom]1297-moths around the pale , flame - like blossom . It was long since [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon 's escapade - there was danger of a tradition again arising that people in [their]1275-those three who lived there position never cross the hedge to pluck that flower ; that one could reckon on having love , like measles , once in due season , and getting over it comfortably for all time - as with measles , on a soothing mixture of butter and honey - in the arms of [wedlock]1298-wedlock . Of all those whom this strange rumour about [Bosinney]168-bosinney and [Mrs. Soames]177-soames reached , [James]173-james was the most affected . [He]1299-he had long forgotten how [he]1299-he had hovered , lanky and pale , in side whiskers of chestnut hue , round [Emily]173-james , in the days of [his]1299-he own courtship . [He]1299-he had long forgotten [the small house in the purlieus of [Mayfair]85-mayfair , where [he]1299-he had spent the early days of [his]1299-he married life]1300-the small house in the purlieus of mayfair , where he had spent the early days of his married life , or rather , [he]1299-he had long forgotten the early days , not [the small house]1301-the small house , - a [Forsyte]303-euphemia never forgot [a house]689-a house - [he]1299-he had afterwards sold [it]689-a house at a clear profit of four hundred pounds . [He]1299-he had long forgotten those days , with [their]1303-their hopes and fears and doubts about the prudence of the match for [Emily]173-james , though pretty , had nothing , and [he]1299-he [himself]1299-he at that time was making a bare thousand a year , and that strange , irresistible attraction which had drawn [him]1299-he on , till [he]1299-he felt [he]1299-he must die if [he]1299-he could not marry [the girl with the fair hair , looped so neatly back]1304-the girl with the fair hair , looped so neatly back , the fair arms emerging from a skin - tight bodice , the fair form decorously shielded by a cage of really stupendous circumference . [James]173-james had passed through the fire , but [he]1299-he had passed also through the river of years which washes out the fire ; [he]1299-he had experienced the saddest experience of all - forgetfulness of what it was like to be in love . Forgotten ! Forgotten so long , that [he]1299-he had forgotten even that [he]1299-he had forgotten . And now this rumour had come upon [him]1299-he , this rumour about [[[his]1299-he son]2441-his son 's wife]1306-his son 's wife ; very vague , a shadow dodging among the palpable , straightforward appearances of things , unreal , unintelligible as a ghost , but carrying with it , like a ghost , inexplicable terror . [He]1299-he tried to bring it home to [his]1299-he mind , but it was no more use than trying to apply to [himself]1299-he one of those tragedies [he]1299-he read of daily in [his]1299-he evening paper . [He]1299-he simply could not . There could be nothing in it . It was all [their]1307-they nonsense . [She]1306-his son 's wife did n't get on with [Soames]177-soames as well as [she]1306-his son 's wife might , but [she]1306-his son 's wife was a good little thing - a good little thing ! Like [the not inconsiderable majority of [men]550-men]1308-the not inconsiderable majority of men , [James]173-james relished a nice little bit of scandal , and would say , in a matter - of - fact tone , licking [his]1299-he lips , " Yes , yes - [she]1306-his son 's wife and [young Dyson]314-young dyson ; [they]1307-they tell [me]1299-he [they]1307-they 're living at [Monte Carlo]86-monte carlo ! "[1299-he] But the significance of an affair of this sort - of its past , its present , or its future - had never struck [him]1299-he . What it meant , what torture and raptures had gone to its construction , what slow , overmastering fate had lurked within the facts , very naked , sometimes sordid , but generally spicy , presented to [his]1299-he gaze . [He]1299-he was not in the habit of blaming , praising , drawing deductions , or generalizing at all about such things ; [he]1299-he simply listened rather greedily , and repeated what [he]1299-he was told , finding considerable benefit from the practice , as from the consumption of a sherry and bitters before a meal . Now , however , that such a thing - or rather the rumour , the breath of it - had come near [him]1299-he personally , [he]1299-he felt as in a fog , which filled [his]1299-he mouth full of a bad , thick flavour , and made it difficult to draw breath . A scandal ! A possible scandal ! To repeat this word to [himself]1299-he thus was the only way in which [he]1299-he could focus or make it thinkable . [He]1299-he had forgotten the sensations necessary for understanding the progress , fate , or meaning of any such business ; [he]1299-he simply could no longer grasp the possibilities of [people]600-people running any risk for the sake of passion . Amongst [all those persons of [his]1299-he acquaintance , who went into [the City]2392-the city day after day and did [their]1311-all those persons of his acquaintance , who went into the city day after day and did their business there business [there]454-there]1311-all those persons of his acquaintance , who went into the city day after day and did their business there , whatever it was , and in [their]1311-all those persons of his acquaintance , who went into the city day after day and did their business there leisure moments bought shares , and [houses]2315-houses , and ate dinners , and played games , as [he]1299-he was told , it would have seemed to [him]1299-he ridiculous to suppose that there were [any who would run risks for the sake of anything so recondite , so figurative , as passion]1315-any who would run risks for the sake of anything so recondite , so figurative , as passion . Passion ! [He]1299-he seemed , indeed , to have heard of it , and rules such as ' [A young man]1316-a young man and [a young woman]1008-a young woman ought never to be trusted together ' were fixed in [his]1299-he mind as the parallels of latitude are fixed on a map for all [Forsytes]164-soames , when it comes to ' bed - rock ' matters of fact , have quite a fine taste in realism ; but as to anything else - well , [he]1299-he could only appreciate it at all through the catch - word ' scandal . ' Ah ! but there was no truth in it - could not be . [He]1299-he was not afraid ; [she]1318-she was really a good little thing . But there it was when [you]1319-you got a thing like that into [your]1319-you mind . And [James]173-james was of a nervous temperament - one of [those men whom things will not leave alone , who suffer tortures from anticipation and indecision]1320-those men whom things will not leave alone , who suffer tortures from anticipation and indecision . For fear of letting something slip that [he]1299-he might otherwise secure , [he]1299-he was physically unable to make up [his]1299-he mind until absolutely certain that , by not making it up , [he]1299-he would suffer loss . In life , however , there were many occasions when the business of making up [his]1299-he mind did not even rest with [himself]1299-he , and this was one of them . What could [he]1299-he do ? Talk it over with [Soames]164-soames ? That would only make matters worse . And , after all , there was nothing in it , [he]1299-he felt sure . It was all [that house]1321-that house . [He]1299-he had mistrusted the idea from the first . What did [Soames]164-soames want to go into [the country]2374-the country for ? And , if [he]1299-he must go spending a lot of money building [himself]1299-he [a house]689-a house , why not have [a first - rate man]1000-a first - rate man , instead of [this young Bosinney , whom [nobody]2292-nobody knew anything about]1325-this young bosinney , whom nobody knew anything about ? [He]1299-he had told [them]1327-them how it would be . And [he]1299-he had heard that [the house]2326-the house was costing [Soames]164-soames a pretty penny beyond what [he]1299-he had reckoned on spending . This fact , more than any other , brought [home]436-home to [James]173-james the real danger of the situation . It was always like this with [these ' artistic ' chaps]1330-these ' artistic ' chaps ; [a sensible man]1331-a sensible man should have nothing to say to [them]1330-these ' artistic ' chaps . [He]1299-he had warned [Irene]186-irene , too . And see what had come of it ! And it suddenly sprang into [James]173-james 's mind that [he]1299-he ought to go and see for [himself]1299-he . In the midst of that fog of uneasiness in which [his]1299-he mind was enveloped the notion that [he]1299-he could go and look at [the house]2326-the house afforded [him]1299-he inexplicable satisfaction . It may have been simply the decision to do something - more possibly the fact that [he]1299-he was going to look at [a house]689-a house - that gave [him]1299-he relief . [He]1299-he felt that in staring at an edifice of bricks and mortar , of wood and stone , built by [the suspected man]1334-the suspected man [himself]1299-he , [he]1299-he would be looking into the heart of that rumour about [Irene]186-irene . Without saying a word , therefore , to [anyone]879-anyone , [he]1299-he took a hansom to [the station]2335-the station and proceeded by [train]1337-train to [Robin Hill]53-robin hill ; thence - there being no ' flies , ' in accordance with the custom of [the neighbourhood]2469-the neighbourhood - [he]1299-he found [himself]1299-he obliged to walk . [He]1299-he started slowly up [the hill]937-the hill , [his]1299-he angular knees and high shoulders bent complainingly , [his]1299-he eyes fixed on [his]1299-he feet , yet , neat for all that , in [his]1299-he high hat and [his]1299-he frock - coat , on which was the speckless gloss imparted by perfect superintendence . [Emily]173-james saw to that ; that is , [she]173-james did not , of course , see to it - [people of good position]1340-people of good position not seeing to each other 's buttons , and [Emily]173-james was of good position - but [she]173-james saw that [the butler]542-the butler saw to it . [He]542-the butler had to ask [his]542-the butler way three times ; on each occasion [he]542-the butler repeated the directions given [him]542-the butler , got [the man]2473-the man to repeat them , then repeated them a second time , for [he]542-the butler was naturally of a talkative disposition , and [one]2652-one could not be too careful in [a new neighbourhood]1344-a new neighbourhood . [He]1299-he kept assuring [them]1345-them that it was [a new house]1346-a new house [he]1299-he was looking for ; it was only , however , when [he]1299-he was shown the roof through the trees that [he]1299-he could feel really satisfied that [he]1299-he had not been directed entirely wrong . A heavy sky seemed to cover [the world]2286-the world with the grey whiteness of a whitewashed ceiling . There was no freshness or fragrance in the air . On such a day even [British workmen]1348-british workmen scarcely cared to do more then [they]1348-british workmen were obliged , and moved about [their]1348-british workmen business without the drone of talk which whiles away the pangs of labour . Through spaces of [the unfinished house]3569-the unfinished house , [shirt - sleeved figures]1350-shirt - sleeved figures worked slowly , and sounds arose - spasmodic knockings , the scraping of metal , the sawing of wood , with the rumble of wheelbarrows along boards ; now and again [the foreman]1351-the foreman 's dog , tethered by a string to an oaken beam , whimpered feebly , with a sound like the singing of a kettle . The fresh - fitted window - panes , daubed each with a white patch in the centre , stared out at [James]173-james like the eyes of a blind dog . And the building chorus went on , strident and mirthless under the grey - white sky . But the thrushes , hunting amongst the fresh - turned earth for worms , were silent quite . [James]173-james picked [his]1299-he way among the heaps of gravel - [the drive]1352-the drive was being laid - till [he]1299-he came opposite [the porch]1353-the porch . Here [he]1299-he stopped and raised [his]1299-he eyes . There was but little to see from this point of view , and that little [he]1299-he took in at once ; but [he]1299-he stayed in this position many minutes , and who shall know of what [he]1299-he thought . [His]1299-he china - blue eyes under white eyebrows that jutted out in little horns , never stirred ; the long upper lip of [his]1299-he wide mouth , between the fine white whiskers , twitched once or twice ; it was easy to see from that anxious rapt expression , whence [Soames]164-soames derived the handicapped look which sometimes came upon [his]1299-he face . [James]173-james might have been saying to [himself]173-james : ' [I]0-i do n't know - life 's a tough job . ' In this position [Bosinney]168-bosinney surprised [him]1299-he . [James]173-james brought [his]1299-he eyes down from whatever bird's - nest [they]1354-they had been looking for in the sky to [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's face , on which was a kind of humorous scorn . " How do [you]168-bosinney do , [Mr. Forsyte]171-soames ? Come down to see for [yourself]168-bosinney ? "[168-bosinney] It was exactly what [James]173-james , as [we]1355-we know , had come for , and [he]1299-he was made correspondingly uneasy . [The fellow]2355-the fellow was sharper than [he]1299-he had thought , and better - looking than [he]1299-he had hoped . [He]2355-the fellow had a - a ' do n't care ' appearance that [James , to whom risk was the most intolerable thing in life]1372-james , to whom risk was the most intolerable thing in life , did not appreciate ; a peculiar smile , too , coming when least expected ; and very queer eyes . [He]2355-the fellow reminded [James]173-james , as [he]2355-the fellow said afterwards , of a hungry cat . At last , having seen all that was to be seen , [he]1299-he came out again at the door where [he]1299-he had gone in ; and now , feeling that [he]1299-he was wasting time and strength and money , all for nothing , [he]1299-he took the courage of [a Forsyte]171-soames in both hands , and , looking sharply at [Bosinney]168-bosinney , said : " [I]1299-he dare say [you]168-bosinney see a good deal of [[my]1299-he daughter - in - law]3595-my daughter - in - law ; now , what does [she]186-irene think of [the house]2326-the house ? Passing through [the Groceries]1377-the groceries [her]303-euphemia eye was unpleasantly attracted by the back view of [a very beautiful figure]3620-a very beautiful figure . It was so charmingly proportioned , so balanced , and so well clothed , that [Euphemia]303-euphemia 's instinctive propriety was at once alarmed ; [such figures]3621-such figures , [she]303-euphemia knew , by intuition rather than experience , were rarely connected with virtue - certainly never in [her]303-euphemia mind , for [her]303-euphemia own back was somewhat difficult to fit . [Her]303-euphemia suspicions were fortunately confirmed . [Mrs. Soames]177-soames , usually somewhat pale , had a delightful colour in [her]177-soames cheeks ; and [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney 's manner was strange , though attractive [she]303-euphemia thought [him]168-bosinney rather [a distinguished - looking man]3629-a distinguished - looking man , and [George]291-george 's name for [him]168-bosinney , ' The Buccaneer ' - about which there was something romantic - quite charming . [One nice old General]3630-one nice old general , going towards [Cigars]87-cigars , was obliged to step quite out of the way , and chancing to look up and see [Mrs. Soames]177-soames ' face , [he]168-bosinney actually took off [his]168-bosinney hat , [the old fool]3631-the old fool ! So like [a man]515-a man ! But it was [Mrs. Soames]177-soames ' eyes that worried [Euphemia]303-euphemia . [She]303-euphemia never once looked at [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney until [he]168-bosinney moved on , and then [she]303-euphemia looked after [him]168-bosinney . And , oh , that look ! When [he]316-james reached [the office of [Forsyte]303-euphemia , [Bustard]242-bustard and [Forsyte]303-euphemia]3636-the office of forsyte , bustard and forsyte , [he]316-james found [Soames]177-soames , sitting in [his]316-james revolving , chair , drawing up a defence . [The latter]2450-the latter greeted [[his]2450-the latter father]559-his father with a curt good - morning , and , taking an envelope from [his]316-james pocket , said : "[1381-dear auntie] It may interest [you]1380-you to look through this . " [James]316-james read as follows : ' 309D , [SLOANE STREET]56-sloane street , May 15 , ' [DEAR FORSYTE]303-euphemia , ' The construction of [[your]303-euphemia house]2720-your house being now completed , [my]1381-dear auntie duties as [architect]3133-architect have come to an end . If [I]1381-dear auntie am to go on with the business of decoration , which at [your]303-euphemia request [I]1381-dear auntie undertook , [I]1381-dear auntie should like [you]303-euphemia to clearly understand that [I]1381-dear auntie must have a free hand . ' [You]303-euphemia never come down without suggesting something that goes counter to [my]1381-dear auntie scheme . [I]1381-dear auntie have here three letters from [you]303-euphemia , each of which recommends an article [I]1381-dear auntie should never dream of putting in . [I]1381-dear auntie had [[your]303-euphemia father]3641-your father [here]735-here yesterday afternoon , who made further valuable suggestions . ' Please make up [your]303-euphemia mind , therefore , whether [you]303-euphemia want [me]1381-dear auntie to decorate for [you]303-euphemia , or to retire which on the whole [I]1381-dear auntie should prefer to do . ' But understand that , if [I]1381-dear auntie decorate , [I]1381-dear auntie decorate alone , without interference of any sort . If [I]1381-dear auntie do the thing , [I]1381-dear auntie will do it thoroughly , but [I]1381-dear auntie must have a free hand . ' [Yours]303-euphemia truly , ' [PHILIP BOSINNEY]316-james . ' The exact and immediate cause of this letter can not , of course , be told , though it is not improbable that [Bosinney]316-james may have been moved by some sudden revolt against [his]316-james position towards [Soames]177-soames - that eternal position of Art towards Property - which is so admirably summed up , on the back of the most indispensable of modern appliances , in a sentence comparable to the very finest in [Tacitus]318-tacitus : [THOS]319-thos . T. [SORROW]320-sorrow , [Inventor]321-inventor . [BERT M. PADLAND]277-bobby , [Proprietor]3643-proprietor . "[1381-dear auntie] What are [you]1382-you going to say to [him]1382-you ? " [James]316-james asked . [Soames]177-soames did not even turn [his]0-i head . "[1382-you] [I]0-i have n't made up [my]0-i mind , " [he]0-i said , and went on with [his]0-i defence . [A client of [his]0-i]3644-a client of his , having put [some buildings on a piece of ground that did not belong to [him]0-i]3645-some buildings on a piece of ground that did not belong to him , had been suddenly and most irritatingly warned to take them off again . After carefully going into the facts , however , [Soames]177-soames had seen [his]0-i way to advise that [[his]0-i client]3646-his client had what was known as a title by possession , and that , though undoubtedly the ground did not belong to [him]0-i , [he]0-i was entitled to keep it , and had better do so ; and [he]0-i was now following up this advice by taking steps to - as [the sailors]3647-the sailors say - ' make it so . ' [He]0-i had a distinct reputation for sound advice ; [people]600-people saying of [him]0-i : "[0-i] Go to [young Forsyte]303-euphemia - [a long - headed fellow]1383-a long - headed fellow ! " and [he]0-i prized this reputation highly . [His]0-i natural taciturnity was in [his]0-i favour ; nothing could be more calculated to give [people]600-people , especially people with property [Soames]177-soames had [no other clients]3650-no other clients , the impression that [he]0-i was [a safe man]3651-a safe man . And [he]0-i was safe . Tradition , habit , education , inherited aptitude , native caution , all joined to form a solid professional honesty , superior to temptation - from the very fact that it was built on an innate avoidance of risk . How could [he]0-i fall , when [his]0-i soul abhorred circumstances which render a fall possible - [a man]515-a man can not fall off the floor ! And [those countless Forsytes , who , in the course of innumerable transactions concerned with property of all sorts from wives to water rights]3653-those countless forsytes , who , in the course of innumerable transactions concerned with property of all sorts from wives to water rights , had occasion for the services of [a safe man]3651-a safe man , found it both reposeful and profitable to confide in [Soames]177-soames . That slight superciliousness of [his]0-i , combined with an air of mousing amongst precedents , was in [his]0-i favour too - [a man]515-a man would not be supercilious unless [he]515-a man knew ! [He]0-i was really at the head of the business , for though [James]316-james still came nearly every day to , see for [himself]316-james , [he]316-james did little now but sit in [his]316-james chair , twist [his]316-james legs , slightly confuse things already decided , and presently go away again , and [the other partner]3656-the other partner , [Bustard]242-bustard , was a poor thing , who did a great deal of work , but whose opinion was never taken . [So Soames]177-soames went steadily on with [his]0-i defence . Yet it would be idle to say that [his]0-i mind was at ease . [He]0-i was suffering from a sense of impending trouble , that had haunted [him]0-i for some time past . [He]0-i tried to think it physical - a condition of [his]0-i liver - but knew that it was not . [He]0-i looked at [his]0-i watch . In a quarter of an hour [he]0-i was due at [the General Meeting of [the New Colliery Company]2601-the new colliery company]3657-the general meeting of the new colliery company - one of [Uncle Jolyon]271-old jolyon 's concerns ; [he]0-i should see [Uncle Jolyon]271-old jolyon [there]454-there , and say something to [him]271-old jolyon about [Bosinney]316-james - [he]0-i had not made up [his]0-i mind what , but something - in any case [he]0-i should not answer this letter until [he]0-i had seen [Uncle Jolyon]271-old jolyon . [He]0-i got up and methodically put away the draft of [his]0-i defence . Going into a dark little cupboard , [he]0-i turned up the light , washed [his]0-i hands with a piece of brown Windsor soap , and dried them on a roller towel . Then [he]0-i brushed [his]0-i hair , paying strict attention to the parting , turned down the light , took [his]0-i hat , and saying [he]0-i would be back at half - past two , stepped into [the Poultry]3660-the poultry . [It]3661-it was not far to [the Offices of [the New Colliery Company]2601-the new colliery company in [Ironmonger Lane]89-ironmonger lane]3662-the offices of the new colliery company in ironmonger lane , where , and not at [the Cannon Street Hotel]3664-the cannon street hotel , in accordance with the more ambitious practice of [other companies]3665-other companies , the General Meeting was always held . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon had from the first set [his]163-old jolyon face against the Press . What business - [he]0-i said - had [the Public]3666-the public with [his]0-i concerns ! [Soames]177-soames arrived on the stroke of time , and took [his]0-i seat alongside [the Board]3667-the board , who , in a row , [each Director behind [his]0-i own ink - pot]3668-each director behind his own ink - pot , faced [[their]3667-the board Shareholders]3669-their shareholders . In the centre of this row [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon , conspicuous in [his]163-old jolyon black , tightly - buttoned frock - coat and [his]163-old jolyon white moustaches , was leaning back with finger tips crossed on a copy of [the Directors]3670-the directors ' report and accounts . On [his]163-old jolyon right hand , always a little larger than life , sat [the Secretary]3671-the secretary , ' Down - by - [the - starn ' Hemmings]323-hemmings ; an all - too - sad sadness beaming in [his]163-old jolyon fine eyes ; [his]163-old jolyon iron - grey beard , in mourning like the rest of [him]163-old jolyon , giving the feeling of an all - too - black tie behind it . The occasion indeed was a melancholy one , only six weeks having elapsed since that telegram had come from [Scorrier]322-scorrier , [the mining expert]3672-the mining expert , on a private mission to [the Mines]3673-the mines , informing [them]3667-the board that [Pippin]225-pippin , [[their]3667-the board Superintendent]3674-their superintendent , had committed suicide in endeavouring , after [his]225-pippin extraordinary two years ' silence , to write a letter to [[his]225-pippin Board]3675-his board . That letter was on the table now ; it would be read to [the Shareholders , who would of course be put into possession of all the facts]3676-the shareholders , who would of course be put into possession of all the facts . [Hemmings]323-hemmings had often said to [Soames]177-soames , standing with [his]0-i coat - tails divided before the fireplace : "[1383-a long - headed fellow] What [[our]1384-our Shareholders]1385-our shareholders do n't know about [our]1384-our affairs is n't worth knowing . [You]1386-you may take that from [me]0-i , [Mr. Soames]171-soames . " On one occasion , [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon being present , [Soames]171-soames recollected a little unpleasantness . [[His]171-soames uncle]3677-his uncle had looked up sharply and said : "[171-soames] Do n't talk nonsense , [Hemmings]323-hemmings ! [You]323-hemmings mean that what [they]1385-our shareholders do know is n't worth knowing ! " [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon detested [humbug]324-humbug . [Soames]171-soames always attended the General Meeting ; it was considered better that [he]171-soames should do so , in case ' anything should arise ! This photograph - a witness to the eternal irony underlying commercial enterprise till retained its position on the - wall , an effigy of [the directors]3670-the directors ' pet , but dead , lamb . And now [old Jolyon]271-old jolyon rose , to present the report and accounts . Veiling under a Jove - like serenity that perpetual antagonism deep - seated in the bosom of [a director]583-a director towards [[his]171-soames shareholders]3690-his shareholders , [he]171-soames faced [them]3690-his shareholders calmly . "[1421-you] Can [I]0-i speak to [you]0-i for a minute , [Uncle Jolyon]271-old jolyon ? " It is uncertain what [Soames]171-soames expected to get out of this interview . Apart from that somewhat mysterious awe in which [Forsytes]164-soames in general held [old Jolyon]271-old jolyon , due to [his]271-old jolyon philosophic twist , or perhaps - as [Hemmings]323-hemmings would doubtless have said - to [his]271-old jolyon chin , there was , and always had been , a subtle antagonism between [the younger man]3752-the younger man and [the old]3753-the old . Both [these Forsytes]658-these forsytes , wide asunder as the poles in many respects , possessed in [their]3754-their different ways - to a greater degree than [the rest of [the family]450-the family]3758-the rest of the family - that essential quality of tenacious and prudent insight into ' affairs , ' which is the highwater mark of [[their]3754-their great class]3760-their great class . [Either of [them]3754-their]3761-either of them , with a little luck and opportunity , was equal to a lofty career ; [either of [them]3754-their]3761-either of them would have made [a good financier]3763-a good financier , [a great contractor]3764-a great contractor , [a statesman]3765-a statesman , though [old Jolyon]271-old jolyon , in certain of [his]271-old jolyon moods when under the influence of a cigar or of Nature - would have been capable of , not perhaps despising , but certainly of questioning , [his]271-old jolyon own high position , while [Soames]164-soames , who never smoked cigars , would not . And last , not least - for [he]271-old jolyon was no more outside the radiation of family gossip than [any other Forsyte]3768-any other forsyte - [he]271-old jolyon had now heard the sinister , indefinite , but none the less disturbing rumour about [Bosinney]316-james , and [his]271-old jolyon pride was wounded to the quick . Characteristically , [his]271-old jolyon irritation turned not against [Irene]186-irene but against [Soames]164-soames . The idea that [[[his]271-old jolyon nephew]3769-his nephew 's wife]3770-his nephew 's wife why could n't [the fellow]2355-the fellow take better care of [her]186-irene - Oh ! quaint injustice ! as though [Soames]164-soames could possibly take more care ! - should be drawing to [herself]186-irene [[June]166-june 's lover]3772-june 's lover , was intolerably humiliating . And seeing the danger , [he]271-old jolyon did not , like [James]316-james , hide it away in sheer nervousness , but owned with the dispassion of [his]271-old jolyon broader outlook , that it was not unlikely ; there was something very attractive about [Irene]186-irene ! [He]271-old jolyon had a presentiment on the subject of [Soames]164-soames ' communication as [they]3773-they left [the Board Room]3774-the board room together , and went out into the noise and hurry of [Cheapside]59-cheapside . Then [Soames]164-soames , without lifting [his]164-soames eyes , began : "[271-old jolyon] [I]0-i 've had this letter from [Bosinney]316-james . " "[0-i] No , " said [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon abruptly ; "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll have nothing to do with it ! " The words of [both uncle]3777-both uncle and [nephew]3778-nephew gave the impression of unspoken meanings , far more important , behind .
