"[0-i] Well , " said [Soames]164-soames ; "[0-i] [I]0-i thought , for [June]166-june 's sake , [I]0-i 'd tell [you]1429-you , that 's all ; [I]0-i thought [you]1429-you 'd better know [I]0-i sha n't stand any nonsense ! " "[0-i] What is that to [me]0-i ? " [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon took [him]0-i up . "[0-i] Oh ! [I]0-i do n't know , " said [Soames]164-soames , and flurried by that sharp look [he]0-i was unable to say more . "[0-i] Do n't say [I]0-i did n't tell [you]1429-you , " [he]0-i added sulkily , recovering [his]0-i composure . "[0-i] Tell [me]0-i ! " said [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon ; "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know what [you]1429-you mean . [You]1429-you come worrying [me]0-i about a thing like this . [I]0-i do n't want to hear about [your]1429-you affairs ; [you]1429-you must manage them [yourself]1429-you ! " "[1429-you] Very well , " said [Soames]164-soames immovably , "[0-i] [I]0-i will ! " "[0-i] Good - morning , then , " said [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon , and [they]3780-they parted . [Soames]164-soames retraced [his]164-soames steps , and going into [a celebrated eating - house]3781-a celebrated eating - house , asked for a plate of smoked salmon and a glass of Chablis ; [he]164-soames seldom ate much in the middle of the day , and generally ate standing , finding the position beneficial to [his]164-soames liver , which was very sound , but to which [he]164-soames desired to put down all [his]164-soames troubles . When [he]164-soames had finished [he]164-soames went slowly back to [[his]164-soames office]3135-his office , with bent head , taking no notice of [the swarming thousands on the pavements]3783-the swarming thousands on the pavements , who in [their]3783-the swarming thousands on the pavements turn took no notice of [him]164-soames . The evening post carried the following reply to [Bosinney]316-james : ' [FORSYTE]166-june , [BUSTARD]242-bustard AND [FORSYTE]166-june , ' [Commissioners for Oaths]3784-commissioners for oaths , ' 92001 , [BRANCH LANE]92-branch lane , [POULTRY]331-poultry , E.C. , ' May 17 , 1887 . ' [DEAR BOSINNEY]316-james , ' [I]0-i have , received [your]316-james letter , the terms of which not a little surprise [me]0-i . [I]0-i was under the impression that [you]316-james had , and have had all along , a "[0-i] free hand " ; for [I]0-i do not recollect that any suggestions [I]0-i have been so unfortunate as to make have met with [your]316-james approval . In giving [you]316-james , in accordance with [your]316-james request , this "[0-i] free hand , " [I]0-i wish [you]316-james to clearly understand that the total cost of [the house]2326-the house as handed over to [me]0-i completely decorated , inclusive of [your]316-james fee as arranged between [us]3786-us , must not exceed twelve thousand pounds - L12,000 . This gives [you]316-james an ample margin , and , as [you]316-james know , is far more than [I]0-i originally contemplated . ' [I]0-i am , ' [Yours]316-james truly , ' [SOAMES FORSYTE]166-june . ' On the following day [he]0-i received a note from [Bosinney]316-james : ' [PHILIP BAYNES BOSINNEY]316-james , ' Architect , ' 309D , [SLOANE STREET]56-sloane street , [S.W.]93-s.w. , ' May 18 . ' [DEAR FORSYTE]166-june , ' If [you]316-james think that in such a delicate matter as decoration [I]0-i can bind [myself]0-i to the exact pound , [I]0-i am afraid [you]316-james are mistaken . [I]0-i can see that [you]316-james are tired of the arrangement , and of [me]0-i , and [I]0-i had better , therefore , resign . ' [Yours]316-james faithfully , ' [PHILIP BAYNES BOSINNEY]316-james . ' [Soames]164-soames pondered long and painfully over [his]0-i answer , and late at night in [the dining - room]2449-the dining - room , when [Irene]186-irene had gone to bed , [he]164-soames composed the following : ' 62 , [MONTPELLIER SQUARE]8-montpellier square , [S.W.]93-s.w. , ' May 19 , 1887 . ' [DEAR BOSINNEY]316-james , ' [I]0-i think that in both [our]3788-our interests it would be extremely undesirable that matters should be so left at this stage . [I]0-i did not mean to say that if [you]316-james should exceed the sum named in [my]0-i letter to [you]316-james by ten or twenty or even fifty pounds , there would be any difficulty between [us]3788-our . This being so , [I]0-i should like [you]316-james to reconsider [your]316-james answer . [You]316-james have a "[0-i] free hand " in the terms of this correspondence , and [I]0-i hope [you]316-james will see [your]316-james way to completing the decorations , in the matter of which [I]0-i know it is difficult to be absolutely exact . ' [Yours]316-james truly , ' [SOAMES FORSYTE]166-june . ' [Bosinney]316-james 's answer , which came in the course of the next day , was : ' May 20 . ' [DEAR FORSYTE]166-june , ' Very well . ' [PH . BOSINNEY]332-bosinney . ' [CHAPTER VI]94-chapter vi - [OLD JOLYON]163-old jolyon AT [THE ZOO]539-the zoo [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon disposed of [his]163-old jolyon second Meeting - an ordinary Board - summarily . [He]163-old jolyon was so dictatorial that [[his]163-old jolyon fellow directors]3790-his fellow directors were left in cabal over the increasing domineeringness of [old Forsyte]166-june , which [they]3790-his fellow directors were far from intending to stand much longer , [they]3790-his fellow directors said . [He]163-old jolyon went out by [Underground]95-underground to [Portland Road Station]96-portland road station , whence [he]163-old jolyon took [a cab]2536-a cab and drove to [the Zoo]539-the zoo . [He]163-old jolyon had an assignation there , one of those assignations that had lately been growing more frequent , to which [his]163-old jolyon increasing uneasiness about [June]166-june and the ' change in [her]166-june , ' as [he]163-old jolyon expressed it , was driving [him]163-old jolyon . [She]166-june buried [herself]166-june away , and was growing thin ; if [he]163-old jolyon spoke to [her]166-june [he]163-old jolyon got no answer , or had [his]163-old jolyon head snapped off , or [she]166-june looked as if [she]166-june would burst into tears . [She]166-june was as changed as [she]166-june could be , all through this [Bosinney]316-james . As for telling [him]163-old jolyon about anything , not a bit of it ! And [he]163-old jolyon would sit for long spells brooding , [his]163-old jolyon paper unread before [him]163-old jolyon , a cigar extinct between [his]163-old jolyon lips . [She]166-june had been such [a companion to [him]163-old jolyon]3793-a companion to him ever since [she]166-june was three years old ! And [he]163-old jolyon loved [her]166-june so ! Forces regardless of [family]528-family or class or custom were beating down [his]163-old jolyon guard ; impending events over which [he]163-old jolyon had no control threw their shadows on [his]163-old jolyon head . The irritation of [one accustomed to have]3795-one accustomed to have [his]163-old jolyon way was roused against [he]163-old jolyon knew not what . Chafing at the slowness of [his]163-old jolyon cab , [he]163-old jolyon reached the Zoo door ; but , with [his]163-old jolyon sunny instinct for seizing the good of each moment , [he]163-old jolyon forgot [his]163-old jolyon vexation as [he]163-old jolyon walked towards the tryst . From the stone terrace above [the bear - pit]3796-the bear - pit [[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son and [[his]163-old jolyon two grandchildren]3010-his two grandchildren came hastening down when [they]3799-they saw [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon coming , and led [him]163-old jolyon away towards [the lion - house]3800-the lion - house . [They]3799-they supported [him]163-old jolyon on either side , holding one to each of [his]163-old jolyon hands , - whilst [Jolly]218-jolly , perverse like [[his]218-jolly father]559-his father , carried [[his]218-jolly grandfather]3802-his grandfather 's umbrella in such a way as to catch [people]600-people 's legs with the crutch of the handle . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon followed . It was as good as a play to see [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father with [the children]3054-the children , but such a play as brings smiles with tears behind . [An old man]2353-an old man and [two small children walking together]3807-two small children walking together can be seen at any hour of the day ; but the sight of [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon , with [Jolly]218-jolly and [Holly]220-holly seemed to [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon a special peep - show of the things that lie at the bottom of [our]3808-they hearts . The complete surrender of [that erect old figure to those little figures on either hand]3809-that erect old figure to those little figures on either hand was too poignantly tender , and , being [a man of an habitual reflex action]3810-a man of an habitual reflex action , [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon swore softly under [his]167-young jolyon breath . The show affected [him]167-young jolyon in a way unbecoming to [a Forsyte , who is nothing if not undemonstrative]3811-a forsyte , who is nothing if not undemonstrative . Thus [they]3808-they reached [the lion - house]3800-the lion - house . There had been a morning fete at [the Botanical Gardens]3813-the botanical gardens , and a large number of [Forsy ...]3814-forsy ... ' - that is , of [well - dressed people who kept carriages]3815-well - dressed people who kept carriages had brought [them]3814-forsy ... on to [the Zoo]539-the zoo , so as to have more , if possible , for [their]3814-forsy ... money , before going back to [Rutland Gate]97-rutland gate or [Bryanston Square]98-bryanston square . "[0-i] Let 's go on to [the Zoo]539-the zoo , " [they]3808-they had said to [each other]2556-each other ; "[0-i] it 'll be great fun ! " It was a shilling day ; and there would not be [all those horrid common people]3818-all those horrid common people . In front of the long line of [cages]3819-cages [they]3808-they were collected in rows , watching the tawny , ravenous beasts behind the bars await [their]3814-forsy ... only pleasure of the four - and - twenty hours . The hungrier the beast , the greater the fascination . But whether because [the spectators]3820-the spectators envied [his]1432-his appetite , or , more humanely , because it was so soon to be satisfied , [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon could not tell . Remarks kept falling on [his]167-young jolyon ears : "[0-i] That 's a nasty - looking brute , that tiger ! " "[0-i] Oh , what a love ! Look at [his]1432-his little mouth ! " "[1432-his] Yes , [he]1432-his 's rather nice ! Do n't go too near , [mother]1433-mother . " And frequently , with little pats , [one or another]3821-one or another would clap [their]3821-one or another hands to [their]3821-one or another pockets behind and look round , as though expecting [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon or [some disinterested - looking person]3822-some disinterested - looking person to relieve [them]3821-one or another of the contents . [A well - fed man in a white waistcoat]3823-a well - fed man in a white waistcoat said slowly through [his]3823-a well - fed man in a white waistcoat teeth : "[1433-mother] It 's all greed ; [they]1434-they ca n't be hungry . Why , [they]1434-they take no exercise . " At these words [a tiger]3824-a tiger snatched a piece of bleeding liver , and [the fat man]3825-the fat man laughed . [[His]3823-a well - fed man in a white waistcoat wife]558-his wife , in a [Paris]99-paris [model frock and gold nose - nippers]3827-model frock and gold nose - nippers , reproved [him]3823-a well - fed man in a white waistcoat : "[1434-they] How can [you]1435-you laugh , [Harry]333-harry ? Such a horrid sight ! " [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon frowned . The circumstances of [his]167-young jolyon life , though [he]167-young jolyon had ceased to take a too personal view of [them]1434-they , had left [him]167-young jolyon subject to an intermittent contempt ; and the class to which [he]167-young jolyon had belonged - [the carriage class]3828-the carriage class - especially excited [his]167-young jolyon sarcasm . To shut up a lion or tiger in confinement was surely a horrible barbarity . But [no cultivated person]3829-no cultivated person would admit this . The idea of its being barbarous to confine wild animals had probably never even occurred to [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father for instance ; [he]167-young jolyon belonged to [the old school , who considered it at once humanizing and educational to confine baboons and panthers , holding the view]3831-the old school , who considered it at once humanizing and educational to confine baboons and panthers , holding the view , no doubt , that in course of time [they]1434-they might induce these creatures not so unreasonably to die of misery and heart - sickness against the bars of [their]1434-they cages , and put the society to the expense of getting [others]1283-others ! In [his]167-young jolyon eyes , as in the eyes of [all Forsytes]611-all forsytes , the pleasure of seeing these beautiful creatures in a state of captivity far outweighed the inconvenience of imprisonment to beasts whom [God]304-god had so improvidently placed in a state of freedom ! It was for the animals good , removing [them]1434-they at once from the countless dangers of open air and exercise , and enabling [them]1434-they to exercise [their]1434-they functions in the guaranteed seclusion of [a private compartment]3834-a private compartment ! Indeed , it was doubtful what wild animals were made for but to be shut up in [cages]3819-cages ! But as [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon had in [his]167-young jolyon constitution the elements of impartiality , [he]167-young jolyon reflected that to stigmatize as barbarity that which was merely lack of imagination must be wrong ; for [none who held these views]3836-none who held these views had been placed in a similar position to the animals [they]3836-none who held these views caged , and could not , therefore , be expected to enter into [their]3836-none who held these views sensations . It was not until [they]3836-none who held these views were leaving [the gardens]3837-the gardens - [Jolly]218-jolly and [Holly]220-holly in a state of blissful delirium - that [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon found an opportunity of speaking to [[his]0-i son]2441-his son on the matter next [his]0-i heart . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know what to make of it , " [he]0-i said ; "[0-i] if [she]1436-she 's to go on as [she]1436-she 's going on now , [I]0-i ca n't tell what 's to come . [I]0-i wanted [her]1436-she to see [the doctor]2295-the doctor , but [she]1436-she wo n't . [She]1436-she 's not a bit like [me]0-i . " [He]163-old jolyon dropped the subject . It was impossible to discuss with [[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son the true nature and meaning of [Bosinney]332-bosinney 's defection . Had not [[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son done the very same thing worse , if possible fifteen years ago ? There seemed no end to the consequences of that piece of folly . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon also was silent ; [he]167-young jolyon had quickly penetrated [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father 's thought , for , dethroned from the high seat of an obvious and uncomplicated view of things , [he]167-young jolyon had become both perceptive and subtle . The attitude [he]167-young jolyon had adopted towards sexual matters fifteen years before , however , was too different from [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father 's . " "[1444-they] Then , it 's probably true , " remarked [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon unexpectedly ; "[1444-they] and [I]0-i suppose [they]1444-they 've told [you]0-i who [she]1443-some other woman is ? " [They]3851-their stood at a corner to see if [an empty cab]3852-an empty cab would come along , while [carriage after carriage]3853-carriage after carriage drove past , bearing Forsytes of all descriptions from [the Zoo]539-the zoo . The harness , the liveries , the gloss on the horses ' coats , shone and glittered in the May sunlight , and each equipage , landau , sociable , barouche , [Victoria]334-victoria , or brougham , seemed to roll out proudly from its wheels : ' [I]241-james and [[my]241-james horses]3855-my horses and [[my]241-james men]3856-my men [you]190-jo know , ' Indeed the whole turn - out have cost a pot . But [we]3851-their were worth it every penny . Look At [Master]3857-master and at [Missis]335-missis now , [the dawgs]3858-the dawgs ! Ease with security - ah ! that 's the ticket ! And such , as [everyone]3678-everyone knows , is fit accompaniment for [a perambulating Forsyte]3860-a perambulating forsyte . Amongst [these carriages]3861-these carriages was [a barouche]3862-a barouche coming at a greater pace than the others , drawn by a pair of bright bay horses . It swung on its high springs , and [the four people who filled it]3863-the four people who filled it seemed rocked as in a cradle . [This chariot]3864-this chariot attracted [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's attention ; and suddenly , on the back seat , [he]167-young jolyon recognised [[his]167-young jolyon Uncle]3677-his uncle [James]316-james , unmistakable in spite of the increased whiteness of [his]316-james whiskers ; opposite , [their]3851-their backs defended by sunshades , [Rachel Forsyte]261-rachel and [[her]261-rachel elder but married sister]3866-her elder but married sister , [Winifred Dartie]187-dartie , in irreproachable toilettes , had posed [their]3851-their heads haughtily , like two of the birds [they]3851-their had been seeing at [the Zoo]539-the zoo ; while by [James]316-james ' side reclined [Dartie]187-dartie , in a brand - new frock - coat buttoned tight and square , with a large expanse of carefully shot linen protruding below each wristband . An extra , if subdued , sparkle , an added touch of the best gloss or varnish characterized [this vehicle]3868-this vehicle , and seemed to distinguish it from all the others , as though by some happy extravagance - like that which marks out the real ' work of art ' from the ordinary ' picture ' - it were designated as [the typical car]3869-the typical car , the very throne of [Forsytedom]100-forsytedom . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon did not see [them]3851-their pass ; [he]167-young jolyon was petting poor Holly who was tired , but those in [the carriage]2416-the carriage had taken in [the little group]3871-the little group ; [the ladies]828-the ladies ' heads tilted suddenly , there was a spasmodic screening movement of parasols ; [James]316-james ' face protruded naively , like the head of a long bird , [his]316-james mouth slowly opening . The shield - like rounds of the parasols grew smaller and smaller , and vanished . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon saw that [he]167-young jolyon had been recognised , even by [Winifred]187-dartie , who could not have been more than fifteen when [he]187-dartie had forfeited the right to be considered [a Forsyte]261-rachel . There was not much change in [them]3851-their ! [He]167-young jolyon remembered the exact look of [their]3851-their turn - out all that time ago : [Horses]3873-horses , [men]550-men , [carriage]3875-carriage - all different now , no doubt - but of the precise stamp of fifteen years before ; the same neat display , the same nicely calculated arrogance ease with security ! The swing exact , the pose of the sunshades exact , exact the spirit of the whole thing . And in the sunlight , defended by the haughty shields of parasols , [carriage after carriage]3853-carriage after carriage went by . CHAPTER VII - AFTERNOON AT [TIMOTHY]170-timothy 'S If [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon , as [he]167-young jolyon got into [[his]167-young jolyon cab]2992-his cab , had said : ' [I]0-i wo n't believe a word of it ! ' [he]167-young jolyon would more truthfully have expressed [his]167-young jolyon sentiments . The notion that [James]316-james and [[his]316-james womankind]3882-his womankind had seen [him]167-young jolyon in the company of [[his]316-james son]2441-his son had awakened in [him]167-young jolyon not only the impatience [he]167-young jolyon always felt when crossed , but that secret hostility natural between [brothers]3884-brothers , the roots of which - little nursery rivalries - sometimes toughen and deepen as life goes on , and , all hidden , support a plant capable of producing in season the bitterest fruits . Hitherto there had been between [these six brothers]3885-these six brothers no more unfriendly feeling than that caused by the secret and natural doubt that [the others]2691-the others might be richer than [themselves]3885-these six brothers ; a feeling increased to the pitch of curiosity by the approach of death - that end of all handicaps - and the great ' closeness ' of [[their]3885-these six brothers man]3887-their man of business , who , with some sagacity , would profess to [Nicholas]206-nicholas treffry ignorance of [James]316-james ' income , to [James]316-james ignorance of [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's , to [Jolyon]167-young jolyon ignorance of [Roger]317-roger 's , to [Roger]317-roger ignorance of Swithin 's , while to [Swithin]233-swithin [he]233-swithin would say most irritatingly that [Nicholas]206-nicholas treffry must be [a rich man]1036-a rich man . [Timothy]170-timothy alone was exempt , being in gilt - edged securities . But now , between two of [them]3885-these six brothers at least , had arisen a very different sense of injury . From the moment when [James]316-james had the impertinence to pry into [his]316-james affairs - as [he]316-james put it - [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon no longer chose to credit this story about [Bosinney]316-james . [[His]167-young jolyon grand - daughter]3889-his grand - daughter slighted through [a member of ' [that fellow]3516-that fellow 's ' family]3890-a member of ' that fellow 's ' family ! [He]167-young jolyon made up [his]167-young jolyon mind that [Bosinney]316-james was maligned . There must be some other reason for [his]167-young jolyon defection . [June]166-june had flown out at [him]167-young jolyon , or something ; [she]166-june was as touchy as [she]166-june could be ! [He]167-young jolyon would , however , let [Timothy]170-timothy have a bit of [his]167-young jolyon mind , and see if [he]167-young jolyon would go on dropping hints ! And [he]167-young jolyon would not let the grass grow under [his]167-young jolyon feet either , [he]167-young jolyon would go [there]454-there at once , and take very good care that [he]167-young jolyon did n't have to go again on the same errand . [He]167-young jolyon saw [[James]316-james ' carriage]3893-james ' carriage blocking the pavement in front of ' [The Bower]1099-the bower . ' So [they]3895-they had got there before [him]167-young jolyon - cackling about having seen [him]167-young jolyon , [he]167-young jolyon dared say ! And further on , [[Swithin]233-swithin 's greys]3896-swithin 's greys were turning [their]3896-swithin 's greys noses towards the noses of [[James]316-james ' bays]3897-james ' bays , as though in conclave over [the family]450-the family , while [[their]3896-swithin 's greys coachmen]3899-their coachmen were in conclave above . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon , depositing [his]163-old jolyon hat on the chair in [the narrow hall]3900-the narrow hall , where that hat of [Bosinney]316-james 's had so long ago been mistaken for a cat , passed [his]163-old jolyon thin hand grimly over [his]163-old jolyon face with its great drooping white moustaches , as though to remove all traces of expression , and made [his]163-old jolyon way [upstairs]2967-upstairs . [He]163-old jolyon found [the front drawing - room]3902-the front drawing - room full . [It]3902-the front drawing - room was full enough at the best of times - without [visitors]2792-visitors - without [any one]2838-any one in [it]3902-the front drawing - room - for [Timothy]170-timothy and [[his]170-timothy sisters]3905-his sisters , following the tradition of [[their]3896-swithin 's greys generation]3906-their generation , considered that [a room]3907-a room was not quite ' nice ' unless [it]3907-a room was ' properly ' furnished . It held , therefore , eleven chairs , a sofa , three tables , two cabinets , innumerable knicknacks , and part of a large grand piano . And now , occupied by [Mrs. Small]177-soames , [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester , by [Swithin]233-swithin , [James]316-james , [Rachel]261-rachel , [Winifred]187-dartie , [Euphemia]303-euphemia , who had come in again to return ' Passion and Paregoric ' which [she]181-aunt hester had read at lunch , and [her]181-aunt hester chum [Frances]317-roger , [[Roger]317-roger 's daughter]3908-roger 's daughter the musical Forsyte , [the one who composed songs]3909-the one who composed songs , there was only one chair left unoccupied , except , of course , the two that [nobody]2292-nobody ever sat on - and [the only standing room]3911-the only standing room was occupied by the cat , on whom [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon promptly stepped . In these days it was by no means unusual for [Timothy]170-timothy to have [so many visitors]3912-so many visitors . [The family]450-the family had always , one and all , had a real respect for [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann , and now that [she]169-aunt ann was gone , [they]450-the family were coming far more frequently to [The Bower]1099-the bower , and staying longer . [Swithin]233-swithin had been the first to arrive , and seated torpid in a red satin chair with a gilt back , [he]233-swithin gave every appearance of lasting [the others]2691-the others out . And symbolizing [Bosinney]316-james 's name ' [the big one]1135-the big one , ' with [his]233-swithin great stature and bulk , [his]233-swithin thick white hair , [his]233-swithin puffy immovable shaven face , [he]233-swithin looked more primeval than ever in [the highly upholstered room]3917-the highly upholstered room . [His]233-swithin conversation , as usual of late , had turned at once upon [Irene]186-irene , and [he]233-swithin had lost no time in giving [Aunts Juley]260-aunts juley and [Hester]181-aunt hester [his]233-swithin opinion with regard to this rumour [he]233-swithin heard was going about . No - as [he]233-swithin said - [she]186-irene might want a bit of flirtation - [a pretty woman]718-a pretty woman must have [her]718-a pretty woman fling ; but more than that [he]233-swithin did not believe . Nothing open ; [she]186-irene had too much good sense , too much proper appreciation of what was due to [her]186-irene position , and to [the family]450-the family ! No sc - , [he]233-swithin was going to say ' scandal ' but the very idea was so preposterous that [he]233-swithin waved [his]233-swithin hand as though to say - ' but let that pass ! ' Granted that [Swithin]233-swithin took [a bachelor]3920-a bachelor 's view of the situation - still what indeed was not due to [that family in which [so many]3922-so many had done so well for [themselves]3922-so many]3921-that family in which so many had done so well for themselves , had attained a certain position ? If [he]233-swithin had heard in dark , pessimistic moments the words ' yeomen ' and ' ve ry small beer ' used in connection with [his]233-swithin origin , did [he]233-swithin believe them ? No ! [he]233-swithin cherished , hugging it pathetically to [his]233-swithin bosom the secret theory that there was something distinguished somewhere in [his]233-swithin ancestry . "[0-i] Must be , " [he]233-swithin once said to [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon , before [the latter]2450-the latter went to the bad . "[0-i] Look at [us]1455-us , [we]1455-us 've got on ! There must be good blood in [us]1455-us somewhere . " [He]233-swithin had been fond of [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon : [the boy]2442-the boy had been in a good set at College , had known that [old ruffian [Sir [Charles Fiste]336-charles fiste 's sons]3926-sir charles fiste 's sons]3925-old ruffian sir charles fiste 's sons - [a pretty rascal one of [them]3925-old ruffian sir charles fiste 's sons]3927-a pretty rascal one of them had turned out , too ; and there was style about [him]233-swithin - it was a thousand pities [he]233-swithin had run off with [that half - foreign governess]3928-that half - foreign governess ! If [he]233-swithin must go off like that why could n't [he]233-swithin have chosen someone who would have done [them]3925-old ruffian sir charles fiste 's sons credit ! And what was [he]233-swithin now ? - an underwriter at [Lloyd]221-lloyd 's ; [they]3925-old ruffian sir charles fiste 's sons said [he]233-swithin even painted pictures - pictures ! [Damme]310-damme ! [he]233-swithin might have ended as [Sir Jolyon Forsyte]165-old jolyon , [Bart]338-bart . , with a seat in Parliament , and a place in [the country]2374-the country ! It was [Swithin]233-swithin who , following the impulse which sooner or later urges thereto [some member of [every great family]3931-every great family]3930-some member of every great family , went to [[the Heralds]3932-the heralds ' Office]3933-the heralds ' office , where [they]3925-old ruffian sir charles fiste 's sons assured [him]233-swithin that [he]233-swithin was undoubtedly of the same family as [the well - known Forsites]3934-the well - known forsites with an ' i , ' whose arms were ' three dexter buckles on a sable ground gules , ' hoping no doubt to get [him]233-swithin to take them up . [Swithin]233-swithin , however , did not do this , but having ascertained that the crest was a ' pheasant proper , ' and the motto ' For Forsite , ' [he]233-swithin had the pheasant proper placed upon [[his]233-swithin carriage]3242-his carriage and the buttons of [[his]233-swithin coachman]3523-his coachman , and both crest and motto on [his]233-swithin writing - paper . The arms [he]233-swithin hugged to [himself]233-swithin , partly because , not having paid for them , [he]233-swithin thought it would look ostentatious to put them on [his]233-swithin carriage , and [he]233-swithin hated ostentation , and partly because [he]233-swithin , like [any practical man all over [the country]2374-the country]3937-any practical man all over the country , had a secret dislike and contempt for things [he]233-swithin could not understand [he]233-swithin found it hard , as [anyone]879-anyone might , to swallow ' three dexter buckles on a sable ground gules . ' [He]233-swithin never forgot , however , [their]3940-their having told [him]233-swithin that if [he]233-swithin paid for [them]3940-their [he]233-swithin would be entitled to use them , and it strengthened [his]233-swithin conviction that [he]233-swithin was [a gentleman]1029-a gentleman . Imperceptibly [the rest of [the family]450-the family]3758-the rest of the family absorbed the ' pheasant proper , ' and [some]510-some , more serious than [others]1283-others , adopted the motto ; [old Jolyon]165-old jolyon , however , refused to use the latter , saying that it was humbug meaning nothing , so far as [he]165-old jolyon could see . Among [the older generation]3946-the older generation it was perhaps known at bottom from what great historical event [they]3946-the older generation derived [their]3946-the older generation crest ; and if pressed on the subject , sooner than tell a lie - [they]3946-the older generation did not like telling lies , having an impression that only [Frenchmen]339-frenchmen and [Russians]340-russians told [them]3946-the older generation - [they]3946-the older generation would confess hurriedly that [Swithin]233-swithin had got hold of it somehow . Among [the younger generation]497-the younger generation the matter was wrapped in a discretion proper . [They]497-the younger generation did not want to hurt the feelings of [[their]497-the younger generation elders]3948-their elders , nor to feel ridiculous [themselves]497-the younger generation ; [they]497-the younger generation simply used the crest .... "[0-i] No , " said [Swithin]233-swithin , "[1456-he] [he]1456-he had had an opportunity of seeing for [himself]1456-he , and what [he]1456-he should say was , that there was nothing in [her]1457-me manner to [that young Buccaneer]1458-that young buccaneer or [Bosinney]316-james or whatever [his]1456-he name was , different from [her]1457-me manner to [himself]1456-he ; in fact , [he]1456-he should rather say .... " But here the entrance of [Frances]317-roger and [Euphemia]303-euphemia put an unfortunate stop to the conversation , for this was not a subject which could be discussed before [young people]1002-young people . And though [Swithin]233-swithin was somewhat upset at being stopped like this on the point of saying something important , [he]233-swithin soon recovered [his]233-swithin affability . [He]233-swithin was rather fond of [Frances]317-roger - Francie , as [she]317-roger was called in [the family]450-the family . [She]317-roger was so smart , and [they]3951-they told [him]233-swithin [she]317-roger made a pretty little pot of pin - money by [her]317-roger songs ; [he]233-swithin called it very clever of [her]317-roger . [He]233-swithin rather prided [himself]233-swithin indeed on a liberal attitude towards [women]817-women , not seeing any reason why [they]817-women should n't paint pictures , or write tunes , or books even , for the matter of that , especially if [they]817-women could turn a useful penny by it ; not at all - kept [them]817-women out of mischief . It was not as if [they]817-women were [men]550-men ! ' [Little Francie]317-roger , ' as [she]317-roger was usually called with good - natured contempt , was [an important personage]3954-an important personage , if only as a standing illustration of the attitude of [Forsytes]164-soames towards the Arts . [She]317-roger was not really ' little , ' but rather tall , with dark hair for a Forsyte , which , together with a grey eye , gave [her]317-roger what was called ' a Celtic appearance . ' [She]317-roger wrote songs with titles like ' Breathing Sighs , ' or ' Kiss [me]1457-me , [Mother]1433-mother , ere [I]1457-me die , ' with a refrain like an anthem : ' Kiss [me]1457-me , [Mother]1433-mother , ere [I]1457-me die ; Kiss [me]1457-me - kiss [me]1457-me , [Mother]341-mother , ah ! Kiss , ah ! kiss [me]1457-me e - ere [I]1457-me - Kiss [me]1457-me , [Mother]1433-mother , ere [I]1457-me d - d - die ! ' [She]317-roger wrote the words to them [herself]317-roger , and other poems . In lighter moments [she]317-roger wrote waltzes , one of which , the ' Kensington Coil , ' was almost national to [Kensington]106-kensington , having a sweet dip in it . It was very original . Then there were [her]317-roger ' Songs for [Little People]3958-little people , ' at once educational and witty , especially ' [Gran'ma]343-gran'ma 's Porgie , ' and that ditty , almost prophetically imbued with the coming Imperial spirit , entitled ' Black [Him]3959-his In [His]3959-his Little Eye . ' [Any publisher]3960-any publisher would take these , and reviews like ' High Living , ' and the ' Ladies ' Genteel Guide ' went into raptures over : ' Another of [Miss Francie Forsyte]344-miss francie forsyte 's spirited ditties , sparkling and pathetic . [We]3961-they [ourselves]3961-they were moved to tears and laughter . [Miss Forsyte]344-miss francie forsyte should go far . ' With the true instinct of [her]317-roger breed , [Francie]344-miss francie forsyte had made a point of knowing [the right people]3962-the right people - people who would write about [her]344-miss francie forsyte , and talk about [her]344-miss francie forsyte , and [people in Society]3963-people in society , too - keeping a mental register of just where to exert [her]317-roger fascinations , and an eye on that steady scale of rising prices , which in [her]317-roger mind 's eye represented the future . In this way [she]317-roger caused [herself]317-roger to be universally respected . Once , at a time when [her]317-roger emotions were whipped by an attachment - for the tenor of [Roger]317-roger 's life , with its whole - hearted collection of [house property]3964-house property , had induced in [[his]3959-his only daughter]3965-his only daughter a tendency towards passion - [she]317-roger turned to great and sincere work , choosing the sonata form , for the violin . This was the only one of [her]317-roger productions that troubled [the Forsytes]164-soames . [They]3961-they felt at once that it would not sell . [Roger]317-roger , who liked having [a clever daughter]3966-a clever daughter well enough , and often alluded to the amount of pocket - money [she]317-roger made for [herself]317-roger , was upset by this violin sonata . "[1457-me] Rubbish like that ! " [he]3959-his called it . [Francie]317-roger had borrowed [young Flageoletti]244-young flageoletti from [Euphemia]303-euphemia , to play it in [the drawing - room at [Prince 's Gardens]101-prince 's gardens]3967-the drawing - room at prince 's gardens . As a matter of fact [Roger]317-roger was right . It was rubbish , but - annoying ! the sort of rubbish that would n't sell . As every [Forsyte]303-euphemia knows , rubbish that sells is not rubbish at all - far from it . And yet , in spite of the sound common sense which fixed the worth of art at what it would fetch , [some of [the Forsytes]164-soames]3968-some of the forsytes - [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester , for instance , who had always been musical - could not help regretting that [Francie]317-roger 's music was not ' classical ' ; the same with [her]317-roger poems . But then , as [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester said , [they]3961-they did n't see any poetry nowadays , all the poems were ' little light things . ' There was nobody who could write a poem like ' Paradise Lost , ' or ' [Childe Harold]333-harry ' ; either of which made [you]3969-you feel that [you]3969-you really had read something . Still , it was nice for [Francie]317-roger to have something to occupy [her]317-roger ; while [other girls]3970-other girls were spending money shopping [she]317-roger was making it ! And both [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester and [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley were always ready to listen to the latest story of how [Francie]317-roger had got [her]317-roger price increased . [They]3961-they listened now , together with [Swithin]233-swithin , who sat pretending not to , for [these young people]3971-these young people talked so fast and mumbled so , [he]233-swithin never could catch what [they]3971-these young people said . "[1457-me] And [I]0-i ca n't think , " said [Mrs. Septimus]177-soames , "[0-i] how [you]1459-you do it . [I]0-i should never have the audacity ! " [Francie]317-roger smiled lightly . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'd much rather deal with [a man]515-a man than [a woman]3436-a woman . [Women]817-women are so sharp ! It 's a pleasure to see [her]1466-her . " At this moment [James]316-james and [[his]316-james daughters]3978-his daughters were announced . [Dartie]187-dartie , feeling badly in want of a drink , had pleaded an appointment with [[his]187-dartie dentist]3979-his dentist , and , being put down at [the Marble Arch]76-the marble arch , had got into a hansom , and was already seated in the window of [[his]187-dartie club in [Piccadilly]67-piccadilly]3980-his club in piccadilly . [[His]187-dartie wife]558-his wife , [he]187-dartie told [[his]187-dartie cronies]3982-his cronies , had wanted to take [him]187-dartie to pay some calls . It was not in [his]187-dartie line - not exactly . Haw ! Hailing [the waiter]3983-the waiter , [he]187-dartie sent [him]3983-the waiter out to [the hall]2543-the hall to see what had won the 4.30 race . [He]187-dartie was dog - tired , [he]187-dartie said , and that was a fact ; had been drivin ' about with [[his]187-dartie wife]558-his wife to ' shows ' all the afternoon . Had put [his]187-dartie foot down at last . [A fellow]3986-a fellow must live [his]3986-a fellow own life . At this moment , glancing out of the bay window - for [he]187-dartie loved this seat whence [he]187-dartie could see [everybody]601-everybody pass - [his]187-dartie eye unfortunately , or perhaps fortunately , chanced to light on the figure of [Soames]177-soames , who was mousing across [the road]1291-the road from [the Green Park - side]3989-the green park - side , with the evident intention of coming in , for [he]187-dartie , too , belonged to ' [The Iseeum]345-the iseeum . ' [Dartie]187-dartie sprang to [his]187-dartie feet ; grasping [his]187-dartie glass , [he]187-dartie muttered something about ' that 4.30 race , ' and swiftly withdrew to [the card - room]3990-the card - room , where [Soames]177-soames never came . Here , in complete isolation and a dim light , [he]187-dartie lived [his]187-dartie own life till half past seven , by which hour [he]187-dartie knew [Soames]177-soames must certainly have left [the club]2302-the club . It would not do , as [he]187-dartie kept repeating to [himself]187-dartie whenever [he]187-dartie felt the impulse to join the gossips in the bay - window getting too strong for [him]187-dartie - it absolutely would not do , with finances as low as [his]187-dartie , and [the ' old man ' [James]316-james]3992-the ' old man ' james rusty ever since that business over the oil shares , which was no fault of [his]187-dartie , to risk a row with [Winifred]187-dartie . If [Soames]177-soames were to see [him]187-dartie in [the club]2302-the club it would be sure to come round to [her]177-soames that [he]187-dartie was n't at [the dentist]3994-the dentist 's at all . [He]187-dartie never knew [a family where things ' came round ' so]3995-a family where things ' came round ' so . Uneasily , amongst the green baize card - tables , a frown on [his]187-dartie olive coloured face , [his]187-dartie check trousers crossed , and patent - leather boots shining through the gloom , [he]187-dartie sat biting [his]187-dartie forefinger , and wondering where the deuce [he]187-dartie was to get the money if [Erotic]346-erotic failed to win the Lancashire Cup . [His]187-dartie thoughts turned gloomily to [the Forsytes]164-soames . What a set [they]3996-they were ! There was no getting anything out of [them]3996-they - at least , it was a matter of extreme difficulty . [They]3996-they were so d - -d particular about money matters ; not [a sportsman amongst the lot]3997-a sportsman amongst the lot , unless it were [George]291-george . That fellow [Soames]164-soames , for instance , would have a ft if [you]3998-you tried to borrow a tenner from [him]164-soames , or , if [he]164-soames did n't have a fit , [he]164-soames looked at [you]3998-you with [his]164-soames cursed supercilious smile , as if [you]3998-you were a lost soul because [you]3998-you were in want of money . And [that wife of [his]187-dartie [Dartie]187-dartie]3999-that wife of his dartie 's mouth watered involuntarily , [he]187-dartie had tried to be on good terms with [her]3999-that wife of his dartie , as one naturally would with [any pretty sister - in - law]4000-any pretty sister - in - law , but [he]187-dartie would be cursed if the [he]187-dartie mentally used a coarse word - would have anything to say to [him]187-dartie - [she]3999-that wife of his dartie looked at [him]187-dartie , indeed , as if [he]187-dartie were dirt - and yet [she]3999-that wife of his dartie could go far enough , [he]187-dartie would n't mind betting . [He]187-dartie knew [women]817-women ; [they]817-women were n't made with soft eyes and figures like that for nothing , as that fellow [Soames]164-soames would jolly soon find out , if there were anything in what [he]187-dartie had heard about [this Buccaneer Johnny]4002-this buccaneer johnny . Rising from [his]187-dartie chair , [Dartie]187-dartie took a turn across [the room]488-the room , ending in front of the looking - glass over the marble chimney - piece ; and there [he]187-dartie stood for a long time contemplating in the glass the reflection of [his]187-dartie face . It had that look , peculiar to [some men]4004-some men , of having been steeped in linseed oil , with its waxed dark moustaches and the little distinguished commencements of side whiskers ; and concernedly [he]187-dartie felt the promise of a pimple on the side of [his]187-dartie slightly curved and fattish nose . In the meantime [old Jolyon]165-old jolyon had found the remaining chair in [[Timothy]170-timothy 's commodious drawing - room]4005-timothy 's commodious drawing - room . [His]165-old jolyon advent had obviously put a stop to the conversation , decided awkwardness having set in . [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley , with [her]237-aunt juley well - known kindheartedness , hastened to set [people]600-people at [their]600-people ease again . "[1466-her] Yes , [Jolyon]165-old jolyon , " [she]237-aunt juley said , "[165-old jolyon] [we]1468-we were just saying that [you]165-old jolyon have n't been [here]735-here for a long time ; but [we]1468-we must n't be surprised . [You]165-old jolyon 're busy , of course ? [James]316-james was just saying what a busy time of year .... " "[316-james] Was [he]316-james ? " said [old Jolyon]165-old jolyon , looking hard at [James]316-james . "[316-james] It would n't be half so busy if [everybody]601-everybody minded [their]601-everybody own business . " [James]316-james , brooding in a small chair from which [his]316-james knees ran uphill , shifted [his]316-james feet uneasily , and put one of them down on the cat , which had unwisely taken refuge from [old Jolyon]165-old jolyon beside [him]316-james . "[316-james] Here , [you]165-old jolyon 've got a cat here , " [he]316-james said in an injured voice , withdrawing [his]316-james foot nervously as [he]316-james felt it squeezing into the soft , furry body . "[165-old jolyon] Several , " said [old Jolyon]165-old jolyon , looking at one face and another ; "[0-i] [I]0-i trod on one just now . " A silence followed . Then [Mrs. Small]177-soames , twisting [her]177-soames fingers and gazing round with ' pathetic calm ' , asked : "[0-i] And how is [dear June]166-june ? " A twinkle of humour shot through the sternness of [old Jolyon]165-old jolyon 's eyes . [Extraordinary old woman]4007-extraordinary old woman , [Juley]237-aunt juley ! [No one]514-no one quite like [her]166-june for saying the wrong thing ! "[166-june] Bad ! " [he]316-james said ; "[166-june] [London]2-london do n't agree with [her]166-june - [too many people]1471-too many people about , too much clatter and chatter by half . " [He]316-james laid emphasis on the words , and again looked [James]316-james in the face . [Nobody]2292-nobody spoke . A feeling of its being too dangerous to take a step in any direction , or hazard any remark , had fallen on [them]4010-them all . Something of the sense of the impending , that comes over the spectator of a Greek tragedy , had entered [that upholstered room]4011-that upholstered room , filled with [those white - haired , frock - coated old men]4012-those white - haired , frock - coated old men , and fashionably attired women , who were [all of the same blood]4013-all of the same blood , between [all of whom existed an unseizable resemblance]4014-all of whom existed an unseizable resemblance . Not that [they]4010-them were conscious of it - the visits of such fateful , bitter spirits are only felt . Then [Swithin]233-swithin rose . [He]233-swithin would not sit there , feeling like that - [he]233-swithin was not to be put down by [anyone]879-anyone ! And , manoeuvring round [the room]488-the room with added pomp , [he]233-swithin shook hands with [each separately]4017-each separately . "[1472-you] [You]1472-you tell [Timothy]170-timothy from [me]0-i , " [he]233-swithin said , "[1472-you] that [he]170-timothy coddles [himself]170-timothy too much ! " Then , turning to [Francie]317-roger , whom [he]233-swithin considered ' smart , ' [he]233-swithin added : "[1472-you] [You]1472-you come with [me]0-i for a drive one of these days . " But this conjured up the vision of that other eventful drive which had been so much talked about , and [he]233-swithin stood quite still for a second , with glassy eyes , as though waiting to catch up with the significance of what [he]233-swithin [himself]233-swithin had said ; then , suddenly recollecting that [he]233-swithin did n't care a damn , [he]233-swithin turned to [old Jolyon]165-old jolyon : "[1472-you] Well , good - bye , [Jolyon]165-old jolyon ! [You]1472-you should n't go about without an overcoat ; [you]1472-you 'll be getting sciatica or something ! " And , kicking the cat slightly with the pointed tip of [his]233-swithin patent leather boot , [he]233-swithin took [his]233-swithin huge form away . When [he]233-swithin had gone [everyone]3678-everyone looked secretly at [the others]2691-the others , to see how [they]2691-the others had taken the mention of the word ' drive ' - the word which had become famous , and acquired an overwhelming importance , as the only official - so to speak - news in connection with the vague and sinister rumour clinging to the family tongue . [Euphemia]303-euphemia , yielding to an impulse , said with a short laugh : "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm glad [Uncle Swithin]233-swithin does n't ask [me]0-i to go for drives . " [Mrs. Small]177-soames , to reassure [her]177-soames and smooth over any little awkwardness the subject might have , replied : "[233-swithin] [[My]0-i dear]2282-my dear , [he]233-swithin likes to take [somebody well dressed]1474-somebody well dressed , who will do [him]233-swithin a little credit . [I]0-i shall never forget the drive [he]233-swithin took [me]0-i . It was an experience ! " And [her]177-soames chubby round old face was spread for a moment with a strange contentment ; then broke into pouts , and tears came into [her]177-soames eyes . [She]177-soames was thinking of that long ago driving tour [she]177-soames had once taken with [Septimus Small]177-soames . [James]316-james , who had relapsed into [his]316-james nervous brooding in the little chair , suddenly roused [himself]316-james : "[233-swithin] [He]233-swithin 's [a funny fellow]1475-a funny fellow , [Swithin]233-swithin , " [he]316-james said , but in a half - hearted way . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon 's silence , [his]163-old jolyon stern eyes , held them all in a kind of paralysis . [He]163-old jolyon was disconcerted [himself]163-old jolyon by the effect of [his]163-old jolyon own words - an effect which seemed to deepen the importance of the very rumour [he]163-old jolyon had come to scotch ; but [he]163-old jolyon was still angry . [He]163-old jolyon had not done with [them]4020-them yet - No , no - [he]163-old jolyon would give [them]4020-them another rub or two . [He]163-old jolyon did not wish to rub [[his]163-old jolyon nieces]4021-his nieces , [he]163-old jolyon had no quarrel with [them]4021-his nieces - [a young and presentable female]4022-a young and presentable female always appealed to [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon 's clemency - but [that fellow [James]316-james]4023-that fellow james , and , in a less degree perhaps , [those others]4024-those others , deserved all [they]4020-them would get . And [he]163-old jolyon , too , asked for [Timothy]170-timothy . As though feeling that some danger threatened [[her]1478-her younger brother]4025-her younger brother , [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley suddenly offered [him]1476-you tea : "[233-swithin] There it is , " [she]237-aunt juley said , "[233-swithin] all cold and nasty , waiting for [you]1476-you in [the back drawing room]1477-the back drawing room , but [Smither]259-smither shall make [you]1476-you some fresh . " [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon rose : "[259-smither] Thank [you]1478-her , " [he]0-i said , looking straight at [James]316-james , "[1478-her] but [I]0-i 've no time for tea , and - scandal , and the rest of it ! It 's time [I]0-i was at [home]436-home . Good - bye , [Julia]176-juley ; good - bye , [Hester]181-aunt hester ; good - bye , [Winifred]187-dartie . " Without more ceremonious adieux , [he]0-i marched out . Once again in [[his]0-i cab]2992-his cab , [his]0-i anger evaporated , for so it ever was with [his]0-i wrath - when [he]0-i had rapped out , it was gone . Sadness came over [his]0-i spirit . [He]0-i had stopped [their]4027-their mouths , maybe , but at what a cost ! At the cost of certain knowledge that the rumour [he]0-i had been resolved not to believe was true . [June]166-june was abandoned , and for [the wife of [that fellow]3516-that fellow 's son]4028-the wife of that fellow 's son ! [He]0-i felt it was true , and hardened [himself]0-i to treat it as if it were not ; but the pain [he]0-i hid beneath this resolution began slowly , surely , to vent itself in a blind resentment against [James]316-james and [[his]316-james son]2441-his son . [The six women]4031-the six women and [one man left behind]4032-one man left behind in [the little drawing - room]4033-the little drawing - room began talking as easily as might be after such an occurrence , for though [each one of [them]4031-the six women]4034-each one of them knew for a fact that [he]4035-he or [she]4036-she never talked scandal , [each one of [them]4031-the six women]4034-each one of them also knew that [the other six]4038-the other six did ; [all]592-all were therefore angry and at a loss . [James]316-james only was silent , disturbed , to the bottom of [his]316-james soul . [Presently Francie]347-presently francie said : "[187-dartie] Do [you]1480-you know , [I]0-i think [Uncle Jolyon]271-old jolyon is terribly changed this last year . What do [you]1480-you think , [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester ? " [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester made a little movement of recoil : "[1480-you] Oh , ask [[your]1480-you Aunt [Julia]176-juley]1481-your aunt julia ! " [she]181-aunt hester said ; "[176-juley] [I]0-i know nothing about it . " [No one else]4040-no one else was afraid of assenting , and [James]316-james muttered gloomily at the floor : "[176-juley] [He]271-old jolyon 's not half the man [he]271-old jolyon was . " "[0-i] [I]0-i 've noticed it a long time , " went on [Francie]347-presently francie ; "[271-old jolyon] [he]271-old jolyon 's aged tremendously . " [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley shook [her]237-aunt juley head ; [her]237-aunt juley face seemed suddenly to have become one immense pout . "[271-old jolyon] [Poor dear Jolyon]271-old jolyon , " [she]237-aunt juley said , ' [somebody]543-somebody ought to see to it for [him]271-old jolyon ! "[271-old jolyon] There was again silence ; then , as though in terror of being left solitarily behind , [all five visitors]1482-all five visitors rose simultaneously , and took [their]1482-all five visitors departure . That evening , when [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester had just got off to sleep in [the back bedroom]1484-the back bedroom that used to be [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley 's before [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley took [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann 's , [her]181-aunt hester door was opened , and [Mrs. Small]177-soames , in a pink night - cap , a candle in [her]177-soames hand , entered : " [Hester]181-aunt hester !
