' Back in [[her]237-aunt juley own room]3498-her own room , [she]237-aunt juley stood at the window gazing at the moon over [the trees in [the Park]531-the park]1486-the trees in the park , through a chink in the muslin curtains , close drawn lest [anyone]879-anyone should see . And there , with [her]237-aunt juley face all round and pouting in its pink cap , and [her]237-aunt juley eyes wet , [she]237-aunt juley thought of ' [dear Jolyon]271-old jolyon , ' so old and so lonely , and how [she]237-aunt juley could be of some use to [him]271-old jolyon ; and how [he]271-old jolyon would come to love [her]237-aunt juley , as [she]237-aunt juley had never been loved since - since [poor Septimus]177-soames went away . CHAPTER VIII - DANCE AT [ROGER]105-roger 'S [[Roger]317-roger 's house in [Prince 's Gardens]101-prince 's gardens]1489-roger 's house in prince 's gardens was brilliantly alight . Large numbers of wax candles had been collected and placed in cut - glass chandeliers , and the parquet floor of [the long , double drawing - room]1490-the long , double drawing - room reflected these constellations . An appearance of real spaciousness had been secured by moving out all the furniture on to [the upper landings]1491-the upper landings , and enclosing [the room]488-the room with those strange appendages of civilization known as ' rout ' seats . In a remote corner , embowered in palms , was a cottage piano , with a copy of the ' Kensington Coil ' open on the music - stand . [Roger]317-roger had objected to a band . [He]105-roger did n't see in the least what [they]1493-they wanted with a band ; [he]105-roger would n't go to the expense , and there was an end of it . [Francie]317-roger [[her]317-roger mother]714-her mother , whom [Roger]317-roger had long since reduced to chronic dyspepsia , went to bed on such occasions , had been obliged to content [herself]714-her mother with supplementing the piano by [a young man who played the cornet]1495-a young man who played the cornet , and [she]714-her mother so arranged with palms that [anyone who did not look into the heart of things]1496-anyone who did not look into the heart of things might imagine there were [several musicians]1497-several musicians secreted [there]454-there . [She]714-her mother made up [her]714-her mother mind to tell [them]1497-several musicians to play loud - there was a lot of music in a cornet , if [the man]2473-the man would only put [his]2473-the man soul into it . In the more cultivated American tongue , [she]714-her mother was ' through ' at last - through that tortuous labyrinth of make - shifts , which must be traversed before fashionable display can be combined with the sound economy of [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte . Thin but brilliant , in [her]714-her mother maize - coloured frock with much tulle about the shoulders , [she]714-her mother went from place to place , fitting on [her]714-her mother gloves , and casting [her]714-her mother eye over it all . To [the hired butler for [Roger]317-roger]1501-the hired butler for roger only kept maids [she]714-her mother spoke about the wine . Did [he]1501-the hired butler for roger quite understand that [Mr. Forsyte]171-soames wished a dozen bottles of the champagne from [Whiteley]348-whiteley 's to be put out ? But if that were finished [she]714-her mother did not suppose it would be , [most of [the ladies]828-the ladies]1502-most of the ladies would drink water , no doubt , but if it were , there was the champagne cup , and [he]1501-the hired butler for roger must do the best [he]1501-the hired butler for roger could with that . [She]714-her mother hated having to say this sort of thing to [a butler]3102-a butler , it was so infra dig . ; but what could [you]1505-you do with [father]695-father ? [Roger]317-roger , indeed , after making [himself]317-roger consistently disagreeable about the dance , would come down presently , with [his]1501-the hired butler for roger fresh colour and bumpy forehead , as though [he]1501-the hired butler for roger had been [its promoter]1507-its promoter ; and [he]1501-the hired butler for roger would smile , and probably take [the prettiest woman]1508-the prettiest woman in to supper ; and at two o'clock , just as [they]1509-they were getting into the swing , [he]1501-the hired butler for roger would go up secretly to [the musicians]1510-the musicians and tell [them]1510-the musicians to play ' [God Save]304-god [the Queen]1511-the queen , ' and go away . [Francie]317-roger devoutly hoped [he]1501-the hired butler for roger might soon get tired , and slip off to bed . [The three or four devoted girl friends who were staying in]1512-the three or four devoted girl friends who were staying in [the house]2326-the house for this dance had partaken with [her]317-roger , in [a small , abandoned room upstairs]1514-a small , abandoned room upstairs , of tea and cold chicken - legs , hurriedly served ; [the men]3441-the men had been sent out to dine at [[Eustace]180-eustace 's Club]1516-eustace 's club , it being felt that [they]3441-the men must be fed up . Punctually on the stroke of nine arrived [Mrs. Small]177-soames alone . [She]177-soames made elaborate apologies for the absence of [Timothy]170-timothy , omitting all mention of [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester , who , at the last minute , had said [she]181-aunt hester could not be bothered . [Francie]317-roger received [her]317-roger effusively , and placed [her]317-roger on a rout seat , where [she]317-roger left [her]317-roger , pouting and solitary in lavender - coloured satin - the first time [she]317-roger had worn colour since [Aunt Ann]169-aunt ann 's death . [The devoted maiden friends]1517-the devoted maiden friends came now from [[their]1517-the devoted maiden friends rooms]1518-their rooms , each by magic arrangement in a differently coloured frock , but all with the same liberal allowance of tulle on the shoulders and at the bosom - for [they]1517-the devoted maiden friends were , by some fatality , lean to [a girl]2620-a girl . [They]1517-the devoted maiden friends were all taken up to [Mrs. Small]177-soames . [None]1520-none stayed with [her]177-soames more than a few seconds , but clustering together talked and twisted [their]1517-the devoted maiden friends programmes , looking secretly at the door for the first appearance of [a man]515-a man . Then arrived in a group a number of Nicholases , always punctual - the fashion up [Ladbroke Grove]18-ladbroke grove way ; and close behind [them]1517-the devoted maiden friends [Eustace]180-eustace and [[his]180-eustace men]1522-his men , gloomy and smelling rather of smoke . [Three or four of [Francie]317-roger 's lovers]1523-three or four of francie 's lovers now appeared , one after [the other]2339-the other ; [she]317-roger had made each promise to come early . [They]1517-the devoted maiden friends were all clean - shaven and sprightly , with that peculiar kind of young - man sprightliness which had recently invaded [Kensington]106-kensington ; [they]1517-the devoted maiden friends did not seem to mind [each other]2556-each other 's presence in the least , and wore [their]1517-the devoted maiden friends ties bunching out at the ends , white waistcoats , and socks with clocks . [All]592-all had handkerchiefs concealed in [their]592-all cuffs . [They]1517-the devoted maiden friends moved buoyantly , [each armoured]1527-each armoured in professional gaiety , as though [he]1527-each armoured had come to do great deeds . [Their]1517-the devoted maiden friends faces when [they]1517-the devoted maiden friends danced , far from wearing the traditional solemn look of [the dancing Englishman]1528-the dancing englishman , were irresponsible , charming , suave ; [they]1517-the devoted maiden friends bounded , twirling [[their]1517-the devoted maiden friends partners]1529-their partners at great pace , without pedantic attention to the rhythm of the music . At [other dancers]1530-other dancers [they]1517-the devoted maiden friends looked with a kind of airy scorn - [they]1517-the devoted maiden friends , [the light brigade]1531-the light brigade , [the heroes of [a hundred Kensington ' hops ' - from whom alone could the right manner and smile and step be hoped]1533-a hundred kensington ' hops ' - from whom alone could the right manner and smile and step be hoped]1532-the heroes of a hundred kensington ' hops ' - from whom alone could the right manner and smile and step be hoped . After this the stream came fast ; [chaperones silting up along the wall facing the entrance]1534-chaperones silting up along the wall facing the entrance , the volatile element swelling the eddy in [the larger room]1535-the larger room . [Men]550-men were scarce , and [wallflowers]1537-wallflowers wore [their]1537-wallflowers peculiar , pathetic expression , a patient , sourish smile which seemed to say : " Oh , no ! do n't mistake [me]1537-wallflowers , [I]1537-wallflowers know [you]1537-wallflowers are not coming up to [me]1537-wallflowers . [I]1537-wallflowers can hardly expect that ! "[1537-wallflowers] And [Francie]317-roger would plead with [one of [[her]317-roger lovers]1539-her lovers]1538-one of her lovers , or with [some callow youth]1540-some callow youth : " Now , to please [me]317-roger , do let [me]317-roger introduce [you]1538-one of her lovers to [Miss Pink]349-miss pink ; such [a nice girl]1121-a nice girl , really ! "[317-roger] and [she]317-roger would bring [him]1538-one of her lovers up , and say : " [Miss Pink]349-miss pink - [Mr. Gathercole]350-mr. gathercole . Can [you]350-mr. gathercole spare [him]1538-one of her lovers a dance ? "[317-roger] Then [Miss Pink]349-miss pink , smiling [her]349-miss pink forced smile , colouring a little , answered : " Oh ! [I]349-miss pink think so ! "[349-miss pink] and screening [her]349-miss pink empty card , wrote on it the name of [Gathercole]350-mr. gathercole , spelling it passionately in the district that [he]350-mr. gathercole proposed , about the second extra . But when [the youth]1541-the youth had murmured that it was hot , and passed , [she]349-miss pink relapsed into [her]349-miss pink attitude of hopeless expectation , into [her]349-miss pink patient , sourish smile . [Mothers]2696-mothers , slowly fanning [their]2696-mothers faces , watched [[their]2696-mothers daughters]1543-their daughters , and in [their]2696-mothers eyes could be read all the story of [those daughters]1544-those daughters ' fortunes . As for [themselves]1543-their daughters , to sit hour after hour , dead tired , silent , or talking spasmodically - what did it matter , so long as [the girls]2719-the girls were having a good time ! But to see [them]2719-the girls neglected and passed by ! Ah ! [they]1543-their daughters smiled , but [their]1543-their daughters eyes stabbed like the eyes of [an offended swan]1546-an offended swan ; [they]1543-their daughters longed to pluck [young Gathercole]350-mr. gathercole by the slack of [his]350-mr. gathercole dandified breeches , and drag [him]350-mr. gathercole to [[their]1543-their daughters daughters]1543-their daughters - the jackanapes ! And all the cruelties and hardness of life , its pathos and unequal chances , its conceit , self - forgetfulness , and patience , were presented on the battle - field of [this Kensington ball - room]1548-this kensington ball - room . Here and there , too , [lovers]1549-lovers - not lovers like [Francie]317-roger 's , [a peculiar breed]1550-a peculiar breed , but simply [lovers]1549-lovers - trembling , blushing , silent , sought [each other]2556-each other by flying glances , sought to meet and touch in the mazes of the dance , and now and again dancing together , struck [some beholder]1553-some beholder by the light in [their]1543-their daughters eyes . Not a second before ten o'clock came [the Jameses]1554-the jameses - [Emily]173-james , [Rachel]261-rachel , [Winifred Dartie]187-dartie had been left behind , having on a former occasion drunk too much of [Roger]317-roger 's champagne , and [Cicely]262-cicely , [the youngest]1555-the youngest , making [her]1555-the youngest debut ; behind [them]1554-the jameses , following in a hansom from [the paternal mansion where [they]1554-the jameses had dined]1556-the paternal mansion where they had dined , [Soames]177-soames and [Irene]186-irene . [All these ladies]1557-all these ladies had shoulder - straps and no tulle - thus showing at once , by a bolder exposure of flesh , that [they]1557-all these ladies came from [the more fashionable side of [the Park]531-the park]1558-the more fashionable side of the park . [Soames]177-soames , sidling back from the contact of [the dancers]1560-the dancers , took up a position against the wall . Guarding [himself]177-soames with [his]1561-he pale smile , [he]1561-he stood watching . Waltz after waltz began and ended , [couple]1562-couple after [couple]1562-couple brushed by with smiling lips , laughter , and snatches of talk ; or with set lips , and eyes searching [the throng]1564-the throng ; or again , with silent , parted lips , and eyes on [each other]2556-each other . And the scent of festivity , the odour of flowers , and hair , of essences that [women]817-women love , rose suffocatingly in the heat of the summer night . [Silent]351-silent , with something of scorn in [his]1561-he smile , [Soames]177-soames seemed to notice nothing ; but now and again [his]1561-he eyes , finding that which [they]1567-they sought , would fix themselves on a point in [the shifting throng]1568-the shifting throng , and the smile die off [his]1561-he lips . [He]1561-he danced with [no one]514-no one . [Some fellows]1570-some fellows danced with [[their]1570-some fellows wives]666-their wives ; [his]1561-he sense of ' form ' had never permitted [him]1561-he to dance with [Irene]186-irene since [their]1572-their marriage , and [the God of [the Forsytes]164-soames]1573-the god of the forsytes alone can tell whether this was a relief to [him]1561-he or not . [She]186-irene passed , dancing with [other men]1574-other men , [her]186-irene dress , iris - coloured , floating away from [her]186-irene feet . [She]186-irene danced well ; [he]1561-he was tired of hearing [women]817-women say with an acid smile : " How beautifully [[your]1561-he wife]1092-your wife dances , [Mr. Forsyte]171-soames - it 's quite a pleasure to watch [her]186-irene ! "[817-women] Tired of answering [them]817-women with [his]1561-he sidelong glance : " [You]817-women think so ? "[1561-he] [A young couple close by]1576-a young couple close by flirted a fan by turns , making an unpleasant draught . [Francie]317-roger and [one of [[her]317-roger lovers]1539-her lovers]1538-one of her lovers stood near . [They]1576-a young couple close by were talking of love . [He]1561-he heard [Roger]317-roger 's voice behind , giving an order about supper to [a servant]1579-a servant . Everything was very second - class ! [He]1561-he wished that [he]1561-he had not come ! [He]1561-he had asked [Irene]186-irene whether [she]186-irene wanted [him]1561-he ; [she]186-irene had answered with that maddening smile of [hers]186-irene " Oh , no ! "[186-irene] Why had [he]1561-he come ? For the last quarter of an hour [he]1561-he had not even seen [her]186-irene . Here was [George]291-george advancing with [his]291-george Quilpish face ; it was too late to get out of [his]291-george way . " Have [you]171-soames seen ' [The Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer ' ? "[1580-this licensed wag] said [this licensed wag]1580-this licensed wag ; " [he]789-the buccaneer 's on the warpath - hair cut and everything ! "[1580-this licensed wag] [Soames]171-soames said [he]171-soames had not , and crossing [the room]488-the room , half - empty in an interval of the dance , [he]171-soames went out on [the balcony]1582-the balcony , and looked down into [the street]2964-the street . [A carriage]1584-a carriage had driven up with late arrivals , and round the door hung [some of [those patient watchers of the [London]2-london [streets who spring up to the call of light or music]1587-streets who spring up to the call of light or music]1586-those patient watchers of the london streets who spring up to the call of light or music ; [their]1585-some of those patient watchers of the london streets who spring up to the call of light or music ; their faces , pale and upturned above their black and rusty figures faces , pale and upturned above [their]1585-some of those patient watchers of the london streets who spring up to the call of light or music ; their faces , pale and upturned above their black and rusty figures black and rusty figures]1585-some of those patient watchers of the london streets who spring up to the call of light or music ; their faces , pale and upturned above their black and rusty figures , had an air of stolid watching that annoyed [Soames]171-soames . Why were [they]1585-some of those patient watchers of the london streets who spring up to the call of light or music ; their faces , pale and upturned above their black and rusty figures allowed to hang about ; why did n't [the bobby]1588-the bobby move [them]1585-some of those patient watchers of the london streets who spring up to the call of light or music ; their faces , pale and upturned above their black and rusty figures on ? But [the policeman]1589-the policeman took no notice of [them]1585-some of those patient watchers of the london streets who spring up to the call of light or music ; their faces , pale and upturned above their black and rusty figures ; [his]1589-the policeman feet were planted apart on the strip of crimson carpet stretched across [the pavement]2865-the pavement ; [his]1589-the policeman face , under the helmet , wore the same stolid , watching look as [theirs]1585-some of those patient watchers of the london streets who spring up to the call of light or music ; their faces , pale and upturned above their black and rusty figures . Across [the road]1291-the road , through the railings , [Soames]171-soames could see the branches of trees shining , faintly stirring in the breeze , by the gleam of the street lamps ; beyond , again , the upper lights of [the houses on the other side]1592-the houses on the other side , so many eyes looking down on the quiet blackness of [the garden]1015-the garden ; and over all , the sky , that wonderful [London]2-london sky , dusted with the innumerable reflection of countless lamps ; a dome woven over between [its]1594-its stars with the refraction of human needs and human fancies - immense mirror of pomp and misery that night after night stretches its kindly mocking over miles of [houses]2315-houses and [gardens]1596-gardens , [mansions]1597-mansions and squalor , over [Forsytes]1598-forsytes , [policemen]1599-policemen , and [patient watchers]1600-patient watchers in [the streets]2464-the streets . [Soames]171-soames turned away , and , hidden in the recess , gazed into [the lighted room]1602-the lighted room . It was cooler out there . [He]171-soames saw [the new arrivals]1603-the new arrivals , [June]166-june and [[her]166-june grandfather]3464-her grandfather , enter . What had made [them]1603-the new arrivals so late ? [They]1603-the new arrivals stood by the doorway . [They]1603-the new arrivals looked fagged . [Fancy Uncle Jolyon]271-old jolyon turning out at this time of night ! Why had n't [June]166-june come to [Irene]186-irene , as [she]166-june usually did , and it occurred to [him]171-soames suddenly that [he]171-soames had seen nothing of [June]166-june for a long time now . Watching [her]166-june face with idle malice , [he]171-soames saw it change , grow so pale that [he]171-soames thought [she]166-june would drop , then flame out crimson . Turning to see at what [she]166-june was looking , [he]171-soames saw [[his]171-soames wife]558-his wife on [Bosinney]316-james 's arm , coming from [the conservatory at the end of [the room]488-the room]1606-the conservatory at the end of the room . [Her]166-june eyes were raised to [his]171-soames , as though answering some question [he]171-soames had asked , and [he]171-soames was gazing at [her]166-june intently . [Soames]171-soames looked again at [June]166-june . [Her]166-june hand rested on [old Jolyon]271-old jolyon 's arm ; [she]166-june seemed to be making a request . [He]171-soames saw a surprised look on [[his]171-soames uncle]3677-his uncle 's face ; [they]1609-they turned and passed through the door out of [his]171-soames sight . The music began again - a waltz - and , still as a statue in the recess of the window , [his]171-soames face unmoved , but no smile on [his]171-soames lips , [Soames]171-soames waited . Presently , within a yard of [the dark balcony]1610-the dark balcony , [[his]171-soames wife]558-his wife and [Bosinney]316-james passed . [He]171-soames caught the perfume of the gardenias that [she]166-june wore , saw the rise and fall of [her]166-june bosom , the languor in [her]166-june eyes , [her]166-june parted lips , and a look on [her]166-june face that [he]171-soames did not know . To the slow , swinging measure [they]1609-they danced by , and it seemed to [him]171-soames that [they]1609-they clung to [each other]2556-each other ; [he]171-soames saw [her]166-june raise [her]166-june eyes , soft and dark , to [Bosinney]316-james 's , and drop them again . Very white , [he]171-soames turned back to [the balcony]1582-the balcony , and leaning on it , gazed down on [the Square]846-the square ; [the figures]1615-the figures were still there looking up at the light with dull persistency , [the policeman]1589-the policeman 's face , too , upturned , and staring , but [he]171-soames saw nothing of [them]1615-the figures . Below , [a carriage]1584-a carriage drew up , [two figures]1618-two figures got in , and drove away .... That evening [June]166-june and [old Jolyon]271-old jolyon sat down to dinner at the usual hour . [The girl]595-the girl was in [her]595-the girl customary high - necked frock , [old Jolyon]271-old jolyon had not dressed . At breakfast [she]595-the girl had spoken of the dance at [[Uncle Roger]352-roger 's]1620-uncle roger 's , [she]595-the girl wanted to go ; [she]595-the girl had been stupid enough , [she]595-the girl said , not to think of asking [anyone]879-anyone to take [her]595-the girl . It was too late now . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon lifted [his]163-old jolyon keen eyes . [June]166-june was used to go to dances with [Irene]186-irene as a matter of course ! and deliberately fixing [his]163-old jolyon gaze on [her]595-the girl , [he]163-old jolyon asked : " Why do n't [you]595-the girl get [Irene]186-irene ? "[163-old jolyon] No ! [June]166-june did not want to ask [Irene]186-irene ; [she]166-june would only go if - if [[her]595-the girl grandfather]3464-her grandfather would n't mind just for once for a little time ! At [her]595-the girl look , so eager and so worn , [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon had grumblingly consented . [He]163-old jolyon did not know what [she]595-the girl wanted , [he]163-old jolyon said , with going to a dance like this , a poor affair , [he]163-old jolyon would wager ; and [she]595-the girl no more fit for it than a cat ! What [she]595-the girl wanted was sea air , and after [his]163-old jolyon general meeting of [the Globular Gold Concessions]1623-the globular gold concessions [he]163-old jolyon was ready to take [her]595-the girl . [She]595-the girl did n't want to go away ? Ah ! [she]595-the girl would knock [herself]595-the girl up ! Stealing a mournful look at [her]595-the girl , [he]163-old jolyon went on with [his]163-old jolyon breakfast . [June]166-june went out early , and wandered restlessly about in the heat . [[Her]595-the girl little light figure that lately had moved so languidly about its business]1624-her little light figure that lately had moved so languidly about its business , was all on fire . [She]595-the girl bought [herself]595-the girl some flowers . [She]595-the girl wanted - [she]595-the girl meant to look [her]595-the girl best . [He]163-old jolyon would be [there]454-there ! [She]595-the girl knew well enough that [he]163-old jolyon had a card . [She]595-the girl would show [him]163-old jolyon that [she]595-the girl did not care . But deep down in [her]595-the girl heart [she]595-the girl resolved that evening to win [him]163-old jolyon back . [She]595-the girl came in flushed , and talked brightly all lunch ; [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon was [there]454-there , and [he]163-old jolyon was deceived . In the afternoon [she]595-the girl was overtaken by a desperate fit of sobbing . [She]595-the girl strangled the noise against the pillows of [her]595-the girl bed , but when at last it ceased [she]595-the girl saw in the glass a swollen face with reddened eyes , and violet circles round them . [She]595-the girl stayed in [the darkened room]1627-the darkened room till dinner time . All through that silent meal the struggle went on within [her]595-the girl . [She]595-the girl looked so shadowy and exhausted that [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon told ' [Sankey]272-sankey ' to countermand [the carriage]2416-the carriage , [he]163-old jolyon would not have [her]595-the girl going out .... [She]595-the girl was to go to bed ! [She]595-the girl made no resistance . [She]595-the girl went up to [[her]595-the girl room]2872-her room , and sat in the dark . At ten o'clock [she]595-the girl rang for [[her]595-the girl maid]1630-her maid . " Bring some hot water , and go down and tell [Mr. Forsyte]171-soames that [I]595-the girl feel perfectly rested . Say that if [he]171-soames 's too tired [I]595-the girl can go to the dance by [myself]595-the girl . "[595-the girl] [The maid]2855-the maid looked askance , and [June]166-june turned on [her]2855-the maid imperiously . " Go , "[2855-the maid] [she]2855-the maid said , " bring the hot water at once ! "[2855-the maid] [Her]595-the girl ball - dress still lay on the sofa , and with a sort of fierce care [she]595-the girl arrayed [herself]595-the girl , took the flowers in [her]595-the girl hand , and went down , [her]595-the girl small face carried high under its burden of hair . [She]595-the girl could hear [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon in [[his]163-old jolyon room]1632-his room as [she]595-the girl passed . Bewildered and vexed , [he]163-old jolyon was dressing . It was past ten , [they]1633-they would not get [there]454-there till eleven ; [the girl]595-the girl was mad . But [he]163-old jolyon dared not cross [her]595-the girl - the expression of [her]595-the girl face at dinner haunted [him]163-old jolyon . With great ebony brushes [he]163-old jolyon smoothed [his]163-old jolyon hair till it shone like silver under the light ; then [he]163-old jolyon , too , came out on the gloomy staircase . [June]166-june met [him]163-old jolyon below , and , without a word , [they]1633-they went to [the carriage]2416-the carriage . When , after that drive which seemed to last for ever , [she]166-june entered [[Roger]352-roger 's drawing - room]1637-roger 's drawing - room , [she]166-june disguised under a mask of resolution a very torment of nervousness and emotion . The feeling of shame at what might be called ' running after [him]163-old jolyon ' was smothered by the dread that [he]163-old jolyon might not be [there]454-there , that [she]166-june might not see [him]163-old jolyon after all , and by that dogged resolve - somehow , [she]166-june did not know how - to win [him]163-old jolyon back . The sight of [the ballroom]1639-the ballroom , with [its]1639-the ballroom gleaming floor , gave [her]166-june a feeling of joy , of triumph , for [she]166-june loved dancing , and when dancing [she]166-june floated , so light was [she]166-june , like [a strenuous , eager little spirit]1640-a strenuous , eager little spirit . [He]163-old jolyon would surely ask [her]166-june to dance , and if [he]163-old jolyon danced with [her]166-june it would all be as it was before . [She]166-june looked about [her]166-june eagerly . The sight of [Bosinney]316-james coming with [Irene]186-irene from [the conservatory]1641-the conservatory , with that strange look of utter absorption on [his]316-james face , struck [her]166-june too suddenly . [They]1642-they had not seen - [no one]514-no one should see - [her]166-june distress , not even [[her]166-june grandfather]3464-her grandfather . [She]166-june put [her]166-june hand on [Jolyon]163-old jolyon 's arm , and said very low : " [I]166-june must go [home]436-home , [Gran]353-gran ; [I]166-june feel ill . "[166-june] [He]316-james hurried [her]166-june away , grumbling to [himself]316-james that [he]316-james had known how it would be . To [her]166-june [he]316-james said nothing ; only when [they]1642-they were once more in [the carriage]2416-the carriage , which by some fortunate chance had lingered near the door , [he]316-james asked [her]166-june : " What is it , [[my]316-james darling]1160-my darling ? "[316-james] Feeling [her]166-june whole slender body shaken by sobs , [he]316-james was terribly alarmed . [She]166-june must have [Blank]283-blank to - morrow . [He]316-james would insist upon it . [He]316-james could not have [her]166-june like this .... There , there ! [June]166-june mastered [her]166-june sobs , and squeezing [his]316-james hand feverishly , [she]166-june lay back in [her]166-june corner , [her]166-june face muffled in a shawl . [He]316-james could only see [her]166-june eyes , fixed and staring in the dark , but [he]316-james did not cease to stroke [her]166-june hand with [his]316-james thin fingers . CHAPTER IX - EVENING AT [RICHMOND]24-richmond Other eyes besides the eyes of [June]166-june and of [Soames]171-soames had seen ' those two ' as [Euphemia]303-euphemia had already begun to call [them]1646-them coming from [the conservatory]1641-the conservatory ; other eyes had noticed the look on [Bosinney]316-james 's face . There are moments when Nature reveals the passion hidden beneath the careless calm of [her]166-june ordinary moods - violent spring flashing white on almond - blossom through the purple clouds ; a snowy , moonlit peak , with its single star , soaring up to the passionate blue ; or against the flames of sunset , an old yew - tree standing dark guardian of some fiery secret . There are moments , too , when in [a picture - gallery]1648-a picture - gallery , a work , noted by [the casual spectator]1649-the casual spectator as ' ...... [Titian]354-titian - remarkably fine , ' breaks through the defences of [some Forsyte better lunched perhaps than [[his]316-james fellows]1651-his fellows]1650-some forsyte better lunched perhaps than his fellows , and holds [him]316-james spellbound in a kind of ecstasy . There are things , [he]316-james feels - there are things here which - well , which are things . Something unreasoning , unreasonable , is upon [him]316-james ; when [he]316-james tries to define it with the precision of [a practical man]1652-a practical man , it eludes [him]316-james , slips away , as the glow of the wine [he]316-james has drunk is slipping away , leaving [him]316-james cross , and conscious of [his]316-james liver . [He]316-james feels that [he]316-james has been extravagant , prodigal of something ; virtue has gone out of [him]316-james . [He]316-james did not desire this glimpse of what lay under the three stars of [his]316-james catalogue . God forbid that [he]316-james should know anything about the forces of Nature ! [God]304-god forbid that [he]316-james should admit for a moment that there are such things ! Once admit that , and where was [he]316-james ? [One]2652-one paid a shilling for entrance , and another for the programme . The look which [June]166-june had seen , which [other Forsytes]164-soames had seen , was like the sudden flashing of a candle through a hole in some imaginary canvas , behind which it was being moved - the sudden flaming - out of a vague , erratic glow , shadowy and enticing . It brought home to [onlookers]1654-onlookers the consciousness that [dangerous forces were at work]1655-dangerous forces were at work . For a moment [they]1654-onlookers noticed it with pleasure , with interest , then felt [they]1654-onlookers must not notice it at all . It supplied , however , the reason of [June]166-june 's coming so late and disappearing again without dancing , without even shaking hands with [[her]166-june lover]554-her lover . [She]166-june was ill , it was said , and no wonder . But here [they]1657-they looked at [each other]2556-each other guiltily . [They]1657-they had no desire to spread scandal , no desire to be ill - natured . Who would have ? And to [outsiders]1659-outsiders no word was breathed , unwritten law keeping [them]1657-they silent . Then came the news that [June]166-june had gone to [the seaside]1660-the seaside with [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon . [He]163-old jolyon had carried [her]166-june off to [Broadstairs]108-broadstairs , for which place there was just then a feeling , [Yarmouth]6-yarmouth having lost caste , in spite of [Nicholas]206-nicholas treffry , and no [Forsyte]166-june going to [the sea]2321-the sea without intending to have an air for [his]163-old jolyon money such as would render [him]163-old jolyon bilious in a week . That fatally aristocratic tendency of [the first Forsyte]1662-the first forsyte to drink [Madeira]193-madeira had left [[his]163-old jolyon descendants]1663-his descendants undoubtedly accessible . So [June]166-june went to [the sea]2321-the sea . [The family]450-the family awaited developments ; there was nothing else to do . But how far - how far had ' [those two]1666-those two ' gone ? How far were [they]1666-those two going to go ? Could [they]1666-those two really be going at all ? Nothing could surely come of it , for [neither of [them]1666-those two]1667-neither of them had any money . At the most a flirtation , ending , as all such attachments should , at the proper time . [[Soames]164-soames ' sister]1668-soames ' sister , [Winifred Dartie]187-dartie , who had imbibed with the breezes of [Mayfair]85-mayfair - [she]1668-soames ' sister lived in [Green Street]109-green street - more fashionable principles in regard to matrimonial behaviour than were current , for instance , in [Ladbroke Grove]18-ladbroke grove , laughed at the idea of there being anything in it . The ' little thing ' - [Irene]186-irene was taller than [herself]186-irene , and it was real testimony to the solid worth of [a Forsyte]166-june that [she]186-irene should always thus be a ' little thing ' - [the little thing]1669-the little thing was bored . Why should n't [she]186-irene amuse [herself]186-irene ? [Soames]164-soames was rather tiring ; and as to [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney - only [that buffoon George]1670-that buffoon george would have called [him]168-bosinney [the Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer - [she]186-irene maintained that [he]168-bosinney was very chic . This dictum - that [Bosinney]168-bosinney was chic - caused quit a sensation . It failed to convince . That [he]168-bosinney was ' good - looking in a way ' [they]1672-they were prepared to admit , but that [anyone]879-anyone could call a man with [his]168-bosinney [pronounced cheekbones , curious eyes , and soft felt hats chic]1674-pronounced cheekbones , curious eyes , and soft felt hats chic was only another instance of [Winifred]187-dartie 's extravagant way of running after something new . It was that famous summer when extravagance was fashionable , when the very earth was extravagant , chestnut - trees spread with blossom , and flowers drenched in perfume , as they had never been before ; when roses blew in [every garden]1675-every garden ; and for the swarming stars the nights had hardly space ; when every day and all day long the sun , in full armour , swung [his]168-bosinney brazen shield above [the Park]531-the park , and [people]600-people did strange things , lunching and dining in the open air . Unprecedented was the tale of [cabs]1678-cabs and carriages that streamed across [the bridges of [the shining river]1680-the shining river]1679-the bridges of the shining river , bearing [the upper - middle class]609-the upper - middle class in thousands to [the green glories of [Bushey]110-bushey , [Richmond]24-richmond , [Kew]111-kew]1682-the green glories of bushey , richmond , kew , and [Hampton Court]112-hampton court . Almost [every family with any pretensions to be of the carriage - class]1683-every family with any pretensions to be of the carriage - class paid one visit that year to the horse - chestnuts at [Bushey]110-bushey , or took one drive amongst [the Spanish chestnuts of [Richmond Park]113-richmond park]1684-the spanish chestnuts of richmond park . Bowling smoothly , if dustily , along , in a cloud of [their]1683-every family with any pretensions to be of the carriage - class own creation , [they]1683-every family with any pretensions to be of the carriage - class would stare fashionably at the antlered heads which the great slow deer raised out of [a forest of bracken]1685-a forest of bracken that promised to autumn [lovers such cover as was never seen before]1686-lovers such cover as was never seen before . And now and again , as the amorous perfume of chestnut flowers and of fern was drifted too near , [one]2652-one would say to [the other]2339-the other : " [[My]2652-one dear]2282-my dear ! What a peculiar scent ! "[2652-one] And the lime - flowers that year were of rare prime , near honey - coloured . At the corners of [London]2-london squares [they]1683-every family with any pretensions to be of the carriage - class gave out , as the sun went down , a perfume sweeter than the honey bees had taken - a perfume that stirred a yearning unnamable in the hearts of [Forsytes]164-soames and [[their]1683-every family with any pretensions to be of the carriage - class peers]1689-their peers , taking the cool after dinner in [the precincts of [those gardens to which [they]1683-every family with any pretensions to be of the carriage - class alone had keys]1691-those gardens to which they alone had keys]1690-the precincts of those gardens to which they alone had keys . And that yearning made [them]1683-every family with any pretensions to be of the carriage - class linger amidst the dim shapes of flower - beds in the failing daylight , made [them]1683-every family with any pretensions to be of the carriage - class turn , and turn , and turn again , as though [lovers]1549-lovers were waiting for [them]1683-every family with any pretensions to be of the carriage - class - waiting for the last light to die away under the shadow of the branches . Some vague sympathy evoked by the scent of the limes , some sisterly desire to see for [herself]1693-her , some idea of demonstrating the soundness of [her]1693-her dictum that there was ' nothing in it ' ; or merely the craving to drive down to [Richmond]24-richmond , irresistible that summer , moved [the mother of [the little Darties of [little Publius]356-little publius]1695-the little darties of little publius , of [Imogen]357-imogen , [Maud]358-maud , and [Benedict]359-benedict]1694-the mother of the little darties of little publius , of imogen , maud , and benedict to write the following note to [[her]1693-her sister - in - law]1696-her sister - in - law : ' [DEAR IRENE]186-irene , ' June 30 . ' [I]0-i hear that [Soames]164-soames is going to [Henley]114-henley tomorrow for the night . [I]0-i thought it would be great fun if [we]1697-we made up a little party and drove down to , [Richmond]24-richmond . Will [you]186-irene ask [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney , and [I]0-i will get [young Flippard]360-young flippard . ' [Emily]173-james [they]1697-we called [[their]1697-we mother]1698-their mother [Emily]173-james - it was so chic will lend [us]1697-we [the carriage]2416-the carriage . [I]0-i will call for [you]186-irene and [[your]186-irene young man]1700-your young man at seven o'clock . ' [[Your]186-irene affectionate sister]1701-your affectionate sister , ' [WINIFRED DARTIE]356-little publius . ' [Montague]311-montague believes the dinner at the Crown and Sceptre to be quite eatable . ' [Montague]311-montague was [Dartie]356-little publius 's second and better known name - [his]311-montague first being [Moses]361-moses ; for [he]311-montague was nothing if not [a man of [the world]2286-the world]1702-a man of the world . [Her]1698-their mother plan met with more opposition from [Providence]265-providence than so benevolent a scheme deserved . In the first place [young Flippard]360-young flippard wrote : ' [DEAR Mrs. DARTIE]362-dartie , ' Awfully sorry . Engaged two deep . ' [Yours]186-irene , ' [AUGUSTUS FLIPPARD]360-young flippard . ' It was late to send into the by - ways and hedges to remedy this misfortune . With the promptitude and conduct of [a mother]2931-a mother , [Winifred]187-dartie fell back on [[her]1698-their mother husband]2635-her husband . [She]1698-their mother had , indeed , the decided but tolerant temperament that goes with a good deal of profile , fair hair , and greenish eyes . [She]1698-their mother was seldom or never at a loss ; or if at a loss , was always able to convert it into a gain . [Dartie]187-dartie , too , was in good feather . [Erotic]346-erotic had failed to win the Lancashire Cup . Indeed , that celebrated animal , owned as [he]187-dartie was by [a pillar of the turf]1706-a pillar of the turf , who had secretly laid many thousands against [him]187-dartie , had not even started . The forty - eight hours that followed [his]187-dartie scratching were among the darkest in [Dartie]187-dartie 's life . Visions of [James]173-james haunted [him]187-dartie day and night . Black thoughts about [Soames]164-soames mingled with the faintest hopes . On the Friday night [he]187-dartie got drunk , so greatly was [he]187-dartie affected . But on Saturday morning the true Stock Exchange instinct triumphed within [him]187-dartie . Owing some hundreds , which by no possibility could [he]187-dartie pay , [he]187-dartie went into [town]656-town and put them all on Concertina for [the Saltown Borough Handicap]1708-the saltown borough handicap . As [he]187-dartie said to [Major Scrotton]363-major scrotton , with whom [he]187-dartie lunched at [the Iseeum]345-the iseeum : " [That little Jew boy]4048-that little jew boy , [Nathans]364-nathans , had given [him]4048-that little jew boy the tip . [He]4048-that little jew boy did n't care [a cursh]4049-a cursh . [He]4048-that little jew boy wash in - [a mucker]4050-a mucker . If it did n't come up - well then , [damme]4051-damme , [the old man]3057-the old man would have to pay ! "[187-dartie] A bottle of Pol Roger to [his]187-dartie own cheek had given [him]187-dartie a new contempt for [James]173-james . [It]1709-it came up . [Concertina]365-concertina was squeezed [home]436-home by [her]1711-her neck - a terrible squeak ! But , as [Dartie]187-dartie said : There was nothing like pluck ! [He]187-dartie was by no means averse to the expedition to [Richmond]24-richmond . [He]187-dartie would ' stand ' it [himself]187-dartie ! [He]187-dartie cherished an admiration for [Irene]186-irene , and wished to be on more playful terms with [her]186-irene . At half - past five [the Park Lane footman]1712-the park lane footman came round to say : [Mrs. Forsyte]189-nicholas was very sorry , but one of the horses was coughing ! [They]1714-they would go down in hansoms and meet at [the Crown and Sceptre]25-the crown and sceptre at 7.45 . [Dartie]187-dartie , on being told , was pleased enough . It was better than going down with [your]1715-your back to the horses ! [He]187-dartie had no objection to driving down with [Irene]186-irene . [He]187-dartie supposed [they]1714-they would pick up the others at [Montpellier Square]8-montpellier square , and swop [hansoms]1716-hansoms [there]454-there ? At seven o'clock [they]1714-they started , [Dartie]187-dartie offering to bet [the driver]2541-the driver half - a - crown [he]187-dartie did n't do it in the three - quarters of an hour . Twice only did [husband]1720-husband and [wife]1721-wife exchange remarks on the way . [Dartie]187-dartie said : " It 'll put [Master Soames]171-soames 's nose out of joint to hear [[his]187-dartie wife]558-his wife 's been drivin ' in a hansom with [Master Bosinney]168-bosinney ! "[187-dartie] [Winifred]187-dartie replied : " Do n't talk such nonsense , [Monty]311-montague ! "[187-dartie] " Nonsense ! "[187-dartie] repeated [Dartie]187-dartie . " [You]187-dartie do n't know [women]817-women , [[my]187-dartie fine lady]4055-my fine lady ! "[187-dartie] On the other occasion [he]187-dartie merely asked : " How am [I]187-dartie looking ? A bit puffy about the gills ? That fizz old [George]291-george is so fond of is a windy wine ! "[187-dartie] [He]187-dartie had been lunching with [George Forsyte]183-george at [the Haversnake]116-the haversnake . [Bosinney]168-bosinney and [Irene]186-irene had arrived before [them]1722-them . [They]1722-them were standing in [one of the long French windows overlooking [the river]2706-the river]1723-one of the long french windows overlooking the river . Windows that summer were open all day long , and all night too , and day and night the scents of flowers and trees came in , the hot scent of parching grass , and the cool scent of the heavy dews . To the eye of [the observant Dartie]187-dartie [[his]187-dartie two guests]1725-his two guests did not appear to be making much running , standing there close together , without a word . [Bosinney]168-bosinney was [a hungry - looking creature]1726-a hungry - looking creature - not much go about [him]168-bosinney . [He]168-bosinney left [them]1725-his two guests to [Winifred]187-dartie , however , and busied [himself]168-bosinney to order the dinner . [A Forsyte]183-george will require good , if not delicate feeding , but [a Dartie]187-dartie will tax the resources of a Crown and Sceptre . Living as [he]187-dartie does , from hand to mouth , nothing is too good for [him]187-dartie to eat ; and [he]187-dartie will eat it . [His]187-dartie drink , too , will need to be carefully provided ; there is much drink in [this country]1727-this country ' not good enough ' for [a Dartie]1728-a dartie ; [he]187-dartie will have the best . Paying for things vicariously , there is no reason why [he]187-dartie should stint [himself]187-dartie . To stint [yourself]1729-yourself is the mark of [a fool]1730-a fool , not of [a Dartie]187-dartie . The best of everything ! No sounder principle on which [a man]515-a man can base [his]515-a man life , [whose father - in - law has a very considerable income , and a partiality for [[his]515-a man grandchildren]3018-his grandchildren]1732-whose father - in - law has a very considerable income , and a partiality for his grandchildren . With [his]187-dartie not unable eye [Dartie]187-dartie had spotted this weakness in [James]173-james the very first year after [little Publius]356-little publius 's arrival an error ; [he]187-dartie had profited by [his]187-dartie perspicacity . [Four little Darties]366-the darties were now a sort of perpetual insurance . The feature of the feast was unquestionably the red mullet . This delectable fish , brought from a considerable distance in a state of almost perfect preservation , was first fried , then boned , then served in ice , with Madeira punch in place of sauce , according to a recipe known to [a few men of [the world]2286-the world]1734-a few men of the world . Nothing else calls for remark except the payment of the bill by [Dartie]187-dartie . [He]187-dartie had made [himself]187-dartie extremely agreeable throughout the meal ; [his]187-dartie bold , admiring stare seldom abandoning [Irene]186-irene 's face and figure . As [he]187-dartie was obliged to confess to [himself]187-dartie , [he]187-dartie got no change out of [her]186-irene - [she]186-irene was cool enough , as cool as [her]186-irene shoulders looked under their veil of creamy lace . [He]187-dartie expected to have caught [her]186-irene out in some little game with [Bosinney]168-bosinney ; but not a bit of it , [she]186-irene kept up [her]186-irene end remarkably well . As for [that architect chap]3580-that architect chap , [he]3580-that architect chap was as glum as a bear with a sore head - [Winifred]187-dartie could barely get a word out of [him]3580-that architect chap ; [he]3580-that architect chap ate nothing , but [he]3580-that architect chap certainly took [his]3580-that architect chap liquor , and [his]3580-that architect chap face kept getting whiter , and [his]3580-that architect chap eyes looked queer . It was all very amusing . For [Dartie]187-dartie [himself]187-dartie was in capital form , and talked freely , with a certain poignancy , being [no fool]1737-no fool . [He]187-dartie told two or three stories verging on the improper , a concession to [the company]3274-the company , for [his]187-dartie stories were not used to verging . [He]187-dartie proposed [Irene]186-irene 's health in a mock speech . [Nobody]2292-nobody drank it , and [Winifred]187-dartie said : " Do n't be such [a clown]4056-a clown , [Monty]311-montague ! "[187-dartie] At [her]186-irene suggestion [they]1740-they went after dinner to [the public terrace overlooking [the river]2706-the river]1741-the public terrace overlooking the river . " [I]186-irene should like to see [the common people]4057-the common people making love , "[186-irene] [she]186-irene said , " it 's such fun ! "[186-irene] There were numbers of [them]1740-they walking in the cool , after the day 's heat , and the air was alive with the sound of voices , coarse and loud , or soft as though murmuring secrets . It was not long before [Winifred]187-dartie 's better sense - [she]186-irene was [the only Forsyte present]1743-the only forsyte present - secured [them]1740-they an empty bench . [They]1740-they sat down in a row . A heavy tree spread a thick canopy above [their]1740-they heads , and the haze darkened slowly over [the river]2706-the river . [Dartie]187-dartie sat at the end , next to [him]187-dartie [Irene]186-irene , then [Bosinney]168-bosinney , then [Winifred]187-dartie . [He]1745-the man of the world thought : ' That Buccaneer [Johnny]307-jack robinson sha n't have it all to [himself]307-jack robinson ! It 's a pretty tight fit , certainly ! ' From far down below on [the dark river]1747-the dark river came drifting the tinkle of a mandoline , and voices singing the old round : ' [A boat]1748-a boat , [a boat]1748-a boat , unto [the ferry]1750-the ferry , For [we]1751-we 'll go over and be merry ; And laugh , and quaff , and drink brown sherry ! ' And suddenly the moon appeared , young and tender , floating up on [her]186-irene back from behind a tree ; and as though [she]186-irene had breathed , the air was cooler , but down that cooler air came always the warm odour of the limes . Over [his]1745-the man of the world cigar [Dartie]187-dartie peered round at [Bosinney]168-bosinney , who was sitting with [his]168-bosinney arms crossed , staring straight in front of [him]168-bosinney , and on [his]168-bosinney face the look of [a man being tortured]1752-a man being tortured . And [Dartie]187-dartie thought : ' [Women]817-women ! ' The glow died above [the river]2706-the river , the singing ceased ; the young moon hid behind a tree , and all was dark . [He]187-dartie pressed [himself]187-dartie against [Irene]186-irene . [He]187-dartie was not alarmed at the shuddering that ran through the limbs [he]187-dartie touched , or at the troubled , scornful look of [her]186-irene eyes . [He]187-dartie felt [her]186-irene trying to draw [herself]186-irene away , and smiled . It must be confessed that [the man of [the world]2286-the world]1745-the man of the world had drunk quite as much as was good for [him]187-dartie . [They]1775-they strolled along toward [the cabs awaiting [them]1775-they at the farther end]1776-the cabs awaiting them at the farther end . "[187-dartie] [He]187-dartie drowned [Winifred]187-dartie 's rejoinder with fresh calls to [the Almighty]304-god ; nor was it until [they]1791-they reached [Barnes]117-barnes that [he]187-dartie ceased a Jeremiad , in the course of which [he]187-dartie had abused [her]558-his wife , [[her]558-his wife father]712-her father , [[her]558-his wife brother]451-her brother , [Irene]186-irene , [Bosinney]168-bosinney , the name of [Forsyte]183-george , [[his]187-dartie own children]827-his own children , and cursed the day when [he]187-dartie had ever married . [His]187-dartie angry eyes never deserted the back of [that cab]1782-that cab , which , like a lost chance , haunted the darkness in front of [him]187-dartie . [The Darties]366-the darties saw [Bosinney]168-bosinney spring out , and [Irene]186-irene follow , and hasten up the steps with bent head . [She]186-irene evidently had [her]186-irene key in [her]186-irene hand , for [she]186-irene disappeared at once . [The latter]2450-the latter came walking past [[their]1801-their cab]1805-their cab ; [both husband]1806-both husband and [wife]1721-wife had an admirable view of [his]168-bosinney face in the light of a street lamp . It was working with violent emotion . " Good - night , [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney ! "[187-dartie] called [Winifred]187-dartie . "[187-dartie] said [Dartie]187-dartie , " did [you]168-bosinney see the beast 's face ? What did [I]168-bosinney say ? Fine games ! "[168-bosinney] [He]168-bosinney improved the occasion . There had so clearly been a crisis in [the cab]2463-the cab that [Winifred]187-dartie was unable to defend [her]1721-wife theory . [She]1721-wife said : " [I]1721-wife shall say nothing about it . "[1721-wife] With that view [Dartie]187-dartie at once concurred ; looking upon [James]173-james as [a private preserve]1809-a private preserve , [he]187-dartie disapproved of [his]168-bosinney being disturbed by the troubles of [others]1283-others . " Quite right , "[168-bosinney] [he]168-bosinney said ; " let [Soames]171-soames look after [himself]171-soames . [He]171-soames 's jolly well able to ! "[168-bosinney] Thus speaking , [the Darties]366-the darties entered [[their]366-the darties habitat]1811-their habitat in [Green Street]109-green street , the rent of which was paid by [James]173-james , and sought a well - earned rest . The hour was midnight , and [no Forsytes]1812-no forsytes remained abroad in [the streets]2464-the streets to spy out [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's wanderings ; to see [him]168-bosinney return and stand against the rails of [the Square garden]1814-the square garden , back from the glow of the street lamp ; to see [him]168-bosinney stand there in the shadow of trees , watching [the house]2326-the house where in the dark was hidden [she]1816-she whom [he]168-bosinney would have given [the world to see]1817-the world to see for a single minute - [she]1816-she who was now to [him]168-bosinney the breath of the lime - trees , the meaning of the light and the darkness , the very beating of [his]168-bosinney own heart . CHAPTER X - DIAGNOSIS OF A FORSYTE It is in the nature of [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte to be ignorant that [he]168-bosinney is [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte ; but [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon was well aware of being one . [He]163-old jolyon had not known it till after the decisive step which had made [him]163-old jolyon [an outcast]1820-an outcast ; since then the knowledge had been with [him]163-old jolyon continually . [He]163-old jolyon felt it throughout [his]163-old jolyon alliance , throughout all [his]163-old jolyon dealings with [[his]163-old jolyon second wife]1821-his second wife , who was emphatically not [a Forsyte]171-soames . [He]163-old jolyon knew that if [he]163-old jolyon had not possessed in great measure the eye for what [he]163-old jolyon wanted , the tenacity to hold on to it , the sense of the folly of wasting that for which [he]163-old jolyon had given so big a price - in other words , the ' sense of property ' [he]163-old jolyon could never have retained [her]1821-his second wife perhaps never would have desired to retain [her]1821-his second wife with [him]163-old jolyon through all the financial troubles , slights , and misconstructions of those fifteen years ; never have induced [her]1821-his second wife to marry [him]163-old jolyon on the death of [[his]163-old jolyon first wife]1822-his first wife ; never have lived it all through , and come up , as it were , thin , but smiling . [He]163-old jolyon was [one of [those men who , seated cross - legged like miniature Chinese idols in the cages of [their]1824-those men who , seated cross - legged like miniature chinese idols in the cages of their own hearts own hearts]1824-those men who , seated cross - legged like miniature chinese idols in the cages of their own hearts]1823-one of those men who , seated cross - legged like miniature chinese idols in the cages of their own hearts , are ever smiling at [themselves]1824-those men who , seated cross - legged like miniature chinese idols in the cages of their own hearts a doubting smile . Not that this smile , so intimate and eternal , interfered with [his]163-old jolyon actions , which , like [his]163-old jolyon chin and [his]163-old jolyon temperament , were quite a peculiar blend of softness and determination . [He]163-old jolyon was conscious , too , of being [a Forsyte]171-soames in [his]163-old jolyon work , that painting of water - colours to which [he]163-old jolyon devoted so much energy , always with an eye on [himself]163-old jolyon , as though [he]163-old jolyon could not take so unpractical a pursuit quite seriously , and always with a certain queer uneasiness that [he]163-old jolyon did not make more money at it . It was , then , this consciousness of what it meant to be [a Forsyte]171-soames , that made [him]163-old jolyon receive the following letter from [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon , with a mixture of sympathy and disgust : ' [SHELDRAKE HOUSE]118-sheldrake house , ' [BROADSTAIRS]108-broadstairs , ' July 1 . ' [MY]0-i DEAR [JO]190-jo , ' [The Dad]223-dad 's handwriting had altered very little in the thirty odd years that [he]0-i remembered it . ' [We]1825-we have been [here]735-here now a fortnight , and have had good weather on the whole . The air is bracing , but [my]0-i liver is out of order , and [I]0-i shall be glad enough to get back to [town]656-town . [I]0-i can not say much for [June]166-june , [her]166-june health and spirits are very indifferent , and [I]0-i do n't see what is to come of it . [She]166-june says nothing , but it is clear that [she]166-june is harping on this engagement , which is an engagement and no engagement , and - goodness knows what . [I]0-i have grave doubts whether [she]166-june ought to be allowed to return to [London]2-london in the present state of affairs , but [she]166-june is so self - willed that [she]166-june might take it into [her]166-june head to come up at any moment . The fact is [someone]2710-someone ought to speak to [Bosinney]168-bosinney and ascertain what [he]168-bosinney means . [I]0-i 'm afraid of this [myself]0-i , for [I]0-i should certainly rap [him]168-bosinney over the knuckles , but [I]0-i thought that [you]1829-you , knowing [him]168-bosinney at [the Club]2302-the club , might put in a word , and get to ascertain what [the fellow]2355-the fellow is about . [You]1829-you will of course in no way commit [June]166-june . [I]0-i shall be glad to hear from [you]1829-you in the course of a few days whether [you]1829-you have succeeded in gaining any information . The situation is very distressing to [me]0-i , [I]0-i worry about it at night . With [my]0-i love to [Jolly]218-jolly and [Holly]220-holly . ' [I]0-i am , ' [Your]1829-you affect . [father]695-father , ' [JOLYON FORSYTE]165-old jolyon . ' [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon pondered this letter so long and seriously that [[his]167-young jolyon wife]558-his wife noticed [his]167-young jolyon preoccupation , and asked [him]167-young jolyon what was the matter . [He]167-young jolyon replied : " Nothing . "[167-young jolyon] It was a fixed principle with [him]167-young jolyon never to allude to [June]166-june . [She]558-his wife might take alarm , [he]167-young jolyon did not know what [she]558-his wife might think ; [he]167-young jolyon hastened , therefore , to banish from [his]167-young jolyon manner all traces of absorption , but in this [he]167-young jolyon was about as successful as [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father would have been , for [he]167-young jolyon had inherited all [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's transparency in matters of domestic finesse ; and [young Mrs. Jolyon]185-young mrs. jolyon , busying [herself]185-young mrs. jolyon over the affairs of [the house]2326-the house , went about with tightened lips , stealing at [him]167-young jolyon unfathomable looks . [He]167-young jolyon started for [the Club]2302-the club in the afternoon with the letter in [his]167-young jolyon pocket , and without having made up [his]167-young jolyon mind . To sound [a man]515-a man as to ' [his]515-a man intentions ' was peculiarly unpleasant to [him]167-young jolyon ; nor did [his]167-young jolyon own anomalous position diminish this unpleasantness . It was so like [[his]167-young jolyon family]2527-his family , so like [all the people [they]2527-his family knew and mixed with]1839-all the people they knew and mixed with , to enforce what [they]2527-his family called [their]2527-his family rights over [a man]515-a man , to bring [him]515-a man up to the mark ; so like [them]2527-his family to carry [their]2527-his family business principles into [their]2527-his family private relations . And how that phrase in the letter - ' [You]1841-you will , of course , in no way commit [June]166-june ' - gave the whole thing away . Yet the letter , with the personal grievance , the concern for [June]166-june , the ' rap over the knuckles , ' was all so natural . No wonder [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father wanted to know what [Bosinney]168-bosinney meant , no wonder [he]559-his father was angry . It was difficult to refuse ! But why give the thing to [him]167-young jolyon to do ? That was surely quite unbecoming ; but so long as [a Forsyte]166-june got what [he]167-young jolyon was after , [he]167-young jolyon was not too particular about the means , provided appearances were saved . How should [he]167-young jolyon set about it , or how refuse ? Both seemed impossible . So , [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon ! [He]167-young jolyon arrived at [the Club]2302-the club at three o'clock , and [the first person]1844-the first person [he]167-young jolyon saw was [Bosinney]168-bosinney [himself]168-bosinney , seated in a corner , staring out of the window . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon sat down not far off , and began nervously to reconsider [his]167-young jolyon position . [He]167-young jolyon looked covertly at [Bosinney]168-bosinney sitting there unconscious . [He]167-young jolyon did not know [him]168-bosinney very well , and studied [him]168-bosinney attentively for perhaps the first time ; [an unusual looking man]1845-an unusual looking man , unlike in dress , face , and manner to [most of [the other members of the Club]1847-the other members of the club]1846-most of the other members of the club - [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon [himself]167-young jolyon , however different [he]167-young jolyon had become in mood and temper , had always retained the neat reticence of Forsyte appearance . [He]167-young jolyon alone among [Forsytes]164-soames was ignorant of [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's nickname . [The man]2473-the man was unusual , not eccentric , but unusual ; [he]2473-the man looked worn , too , haggard , hollow in the cheeks beneath those broad , high cheekbones , though without any appearance of ill - health , for [he]2473-the man was strongly built , with curly hair that seemed to show all the vitality of a fine constitution . Something in [his]2473-the man face and attitude touched [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon . [He]167-young jolyon knew what suffering was like , and [this man]1414-this man looked as if [he]2473-the man were suffering . [He]167-young jolyon got up and touched [his]2473-the man arm . [Bosinney]168-bosinney started , but exhibited no sign of embarrassment on seeing who it was . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon sat down . " [I]167-young jolyon have n't seen [you]167-young jolyon for a long time , "[167-young jolyon] [he]167-young jolyon said . " How are [you]167-young jolyon getting on with [[[my]167-young jolyon cousin]4064-my cousin 's house]4065-my cousin 's house ? "[167-young jolyon] " It 'll be finished in about a week . "[167-young jolyon] " [I]167-young jolyon congratulate [you]167-young jolyon ! "[167-young jolyon] " Thanks - [I]167-young jolyon do n't know that it 's much of a subject for congratulation . "[167-young jolyon] " No ? "[167-young jolyon] queried [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon ; " [I]167-young jolyon should have thought [you]167-young jolyon 'd be glad to get a long job like that off [your]167-young jolyon hands ; but [I]167-young jolyon suppose [you]167-young jolyon feel it much as [I]167-young jolyon do when [I]167-young jolyon part with a picture - a sort of [child]579-child ? "[167-young jolyon] [He]167-young jolyon looked kindly at [Bosinney]168-bosinney . " Yes , "[2450-the latter] said [the latter]2450-the latter more cordially , " it goes out from [you]167-young jolyon and there 's an end of it . [I]2450-the latter did n't know [you]167-young jolyon painted . "[2450-the latter] " Only water - colours ; [I]167-young jolyon ca n't say [I]167-young jolyon believe in [my]167-young jolyon work . "[167-young jolyon] " And how do [you]167-young jolyon tell [them]4073-them , may [I]168-bosinney ask ? "[168-bosinney] said [Bosinney]168-bosinney . " By [their]4073-them sense of property . [A Forsyte]166-june takes a practical - one might say a commonsense - view of things , and a practical view of things is based fundamentally on a sense of property . [A Forsyte]166-june , [you]167-young jolyon will notice , never gives [himself]166-june away . "[168-bosinney] " Joking ? "[167-young jolyon] [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's eye twinkled . " Not much . As a Forsyte [myself]168-bosinney , [I]168-bosinney have no business to talk . But [I]168-bosinney 'm [a kind of thoroughbred mongrel]4074-a kind of thoroughbred mongrel ; now , there 's no mistaking [you]167-young jolyon : [You]167-young jolyon 're as different from [me]168-bosinney as [I]168-bosinney am from [[my]168-bosinney Uncle James , who is the perfect specimen of [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte]241-james . "[168-bosinney] " Ah ! "[168-bosinney] murmured [Bosinney]168-bosinney . " [You]0-i should patent the word . " "[1853-you] [You]1853-you talk of [them]1855-them , " said [Bosinney]168-bosinney , "[1853-you] as if [they]1855-them were half [England]12-england . Without Forsytes , who believe in none of these things , and habitats but turn [them]1855-them all to use , where should [we]1856-we be ? [[My]0-i dear sir]1857-my dear sir , [the Forsytes]164-soames are [the middlemen]1858-the middlemen , [the commercials]1859-the commercials , [the pillars of society]1860-the pillars of society , the cornerstones of convention ; everything that is admirable ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know whether [I]0-i catch [your]1853-you drift , " said [Bosinney]168-bosinney , "[0-i] but [I]0-i fancy there are plenty of [Forsytes]164-soames , as [you]1853-you call [them]1855-them , in [my]0-i profession . But [I]0-i 'm not laughing . It is dangerous to go against [the majority]1875-the majority and what [a majority]1876-a majority ! " [He]0-i fixed [his]0-i eyes on [Bosinney]168-bosinney : "[1876-a majority] It 's dangerous to let anything carry [you]1877-you away - [a house]689-a house , a picture , [a - woman]1879-a - woman ! " [They]4083-they looked at [each other]2556-each other . - And , as though [he]0-i had done that which [no Forsyte]241-james did - given [himself]0-i away , [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon drew into [his]167-young jolyon shell . [Bosinney]168-bosinney broke the silence . "[1876-a majority] Why do [you]1877-you take [[your]1877-you own people]1880-your own people as the type ? " said [he]168-bosinney . "[1877-you] [[My]0-i people]1881-my people , " replied [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon , "[1876-a majority] are not very extreme , and [they]1881-my people have [their]1881-my people own private peculiarities , like [every other family]1882-every other family , but [they]1881-my people possess in a remarkable degree those two qualities which are the real tests of [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte - the power of never being able to give [yourself]1884-yourself up to anything soul and body , and the ' sense of property ' . " [Bosinney]168-bosinney smiled : "[233-swithin] How about [the big one]1135-the big one , for instance ? " "[1135-the big one] Do [you]1877-you mean [Swithin]233-swithin ? " asked [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon . "[1877-you] Ah ! in [Swithin]233-swithin there 's something primeval still . [The town]1886-the town and middle - class life have n't digested [him]1887-he yet . All the old centuries of farm work and brute force have settled in [him]1887-he , and there [they]1888-they 've stuck , for all [he]1887-he 's so distinguished . " [Bosinney]168-bosinney seemed to ponder . "[1888-they] Well , [you]1877-you 've hit [[your]1877-you cousin]1039-your cousin [Soames]164-soames off to the life , " [he]168-bosinney said suddenly . "[1877-you] [He]164-soames 'll never blow [his]164-soames brains out . " [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon shot at [him]168-bosinney a penetrating glance . It 's easy to laugh , but do n't mistake [me]0-i . It does n't do to despise [a Forsyte]241-james ; it does n't do to disregard [them]1890-their ! " "[1877-you] Yet [you]1877-you 've done it [yourself]1877-you ! " [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon acknowledged the hit by losing [his]167-young jolyon smile . "[1877-you] [You]1877-you forget , " [he]0-i said with a queer pride , "[1877-you] [I]0-i can hold on , too - [I]0-i 'm a Forsyte [myself]0-i . [We]1891-we 're all in the path of [great forces]1892-great forces . [The man who leaves the shelter of the wall]1893-the man who leaves the shelter of the wall - well - [you]1877-you know what [I]0-i mean .
