" The colour rushed into [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's face , but soon receded , leaving it sallow - brown as before . [He]168-bosinney gave a short laugh , that left [his]168-bosinney lips fixed in a queer , fierce smile ; [his]168-bosinney eyes mocked [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon . "[0-i] Thanks , " [he]168-bosinney said . "[0-i] It 's deuced kind of [you]1877-you . But [you]1877-you 're not the only [chaps that can hold on]1895-chaps that can hold on . " [He]168-bosinney rose . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon looked after [him]168-bosinney as [he]168-bosinney walked away , and , resting [his]167-young jolyon head on [his]167-young jolyon hand , sighed . In [the drowsy , almost empty room]4085-the drowsy , almost empty room the only sounds were the rustle of newspapers , the scraping of matches being struck . [He]167-young jolyon stayed a long time without moving , living over again those days when [he]167-young jolyon , too , had sat long hours watching the clock , waiting for the minutes to pass - long hours full of the torments of uncertainty , and of a fierce , sweet aching ; and the slow , delicious agony of that season came back to [him]167-young jolyon with its old poignancy . The sight of [Bosinney]168-bosinney , with [his]168-bosinney haggard face , and [his]168-bosinney restless eyes always wandering to the clock , had roused in [him]167-young jolyon a pity , with which was mingled strange , irresistible envy . [He]167-young jolyon knew the signs so well . [Whither]367-whither was [he]167-young jolyon going - to what sort of fate ? What kind of woman was it who was drawing [him]167-young jolyon to [her]4086-her by that magnetic force which no consideration of honour , no principle , no interest could withstand ; from which the only escape was flight . Flight ! But why should [Bosinney]168-bosinney fly ? [A man]515-a man fled when [he]515-a man was in danger of destroying hearth and [home]436-home , when there were [children]568-children , when [he]515-a man felt [himself]515-a man trampling down ideals , breaking something . But here , so [he]167-young jolyon had heard , it was all broken to [his]167-young jolyon hand . [He]167-young jolyon [himself]167-young jolyon had not fled , nor would [he]167-young jolyon fly if it were all to come over again . Yet [he]167-young jolyon had gone further than [Bosinney]168-bosinney , had broken up [[his]167-young jolyon own unhappy home]4090-his own unhappy home , not [someone else]3348-someone else 's : And the old saying came back to [him]167-young jolyon : ' [A man]515-a man 's fate lies in [his]515-a man own heart . ' In [his]167-young jolyon own heart ! The proof of the pudding was in the eating - [Bosinney]168-bosinney had still to eat [his]168-bosinney pudding . [His]168-bosinney thoughts passed to [the woman]2805-the woman , [the woman whom [he]168-bosinney did not know , but the outline of whose story [he]168-bosinney had heard]4094-the woman whom he did not know , but the outline of whose story he had heard . An unhappy marriage ! No ill - treatment - only that indefinable malaise , that terrible blight which killed all sweetness under [Heaven]4095-heaven ; and so from day to day , from night to night , from week to week , from year to year , till death should end it . But [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon , the bitterness of whose own feelings time had assuaged , saw [Soames]164-soames ' side of the question too . Whence should [a man like [[his]4096-a man like his cousin , saturated with all the prejudices and beliefs of his class cousin]470-his cousin , saturated with all the prejudices and beliefs of [[his]4096-a man like his cousin , saturated with all the prejudices and beliefs of his class class]2502-his class]4096-a man like his cousin , saturated with all the prejudices and beliefs of his class , draw the insight or inspiration necessary to break up this life ? It was a question of imagination , of projecting [himself]4096-a man like his cousin , saturated with all the prejudices and beliefs of his class into the future beyond the unpleasant gossip , sneers , and tattle that followed on such separations , beyond the passing pangs that the lack of the sight of [her]470-his cousin would cause , beyond the grave disapproval of [the worthy]4099-the worthy . But [few men]4100-few men , and especially [few men of [Soames]164-soames ' class]4101-few men of soames ' class , had imagination enough for that . A deal of mortals in [this world]3111-this world , and not enough imagination to go round ! And sweet Heaven , what a difference between theory and practice ; [many [a man]515-a man , perhaps even [Soames]164-soames]4103-many a man , perhaps even soames , held chivalrous views on such matters , who when the shoe pinched found a distinguishing factor that made of [himself]164-soames an exception . Then , too , [he]164-soames distrusted [his]164-soames judgment . [He]164-soames had been through the experience [himself]164-soames , had tasted too the dregs the bitterness of an unhappy marriage , and how could [he]164-soames take the wide and dispassionate view of [those who had never been within sound of the battle]4105-those who had never been within sound of the battle ? [His]164-soames evidence was too first - hand - like the evidence on military matters of [a soldier who has been through much active service]4106-a soldier who has been through much active service , against that of [civilians who have not suffered the disadvantage of seeing things too close]4107-civilians who have not suffered the disadvantage of seeing things too close . [Most people]4108-most people would consider such a marriage as that of [Soames]164-soames and [Irene]186-irene quite fairly successful ; [he]164-soames had money , [she]186-irene had beauty ; it was a case for compromise . There was no reason why [they]4108-most people should not jog along , even if [they]4108-most people hated [each other]2556-each other . It would not matter if [they]4108-most people went [their]4108-most people own ways a little so long as the decencies were observed - the sanctity of the marriage tie , of [the common home]4110-the common home , respected . Half the marriages of [the upper classes]4111-the upper classes were conducted on these lines : Do not offend the susceptibilities of Society ; do not offend the susceptibilities of [the Church]4112-the church . To avoid offending these is worth the sacrifice of any private feelings . The advantages of [the stable home]4113-the stable home are visible , tangible , so many pieces of property ; there is no risk in the statu quo . To break up [a home]4114-a home is at the best a dangerous experiment , and selfish into the bargain . This was the case for the defence , and [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon sighed . ' The core of it all , ' [he]167-young jolyon thought , ' is property , but there are [many people who would not like it put that way]4115-many people who would not like it put that way . To [them]4115-many people who would not like it put that way it is "[1877-you] the sanctity of the marriage tie " ; but the sanctity of the marriage tie is dependent on the sanctity of [the family]450-the family , and the sanctity of [the family]450-the family is dependent on the sanctity of property . And yet [I]1877-you imagine all [these people]4118-these people are followers of One who never owned anything . It is curious ! And again [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon sighed . ' Am [I]1877-you going on [my]1877-you way [home]436-home to ask [any poor devils [I]1877-you meet]4120-any poor devils i meet to share [my]1877-you dinner , which will then be too little for [myself]1877-you , or , at all events , for [[my]1877-you wife]1017-my wife , who is necessary to [my]1877-you health and happiness ? It may be that after all [Soames]164-soames does well to exercise [his]164-soames rights and support by [his]164-soames practice the sacred principle of property which benefits [us]4122-us all , with the exception of [those who suffer by the process]4123-those who suffer by the process . ' And so [he]1877-you left [his]1877-you chair , threaded [his]1877-you way through the maze of seats , took [his]1877-you hat , and languidly up [the hot streets]4124-the hot streets crowded with carriages , reeking with dusty odours , wended [his]1877-you way [home]436-home . Before reaching [Wistaria Avenue]34-wistaria avenue [he]1877-you removed [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's letter from [his]1877-you pocket , and tearing it carefully into tiny pieces , scattered them in the dust of [the road]1291-the road . [He]1877-you let [himself]1877-you in with [his]1877-you key , and called [[his]1877-you wife]558-his wife 's name . But [she]558-his wife had gone out , taking [Jolly]218-jolly and [Holly]220-holly , and [the house]2326-the house was empty ; alone in [the garden]1015-the garden the dog [Balthasar]267-balthasar lay in the shade snapping at flies . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon took [his]167-young jolyon seat there , too , under the pear - tree that bore no fruit . [CHAPTER XI - BOSINNEY]368-chapter xi - bosinney ON PAROLE The day after the evening at [Richmond]24-richmond [Soames]164-soames returned from [Henley]114-henley by [a morning train]4130-a morning train . Not constitutionally interested in amphibious sports , [his]164-soames visit had been one of business rather than pleasure , a client of some importance having asked [him]164-soames down . [He]164-soames went straight to [the City]2392-the city , but finding things slack , [he]164-soames left at three o'clock , glad of this chance to get [home]436-home quietly . [Irene]186-irene did not expect [him]164-soames . Not that [he]164-soames had any desire to spy on [her]186-irene actions , but there was no harm in thus unexpectedly surveying the scene . After changing to Park clothes [he]164-soames went into [the drawing - room]849-the drawing - room . [She]186-irene was sitting idly in the corner of the sofa , [her]186-irene favourite seat ; and there were circles under [her]186-irene eyes , as though [she]186-irene had not slept . [He]164-soames asked : "[1877-you] How is it [you]1896-you 're in ? Are [you]1896-you expecting [somebody]543-somebody ? " "[543-somebody] Yes that is , not particularly . " "[543-somebody] Who ? " "[168-bosinney] [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney said [he]543-somebody might come . " "[168-bosinney] [Bosinney]168-bosinney . [He]543-somebody ought to be at work . " To this [she]186-irene made no answer . "[543-somebody] Well , " said [Soames]164-soames , "[0-i] [I]0-i want [you]1896-you to come out to [the Stores]1376-the stores with [me]0-i , and after that [we]1899-we 'll go to [the Park]120-the park . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't want to go out ; [I]0-i have a headache . " [Soames]164-soames replied : "[0-i] If ever [I]0-i want [you]1896-you to do anything , [you]1896-you 've always got a headache . It 'll do [you]1896-you good to come and sit under the trees . " [She]186-irene did not answer . [Soames]164-soames was silent for some minutes ; at last [he]164-soames said : "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know what [your]1896-you idea of [a wife]2821-a wife 's duty is . [I]0-i never have known ! " [He]164-soames had not expected [her]186-irene to reply , but [she]186-irene did . "[0-i] [I]0-i have tried to do what [you]0-i want ; it 's not [my]0-i fault that [I]0-i have n't been able to put [my]0-i heart into it . " "[0-i] Whose fault is it , then ? " [He]164-soames watched [her]186-irene askance . "[0-i] Before [we]1901-we were married [you]0-i promised to let [me]0-i go if [our]1901-we marriage was not a success . Is it a success ? " [Soames]164-soames frowned . "[0-i] Success , " [he]164-soames stammered - "[0-i] it would be a success if [you]1896-you behaved [yourself]1896-you properly ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i have tried , " said [Irene]186-irene . "[0-i] Will [you]0-i let [me]0-i go ? " [Soames]164-soames turned away . [Secretly]369-secretly alarmed , [he]164-soames took refuge in bluster . "[0-i] Let [you]1896-you go ? [You]1896-you do n't know what [you]1896-you 're talking about . Let [you]1896-you go ? How can [I]0-i let [you]1896-you go ? [We]1901-we 're married , are n't [we]1901-we ? Then , what are [you]1896-you talking about ? For [God]304-god 's sake , do n't let ['s]1901-we have any of this sort of nonsense ! Get [your]1896-you hat on , and come and sit in [the Park]531-the park . " "[0-i] Then , [you]0-i wo n't let [me]0-i go ? " [He]0-i felt [her]1896-you eyes resting on [him]0-i with a strange , touching look . "[0-i] Let [you]1896-you go ! " [he]0-i said ; "[0-i] and what on earth would [you]1896-you do with [yourself]1896-you if [I]0-i did ? [You]1896-you 've got no money ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i could manage somehow . " [He]0-i took a swift turn up and down [the room]488-the room ; then came and stood before [her]1896-you . "[0-i] Understand , " [he]0-i said , "[0-i] once and for all , [I]0-i wo n't have [you]1896-you say this sort of thing . Go and get [your]1896-you hat on ! " [She]1896-you did not move . "[1896-you] [I]0-i suppose , " said [Soames]164-soames , "[0-i] [you]1896-you do n't want to miss [Bosinney]316-james if [he]316-james comes ! " [Irene]186-irene got up slowly and left [the room]488-the room . [She]186-irene came down with [her]186-irene hat on . [They]4136-themselves went out . In [the Park]531-the park , the motley hour of mid - afternoon , when [foreigners]4138-foreigners and [other pathetic folk drive]4139-other pathetic folk drive , thinking [themselves]4136-themselves to be in fashion , had passed ; the right , the proper , hour had come , was nearly gone , before [Soames]164-soames and [Irene]186-irene seated [themselves]4136-themselves under the Achilles statue . It was some time since [he]164-soames had enjoyed [her]186-irene company in [the Park]531-the park . That was one of the past delights of the first two seasons of [his]164-soames married life , when to feel [himself]164-soames [the possessor of [this gracious creature]4142-this gracious creature before all [London]2-london]4141-the possessor of this gracious creature before all london had been [his]164-soames greatest , though secret , pride . How many afternoons had [he]164-soames not sat beside [her]186-irene , extremely neat , with light grey gloves and faint , supercilious smile , nodding to [acquaintances]3126-acquaintances , and now and again removing [his]164-soames hat . [His]164-soames light grey gloves were still on [his]164-soames hands , and on [his]164-soames lips [his]164-soames smile sardonic , but where the feeling in [his]164-soames heart ? The seats were emptying fast , but still [he]164-soames kept [her]186-irene there , silent and pale , as though to work out a secret punishment . Once or twice [he]164-soames made some comment , and [she]186-irene bent [her]186-irene head , or answered "[0-i] Yes " with a tired smile . Along the rails [a man]515-a man was walking so fast that [people]600-people stared after [him]515-a man when [he]515-a man passed . "[0-i] Look at that ass ! " said [Soames]164-soames ; "[0-i] [he]1903-he must be mad to walk like that in this heat ! " [He]164-soames turned ; [Irene]186-irene had made a rapid movement . "[1903-he] Hallo ! " [he]164-soames said : "[1903-he] it 's [[our]1904-our friend]1905-our friend [the Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer ! " And [he]164-soames sat still , with [his]164-soames sneering smile , conscious that [Irene]186-irene was sitting still , and smiling too . "[789-the buccaneer] Will [she]1907-you bow to [him]1903-he ? " [he]164-soames thought . But [she]186-irene made no sign . [Bosinney]168-bosinney reached the end of the rails , and came walking back amongst the chairs , quartering [his]168-bosinney ground like a pointer . When [he]168-bosinney saw [them]1904-our [he]168-bosinney stopped dead , and raised [his]168-bosinney hat . The smile never left [Soames]164-soames ' face ; [he]168-bosinney also took off [his]168-bosinney hat . [Bosinney]168-bosinney came up , looking exhausted , like [a man after hard physical exercise]4146-a man after hard physical exercise ; the sweat stood in drops on [his]168-bosinney brow , and [Soames]164-soames ' smile seemed to say : "[1907-you] [You]1907-you 've had a trying time , [[my]0-i friend]1908-my friend ...... What are [you]1907-you doing in [the Park]531-the park ? " [he]0-i asked . "[1907-you] [We]1910-we thought [you]1907-you despised such frivolity ! " [Bosinney]168-bosinney did not seem to hear ; [he]168-bosinney made [his]168-bosinney answer to [Irene]186-irene : "[1910-we] [I]0-i 've been round to [[your]1907-you place]1911-your place ; [I]0-i hoped [I]0-i should find [you]1907-you in . " [Somebody]543-somebody tapped [Soames]164-soames on the back , and spoke to [him]168-bosinney ; and in the exchange of those platitudes over [his]168-bosinney shoulder , [he]168-bosinney missed [her]543-somebody answer , and took a resolution . "[1910-we] [We]1910-we 're just going in , " [he]168-bosinney said to [Bosinney]168-bosinney ; "[1910-we] [you]1907-you 'd better come back to dinner with [us]1910-we . " Into that invitation [he]168-bosinney put a strange bravado , [a stranger pathos]4148-a stranger pathos : "[1907-you] [You]1907-you , ca n't deceive [me]0-i , " [his]0-i look and voice seemed saying , "[1907-you] but see - [I]0-i trust [you]1907-you - [I]0-i 'm not afraid of [you]1907-you ! " [They]1910-we started back to [Montpellier Square]8-montpellier square together , [Irene]186-irene between [them]1910-we . In [the crowded streets]4149-the crowded streets [Soames]164-soames went on in front . [He]164-soames did not listen to [their]1910-we conversation ; the strange resolution of trustfulness [he]164-soames had taken seemed to animate even [his]164-soames secret conduct . Like [a gambler]4150-a gambler , [he]164-soames said to [himself]164-soames : ' It 's a card [I]1912-i dare not throw away - [I]1912-i must play it for what it 's worth . [I]1912-i have not too many chances . ' [He]164-soames dressed slowly , heard [her]186-irene leave [[her]186-irene room]2872-her room and go [downstairs]3086-downstairs , and , for full five minutes after , dawdled about in [[his]164-soames dressing - room]3164-his dressing - room . Then [he]164-soames went down , purposely shutting the door loudly to show that [he]164-soames was coming . [He]164-soames found [them]4154-them standing by the hearth , perhaps talking , perhaps not ; [he]164-soames could not say . [He]164-soames played [his]164-soames part out in the farce , the long evening through - [his]164-soames manner to [[his]164-soames guest]4155-his guest more friendly than it had ever been before ; and when at last [Bosinney]168-bosinney went , [he]164-soames said : "[1912-i] [You]1912-i must come again soon ; [Irene]186-irene likes to have [you]1912-i to talk about [the house]2326-the house ! " Again [his]164-soames voice had the strange bravado and the stranger pathos ; but [his]164-soames hand was cold as ice . Loyal to [his]164-soames resolution , [he]164-soames turned away from [their]4154-them parting , turned away from [[his]164-soames wife]558-his wife as [she]558-his wife stood under the hanging lamp to say good - night - away from the sight of [her]558-his wife golden head shining so under the light , of [her]558-his wife smiling mournful lips ; away from the sight of [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's eyes looking at [her]558-his wife , so like a dog 's looking at its master . And [he]164-soames went to bed with the certainty that [Bosinney]168-bosinney was in love with [[his]164-soames wife]558-his wife . The summer night was hot , so hot and still that through every opened window came in but hotter air . For long hours [he]164-soames lay listening to [her]558-his wife breathing . [She]558-his wife could sleep , but [he]164-soames must lie awake . And , lying awake , [he]164-soames hardened [himself]164-soames to play the part of [the serene and trusting husband]4158-the serene and trusting husband . In the small hours [he]164-soames slipped out of bed , and passing into [[his]164-soames dressing - room]3164-his dressing - room , leaned by the open window . [He]164-soames could hardly breathe . A night four years ago came back to [him]164-soames - the night but one before [his]164-soames marriage ; as hot and stifling as this . [He]164-soames remembered how [he]164-soames had lain in a long cane chair in the window of [[his]164-soames sitting - room]4160-his sitting - room off [Victoria Street]121-victoria street . Down below in [a side street]4161-a side street [a man]515-a man had banged at a door , [a woman]3436-a woman had cried out ; [he]164-soames remembered , as though it were now , the sound of the scuffle , the slam of the door , the dead silence that followed . And then the early water - cart , cleansing the reek of [the streets]2464-the streets , had approached through the strange - seeming , useless lamp - light ; [he]164-soames seemed to hear again its rumble , nearer and nearer , till it passed and slowly died away . [He]164-soames leaned far out of the dressing - room window over [the little court below]3166-the little court below , and saw the first light spread . The outlines of dark walls and roofs were blurred for a moment , then came out sharper than before . [He]164-soames remembered how that other night [he]164-soames had watched the lamps paling all the length of [Victoria Street]121-victoria street ; how [he]164-soames had hurried on [his]164-soames clothes and gone down into [the street]2964-the street , down past [houses]2315-houses and [squares]4168-squares , to [the street where [she]3436-a woman was staying]4169-the street where she was staying , and there had stood and looked at the front of [the little house]4170-the little house , as still and grey as the face of [a dead man]4171-a dead man . And suddenly it shot through [his]164-soames mind ; like [a sick man]4172-a sick man 's fancy : What 's [he]164-soames doing ? - [that fellow who haunts [me]186-irene , who was here this evening , who 's in love with [[my]186-irene wife]1017-my wife - prowling out there , perhaps , looking for [her]3436-a woman as [I]186-irene know [he]164-soames was looking for [her]3436-a woman this afternoon ; watching [[my]186-irene house]4175-my house]4173-that fellow who haunts me , who was here this evening , who 's in love with my wife - prowling out there , perhaps , looking for her as i know he was looking for her this afternoon ; watching my house now , for all [I]186-irene can tell ! [He]164-soames stole across [the landing]4176-the landing to the front of [the house]2326-the house , stealthily drew aside a blind , and raised a window . The grey light clung about the trees of [the square]846-the square , as though Night , like a great downy moth , had brushed them with [her]3436-a woman wings . The lamps were still alight , all pale , but not a soul stirred - no living thing in sight . Yet suddenly , very faint , far off in the deathly stillness , [he]164-soames heard a cry writhing , like the voice of some wandering soul barred out of heaven , and crying for [its]4179-its happiness . There it was again - again ! [Soames]164-soames shut the window , shuddering . Then [he]164-soames thought : ' Ah ! it 's only the peacocks , across [the water]4180-the water . ' CHAPTER XII - [JUNE PAYS SOME CALLS Jolyon]370-june stood in [the narrow hall]3900-the narrow hall at [Broadstairs]108-broadstairs , inhaling that odour of oilcloth and herrings which permeates all respectable [seaside lodging - houses]4182-seaside lodging - houses . On a chair - a shiny leather chair , displaying its horsehair through a hole in the top left - hand corner - stood a black despatch case . This [he]164-soames was filling with papers , with the Times , and a bottle of Eau - de Cologne . [He]164-soames had meetings that day of the ' Globular Gold Concessions ' and the ' New Colliery Company , Limited , ' to which [he]164-soames was going up , for [he]164-soames never missed a Board ; to ' miss a Board ' would be one more piece of evidence that [he]164-soames was growing old , and this [his]164-soames jealous Forsyte spirit could not bear . [His]164-soames eyes , as [he]164-soames filled that black despatch case , looked as if at any moment they might blaze up with anger . So gleams the eye of [a schoolboy]4183-a schoolboy , baited by [a ring of [[his]164-soames companions]4185-his companions]4184-a ring of his companions ; but [he]164-soames controls [himself]164-soames , deterred by the fearful odds against [him]164-soames . And [old Jolyon]370-june controlled [himself]370-june , keeping down , with [his]164-soames masterful restraint now slowly wearing out , the irritation fostered in [him]164-soames by the conditions of [his]164-soames life . [He]164-soames had received from [[his]164-soames son]2441-his son an unpractical letter , in which by rambling generalities [the boy]2442-the boy seemed trying to get out of answering a plain question . ' [I]186-irene 've seen [Bosinney]168-bosinney , ' [he]164-soames said ; ' [he]168-bosinney is not [a criminal]4188-a criminal . The more [I]186-irene see of [people]600-people the more [I]186-irene am convinced that [they]600-people are never good or bad - merely comic , or pathetic . [You]2441-his son probably do n't agree with [me]186-irene ! ' [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon did not ; [he]163-old jolyon considered it cynical to so express [oneself]4190-oneself ; [he]163-old jolyon had not yet reached that point of old age when even [Forsytes]164-soames , bereft of those illusions and principles which [they]600-people have cherished carefully for practical purposes but never believed in , bereft of all corporeal enjoyment , stricken to the very heart by having nothing left to hope for - break through the barriers of reserve and say things [they]600-people would never have believed [themselves]600-people capable of saying . Perhaps [he]163-old jolyon did not believe in ' goodness ' and ' badness ' any more than [[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son ; but as [he]163-old jolyon would have said : [He]163-old jolyon did n't know - could n't tell ; there might be something in it ; and why , by an unnecessary expression of disbelief , deprive [yourself]2441-his son of possible advantage ? Accustomed to spend [his]163-old jolyon holidays among [the mountains]4192-the mountains , though like [a true Forsyte]891-a true forsyte [he]163-old jolyon had never attempted anything too adventurous or too foolhardy , [he]163-old jolyon had been passionately fond of [them]4192-the mountains . And when the wonderful view mentioned in [Baedeker]371-baedeker - ' fatiguing but repaying ' - was disclosed to [him]163-old jolyon after the effort of the climb , [he]163-old jolyon had doubtless felt the existence of some great , dignified principle crowning the chaotic strivings , the petty precipices , and ironic little dark chasms of life . This was as near to religion , perhaps , as [his]163-old jolyon practical spirit had ever gone . But it was many years since [he]163-old jolyon had been to [the mountains]4192-the mountains . [He]163-old jolyon had taken [June]370-june [there]454-there two seasons running , after [[his]163-old jolyon wife]558-his wife died , and had realized bitterly that [his]163-old jolyon walking days were over . To [that old mountain]4197-that old mountain - given confidence in a supreme order of things [he]163-old jolyon had long been [a stranger]4198-a stranger . [He]163-old jolyon knew [himself]163-old jolyon to be old , yet [he]163-old jolyon felt young ; and this troubled [him]163-old jolyon . It troubled and puzzled [him]163-old jolyon , too , to think that [he]163-old jolyon , who had always been so careful , should be [father]695-father and [grandfather to such as seemed born to disaster]4200-grandfather to such as seemed born to disaster . [He]163-old jolyon had nothing to say against [Jo]190-jo - who could say anything against [the boy]2442-the boy , [an amiable chap]2497-an amiable chap ? - but [his]163-old jolyon position was deplorable , and this business of [June]370-june 's nearly as bad . It seemed like a fatality , and a fatality was one of those things [no man]3485-no man of [his]163-old jolyon character could either understand or put up with . In writing to [[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son [he]163-old jolyon did not really hope that anything would come of it . Since the ball at [Roger]352-roger 's [he]163-old jolyon had seen too clearly how [the land]2525-the land lay - [he]163-old jolyon could put two and two together quicker than [most men]2547-most men - and , with the example of [[his]163-old jolyon own son]3000-his own son before [his]163-old jolyon eyes , knew better than any Forsyte of [them]4208-them all that the pale flame singes [men]550-men 's wings whether [they]550-men will or no . In the days before [June]370-june 's engagement , when [she]370-june and [Mrs. Soames]177-soames were always together , [he]163-old jolyon had seen enough of [Irene]186-irene to feel the spell [she]186-irene cast over [men]550-men . [She]186-irene was not [a flirt]4211-a flirt , not even [a coquette]4212-a coquette - words dear to the heart of [[his]163-old jolyon generation]4213-his generation , which loved to define things by a good , broad , inadequate word - but [she]186-irene was dangerous . [He]163-old jolyon could not say why . Tell [him]163-old jolyon of a quality innate in [some women]4214-some women - a seductive power beyond [their]4214-some women own control ! [He]163-old jolyon would but answer : ' [Humbug]324-humbug ! ' [She]186-irene was dangerous , and there was an end of it . [He]163-old jolyon wanted to close [his]163-old jolyon eyes to that affair . If it was , it was ; [he]163-old jolyon did not want to hear any more about it - [he]163-old jolyon only wanted to save [June]370-june 's position and [her]370-june peace of mind . [He]163-old jolyon still hoped [she]186-irene might once more become a comfort to [himself]163-old jolyon . And so [he]163-old jolyon had written . [He]163-old jolyon got little enough out of the answer . As to what [young Jolyon]370-june had made of the interview , there was practically only the queer sentence : ' [I]186-irene gather that [he]163-old jolyon 's in [the stream]4215-the stream . ' [The stream]4215-the stream ! [What stream]4217-what stream ? What was this new - fangled way of talking ? [He]163-old jolyon sighed , and folded the last of the papers under the flap of the bag ; [he]163-old jolyon knew well enough what was meant . [June]370-june came out of [the dining - room]2449-the dining - room , and helped [him]163-old jolyon on with [his]163-old jolyon summer coat . From [her]370-june costume , and the expression of [her]370-june little resolute face , [he]163-old jolyon saw at once what was coming . "[186-irene] [I]0-i 'm going with [you]1914-you , " [she]370-june said . "[0-i] Nonsense , [[my]0-i dear]2282-my dear ; [I]0-i go straight into [the City]2392-the city . [I]0-i ca n't have [you]1914-you racketting about ! " "[1914-you] [I]0-i must see [old Mrs. Smeech]372-old mrs. smeech . " "[372-old mrs. smeech] Oh , [your]1914-you precious ' lame ducks ! " grumbled out [old Jolyon]370-june . [He]163-old jolyon did not believe [her]370-june excuse , but ceased [his]163-old jolyon opposition . There was no doing anything with that pertinacity of [hers]370-june . At [Victoria]334-victoria [he]163-old jolyon put [her]1914-you into [the carriage which had been ordered for [himself]163-old jolyon]4219-the carriage which had been ordered for himself - a characteristic action , for [he]163-old jolyon had no petty selfishnesses . "[372-old mrs. smeech] Now , do n't [you]1914-you go tiring [yourself]1914-you , [[my]0-i darling]1160-my darling , " [he]163-old jolyon said , and took [a cab]2536-a cab on into [the city]2392-the city . [June]370-june went first to [a back - street in [Paddington]124-paddington]4222-a back - street in paddington , where [Mrs. Smeech]372-old mrs. smeech , [her]372-old mrs. smeech ' lame duck , ' lived - [an aged person]4223-an aged person , connected with the charring interest ; but after half an hour spent in hearing [her]370-june habitually lamentable recital , and dragooning [her]370-june into temporary comfort , [she]370-june went on to [Stanhope Gate]1-stanhope gate . [The great house]4224-the great house was closed and dark . [She]370-june had decided to learn something at all costs . It was better to face the worst , and have it over . And this was [her]370-june plan : To go first to [[Phil]168-bosinney 's aunt]4225-phil 's aunt , [Mrs. Baynes]203-mrs. baynes , and , failing information there , to [Irene]186-irene [herself]186-irene . [She]370-june had no clear notion of what [she]370-june would gain by these visits . At three o'clock [she]370-june was in [Lowndes Square]73-lowndes square . With [a woman]3436-a woman 's instinct when trouble is to be faced , [she]370-june had put on [her]370-june best frock , and went to the battle with a glance as courageous as [old Jolyon]370-june 's itself . [Her]370-june tremors had passed into eagerness . [Mrs. Baynes]203-mrs. baynes , [[Bosinney]168-bosinney 's aunt]4227-bosinney 's aunt [Louisa]373-louisa was [her]4227-bosinney 's aunt name , was in [[her]4227-bosinney 's aunt kitchen]4228-her kitchen when [June]370-june was announced , organizing [the cook]4229-the cook , for [she]370-june was [an excellent housewife]4230-an excellent housewife , and , as [Baynes]203-mrs. baynes always said , there was ' a lot in a good dinner . ' [He]168-bosinney did [his]168-bosinney best work after dinner . ' On hearing [June]370-june 's name , [she]370-june went hurriedly to [[her]370-june bedroom]4232-her bedroom , and , taking two large bracelets from a red morocco case in a locked drawer , put them on [her]370-june white wrists - for [she]370-june possessed in a remarkable degree that ' sense of property , ' which , as [we]4233-we know , is the touchstone of Forsyteism , and the foundation of good morality . [Her]370-june figure , of medium height and broad build , with a tendency to embonpoint , was reflected by the mirror of [her]370-june whitewood wardrobe , in a gown made under [her]370-june own organization , of one of those half - tints , reminiscent of the distempered walls of corridors in [large hotels]4234-large hotels . [She]370-june raised [her]370-june hands to [her]370-june hair , which [she]370-june wore a la Princesse de Galles , and touched it here and there , settling it more firmly on [her]370-june head , and [her]370-june eyes were full of an unconscious realism , as though [she]370-june were looking in the face one of life 's sordid facts , and making the best of it . In youth [her]370-june cheeks had been of cream and roses , but they were mottled now by middle - age , and again that hard , ugly directness came into [her]370-june eyes as [she]370-june dabbed a powder - puff across [her]370-june forehead . Putting the puff down , [she]370-june stood quite still before the glass , arranging a smile over [her]370-june high , important nose , [her]370-june , chin , never large , and now growing smaller with the increase of [her]370-june neck , [her]370-june thin - lipped , down - drooping mouth . Quickly , not to lose the effect , [she]370-june grasped [her]370-june skirts strongly in both hands , and went [downstairs]3086-downstairs . [She]370-june had been hoping for this visit for some time past . [Whispers]374-whispers had reached [her]370-june that things were not all right between [[her]370-june nephew]4236-her nephew and [[his]4236-her nephew fiancee]2674-his fiancee . [Neither of [them]4239-them]1667-neither of them had been near [her]370-june for weeks . [She]370-june had asked [Phil]168-bosinney to dinner many times ; [his]168-bosinney invariable answer had been ' Too busy . ' [Her]370-june instinct was alarmed , and the instinct in such matters of [this excellent woman]4240-this excellent woman was keen . [She]370-june ought to have been [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte ; in [young Jolyon]370-june 's sense of the word , [she]370-june certainly had that privilege , and merits description as such . [She]370-june had married off [[her]370-june three daughters]4242-her three daughters in a way that [people]600-people said was beyond [their]600-people deserts , for [they]4242-her three daughters had the professional plainness only to be found , as a rule , among [the female kind of the more legal callings]4244-the female kind of the more legal callings . [Her]370-june name was upon the committees of [numberless charities connected with the Church]4245-numberless charities connected with the church - dances , theatricals , or bazaars - and [she]370-june never lent [her]370-june name unless sure beforehand that everything had been thoroughly organized . [She]370-june believed , as [she]370-june often said , in putting things on a commercial basis ; the proper function of [the Church]4112-the church , of charity , indeed , of everything , was to strengthen the fabric of ' Society . ' Individual action , therefore , [she]370-june considered immoral . Organization was the only thing , for by organization alone could [you]4247-you feel sure that [you]4247-you were getting a return for [your]4247-you money . Organization - and again , organization ! And there is no doubt that [she]370-june was what [old Jolyon]370-june called [her]370-june - "[1914-you] a ' dab ' at that " - [he]4248-he went further , [he]4248-he called [her]370-june "[1914-you] a humbug . " The enterprises to which [she]370-june lent [her]370-june name were organized so admirably that by the time the takings were handed over , [they]4249-they were indeed skim milk divested of all cream of human kindness . But as [she]370-june often justly remarked , sentiment was to be deprecated . [She]370-june was , in fact , a little academic . [This great and good woman , so highly thought of in ecclesiastical circles]4250-this great and good woman , so highly thought of in ecclesiastical circles , was [one of [the principal priestesses in [the temple of Forsyteism]4253-the temple of forsyteism]4252-the principal priestesses in the temple of forsyteism , keeping alive day and night a sacred flame to [the God of [Property]125-property]4254-the god of property , whose altar is inscribed with those inspiring words : ' Nothing for nothing , and really remarkably little for sixpence]4251-one of the principal priestesses in the temple of forsyteism , keeping alive day and night a sacred flame to the god of property , whose altar is inscribed with those inspiring words : ' nothing for nothing , and really remarkably little for sixpence . ' When [she]370-june entered [a room]3907-a room it was felt that something substantial had come in , which was probably the reason of [her]370-june popularity as [a patroness]4256-a patroness . [People]600-people liked something substantial when [they]600-people had paid money for it ; and [they]600-people would look at [her]370-june - surrounded by [[her]370-june staff]4258-her staff in [charity ballrooms]4259-charity ballrooms , with [her]370-june high nose and [her]370-june broad , square figure , attired in an uniform covered with sequins - as though [she]370-june were [a general]4260-a general . The only thing against [her]370-june was that [she]370-june had not a double name . [She]370-june was a power in upper middle - class society , with its hundred sets and circles , all intersecting on the common battlefield of charity functions , and on that battlefield brushing skirts so pleasantly with the skirts of Society with the capital ' S. ' [She]370-june was a power in society with the smaller 's , ' that larger , more significant , and more powerful body , where the commercially Christian institutions , maxims , and ' principle , ' which [Mrs. Baynes]203-mrs. baynes embodied , were real life - blood , circulating freely , real business currency , not merely the sterilized imitation that flowed in the veins of smaller Society with the larger ' S. And [Mrs. Baynes]203-mrs. baynes , too , shrewdly recognized that behind the uncompromising frankness of [June]370-june 's manner there was much of [the Forsyte]241-james . If [the girl]595-the girl had been merely frank and courageous , [Mrs. Baynes]203-mrs. baynes would have thought [her]595-the girl ' cranky , ' and despised [her]595-the girl ; if [she]595-the girl had been merely [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte , like [Francie]317-roger - let [us]4271-us say - [she]203-mrs. baynes would have patronized [her]595-the girl from sheer weight of metal ; but [June]370-june , small though [she]370-june was - [Mrs. Baynes]203-mrs. baynes habitually admired quantity - gave [her]370-june an uneasy feeling ; and [she]203-mrs. baynes placed [her]370-june in a chair opposite the light . A change came over [Mrs. Baynes]203-mrs. baynes . [She]203-mrs. baynes rose too ; [her]203-mrs. baynes lips twitched , [she]203-mrs. baynes fidgeted [her]203-mrs. baynes hands . Something was evidently very wrong , and [she]203-mrs. baynes did not dare to ask [this girl]4285-this girl , who stood there , a slim , straight little figure , with [her]4285-this girl decided face , [her]4285-this girl set jaw , and resentful eyes . [She]203-mrs. baynes was not accustomed to be afraid of asking question 's - all organization was based on the asking of questions ! But the issue was so grave that [her]203-mrs. baynes nerve , normally strong , was fairly shaken ; only that morning [[her]203-mrs. baynes husband]2635-her husband had said : "[0-i] [Old Mr. Forsyte]171-soames must be worth well over a hundred thousand pounds ! " And [this girl]4285-this girl stood there , holding out [her]4285-this girl hand - holding out [her]4285-this girl hand ! The chance might be slipping away - [she]203-mrs. baynes could n't tell - the chance of keeping [her]4285-this girl in [the family]450-the family , and yet [she]203-mrs. baynes dared not speak . [Her]203-mrs. baynes eyes followed [June]370-june to the door . It closed . Then with an exclamation [Mrs. Baynes]203-mrs. baynes ran forward , wobbling [her]203-mrs. baynes bulky frame from side to side , and opened it again . Too late ! [She]203-mrs. baynes heard the front door click , and stood still , an expression of real anger and mortification on [her]203-mrs. baynes face . [June]370-june went along [the Square]126-the square with [her]370-june bird - like quickness . [She]370-june detested [that woman]624-that woman now whom in happier days [she]370-june had been accustomed to think so kind . Was [she]370-june always to be put off thus , and forced to undergo this torturing suspense ? [She]370-june would go to [Phil]168-bosinney [himself]168-bosinney , and ask [him]168-bosinney what [he]168-bosinney meant . [She]370-june had the right to know . [She]370-june hurried on down [Sloane Street]56-sloane street till [she]370-june came to [[Bosinney]168-bosinney 's number]4290-bosinney 's number . Passing the swing - door at the bottom , [she]370-june ran up [the stairs]4291-the stairs , [her]370-june heart thumping painfully . At the top of [the third flight]4292-the third flight [she]370-june paused for breath , and holding on to [the bannisters]4293-the bannisters , stood listening . No sound came from above . With a very white face [she]370-june mounted [the last flight]4294-the last flight . [She]370-june saw the door , with [his]168-bosinney name on the plate . And the resolution that had brought [her]370-june so far evaporated . The full meaning of [her]370-june conduct came to [her]370-june . [She]370-june felt hot all over ; the palms of [her]370-june hands were moist beneath the thin silk covering of [her]370-june gloves . [She]370-june drew back to the stairs , but did not descend . Leaning against the rail [she]370-june tried to get rid of a feeling of being choked ; and [she]370-june gazed at the door with a sort of dreadful courage . No ! [she]370-june refused to go down . Did it matter what [people]600-people thought of [her]370-june ? [They]600-people would never know ! [No one]514-no one would help [her]370-june if [she]370-june did not help [herself]370-june ! [She]370-june would go through with it . Forcing [herself]370-june , therefore , to leave the support of the wall , [she]370-june rang the bell . The door did not open , and all [her]370-june shame and fear suddenly abandoned [her]370-june ; [she]370-june rang again and again , as though in spite of its emptiness [she]370-june could drag some response out of [that closed room]4297-that closed room , some recompense for the shame and fear that visit had cost [her]370-june . It did not open ; [she]370-june left off ringing , and , sitting down at [the top of the stairs]4298-the top of the stairs , buried [her]370-june face in [her]370-june hands . Presently [she]370-june stole down , out into the air . [She]370-june felt as though [she]370-june had passed through a bad illness , and had no desire now but to get [home]436-home as quickly as [she]370-june could . [The people [she]370-june met]4300-the people she met seemed to know where [she]370-june had been , what [she]370-june had been doing ; and suddenly - over on the opposite side , going towards [[his]4301-his rooms]2613-his rooms from [the direction of [Montpellier Square]8-montpellier square]4303-the direction of montpellier square - [she]370-june saw [Bosinney]168-bosinney [himself]168-bosinney . [She]370-june made a movement to cross into [the traffic]4304-the traffic . [Their]4305-their eyes met , and [he]168-bosinney raised [his]168-bosinney hat . [An omnibus]4306-an omnibus passed , obscuring [her]370-june view ; then , from the edge of [the pavement]2865-the pavement , through a gap in the traffic , [she]370-june saw [him]168-bosinney walking on . And [June]370-june stood motionless , looking after [him]168-bosinney . CHAPTER XIII - [PERFECTION OF [THE HOUSE]2326-the house]4308-perfection of the house ' One mockturtle , clear ; one oxtail ; two glasses of port . ' In [the upper room]4310-the upper room at [French 's]127-french 's , where [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte could still get heavy English food , [James]241-james and [[his]241-james son]2441-his son were sitting down to lunch . Of all eating - places [James]241-james liked best to come [here]735-here ; there was something unpretentious , well - flavoured , and filling about it , and though [he]241-james had been to a certain extent corrupted by the necessity for being fashionable , and the trend of habits keeping pace with an income that would increase , [he]241-james still hankered in [quiet City]4314-quiet city moments after the tasty fleshpots of [his]241-james earlier days . Here [you]4315-you were served by [hairy English waiters]4316-hairy english waiters in aprons ; there was sawdust on the floor , and three round gilt looking - glasses hung just above the line of sight . [They]4316-hairy english waiters had only recently done away with the cubicles , too , in which [you]4315-you could have [your]4315-you chop , [prime chump]4317-prime chump , with a floury - potato , without seeing [[your]4315-you neighbours]4318-your neighbours , like [a gentleman]1029-a gentleman . [He]241-james tucked the top corner of [his]241-james napkin behind the third button of [his]241-james waistcoat , a practice [he]241-james had been obliged to abandon years ago in [the West End]4320-the west end . [He]241-james felt that [he]241-james should relish [his]241-james soup - the entire morning had been given to winding up [the estate of [an old friend]4322-an old friend]4321-the estate of an old friend . After filling [his]241-james mouth with household bread , stale , [he]241-james at once began : "[171-soames] How are [you]1925-you going down to [Robin Hill]53-robin hill ? [You]1925-you going to take [Irene]186-irene ? [You]1925-you 'd better take [her]186-irene . [I]0-i should think there 'll be a lot that 'll want seeing to . " Without looking up , [Soames]171-soames answered : "[186-irene] [She]186-irene wo n't go . " "[186-irene] Wo n't go ? What 's the meaning of that ? [She]186-irene 's going to live in [the house]2326-the house , is n't [she]186-irene ? " [Soames]171-soames made no reply . "[186-irene] [I]0-i do n't know what 's coming to [women]817-women nowadays , " mumbled [James]241-james ; "[0-i] [I]0-i never used to have any trouble with [them]817-women . [She]186-irene 's had too much liberty . [She]186-irene 's spoiled .... " [Soames]171-soames lifted [his]171-soames eyes : "[0-i] [I]0-i wo n't have anything said against [her]186-irene , " [he]171-soames said unexpectedly . The silence was only broken now by the supping of [James]241-james 's soup . [The waiter]3983-the waiter brought the two glasses of port , but [Soames]171-soames stopped [him]3983-the waiter . "[0-i] That 's not the way to serve port , " [he]171-soames said ; "[0-i] take [them]1928-them away , and bring the bottle . " Rousing [himself]241-james from [his]241-james reverie over the soup , [James]241-james took one of [his]241-james rapid shifting surveys of surrounding facts . "[0-i] [[Your]1929-you mother]2307-your mother 's in bed , " [he]0-i said ; "[0-i] [you]1929-you can have [the carriage]2416-the carriage to take [you]1929-you down . [I]0-i should think [Irene'd]243-irene'd like the drive . [This young Bosinney'll]1932-this young bosinney'll be there , [I]0-i suppose , to show [you]1929-you over . " [Soames]171-soames nodded . "[1932-this young bosinney'll] [I]0-i should like to go and see for [myself]0-i what sort of a job [he]1932-this young bosinney'll 's made finishing off , " pursued [James]241-james . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll just drive round and pick [you]1929-you both up . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am going down by [train]1337-train , " replied [Soames]171-soames . "[0-i] If [you]1929-you like to drive round and see , [Irene]186-irene might go with [you]1929-you , [I]0-i ca n't tell . " [He]0-i signed to [the waiter]3983-the waiter to bring the bill , which [James]241-james paid . [They]4325-they parted at [St. Paul 's]58-st. paul 's , [Soames]171-soames branching off to [the station]2335-the station , [James]241-james taking [[his]241-james omnibus]4327-his omnibus westwards . [He]241-james had secured the corner seat next the conductor , where [his]241-james long legs made it difficult for [anyone]879-anyone to get in , and at all who passed [him]241-james [he]241-james looked resentfully , as if [they]4329-they had no business to be using up [his]241-james air . [He]0-i intended to take an opportunity this afternoon of speaking to [Irene]186-irene . A word in time saved nine ; and now that [she]186-irene was going to live in [the country]2374-the country there was a chance for [her]186-irene to turn over a new leaf ! [He]0-i could see that [Soames]171-soames would n't stand very much more of [her]186-irene goings on ! It did not occur to [him]0-i to define what [he]0-i meant by [her]186-irene ' goings on ' ; the expression was wide , vague , and suited to [a Forsyte]171-soames . And [James]241-james had more than [his]241-james common share of courage after lunch . On reaching [home]436-home , [he]241-james ordered out [the barouche]4332-the barouche , with special instructions that [the groom]4333-the groom was to go too . [He]241-james wished to be kind to [her]186-irene , and to give [her]186-irene every chance . When the door of No.62 was opened [he]241-james could distinctly hear [her]186-irene singing , and said so at once , to prevent any chance of being denied entrance . Yes , [Mrs. Soames]177-soames was in , but [the maid]2855-the maid did not know if [she]2855-the maid was seeing [people]600-people . [James]241-james , moving with the rapidity that ever astonished the observers of [his]241-james long figure and absorbed expression , went forthwith into [the drawing - room]849-the drawing - room without permitting this to be ascertained . [He]241-james found [Irene]186-irene seated at the piano with [her]186-irene hands arrested on the keys , evidently listening to the voices in [the hall]2543-the hall . [She]186-irene greeted [him]241-james without smiling . "[0-i] [[Your]1934-your mother - in - law]1935-your mother - in - law 's in bed , " [he]241-james began , hoping at once to enlist [her]186-irene sympathy . "[0-i] [I]0-i 've got [the carriage]2416-the carriage [here]735-here . Now , be [a good girl]974-a good girl , and put on [your]1934-your hat and come with [me]0-i for a drive . It 'll do [you]1934-your good ! " [Irene]186-irene looked at [him]241-james as though about to refuse , but , seeming to change [her]186-irene mind , went [upstairs]2967-upstairs , and came down again with [her]186-irene hat on . "[0-i] Where are [you]0-i going to take [me]0-i ? " [she]186-irene asked . "[0-i] [We]1939-we 'll just go down to [Robin Hill]53-robin hill , " said [James]241-james , spluttering out [his]241-james words very quick ; "[0-i] the horses want exercise , and [I]0-i should like to see what [they]1940-they 've been doing down there . " [Irene]186-irene hung back , but again changed [her]186-irene mind , and went out to [the carriage]2416-the carriage , [James]241-james brooding over [her]186-irene closely , to make quite sure . It was not before [he]241-james had got [her]186-irene more than half way that [he]241-james began : "[0-i] [Soames]177-soames is very fond of [you]0-i - [he]1941-he wo n't have anything said against [you]0-i ; why do n't [you]0-i show [him]1941-he more affection ? " [Irene]186-irene flushed , and said in a low voice : "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't show what [I]0-i have n't got . " [James]241-james looked at [her]186-irene sharply ; [he]241-james felt that now [he]241-james had [her]186-irene in [[his]241-james own carriage]4340-his own carriage , with [[his]241-james own horses]4341-his own horses and [servants]2819-servants , [he]241-james was really in command of the situation . [She]186-irene could not put [him]241-james off ; nor would [she]186-irene make a scene in public . "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't think what [you]0-i 're about , " [he]0-i said . "[0-i] [He]1942-he 's [a very good husband]1943-a very good husband ! " [Irene]186-irene 's answer was so low as to be almost inaudible among the sounds of traffic . [He]0-i caught the words : "[1942-he] [You]0-i are not married to [him]1942-he ! " "[1942-he] What 's that got to do with it ? [He]1942-he 's given [you]0-i everything [you]0-i want . [He]1942-he 's always ready to take [you]0-i anywhere , and now [he]1942-he 's built [you]0-i [this house in [the country]2374-the country]1944-this house in the country . It 's not as if [you]0-i had anything of [your]0-i own . " "[1942-he] No . " Again [James]241-james looked at [her]186-irene ; [he]241-james could not make out the expression on [her]186-irene face . [She]186-irene looked almost as if [she]186-irene were going to cry , and yet .... "[1942-he] [I]0-i 'm sure , " [he]241-james muttered hastily , "[0-i] [we]1946-we 've all tried to be kind to [you]0-i . " [Irene]186-irene 's lips quivered ; to [his]241-james dismay [James]241-james saw a tear steal down [her]186-irene cheek . [He]241-james felt a choke rise in [his]241-james own throat . "[1946-we] [We]1946-we 're all fond of [you]0-i , " [he]241-james said , "[1946-we] if [you]0-i 'd only " - [he]241-james was going to say , "[1946-we] behave [yourself]0-i , " but changed it to - "[0-i] if [you]0-i 'd only be more of [a wife to [him]1948-him]1947-a wife to him . " [Irene]186-irene did not answer , and [James]241-james , too , ceased speaking . There was something in [her]186-irene silence which disconcerted [him]241-james ; it was not the silence of obstinacy , rather that of acquiescence in all that [he]241-james could find to say . And yet [he]241-james felt as if [he]241-james had not had the last word . [He]241-james could not understand this . [He]241-james was unable , however , to long keep silence . "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose that [young Bosinney]168-bosinney , " [he]241-james said , "[168-bosinney] will be getting married to [June]370-june now ? " [Irene]186-irene 's face changed . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know , " [she]186-irene said ; "[370-june] [you]0-i should ask [her]370-june . " "[370-june] Does [she]370-june write to [you]0-i ? " No . "[370-june] How 's that ? " said [James]241-james . "[370-june] [I]0-i thought [you]0-i and [she]370-june were [such great friends]1949-such great friends . " [Irene]186-irene turned on [him]241-james . "[370-june] Again , " [she]186-irene said , "[370-june] [you]0-i should ask [her]370-june ! " "[370-june] Well , " flustered [James]241-james , frightened by [her]186-irene look , "[370-june] it 's very odd that [I]0-i ca n't get a plain answer to a plain question , but there it is . " [He]241-james sat ruminating over [his]241-james rebuff , and burst out at last : "[0-i] Well , [I]0-i 've warned [you]0-i . [You]0-i wo n't look ahead . Soames [he]1950-he does n't say much , but [I]0-i can see [he]1950-he wo n't stand a great deal more of this sort of thing . [You]0-i 'll have [nobody]2292-nobody but [yourself]0-i to blame , and , what 's more , [you]0-i 'll get no sympathy from [anybody]2303-anybody . " [Irene]186-irene bent [her]186-irene head with a little smiling bow . "[0-i] [I]0-i am very much obliged to [you]0-i . " [James]241-james did not know what [on earth]4343-on earth to answer . The bright hot morning had changed slowly to a grey , oppressive afternoon ; a heavy bank of clouds , with the yellow tinge of coming thunder , had risen in the south , and was creeping up . The branches of the trees dropped motionless across [the road]1291-the road without the smallest stir of foliage . A faint odour of glue from the heated horses clung in the thick air ; [the coachman]2776-the coachman and [groom]4346-groom , rigid and unbending , exchanged stealthy murmurs on the box , without ever turning [their]4347-they heads . To [James]241-james ' great relief [they]4347-they reached [the house]2326-the house at last ; the silence and impenetrability of [this woman by [his]241-james side]4349-this woman by his side , whom [he]241-james had always thought so soft and mild , alarmed [him]241-james . [The carriage]2416-the carriage put [them]4347-they down at the door , and [they]4347-they entered . [The hall]2543-the hall was cool , and so still that it was like passing into [a tomb]4352-a tomb ; a shudder ran down [James]241-james 's spine . [He]241-james quickly lifted the heavy leather curtains between the columns into [the inner court]3571-the inner court . [He]241-james could not restrain an exclamation of approval . The decoration was really in excellent taste . The dull ruby tiles that extended from the foot of the walls to the verge of a circular clump of tall iris plants , surrounding in turn a sunken basin of white marble filled with water , were obviously of the best quality . [He]241-james admired extremely the purple leather curtains drawn along one entire side , framing a huge white - tiled stove . The central partitions of the skylight had been slid back , and the warm air from outside penetrated into [the very heart of [the house]2326-the house]4354-the very heart of the house . [He]241-james stood , [his]241-james hands behind [him]241-james , [his]241-james head bent back on [his]241-james high , narrow shoulders , spying the tracery on the columns and the pattern of the frieze which ran round the ivory - coloured walls under [the gallery]4356-the gallery . Evidently , no pains had been spared . It was quite [the house of [a gentleman]1029-a gentleman]4357-the house of a gentleman . [He]241-james went up to the curtains , and , having discovered how they were worked , drew them asunder and disclosed [the picture - gallery]4359-the picture - gallery , ending in a great window taking up the whole end of [the room]488-the room . [It]4359-the picture - gallery had a black oak floor , and [its]4359-the picture - gallery walls , again , were of ivory white . [He]241-james went on throwing open doors , and peeping in . Everything was in apple - pie order , ready for immediate occupation . [He]241-james turned round at last to speak to [Irene]186-irene , and saw [her]186-irene standing over in [the garden]1015-the garden entrance , with [[her]186-irene husband]2635-her husband and [Bosinney]168-bosinney . Though not remarkable for sensibility , [James]241-james felt at once that something was wrong . [He]241-james went up to [them]1953-you , and , vaguely alarmed , ignorant of the nature of the trouble , made an attempt to smooth things over . "[0-i] How are [you]1953-you , [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney ? " [he]241-james said , holding out [his]241-james hand . "[1953-you] [You]1953-you 've been spending money pretty freely down here , [I]0-i should say ! " [Soames]177-soames turned [his]0-i back , and walked away . [James]241-james looked from [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's frowning face to [Irene]186-irene , and , in [his]0-i agitation , spoke [his]0-i thoughts aloud : "[0-i] Well , [I]0-i ca n't tell what 's the matter . [Nobody]2292-nobody tells [me]0-i anything ! " And , making off after [[his]241-james son]2441-his son , [he]241-james heard [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's short laugh , and [his]168-bosinney "[2292-nobody] Well , thank [God]304-god ! [You]1953-you look so .... " Most unfortunately [he]241-james lost the rest . What had happened ? [He]241-james glanced back . [Irene]186-irene was very close to [the architect]2700-the architect , and [her]186-irene face not like the face [he]241-james knew of [her]186-irene . [He]241-james hastened up to [[his]241-james son]2441-his son . [Soames]177-soames was pacing [the picture - gallery]4359-the picture - gallery . "[1953-you] What 's the matter ? " said [James]241-james . "[1953-you] What 's all this ? " [Soames]177-soames looked at [him]241-james with [his]241-james supercilious calm unbroken , but [James]241-james knew well enough that [he]241-james was violently angry . "[1905-our friend] [[Our]1955-we friend]1905-our friend , " [he]241-james said , "[1905-our friend] has exceeded [his]1905-our friend instructions again , that 's all . So much the worse for [him]1905-our friend this time . " [He]241-james turned round and walked back towards the door . [James]241-james followed hurriedly , edging [himself]241-james in front . [He]241-james saw [Irene]186-irene take [her]186-irene finger from before [her]186-irene lips , heard [her]186-irene say something in [her]186-irene ordinary voice , and began to speak before [he]241-james reached [them]1955-we . "[1905-our friend] There 's a storm coming on . [We]1955-we 'd better get [home]436-home . [We]1955-we ca n't take [you]1905-our friend , [I]0-i suppose , [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney ? No , [I]0-i suppose not . Then , good - bye ! " [He]241-james held out [his]241-james hand . [Bosinney]168-bosinney did not take it , but , turning with a laugh , said : "[171-soames] Good - bye , [Mr. Forsyte]171-soames . Do n't get caught in the storm ! " and walked away . "[171-soames] Well , " began [James]241-james , "[171-soames] [I]0-i do n't know .... " But the ' sight of [Irene]186-irene 's face stopped [him]241-james . Taking hold of [[his]241-james daughter - in - law]816-his daughter - in - law by the elbow , [he]241-james escorted [her]186-irene towards [the carriage]2416-the carriage . [He]241-james felt certain , quite certain , [they]1955-we had been making some appointment or other .... Nothing in [this world]3111-this world is more sure to upset [a Forsyte]171-soames than the discovery that something on which [he]171-soames has stipulated to spend a certain sum has cost more . And this is reasonable , for upon the accuracy of [his]171-soames estimates the whole policy of [his]171-soames life is ordered . If [he]171-soames can not rely on definite values of property , [his]171-soames compass is amiss ; [he]171-soames is adrift upon bitter waters without a helm . After writing to [Bosinney]168-bosinney in the terms that have already been chronicled , [Soames]171-soames had dismissed the cost of [the house]2326-the house from [his]241-james mind . [He]241-james believed that [he]241-james had made the matter of the final cost so very plain that the possibility of its being again exceeded had really never entered [his]241-james head . On hearing from [Bosinney]168-bosinney that [his]241-james limit of twelve thousand pounds would be exceeded by something like four hundred , [he]241-james had grown white with anger . [His]241-james original estimate of the cost of [the house]2326-the house completed had been ten thousand pounds , and [he]241-james had often blamed [himself]241-james severely for allowing [himself]241-james to be led into repeated excesses . Over this last expenditure , however , [Bosinney]168-bosinney had put [himself]168-bosinney completely in the wrong . How on earth [a fellow]3986-a fellow could make such an ass of [himself]3986-a fellow [Soames]171-soames could not conceive ; but [he]241-james had done so , and all the rancour and hidden jealousy that had been burning against [him]241-james for so long was now focussed in rage at this crowning piece of extravagance . The attitude of [the confident and friendly husband]4373-the confident and friendly husband was gone . To preserve property - [[his]241-james wife]558-his wife - [he]241-james had assumed it , to preserve property of another kind [he]241-james lost it now . "[0-i] Ah ! " [he]241-james had said to [Bosinney]168-bosinney when [he]241-james could speak , "[0-i] and [I]0-i suppose [you]1958-you 're perfectly contented with [yourself]1958-you . But [I]0-i may as well tell [you]1958-you that [you]1958-you 've altogether mistaken [[your]1958-you man]1959-your man ! " What [he]241-james meant by those words [he]241-james did not quite know at the time , but after dinner [he]241-james looked up the correspondence between [himself]241-james and [Bosinney]168-bosinney to make quite sure . There could be no two opinions about it - [the fellow]2355-the fellow had made [himself]2355-the fellow liable for that extra four hundred , or , at all events , for three hundred and fifty of it , and [he]2355-the fellow would have to make it good . [He]241-james was looking at [[his]241-james wife]558-his wife 's face when [he]241-james came to this conclusion . Seated in [her]558-his wife usual seat on the sofa , [she]558-his wife was altering the lace on a collar . [She]558-his wife had not once spoken to [him]241-james all the evening . [He]241-james went up to the mantelpiece , and contemplating [his]241-james face in the mirror said : "[1958-you] [[Your]1958-you friend]1960-your friend [the Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer has made a fool of [himself]1960-your friend ; [he]1960-your friend will have to pay for it ! " [She]558-his wife looked at [him]241-james scornfully , and answered : "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know what [you]1960-your friend are talking about ! " "[1958-you] [You]1958-you soon will . A mere trifle , quite beneath [your]1958-you contempt - four hundred pounds . " "[1960-your friend] Do [you]1960-your friend mean that [you]1960-your friend are going to make [him]1960-your friend pay that towards [this hateful , house]1962-this hateful , house ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i do . " "[0-i] And [you]1960-your friend know [he]1960-your friend 's got nothing ? " "[1960-your friend] Yes . " "[1960-your friend] Then [you]1958-you are meaner than [I]0-i thought [you]1958-you . " [Soames]171-soames turned from the mirror , and unconsciously taking a china cup from the mantelpiece , clasped [his]171-soames hands around it as though praying . [He]171-soames saw [her]1958-you bosom rise and fall , [her]1958-you eyes darkening with anger , and taking no notice of the taunt , [he]171-soames asked quietly : "[1958-you] Are [you]1958-you carrying on a flirtation with [Bosinney]168-bosinney ? " "[1958-you] No , [I]0-i am not ! " [Her]1958-you eyes met [his]171-soames , and [he]171-soames looked away . [He]171-soames neither believed nor disbelieved [her]1958-you , but [he]171-soames knew that [he]171-soames had made a mistake in asking ; [he]171-soames never had known , never would know , what [she]1958-you was thinking . The sight of [her]1958-you inscrutable face , the thought of all the hundreds of evenings [he]171-soames had seen [her]1958-you sitting there like that soft and passive , but unreadable , unknown , enraged [him]171-soames beyond measure . "[0-i] [I]0-i believe [you]1958-you are made of stone , " [he]171-soames said , clenching [his]171-soames fingers so hard that [he]171-soames broke the fragile cup . The pieces fell into the grate . And [Irene]186-irene smiled . "[0-i] [You]0-i seem to forget , " [she]186-irene said , "[0-i] that cup is not ! " [Soames]171-soames gripped [her]186-irene arm . "[0-i] A good beating , " [he]171-soames said , "[0-i] is the only thing that would bring [you]1958-you to [your]1958-you senses , " but turning on [his]171-soames heel , [he]171-soames left [the room]488-the room . CHAPTER XIV - [SOAMES]171-soames SITS ON [THE STAIRS]4291-the stairs [Soames]171-soames went [upstairs]2967-upstairs that night that [he]171-soames had gone too far . [He]171-soames was prepared to offer excuses for [his]171-soames words . [He]171-soames turned out the gas still burning in [the passage outside [[their]4381-their room]4382-their room]4380-the passage outside their room . [Pausing]375-pausing , with [his]171-soames hand on the knob of the door , [he]171-soames tried to shape [his]171-soames apology , for [he]171-soames had no intention of letting [her]1958-you see that [he]171-soames was nervous . But the door did not open , nor when [he]171-soames pulled it and turned the handle firmly . [She]1958-you must have locked it for some reason , and forgotten . Entering [[his]171-soames dressing - room]3164-his dressing - room where the gas was also light and burning low , [he]171-soames went quickly to the other door . That too was locked . Then [he]171-soames noticed that the camp bed which [he]171-soames occasionally used was prepared , and [his]171-soames sleeping - suit laid out upon [it]4384-it . [He]171-soames put [his]171-soames hand up to [his]171-soames forehead , and brought it away wet . It dawned on [him]171-soames that [he]171-soames was barred out . [He]171-soames went back to the door , and rattling the handle stealthily , called : "[0-i] Unlock the door , do [you]1963-you hear ? Unlock the door ! " There was a faint rustling , but no answer . "[1963-you] Do [you]1963-you hear ? Let [me]0-i in at once - [I]0-i insist on being let in ! " [He]171-soames could catch the sound of [her]1958-you breathing close to the door , like the breathing of [a creature threatened by danger]4385-a creature threatened by danger . There was something terrifying in this inexorable silence , in the impossibility of getting at [her]1958-you . [He]171-soames went back to the other door , and putting [his]171-soames whole weight against it , tried to burst it open . The door was a new one - [he]171-soames had had them renewed [himself]171-soames , in readiness for [their]4386-their coming in after the honeymoon . In a rage [he]171-soames lifted [his]171-soames foot to kick in the panel ; the thought of [the servants]2817-the servants restrained [him]171-soames , and [he]171-soames felt suddenly that [he]171-soames was beaten . Flinging [himself]171-soames down in [the dressing - room]4388-the dressing - room , [he]171-soames took up a book . But instead of the print [he]171-soames seemed to see [[his]171-soames wife]558-his wife - with [her]558-his wife yellow hair flowing over [her]558-his wife bare shoulders , and [her]558-his wife great dark eyes - standing like an animal at bay . And the whole meaning of [her]558-his wife act of revolt came to [him]171-soames . [She]558-his wife meant it to be for good . [He]171-soames could not sit still , and went to the door again . [He]171-soames could still hear [her]558-his wife , and [he]171-soames called : "[186-irene] [Irene]186-irene ! [Irene]186-irene ! " [He]171-soames did not mean to make [his]171-soames voice pathetic . In ominous answer , the faint sounds ceased . [He]171-soames stood with clenched hands , thinking . Presently [he]171-soames stole round on tiptoe , and running suddenly at the other door , made a supreme effort to break it open . It creaked , but did not yield . [He]171-soames sat down on the stairs and buried [his]171-soames face in [his]171-soames hands . For a long time [he]171-soames sat there in the dark , the moon through the skylight above laying a pale smear which lengthened slowly towards [him]171-soames down [the stairway]4390-the stairway . [He]171-soames tried to be philosophical . Since [she]558-his wife had locked [her]558-his wife doors [she]558-his wife had no further claim as [a wife]2821-a wife , and [he]171-soames would console [himself]171-soames with [other women]4392-other women . It was but a spectral journey [he]171-soames made among such delights - [he]171-soames had no appetite for these exploits . [He]171-soames had never had much , and [he]171-soames had lost the habit . [He]171-soames felt that [he]171-soames could never recover it . [His]171-soames hunger could only be appeased by [[his]171-soames wife]558-his wife , inexorable and frightened , behind these shut doors . [No other woman]4394-no other woman could help [him]171-soames . This conviction came to [him]171-soames with terrible force out there in the dark . [His]171-soames philosophy left [him]171-soames ; and surly anger took its place . [Her]558-his wife conduct was immoral , inexcusable , worthy of any punishment within [his]171-soames power . [He]171-soames desired [no one]514-no one but [her]558-his wife , and [she]558-his wife refused [him]171-soames ! [She]558-his wife must really hate [him]171-soames , then ! [He]171-soames had never believed it yet . [He]171-soames did not believe it now . It seemed to [him]171-soames incredible . [He]171-soames felt as though [he]171-soames had lost for ever [his]171-soames power of judgment . If [she]558-his wife , so soft and yielding as [he]171-soames had always judged [her]558-his wife , could take this decided step - what could not happen ? Then [he]171-soames asked [himself]171-soames again if [she]558-his wife were carrying on an intrigue with [Bosinney]168-bosinney . [He]171-soames did not believe that [she]558-his wife was ; [he]171-soames could not afford to believe such a reason for [her]558-his wife conduct - the thought was not to be faced . It would be unbearable to contemplate the necessity of making [his]171-soames marital relations public property . Short of the most convincing proofs [he]171-soames must still refuse to believe , for [he]171-soames did not wish to punish [himself]171-soames . And all the time at heart - [he]171-soames did believe . The moonlight cast a greyish tinge over [his]171-soames figure , hunched against the staircase wall . [Bosinney]168-bosinney was in love with [her]558-his wife ! [He]171-soames hated [the fellow]2355-the fellow , and would not spare [him]168-bosinney now . [He]171-soames could and would refuse to pay a penny piece over twelve thousand and fifty pounds - the extreme limit fixed in the correspondence ; or rather [he]171-soames would pay , [he]171-soames would pay and sue [him]168-bosinney for damages . [He]171-soames would go to [Jobling]376-jobling and [Boulter]377-boulter and put the matter in [their]4397-their hands . [He]171-soames would ruin [the impecunious beggar]4398-the impecunious beggar ! And suddenly - though what connection between the thoughts ? - [he]171-soames reflected that [Irene]186-irene had no money either . [They]4397-their were both [beggars]4399-beggars . This gave [him]171-soames a strange satisfaction . The silence was broken by a faint creaking through the wall . [She]558-his wife was going to bed at last . Ah ! Joy and pleasant dreams ! If [she]558-his wife threw the door open wide [he]171-soames would not go in now ! But [his]171-soames lips , that were twisted in a bitter smile , twitched ; [he]171-soames covered [his]171-soames eyes with [his]171-soames hands .... It was late the following afternoon when [Soames]171-soames stood in the dining - room window gazing gloomily into [the Square]846-the square . The sunlight still showered on the plane - trees , and in the breeze [their]4397-their gay broad leaves shone and swung in rhyme to a barrel organ at the corner . [It]4401-it was playing a waltz , an old waltz that was out of fashion , with a fateful rhythm in the notes ; and it went on and on , though nothing indeed but leaves danced to the tune . [The woman]2805-the woman did not look too gay , for [she]2805-the woman was tired ; and from [the tall houses]4403-the tall houses [no one]514-no one threw [her]2805-the woman down coppers . [She]2805-the woman moved the organ on , and three doors off began again . It was the waltz [they]4397-their had played at [Roger]317-roger 's when [Irene]186-irene had danced with [Bosinney]168-bosinney ; and the perfume of the gardenias [she]2805-the woman had worn came back to [Soames]171-soames , drifted by the malicious music , as it had been drifted to [him]171-soames then , when [she]2805-the woman passed , [her]2805-the woman hair glistening , [her]2805-the woman eyes so soft , drawing [Bosinney]168-bosinney on and on down [an endless ballroom]4405-an endless ballroom . [The organ woman]4406-the organ woman plied [her]4406-the organ woman handle slowly ; [she]2805-the woman had been grinding [her]2805-the woman tune all day - grinding it in [Sloane Street]56-sloane street hard by , grinding it perhaps to [Bosinney]168-bosinney [himself]168-bosinney . [Soames]171-soames turned , took a cigarette from the carven box , and walked back to the window . The tune had mesmerized [him]171-soames , and there came into [his]171-soames view [Irene]186-irene , [her]186-irene sunshade furled , hastening homewards down [the Square]846-the square , in a soft , rose - coloured blouse with drooping sleeves , that [he]171-soames did not know . [She]186-irene stopped before the organ , took out [her]186-irene purse , and gave [the woman]2805-the woman money . [Soames]171-soames shrank back and stood where [he]171-soames could see into [the hall]2543-the hall . [She]186-irene came in with [her]186-irene latch - key , put down [her]186-irene sunshade , and stood looking at [herself]186-irene in the glass . [Her]186-irene cheeks were flushed as if the sun had burned them ; [her]186-irene lips were parted in a smile . [She]186-irene stretched [her]186-irene arms out as though to embrace [herself]186-irene , with a laugh that for all [the world]2286-the world was like a sob . [Soames]171-soames stepped forward . "[186-irene] Very - pretty ! " [he]171-soames said . But as though shot [she]186-irene spun round , and would have passed [him]171-soames up the stairs . [He]171-soames barred the way . "[186-irene] Why such a hurry ? " [he]171-soames said , and [his]171-soames eyes fastened on a curl of hair fallen loose across [her]186-irene ear .... [He]171-soames hardly recognised [her]186-irene . [She]186-irene seemed on fire , so deep and rich the colour of [her]186-irene cheeks , [her]186-irene eyes , [her]186-irene lips , and of the unusual blouse [she]186-irene wore . [She]186-irene put up [her]186-irene hand and smoothed back the curl . [She]186-irene was breathing fast and deep , as though [she]186-irene had been running , and with every breath perfume seemed to come from [her]186-irene hair , and from [her]186-irene body , like perfume from an opening flower .
