"[186-irene] [I]0-i do n't like that blouse , " [he]171-soames said slowly , "[0-i] it 's a soft , shapeless thing ! " [He]171-soames lifted [his]171-soames finger towards [her]186-irene breast , but [she]186-irene dashed [his]171-soames hand aside . "[186-irene] Do n't touch [me]0-i ! " [she]186-irene cried . [He]171-soames caught [her]186-irene wrist ; [she]186-irene wrenched it away . "[186-irene] And where may [you]0-i have been ? " [he]171-soames asked . "[186-irene] In [heaven]4095-heaven - out of [this house]752-this house ! " With those words [she]186-irene fled [upstairs]2967-upstairs . Outside - in thanksgiving - at the very door , [the organ - grinder]4412-the organ - grinder was playing the waltz . And [Soames]171-soames stood motionless . What prevented [him]171-soames from following [her]186-irene ? Was it that , with the eyes of faith , [he]171-soames saw [Bosinney]168-bosinney looking down from that high window in [Sloane Street]56-sloane street , straining [his]171-soames eyes for yet another glimpse of [Irene]186-irene 's vanished figure , cooling [his]171-soames flushed face , dreaming of the moment when [she]186-irene flung [herself]186-irene on [his]171-soames breast - the scent of [her]186-irene still in the air around , and the sound of [her]186-irene laugh that was like a sob ? PART III CHAPTER I - [MRS . MACANDER]378-mrs. macander 'S EVIDENCE [Many people]4413-many people , no doubt , including [the editor of the ' Ultra Vivisectionist]4414-the editor of the ' ultra vivisectionist , ' then in the bloom of its first youth , would say that [Soames]171-soames was less than [a man]515-a man not to have removed the locks from [[his]171-soames wife]558-his wife 's doors , and , after beating [her]186-irene soundly , resumed wedded happiness . Brutality is not so deplorably diluted by humaneness as it used to be , yet [a sentimental segment of [the population]4418-the population]4417-a sentimental segment of the population may still be relieved to learn that [he]171-soames did none of these things . For active brutality is not popular with [Forsytes]1598-forsytes ; [they]1598-forsytes are too circumspect , and , on the whole , too softhearted . And in [Soames]171-soames there was some common pride , not sufficient to make [him]171-soames do a really generous action , but enough to prevent [his]171-soames indulging in an extremely mean one , except , perhaps , in very hot blood . Above all this [a true Forsyte]171-soames refused to feel [himself]171-soames ridiculous . Short of actually beating [[his]171-soames wife]558-his wife , [he]171-soames perceived nothing to be done ; [he]171-soames therefore accepted the situation without another word . Throughout the summer and autumn [he]171-soames continued to go to [the office]2902-the office , to sort [his]171-soames pictures , and ask [[his]171-soames friends]850-his friends to dinner . [He]171-soames did not leave [town]656-town ; [Irene]186-irene refused to go away . [The house at [Robin Hill]53-robin hill]3372-the house at robin hill , finished though [it]3372-the house at robin hill was , remained empty and ownerless . [Soames]171-soames had brought a suit against [the Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer , in which [he]171-soames claimed from [him]171-soames the sum of three hundred and fifty pounds . [A firm of solicitors]4426-a firm of solicitors , [Messrs. Freak and Able]4427-messrs. freak and able , had put in a defence on [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's behalf . Admitting the facts , [they]4426-a firm of solicitors raised a point on the correspondence which , divested of legal phraseology , amounted to this : To speak of ' a free hand in the terms of this correspondence ' is an Irish bull . By a chance , fortuitous but not improbable in the close borough of legal circles , a good deal of information came to [Soames]171-soames ' ear anent this line of policy , [the working partner in [[his]171-soames firm]4429-his firm]4428-the working partner in his firm , [Bustard]242-bustard , happening to sit next at dinner at [Walmisley 's]128-walmisley 's , [the Taxing Master]4430-the taxing master , to [young Chankery]379-young chankery , of [the Common Law Bar]4431-the common law bar . The necessity for talking what is known as ' [shop]4432-shop , ' which comes on [all lawyers]4433-all lawyers with the removal of [the ladies]828-the ladies , caused [Chankery]379-young chankery , [a young and promising advocate]4435-a young and promising advocate , to propound an impersonal conundrum to [[his]379-young chankery neighbour]4436-his neighbour , whose name [he]379-young chankery did not know , for , seated as [he]379-young chankery permanently was in the background , [Bustard]242-bustard had practically no name . [He]379-young chankery had , said [Chankery]379-young chankery , a case coming on with a ' ve ry nice point . ' [He]379-young chankery then explained , preserving every professional discretion , the riddle in [Soames]171-soames ' case . [Everyone]3678-everyone , [he]379-young chankery said , to whom [he]379-young chankery had spoken , thought it a nice point . The issue was small unfortunately , ' though d - - d serious for [[his]379-young chankery client]3646-his client [he]379-young chankery believed ' - [Walmisley]128-walmisley 's 's champagne was bad but plentiful . [A Judge]4439-a judge would make short work of it , [he]379-young chankery was afraid . [He]379-young chankery intended to make a big effort - the point was a nice one . What did [[his]379-young chankery neighbour]4436-his neighbour say ? [Bustard]242-bustard , [a model of secrecy]4441-a model of secrecy , said nothing . [He]242-bustard related the incident to [Soames]171-soames however with some malice , for [this quiet man]4442-this quiet man was capable of human feeling , ending with [his]4442-this quiet man own opinion that the point was ' a very nice one . ' In accordance with [his]4442-this quiet man resolve , [[our]4443-our [Forsyte]171-soames]4444-our forsyte had put [his]4442-this quiet man interests into the hands of [Jobling]376-jobling and [Boulter]377-boulter . From the moment of doing so [he]4442-this quiet man regretted that [he]4442-this quiet man had not acted for [himself]4442-this quiet man . On receiving a copy of [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's defence [he]4442-this quiet man went over to [[their]4445-their offices]4446-their offices . [Boulter]377-boulter , who had the matter in hand , [Jobling]376-jobling having died some years before , told [him]4442-this quiet man that in [his]377-boulter opinion it was rather a nice point ; [he]377-boulter would like [counsel]4447-counsel 's opinion on it . [Soames]171-soames told [him]4442-this quiet man to go to [a good man]4448-a good man , and [they]4445-their went to [Waterbuck]381-waterbuck , Q.C. , marking [him]4442-this quiet man ten and one , who kept the papers six weeks and then wrote as follows : ' In [my]186-irene opinion the true interpretation of this correspondence depends very much on the intention of [the parties]4449-the parties , and will turn upon the evidence given at the trial . [I]186-irene am of opinion that an attempt should be made to secure from [the architect]2700-the architect an admission that [he]2700-the architect understood [he]2700-the architect was not to spend at the outside more than twelve thousand and fifty pounds . With regard to the expression , "[186-irene] a free hand in the terms of this correspondence , " to which [my]186-irene attention is directed , the point is a nice one ; but [I]186-irene am of opinion that upon the whole the ruling in "[186-irene] Boileau v. [The Blasted Cement Co. , Ltd.]1966-the blasted cement co. , ltd. , " will apply . ' Upon this opinion [they]4445-their acted , administering interrogatories , but to [their]4445-their annoyance [Messrs. Freak]382-messrs. freak and Able answered these in so masterly a fashion that nothing whatever was admitted and that without prejudice . It was on October 1 that [Soames]171-soames read [Waterbuck]381-waterbuck 's opinion , in [the dining - room]2449-the dining - room before dinner . It made [him]4442-this quiet man nervous ; not so much because of the case of ' [Boileau]383-boileau v. [The Blasted Cement Co.]4452-the blasted cement co. , Ltd. , ' as that the point had lately begun to seem to [him]4442-this quiet man , too , a nice one ; there was about it just that pleasant flavour of subtlety so attractive to the best legal appetites . To have [his]4442-this quiet man own impression confirmed by [Waterbuck]381-waterbuck , Q.C. , would have disturbed [any man]4453-any man . [He]4442-this quiet man sat thinking it over , and staring at [the empty grate]4454-the empty grate , for though autumn had come , the weather kept as gloriously fine that jubilee year as if it were still high August . It was not pleasant to be disturbed ; [he]4442-this quiet man desired too passionately to set [his]4442-this quiet man foot on [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's neck . Though [he]4442-this quiet man had not seen [the architect]2700-the architect since the last afternoon at [Robin Hill]53-robin hill , [he]4442-this quiet man was never free from the sense of [his]4442-this quiet man presence - never free from the memory of [his]4442-this quiet man worn face with its high cheek bones and enthusiastic eyes . It would not be too much to say that [he]4442-this quiet man had never got rid of the feeling of that night when [he]4442-this quiet man heard the peacock 's cry at dawn - the feeling that [Bosinney]168-bosinney haunted [the house]2326-the house . And [every man]1894-every man 's shape that [he]4442-this quiet man saw in the dark evenings walking past , seemed that of [him]4442-this quiet man whom [George]183-george had so appropriately named [the Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer . [Irene]186-irene still met [him]4442-this quiet man , [he]4442-this quiet man was certain ; where , or how , [he]4442-this quiet man neither knew , nor asked ; deterred by a vague and secret dread of too much knowledge . It all seemed subterranean nowadays . Sometimes when [he]4442-this quiet man questioned [[his]4442-this quiet man wife]558-his wife as to where [she]558-his wife had been , which [he]4442-this quiet man still made a point of doing , as [every Forsyte]183-george should , [she]558-his wife looked very strange . [Her]558-his wife self - possession was wonderful , but there were moments when , behind the mask of [her]558-his wife face , inscrutable as it had always been to [him]4442-this quiet man , lurked an expression [he]4442-this quiet man had never been used to see there . [She]558-his wife had taken to lunching out too ; when [he]4442-this quiet man asked [Bilson]296-bilson if [[her]4442-this quiet man mistress]2876-her mistress had been in to lunch , as often as not [she]558-his wife would answer : "[186-irene] No , [sir]730-sir . " [He]4442-this quiet man strongly disapproved of [her]558-his wife gadding about by [herself]558-his wife , and told [her]558-his wife so . But [she]558-his wife took no notice . There was something that angered , amazed , yet almost amused [him]4442-this quiet man about the calm way in which [she]558-his wife disregarded [his]4442-this quiet man wishes . It was really as if [she]558-his wife were hugging to [herself]558-his wife the thought of a triumph over [him]4442-this quiet man . [He]4442-this quiet man rose from the perusal of [Waterbuck]381-waterbuck , [Q.C.]384-q.c. 's opinion , and , going [upstairs]2967-upstairs , entered [[her]558-his wife room]2872-her room , for [she]558-his wife did not lock [her]558-his wife doors till bed - time - [she]558-his wife had the decency , [he]4442-this quiet man found , to save the feelings of [the servants]2817-the servants . [She]558-his wife was brushing [her]558-his wife hair , and turned to [him]4442-this quiet man with strange fierceness . "[730-sir] What do [you]1968-you want ? " [she]558-his wife said . "[1968-you] Please leave [[my]0-i room]1969-my room ! " [He]0-i answered : "[0-i] [I]0-i want to know how long this state of things between [us]1970-us is to last ? [I]0-i have put up with it long enough . " "[0-i] Will [you]1968-you please leave [[my]0-i room]1969-my room ? " "[1968-you] Will [you]1968-you treat [me]0-i as [[your]1968-you husband]1972-your husband ? " "[1968-you] No . " "[1968-you] Then , [I]0-i shall take steps to make [you]1968-you . " "[0-i] Do ! " [He]0-i stared , amazed at the calmness of [her]558-his wife answer . [Her]558-his wife lips were compressed in a thin line ; [her]558-his wife hair lay in fluffy masses on [her]558-his wife bare shoulders , in all its strange golden contrast to [her]558-his wife dark eyes - those eyes alive with the emotions of fear , hate , contempt , and odd , haunting triumph . "[0-i] Now , please , will [you]1968-you leave [[my]0-i room]1969-my room ? " [He]0-i turned round , and went sulkily out . [He]0-i knew very well that [he]0-i had no intention of taking steps , and [he]0-i saw that [she]558-his wife knew too - knew that [he]0-i was afraid to . It was a habit with [him]0-i to tell [her]558-his wife the doings of [his]0-i day : how such and [such clients]4464-such clients had called ; how [he]0-i had arranged a mortgage for [Parkes]249-parkes ; how that long - standing suit of [Fryer v. Forsyte]385-fryer v. forsyte was getting on , which , arising in the preternaturally careful disposition of [[his]0-i property]2604-his property by [[his]0-i great uncle]4466-his great uncle [Nicholas]189-nicholas , who had tied it up so that [no one could get at it at all]4467-no one could get at it at all , seemed likely to remain a source of income for [several solicitors]4468-several solicitors till the Day of Judgment . And how [he]0-i had called in at [Jobson 's]191-jobson , and seen a Boucher sold , which [he]0-i had just missed buying of [Talleyrand]130-talleyrand and [Sons]386-sons in [Pall Mall]37-pall mall . [He]0-i had an admiration for [Boucher]387-boucher , [Watteau]388-watteau , and all that school . It was a habit with [him]0-i to tell [her]4469-she all these matters , and [he]0-i continued to do it even now , talking for long spells at dinner , as though by the volubility of words [he]0-i could conceal from [himself]0-i the ache in [his]0-i heart . Often , if [they]4470-they were alone , [he]0-i made an attempt to kiss [her]4469-she when [she]4469-she said good - night . [He]0-i may have had some vague notion that some night [she]4469-she would let [him]0-i ; or perhaps only the feeling that [a husband]2822-a husband ought to kiss [[his]0-i wife]558-his wife . Even if [she]4469-she hated [him]0-i , [he]0-i at all events ought not to put [himself]0-i in the wrong by neglecting this ancient rite . And why did [she]4469-she hate [him]0-i ? Even now [he]0-i could not altogether believe it . It was strange to be hated ! - the emotion was too extreme ; yet [he]0-i hated [Bosinney]168-bosinney , [that Buccaneer]4473-that buccaneer , [that prowling vagabond]4474-that prowling vagabond , [that night - wanderer]4475-that night - wanderer . For in [his]0-i thoughts [Soames]171-soames always saw [him]0-i lying in wait - wandering . Ah , but [he]0-i must be in very low water ! [Young Burkitt]202-burkitt , [the architect]2700-the architect , had seen [him]0-i coming out of [a third - rate restaurant]4477-a third - rate restaurant , looking terribly down in the mouth ! During all the hours [he]0-i lay awake , thinking over the situation , which seemed to have no end - unless [she]4469-she should suddenly come to [her]4469-she senses - never once did the thought of separating from [[his]0-i wife]558-his wife seriously enter [his]0-i head .... And [the Forsytes]164-soames ! What part did [they]4479-they play in this stage of [Soames]164-soames ' subterranean tragedy ? Truth to say , little or none , for [they]4479-they were at [the sea]2321-the sea . From [hotels]2984-hotels , [hydropathics]4482-hydropathics , or [lodging - houses]4483-lodging - houses , [they]4479-they were bathing daily ; laying in a stock of ozone to last [them]4479-they through the winter . Each section , in [the vineyard of [its]4484-the vineyard of its own choosing own choosing]4484-the vineyard of its own choosing , grew and culled and pressed and bottled the grapes of a pet sea - air . The end of September began to witness [their]4479-they several returns . In rude health and small omnibuses , with considerable colour in [their]4479-they cheeks , [they]4479-they arrived daily from [the various termini]4485-the various termini . The following morning saw [them]4479-they back at [their]4479-they vocations . On the next Sunday [Timothy]170-timothy 's was thronged from lunch till dinner . Amongst other gossip , too numerous and interesting to relate , [Mrs. Septimus Small]177-soames mentioned that [Soames]177-soames and [Irene]186-irene had not been away . It remained for [a comparative outsider]4486-a comparative outsider to supply the next evidence of interest . It chanced that one afternoon late in September , [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander , [[Winifred Dartie]187-dartie 's greatest friend]4487-winifred dartie 's greatest friend , taking a constitutional , with [young Augustus Flippard]360-young flippard , on [her]378-mrs. macander bicycle in [Richmond Park]113-richmond park , passed [Irene]186-irene and [Bosinney]168-bosinney walking from the bracken towards [the Sheen Gate]4488-the sheen gate . Perhaps [the poor little woman]4489-the poor little woman was thirsty , for [she]4489-the poor little woman had ridden long on [a hard , dry road]4490-a hard , dry road , and , as all [London]2-london knows , to ride a bicycle and talk to [young Flippard]360-young flippard will try the toughest constitution ; or perhaps the sight of [the cool bracken grove]4491-the cool bracken grove , whence ' those two ' were coming down , excited [her]4489-the poor little woman envy . [The cool bracken grove]4491-the cool bracken grove on [the top of [the hill]937-the hill]4493-the top of the hill , with the oak boughs for roof , where the pigeons were raising an endless wedding hymn , and the autumn , humming , whispered to the ears of [lovers in the fern]4495-lovers in the fern , while the deer stole by . [The bracken grove of irretrievable delights]4496-the bracken grove of irretrievable delights , of golden minutes in the long marriage of [heaven and earth]4497-heaven and earth ! [The bracken grove]4498-the bracken grove , sacred to stags , to strange tree - stump fauns leaping around the silver whiteness of a birch - tree nymph at summer dusk . [This lady]3404-this lady knew all [the Forsytes]164-soames , and having been at [June]370-june 's ' at [home]436-home , ' was not at a loss to see with whom [she]3404-this lady had to deal . [Her]3404-this lady own marriage , poor thing , had not been successful , but having had the good sense and ability to force [[her]3404-this lady husband]2635-her husband into pronounced error , [she]3404-this lady [herself]3404-this lady had passed through the necessary divorce proceedings without incurring censure . [She]3404-this lady was therefore [a judge of all that sort of thing]4502-a judge of all that sort of thing , and lived in [one of those large buildings]4503-one of those large buildings , where in [small sets of apartments]4504-small sets of apartments , are gathered incredible quantities of Forsytes , whose chief recreation out of business hours is the discussion of [each other]2556-each other 's affairs . [Poor little woman]4506-poor little woman , perhaps [she]3404-this lady was thirsty , certainly [she]3404-this lady was bored , for [Flippard]360-young flippard was [a wit]4507-a wit . To see ' those two ' in so unlikely a spot was quite a merciful ' pick - [me]1974-a dear little woman - up . ' At [the MacAnder]132-the macander , like all [London]2-london , Time pauses . [This small but remarkable woman]4508-this small but remarkable woman merits attention ; [her]3404-this lady all - seeing eye and shrewd tongue were inscrutably the means of furthering the ends of [Providence]265-providence . With an air of being in at the death , [she]3404-this lady had an almost distressing power of taking care of [herself]3404-this lady . [She]3404-this lady had done more , perhaps , in [her]3404-this lady way than [any woman about [town]656-town]4509-any woman about town to destroy the sense of chivalry which still clogs the wheel of civilization . So smart [she]3404-this lady was , and spoken of endearingly as ' [the little MacAnder]4511-the little macander ! ' Dressing tightly and well , [she]3404-this lady belonged to [[a Woman]3436-a woman 's Club]4513-a woman 's club , but was by no means [the neurotic and dismal type of member who was always thinking of [her]3404-this lady rights]4514-the neurotic and dismal type of member who was always thinking of her rights . [She]3404-this lady took [her]3404-this lady rights unconsciously , they came natural to [her]3404-this lady , and [she]3404-this lady knew exactly how to make the most of them without exciting anything but admiration amongst [that great class to whom [she]3404-this lady was affiliated]4515-that great class to whom she was affiliated , not precisely perhaps by manner , but by birth , breeding , and [the true , the secret gauge , a sense of property]4516-the true , the secret gauge , a sense of property . [The daughter of [a Bedfordshire solicitor]4518-a bedfordshire solicitor]4517-the daughter of a bedfordshire solicitor , by [the daughter of [a clergyman]781-a clergyman]4519-the daughter of a clergyman , [she]3404-this lady had never , through all the painful experience of being married to [a very mild painter with a cranky love of Nature]4521-a very mild painter with a cranky love of nature , who had deserted [her]3404-this lady for [an actress]4522-an actress , lost touch with the requirements , beliefs , and inner feeling of Society ; and , on attaining [her]3404-this lady liberty , [she]3404-this lady placed [herself]3404-this lady without effort in the very van of Forsyteism . Always in good spirits , and ' full of information , ' [she]3404-this lady was universally welcomed . [She]3404-this lady excited neither surprise nor disapprobation when encountered on [the Rhine]4523-the rhine or at [Zermatt]133-zermatt , either alone , or travelling with [a lady]3518-a lady and [two gentlemen]4525-two gentlemen ; it was felt that [she]3404-this lady was perfectly capable of taking care of [herself]3404-this lady ; and the hearts of [all Forsytes]611-all forsytes warmed to that wonderful instinct , which enabled [her]3404-this lady to enjoy everything without giving anything away . It was generally felt that to [such women as [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander]4527-such women as mrs. macander should [we]4528-we look for the perpetuation and increase of [[our]4528-we best type of [woman]4530-woman]4529-our best type of woman . [She]3404-this lady had never had [any children]4531-any children . If there was one thing more than another that [she]3404-this lady could not stand it was one of [those soft women with what [men]550-men called ' charm ' about [them]4532-those soft women with what men called ' charm ' about them]4532-those soft women with what men called ' charm ' about them , and for [Mrs. Soames]177-soames [she]3404-this lady always had an especial dislike . Obscurely , no doubt , [she]3404-this lady felt that if charm were once admitted as the criterion , smartness and capability must go to the wall ; and [she]3404-this lady hated - with a hatred the deeper that at times this so - called charm seemed to disturb all calculations - the subtle seductiveness which [she]3404-this lady could not altogether overlook in [Irene]186-irene . [She]3404-this lady said , however , that [she]3404-this lady could see nothing in [the woman]2805-the woman - there was no ' go ' about [her]2805-the woman - [she]2805-the woman would never be able to stand up for [herself]2805-the woman - [anyone]879-anyone could take advantage of [her]2805-the woman , that was plain - [she]2805-the woman could not see in fact what [men]550-men found to admire ! [She]2805-the woman was not really ill - natured , but , in maintaining [her]2805-the woman position after the trying circumstances of [her]2805-the woman married life , [she]2805-the woman had found it so necessary to be ' full of information , ' that the idea of holding [her]2805-the woman tongue about ' those two ' in [the Park]531-the park never occurred to [her]2805-the woman . And it so happened that [she]2805-the woman was dining that very evening at [Timothy 's]170-timothy , where [she]2805-the woman went sometimes to ' cheer the old things up , ' as [she]2805-the woman was wo nt to put it . [The same people]4538-the same people were always asked to meet [her]2805-the woman : [Winifred Dartie]187-dartie and [[her]2805-the woman husband]2635-her husband ; [Francie]317-roger , because [she]317-roger belonged to the artistic circles , for [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander was known to contribute articles on dress to ' The Ladies Kingdom Come ' ; and for [her]2805-the woman to flirt with , provided [they]4538-the same people could be obtained , [two of [the Hayman boys]4541-the hayman boys , who , though [they]4541-the hayman boys [never said anything , were believed to be fast and thoroughly intimate with all that was latest in smart Society]4542-never said anything , were believed to be fast and thoroughly intimate with all that was latest in smart society . At twenty - five minutes past seven [she]2805-the woman turned out the electric light in [[her]2805-the woman little hall]4543-her little hall]4540-two of the hayman boys , who , though they never said anything , were believed to be fast and thoroughly intimate with all that was latest in smart society . at twenty - five minutes past seven she turned out the electric light in her little hall , and wrapped in [her]2805-the woman opera cloak with the chinchilla collar , came out into [the corridor]4544-the corridor , pausing a moment to make sure [she]2805-the woman had [her]2805-the woman latch - key . [These little self - contained flats]4545-these little self - contained flats were convenient ; to be sure , [she]2805-the woman had no light and no air , but [she]2805-the woman could shut it up whenever [she]2805-the woman liked and go away . There was no bother with [servants]2819-servants , and [she]2805-the woman never felt tied as [she]2805-the woman used to when poor , dear [Fred]389-fred was always about , in [his]389-fred mooney way . [She]2805-the woman retained no rancour against poor , dear [Fred]389-fred , [he]389-fred was such [a fool]1730-a fool ; but the thought of [that actress]4548-that actress drew from [her]2805-the woman , even now , a little , bitter , derisive smile . Firmly snapping the door to , [she]2805-the woman crossed [the corridor]4544-the corridor , with [its]4544-the corridor gloomy , yellow - ochre walls , and [its]4544-the corridor infinite vista of brown , numbered doors . [The lift]4550-the lift was going down ; and wrapped to the ears in the high cloak , with every one of [her]2805-the woman auburn hairs in its place , [she]2805-the woman waited motionless for it to stop at [her]2805-the woman floor . The iron gates clanked open ; [she]2805-the woman entered . There were already [three occupants]4551-three occupants , [a man in a great white waistcoat , with a large , smooth face like a baby]4552-a man in a great white waistcoat , with a large , smooth face like a baby 's , and [two old ladies in black , with mittened hands]4553-two old ladies in black , with mittened hands . [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander smiled at [them]4551-three occupants ; [she]378-mrs. macander knew [everybody]601-everybody ; and all these three , who had been admirably silent before , began to talk at once . This was [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander 's successful secret . [She]378-mrs. macander provoked conversation . Throughout a descent of five stories the conversation continued , [the lift boy]4555-the lift boy standing with [his]4555-the lift boy back turned , [his]4555-the lift boy cynical face protruding through the bars . At the bottom [they]4551-three occupants separated , [the man in the white waistcoat]4556-the man in the white waistcoat sentimentally to [the billiard room]4557-the billiard room , [the old ladies]4558-the old ladies to dine and say to [each other]2556-each other : "[1974-a dear little woman] [A dear little woman]1974-a dear little woman ! " "[1974-a dear little woman] Such a rattle ! " and [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander to [[her]378-mrs. macander cab]1781-her cab . When [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander dined at [[Timothy]170-timothy 's]2927-timothy 's , the conversation although [Timothy]170-timothy [himself]170-timothy could never be induced to be present took that wider , man - of - the - world tone current among Forsytes at large , and this , no doubt , was what put [her]378-mrs. macander at a premium there . [Mrs. Small]177-soames and [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester found it an exhilarating change . "[1974-a dear little woman] If only , " [they]4551-three occupants said , "[1974-a dear little woman] [Timothy]170-timothy would meet [her]1975-her ! " It was felt that [she]378-mrs. macander would do [him]170-timothy good . [She]378-mrs. macander could tell [you]4562-you , for instance , the latest story of [[Sir Charles Fiste]336-charles fiste 's son]4563-sir charles fiste 's son at [Monte Carlo]86-monte carlo ; who was the real heroine of [Tynemouth Eddy]390-tynemouth eddy 's fashionable novel that [everyone]3678-everyone was holding up [their]3678-everyone hands over , and what [they]3678-everyone were doing in [Paris]99-paris about wearing bloomers . [She]378-mrs. macander was so sensible , too , knowing all about that vexed question , whether to send [[young Nicholas]189-nicholas ' eldest]4565-young nicholas ' eldest into [the navy]4566-the navy as [[his]4565-young nicholas ' eldest mother]2511-his mother wished , or make [him]4565-young nicholas ' eldest [an accountant as [[his]4565-young nicholas ' eldest father]559-his father thought would be safer]4568-an accountant as his father thought would be safer . [She]378-mrs. macander strongly deprecated [the navy]4566-the navy . If [you]4571-you were not exceptionally brilliant or exceptionally well connected , [they]3678-everyone passed [you]4571-you over so disgracefully , and what was it after all to look forward to , even if [you]4571-you became [an admiral]4572-an admiral - a pittance ! [An accountant]4573-an accountant had many more chances , but let [him]4573-an accountant be put with [a good firm]4574-a good firm , where there was no risk at starting ! Sometimes [she]378-mrs. macander would give [them]3678-everyone a tip on the Stock Exchange ; not that [Mrs. Small]177-soames or [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester ever took it . [They]3678-everyone had indeed no money to invest ; but it seemed to bring [them]3678-everyone into such exciting touch with the realities of life . It was an event . [They]3678-everyone would ask [Timothy]170-timothy , [they]3678-everyone said . But [they]3678-everyone never did , knowing in advance that it would upset [him]170-timothy . Surreptitiously , however , for weeks after [they]3678-everyone would look in that paper , which [they]3678-everyone took with respect on account of its really fashionable proclivities , to see whether ' [Bright]391-bright 's Rubies ' or ' [The Woollen Mackintosh Company]4575-the woollen mackintosh company ' were up or down . Sometimes [they]3678-everyone could not find the name of [the company]3274-the company at all ; and [they]3678-everyone would wait until [James]241-james or [Roger]317-roger or even [Swithin]233-swithin came in , and ask [them]3678-everyone in voices trembling with curiosity how that ' Bolivia Lime and Speltrate ' was doing - [they]3678-everyone could not find it in the paper . And [Roger]317-roger would answer : "[1976-you] What do [you]1976-you want to know for ? Some trash ! [You]1976-you 'll go burning [your]1976-you fingers - investing [your]1976-you money in lime , and things [you]1976-you know nothing about ! Who told [you]1976-you ? " and ascertaining what [they]3678-everyone had been told , [he]241-james would go away , and , making inquiries in [the City]2392-the city , would perhaps invest some of [his]241-james own money in the concern . It was about the middle of dinner , just in fact as the saddle of mutton had been brought in by [Smither]259-smither , that [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander , looking airily round , said : "[1976-you] Oh ! and whom do [you]1976-you think [I]0-i passed to - day in [Richmond Park]113-richmond park ? [You]1976-you 'll never guess - [Mrs. Soames]177-soames and - [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney . [They]1977-they must have been down to look at [the house]2326-the house ! " [Winifred Dartie]187-dartie coughed , and [no one]514-no one said a word . It was the piece of evidence [they]3678-everyone had all unconsciously been waiting for . To do [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander justice , [she]378-mrs. macander had been to [Switzerland]135-switzerland and [the Italian lakes]4579-the italian lakes with [a party of three]4580-a party of three , and had not heard of [Soames]177-soames ' rupture with [[his]241-james architect]901-his architect . [She]378-mrs. macander could not tell , therefore , the profound impression [her]378-mrs. macander words would make . Upright and a little flushed , [she]378-mrs. macander moved [her]378-mrs. macander small , shrewd eyes from face to face , trying to gauge the effect of [her]378-mrs. macander words . On either side of [her]378-mrs. macander [a Hayman boy]4582-a hayman boy , [his]4582-a hayman boy lean , taciturn , hungry face turned towards [his]4582-a hayman boy plate , ate [his]4582-a hayman boy mutton steadily . [These two]548-these two , [Giles]286-giles and [Jesse]287-jesse , were so alike and so inseparable that [they]548-these two were known as [the Dromios]392-the dromios . [They]548-these two never talked , and seemed always completely occupied in doing nothing . It was popularly supposed that [they]548-these two were cramming for an important examination . [They]548-these two walked without hats for long hours in [the Gardens attached to [[their]548-these two house]4585-their house]4584-the gardens attached to their house , books in [their]548-these two hands , a fox - terrier at [their]548-these two heels , never saying a word , and smoking all the time . Every morning , about fifty yards apart , [they]548-these two trotted down [Campden Hill]17-campden hill on two lean hacks , with legs as long as [their]548-these two own , and every morning about an hour later , still fifty yards apart , [they]548-these two cantered up again . Every evening , wherever [they]548-these two had dined , [they]548-these two might be observed about half - past ten , leaning over the balustrade of [the Alhambra promenade]4586-the alhambra promenade . [They]548-these two were never seen otherwise than together ; in this way passing [their]548-these two lives , apparently perfectly content . Inspired by some dumb stirring within [them]548-these two of the feelings of [gentlemen]1428-gentlemen , [they]548-these two turned at this painful moment to [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander , and said in precisely the same voice : "[1977-they] Have [you]1979-you seen [the ...]1980-the ... ? " Such was [her]378-mrs. macander surprise at being thus addressed that [she]378-mrs. macander put down [her]378-mrs. macander fork ; and [Smither]259-smither , who was passing , promptly removed [her]378-mrs. macander plate . [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander , however , with presence of mind , said instantly : "[1979-you] [I]0-i must have a little more of that nice mutton . " But afterwards in [the drawing - room]849-the drawing - room [she]378-mrs. macander sat down by [Mrs. Small]177-soames , determined to get to the bottom of the matter . And [she]378-mrs. macander began : "[1979-you] What [a charming woman]3561-a charming woman , [Mrs. Soames]177-soames ; such a sympathetic temperament ! [Soames]177-soames is [a really lucky man]1982-a really lucky man ! " [Her]378-mrs. macander anxiety for information had not made sufficient allowance for that inner Forsyte skin which refuses to share its troubles with [outsiders]1659-outsiders . [Mrs. Septimus Small]177-soames , drawing [herself]177-soames up with a creak and rustle of [[her]177-soames whole person]4590-her whole person , said , shivering in [her]177-soames dignity : "[1982-a really lucky man] [[My]0-i dear]2282-my dear , it is a subject [we]1984-we do not talk about ! " CHAPTER II - NIGHT IN [THE PARK]531-the park Although with [her]177-soames infallible instinct [Mrs. Small]177-soames had said the very thing to make [[her]177-soames guest]4592-her guest ' more intriguee than ever , ' it is difficult to see how else [she]177-soames could truthfully have spoken . It was not a subject which [the Forsytes]164-soames could talk about even among [themselves]164-soames - to use the word [Soames]164-soames had invented to characterize to [himself]164-soames the situation , it was ' subterranean . ' Yet , within a week of [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander 's encounter in [Richmond Park]113-richmond park , to [all of [them]4593-all of them]4593-all of them - save [Timothy]170-timothy , from whom it was carefully kept - to [James]241-james on [his]241-james domestic beat from [the Poultry]3660-the poultry to [Park Lane]14-park lane , to [George]183-george [the wild one]4595-the wild one , on [his]183-george daily adventure from the bow window at the Haversnake to [the billiard room at the ' Red Pottle]4596-the billiard room at the ' red pottle , ' was it known that ' those two ' had gone to extremes . [George]183-george it was [he]183-george who invented many of those striking expressions still current in fashionable circles voiced the sentiment more accurately than any one when [he]183-george said to [[his]183-george brother]536-his brother [Eustace]180-eustace that ' [the Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer ' was ' going it ' ; [he]183-george expected [Soames]164-soames was about ' fed up . ' It was felt that [he]183-george must be , and yet , what could be done ? [He]183-george ought perhaps to take steps ; but to take steps would be deplorable . Without an open scandal which [they]4599-they could not see [their]4599-they way to recommending , it was difficult to see what steps could be taken . In this impasse , the only thing was to say nothing to [Soames]164-soames , and nothing to [each other]2556-each other ; in fact , to pass it over . By displaying towards [Irene]186-irene a dignified coldness , some impression might be made upon [her]186-irene ; but [she]186-irene was seldom now to be seen , and there seemed a slight difficulty in seeking [her]186-irene out on purpose to show [her]186-irene coldness . Sometimes in the privacy of [[his]0-i bedroom]2406-his bedroom [James]241-james would reveal to [Emily]173-james the real suffering that [[his]0-i son]2441-his son 's misfortune caused [him]0-i . "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't tell , " [he]0-i would say ; "[0-i] it worries [me]0-i out of [my]0-i life . There 'll be a scandal , and that 'll do [him]1985-him no good . [I]0-i sha n't say anything to [him]1985-him . There might be nothing in it . What do [you]1986-you think ? [She]1987-she 's very artistic , [they]1988-they tell [me]0-i . What ? Oh , [you]1986-you 're a ' regular [Juley]237-aunt juley ! Well , [I]0-i do n't know ; [I]0-i expect the worst . This is what comes of having [no children]2293-no children . [I]0-i knew how it would be from the first . [They]1988-they never told [me]0-i [they]1988-they did n't mean to have [any children]4531-any children - [nobody]2292-nobody tells [me]0-i anything ! " On [his]0-i knees by the side of the bed , [his]0-i eyes open and fixed with worry , [he]0-i would breathe into the counterpane . Clad in [his]0-i nightshirt , [his]0-i neck poked forward , [his]0-i back rounded , [he]0-i resembled some long white bird . "[1993-our father-] [[Our]1992-our Father-]1993-our father- , " [he]0-i repeated , turning over and over again the thought of this possible scandal . Like [old Jolyon]370-june , [he]0-i , too , at the bottom of [his]0-i heart set the blame of the tragedy down to [family]528-family interference . What business had that lot - [he]0-i began to think of [the Stanhope Gate branch]4604-the stanhope gate branch , including [young Jolyon]370-june and [[his]0-i daughter]3849-his daughter , as ' that lot ' - to introduce [a person like [this Bosinney]168-bosinney into [the family]450-the family]4606-a person like this bosinney into the family ? [He]0-i had heard [George]183-george 's soubriquet , ' The Buccaneer , ' but [he]0-i could make nothing of that - [the young man]2291-the young man was [an architect]518-an architect . [He]0-i began to feel that [[his]0-i brother]536-his brother [Jolyon]370-june , to whom [he]0-i had always looked up and on whose opinion [he]0-i had relied , was not quite what [he]0-i had expected . Not having [[his]0-i eldest brother]4611-his eldest brother 's force of character , [he]0-i was more sad than angry . [His]0-i great comfort was to go to [[Winifred]187-dartie 's]4612-winifred 's , and take [the little Darties]366-the darties in [[his]0-i carriage]3242-his carriage over to [Kensington Gardens]136-kensington gardens , and there , by [the Round Pond]4614-the round pond , [he]0-i could often be seen walking with [his]0-i eyes fixed anxiously on [[little Publius Dartie]356-little publius 's sailing - boat]4615-little publius dartie 's sailing - boat , which [he]0-i had [himself]0-i freighted with a penny , as though convinced that it would never again come to [shore]4616-shore ; while [little Publius]356-little publius - who , [James]173-james delighted to say , was not a bit like [[his]356-little publius father]559-his father skipping along under [his]356-little publius lee , would try to get [him]0-i to bet another that it never would , having found that it always did . And [James]173-james would make the bet ; [he]0-i always paid - sometimes as many as three or four pennies in the afternoon , for the game seemed never to pall on [little Publius]356-little publius - and always in paying [he]0-i said : "[1993-our father-] Now , that 's for [your]1994-your money - box . Why , [you]1994-your 're getting quite [a rich man]1036-a rich man ! " The thought of [[his]0-i little grandson]4618-his little grandson 's growing wealth was a real pleasure to [him]0-i . But [little Publius]356-little publius knew a sweet - shop , and a trick worth two of that . And [they]4619-they would walk [home]436-home across [the Park]531-the park , [James]173-james ' figure , with high shoulders and absorbed and worried face , exercising its tall , lean protectorship , pathetically unregarded , over [the robust child - figures of [Imogen]357-imogen and [little Publius]356-little publius]4622-the robust child - figures of imogen and little publius . But [those Gardens]4623-those gardens and [that Park]4624-that park were not sacred to [James]173-james . [Forsytes]1598-forsytes and [tramps]4626-tramps , [children]568-children and [lovers]1549-lovers , rested and wandered day after day , night after night , seeking one and all some freedom from labour , from the reek and turmoil of [the streets]2464-the streets . The leaves browned slowly , lingering with the sun and summer - like warmth of the nights . On Saturday , October 5 , the sky that had been blue all day deepened after sunset to the bloom of purple grapes . There was no moon , and a clear dark , like some velvety garment , was wrapped around the trees , whose thinned branches , resembling plumes , stirred not in the still , warm air . All [London]2-london had poured into [the Park]531-the park , draining the cup of summer to its dregs . Couple after [couple]1562-couple , from every gate , [they]4619-they streamed along [the paths]4632-the paths and over the burnt grass , and one after another , silently out of [the lighted spaces]4633-the lighted spaces , stole into the shelter of the feathery trees , where , blotted against some trunk , or under the shadow of shrubs , [they]4619-they were lost to all but [themselves]4619-they in the heart of the soft darkness . To fresh - comers along [the paths]4632-the paths , [these forerunners]4635-these forerunners formed but part of that passionate dusk , whence only a strange murmur , like the confused beating of hearts , came forth . But when that murmur reached [each couple]4636-each couple in the lamp - light [their]4619-they voices wavered , and ceased ; [their]4619-they arms enlaced , [their]4619-they eyes began seeking , searching , probing the blackness . Suddenly , as though drawn by invisible hands , [they]4619-they , too , stepped over the railing , and , silent as shadows , were gone from the light . The stillness , enclosed in the far , inexorable roar of [the town]1886-the town , was alive with the myriad passions , hopes , and loves of [multitudes of struggling human atoms]4638-multitudes of struggling human atoms ; for in spite of the disapproval of [that great body of [Forsytes]164-soames]4639-that great body of forsytes , the Municipal Council - to whom Love had long been considered , next to [the Sewage Question]4640-the sewage question , the gravest danger to [the community]3730-the community - a process was going on that night in [the Park]531-the park , and in [a hundred other parks]4643-a hundred other parks , without which [the thousand factories]4644-the thousand factories , [churches]4645-churches , [shops]4646-shops , taxes , and drains , of which [they]4619-they were [custodians]4647-custodians , were as arteries without blood , [a man without a heart]4648-a man without a heart . The instincts of self - forgetfulness , of passion , and of love , hiding under [the trees]4649-the trees , away from the trustees of [[their]4619-they remorseless enemy]4650-their remorseless enemy , the ' sense of property , ' were holding a stealthy revel , and [Soames]164-soames , returning from [Bayswater]3-bayswater for [he]164-soames had been alone to dine at [Timothy]170-timothy 's walking [home]436-home along [the water]4180-the water , with [his]164-soames mind upon that coming lawsuit , had the blood driven from [his]164-soames heart by a low laugh and the sound of kisses . [He]164-soames thought of writing to the Times the next morning , to draw the attention of [the Editor]4653-the editor to the condition of [[our]4654-our parks]4655-our parks . [He]164-soames did not , however , for [he]164-soames had a horror of seeing [his]164-soames name in print . But starved as [he]164-soames was , the whispered sounds in the stillness , the half - seen forms in the dark , acted on [him]164-soames like some morbid stimulant . [He]164-soames left [the path]4656-the path along [the water]4180-the water and stole under the trees , along the deep shadow of [little plantations]4658-little plantations , where the boughs of chestnut trees hung their great leaves low , and there was blacker refuge , shaping [his]164-soames course in circles which had for [their]4659-their object a stealthy inspection of chairs side by side , against tree - trunks , of enlaced lovers , who stirred at [his]164-soames approach . Now [he]164-soames stood still on the rise overlooking [the Serpentine]137-the serpentine , where , in full lamp - light , black against [the silver water]4660-the silver water , sat [a couple who never moved]4661-a couple who never moved , [the woman]2805-the woman 's face buried on [the man]2473-the man 's neck - a single form , like a carved emblem of passion , silent and unashamed . And , stung by the sight , [Soames]164-soames hurried on deeper into the shadow of the trees . In this search , who knows what [he]164-soames thought and what [he]164-soames sought ? Bread for hunger - light in darkness ? Who knows what [he]164-soames expected to find - impersonal knowledge of the human heart - the end of [his]164-soames private subterranean tragedy - for , again , who knew , but that [each dark couple]4664-each dark couple , unnamed , unnameable , might not be [he]2473-the man and [she]4665-she ? But it could not be such knowledge as this that [he]164-soames was seeking - [the wife of [Soames Forsyte]171-soames]4666-the wife of soames forsyte sitting in [the Park]531-the park like [a common wench]4668-a common wench ! Such thoughts were inconceivable ; and from tree to tree , with [his]164-soames noiseless step , [he]164-soames passed . Once [he]164-soames was sworn at ; once the whisper , "[1036-a rich man] If only it could always be like this ! " sent the blood flying again from [his]164-soames heart , and [he]164-soames waited there , patient and dogged , for [the two]2453-the two to move . But it was only a poor thin slip of [a shop - girl in [her]4670-a shop - girl in her draggled blouse who passed him , clinging to her lover 's arm draggled blouse who passed [him]164-soames , clinging to [[her]4670-a shop - girl in her draggled blouse who passed him , clinging to her lover 's arm lover]554-her lover 's arm]4670-a shop - girl in her draggled blouse who passed him , clinging to her lover 's arm . [A hundred other lovers]4672-a hundred other lovers too whispered that hope in the stillness of the trees , [a hundred other lovers]4672-a hundred other lovers clung to [each other]2556-each other . But shaking [himself]164-soames with sudden disgust , [Soames]171-soames returned to [the path]4656-the path , and left that seeking for [he]164-soames knew not what . CHAPTER III - MEETING AT THE BOTANICAL [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon , whose circumstances were not those of [a Forsyte]171-soames , found at times a difficulty in sparing the money needful for those country jaunts and researches into Nature , without having prosecuted which [no watercolour artist]4676-no watercolour artist ever puts brush to paper . [He]167-young jolyon was frequently , in fact , obliged to take [his]167-young jolyon colour - box into [the Botanical Gardens]3813-the botanical gardens , and there , on [his]167-young jolyon stool , in the shade of a monkey - puzzler or in the lee of some India - rubber plant , [he]167-young jolyon would spend long hours sketching . [An Art critic who had recently been looking at [his]167-young jolyon work]4678-an art critic who had recently been looking at his work had delivered [himself]4678-an art critic who had recently been looking at his work as follows : "[1036-a rich man] In a way [your]1996-you drawings are very good ; tone and colour , in some of them certainly quite a feeling for Nature . But , [you]1996-you see , they 're so scattered ; [you]1996-you 'll never get [the public]3666-the public to look at them . Now , if [you]1996-you 'd taken a definite subject , such as ' [London]2-london by Night , ' or ' [The Crystal Palace]1998-the crystal palace in [the Spring]1999-the spring , ' and made a regular series , [the public]3666-the public would have known at once what [they]3666-the public were looking at . [I]0-i ca n't lay too much stress upon that . All [the men who are making great names in Art]2001-the men who are making great names in art , like [Crum Stone]393-crum stone or [Bleeder]2002-bleeder , are making [them]2003-them by avoiding the unexpected ; by specializing and putting [their]2001-the men who are making great names in art works all in the same pigeon - hole , so that [the public]3666-the public know pat once where to go . And this stands to reason , for if [a man]515-a man 's [a collector]2006-a collector [he]515-a man does n't want [people]600-people to smell at the canvas to find out whom [his]515-a man pictures are by ; [he]515-a man wants [them]600-people to be able to say at once , ' A capital Forsyte ! ' It is all the more important for [you]1996-you to be careful to choose a subject that [they]600-people can lay hold of on the spot , since there 's no very marked originality in [your]1996-you style . " [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon , standing by the little piano , where a bowl of dried rose leaves , the only produce of [the garden]1015-the garden , was deposited on a bit of faded damask , listened with [his]167-young jolyon dim smile . Turning to [[his]167-young jolyon wife]558-his wife , who was looking at [the speaker]3725-the speaker with an angry expression on [her]558-his wife thin face , [he]167-young jolyon said : "[2008-you] [You]2008-you see , [dear]2284-dear ? " "[2008-you] [I]0-i do not , " [she]558-his wife answered in [her]558-his wife staccato voice , that still had a little foreign accent ; "[2008-you] [your]1996-you style has originality . " [The critic]4682-the critic looked at [her]558-his wife , smiled ' deferentially , and said no more . Like [everyone else]4683-everyone else , [he]4682-the critic knew [their]600-people history . The words bore good fruit with [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon ; they were contrary to all that [he]167-young jolyon believed in , to all that [he]167-young jolyon theoretically held good in [his]167-young jolyon Art , but some strange , deep instinct moved [him]167-young jolyon against [his]167-young jolyon will to turn them to profit . [He]167-young jolyon discovered therefore one morning that an idea had come to [him]167-young jolyon for making a series of watercolour drawings of [London]2-london . How the idea had arisen [he]167-young jolyon could not tell ; and it was not till the following year , when [he]167-young jolyon had completed and sold them at a very fair price , that in one of [his]167-young jolyon impersonal moods , [he]167-young jolyon found [himself]167-young jolyon able to recollect [the Art critic]4684-the art critic , and to discover in [his]167-young jolyon own achievement another proof that [he]167-young jolyon was [a Forsyte]455-a forsyte . [He]167-young jolyon decided to commence with [the Botanical Gardens]3813-the botanical gardens , where [he]167-young jolyon had already made so many studies , and chose [the little artificial pond]4687-the little artificial pond , sprinkled now with an autumn shower of red and yellow leaves , for though [the gardeners]4688-the gardeners longed to sweep them off , [they]4688-the gardeners could not reach [them]4688-the gardeners with [their]4688-the gardeners brooms . [The rest of [the gardens]3837-the gardens]4689-the rest of the gardens [they]4688-the gardeners swept bare enough , removing every morning Nature 's rain of leaves ; piling them in heaps , whence from slow fires rose the sweet , acrid smoke that , like the cuckoo 's note for spring , the scent of lime trees for the summer , is the true emblem of the fall . [The gardeners]4688-the gardeners ' tidy souls could not abide the gold and green and russet pattern on the grass . [The gravel paths]4692-the gravel paths must lie unstained , ordered , methodical , without knowledge of the realities of life , nor of that slow and beautiful decay which flings crowns underfoot to star [the earth]3387-the earth with fallen glories , whence , as the cycle rolls , will leap again wild spring . Thus each leaf that fell was marked from the moment when it fluttered a good - bye and dropped , slow turning , from its twig . But on [that little pond]4694-that little pond the leaves floated in peace , and praised [Heaven]394-heaven with their hues , the sunlight haunting over them . And so [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon found [them]4688-the gardeners . Coming [there]454-there one morning in the middle of October , [he]167-young jolyon was disconcerted to find a bench about twenty paces from [his]167-young jolyon stand occupied , for [he]167-young jolyon had a proper horror of [anyone]879-anyone seeing [him]167-young jolyon at work . [A lady in a velvet jacket]4697-a lady in a velvet jacket was sitting there , with [her]4697-a lady in a velvet jacket eyes fixed on the ground . A flowering laurel , however , stood between , and , taking shelter behind this , [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon prepared [his]167-young jolyon easel . [His]167-young jolyon preparations were leisurely ; [he]167-young jolyon caught , as [every true artist]4698-every true artist should , at anything that might delay for a moment the effort of [his]167-young jolyon work , and [he]167-young jolyon found [himself]167-young jolyon looking furtively at [this unknown dame]4699-this unknown dame . Like [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father before [him]167-young jolyon , [he]167-young jolyon had an eye for a face . This face was charming ! [He]167-young jolyon saw a rounded chin nestling in a cream ruffle , [a delicate face with large dark eyes and soft lips]4701-a delicate face with large dark eyes and soft lips . A black ' picture ' hat concealed the hair ; [her]4699-this unknown dame figure was lightly poised against the back of the bench , [her]4699-this unknown dame knees were crossed ; the tip of a patent - leather shoe emerged beneath [her]4699-this unknown dame skirt . There was something , indeed , inexpressibly dainty about [the person of [this lady]3404-this lady]4702-the person of this lady , but [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's attention was chiefly riveted by the look on [her]4699-this unknown dame face , which reminded [him]167-young jolyon of [[his]167-young jolyon wife]558-his wife . It was as though [its owner]4705-its owner had come into contact with forces too strong for [her]4699-this unknown dame . It troubled [him]167-young jolyon , arousing vague feelings of attraction and chivalry . Who was [she]4699-this unknown dame ? And what doing [there]454-there , alone ? [Two young gentlemen of that peculiar breed , at once forward and shy]4707-two young gentlemen of that peculiar breed , at once forward and shy , found in [the Regent 's Park]4708-the regent 's park , came by on [their]4707-two young gentlemen of that peculiar breed , at once forward and shy way to lawn tennis , and [he]167-young jolyon noted with disapproval [their]4707-two young gentlemen of that peculiar breed , at once forward and shy furtive stares of admiration . [A loitering gardener]4709-a loitering gardener halted to do something unnecessary to a clump of pampas grass ; [he]4709-a loitering gardener , too , wanted an excuse for peeping . [A gentleman]1029-a gentleman , old , and , by [his]1029-a gentleman hat , [a professor of horticulture]4711-a professor of horticulture , passed three times to scrutinize [her]4699-this unknown dame long and stealthily , a queer expression about [his]1029-a gentleman lips . With [all these men]4712-all these men [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon felt the same vague irritation . [She]4699-this unknown dame looked at [none of [them]4712-all these men]4713-none of them , yet was [he]167-young jolyon certain that [every man who passed]4714-every man who passed would look at [her]4699-this unknown dame like that . [Her]4699-this unknown dame face was not the face of [a sorceress]4715-a sorceress , who in every look holds out to [men]550-men the offer of pleasure ; it had none of the ' devil 's beauty ' so highly prized among [the first Forsytes of [the land]2525-the land]4717-the first forsytes of the land ; neither was it of that type , no less adorable , associated with the box of chocolate ; it was not of the spiritually passionate , or passionately spiritual order , peculiar to house - decoration and modern poetry ; nor did it seem to promise to the playwright material for the production of [the interesting and neurasthenic figure , who commits suicide in the last act]4719-the interesting and neurasthenic figure , who commits suicide in the last act . In shape and colouring , in its soft persuasive passivity , its sensuous purity , [this woman]2837-this woman 's face reminded [him]167-young jolyon of [Titian]354-titian 's ' Heavenly Love , ' a reproduction of which hung over the sideboard in [[his]167-young jolyon dining - room]4721-his dining - room . And [her]4699-this unknown dame attraction seemed to be in this soft passivity , in the feeling [she]4699-this unknown dame gave that to pressure [she]4699-this unknown dame must yield . For what or whom was [she]4699-this unknown dame waiting , in the silence , with the trees dropping here and there a leaf , and the thrushes strutting close on grass , touched with the sparkle of the autumn rime ? Then [her]4699-this unknown dame charming face grew eager , and , glancing round , with almost [a lover]2846-a lover 's jealousy , [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon saw [Bosinney]168-bosinney striding across the grass . Curiously [he]167-young jolyon watched the meeting , the look in [their]4723-their eyes , the long clasp of [their]4723-their hands . [They]4723-their sat down close together , linked for all [their]4723-their outward discretion . [He]167-young jolyon heard the rapid murmur of [their]4723-their talk ; but what [they]4723-their said [he]167-young jolyon could not catch . [He]167-young jolyon had rowed in [the galley]4724-the galley [himself]167-young jolyon ! [He]167-young jolyon knew the long hours of waiting and the lean minutes of a half - public meeting ; the tortures of suspense that haunt [the unhallowed lover]4725-the unhallowed lover . It required , however , but a glance at [their]4723-their two faces to see that this was none of those affairs of a season that distract [men]550-men and [women]817-women about [town]656-town ; none of those sudden appetites that wake up ravening , and are surfeited and asleep again in six weeks . This was the real thing ! This was what had happened to [himself]167-young jolyon ! Out of this anything might come ! [Bosinney]168-bosinney was pleading , and [she]817-women so quiet , so soft , yet immovable in [her]817-women passivity , sat looking over the grass . Was [he]167-young jolyon the man to carry [her]817-women off , [that tender , passive being]4729-that tender , passive being , who would never stir a step for [herself]817-women ? Who had given [him]167-young jolyon all [herself]817-women , and would die for [him]167-young jolyon , but perhaps would never run away with [him]167-young jolyon ! It seemed to [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon that [he]167-young jolyon could hear [her]817-women saying : "[2008-you] But , [darling]2010-darling , it would ruin [you]2010-darling ! " For [he]167-young jolyon [himself]167-young jolyon had experienced to the full the gnawing fear at the bottom of [each woman]4730-each woman 's heart that [she]817-women is a drag on [the man [she]817-women loves]4731-the man she loves . And [he]167-young jolyon peeped at [them]4732-their no more ; but [their]4732-their soft , rapid talk came to [his]167-young jolyon ears , with the stuttering song of some bird who seemed trying to remember the notes of spring : Joy - tragedy ? Which - which ? And gradually [their]4732-their talk ceased ; long silence followed . ' And where does [Soames]171-soames come in ? ' [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon thought . ' [People]600-people think [she]817-women is concerned about the sin of deceiving [[her]817-women husband]2635-her husband ! Little [they]600-people know of [women]817-women ! [She]817-women 's eating , after starvation - taking [her]817-women revenge ! And [Heaven]394-heaven help [her]817-women - for [he]171-soames 'll take [his]171-soames . ' [He]167-young jolyon heard the swish of silk , and , spying round the laurel , saw [them]4732-their walking away , [their]4732-their hands stealthily joined .... At the end of [July old Jolyon]395-july old jolyon had taken [[his]167-young jolyon grand - daughter]3889-his grand - daughter to [the mountains]4192-the mountains ; and on that visit the last [they]4732-their ever paid [June]370-june recovered to a great extent [her]370-june health and spirits . In [the hotels]2465-the hotels , filled with [British Forsytes]164-soames - for [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon could not bear a ' set of [Germans]396-germans , ' as [he]167-young jolyon called [all foreigners]4739-all foreigners - [she]370-june was looked upon with respect - [the only grand - daughter of that fine - looking , and evidently wealthy , [old Mr. Forsyte]171-soames]4740-the only grand - daughter of that fine - looking , and evidently wealthy , old mr. forsyte . [She]370-june did not mix freely with [people]600-people - to mix freely with [people]600-people was not [June]370-june 's habit - but [she]370-june formed some friendships , and notably one in [the Rhone Valley]4743-the rhone valley , with [a French girl who was dying of consumption]4744-a french girl who was dying of consumption . Determining at once that [[her]370-june friend]2861-her friend should not die , [she]370-june forgot , in the institution of a campaign against Death , much of [her]370-june own trouble . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon watched the new intimacy with relief and disapproval ; for this additional proof that [her]370-june life was to be passed amongst ' [lame ducks]4746-lame ducks ' worried [him]167-young jolyon . Would [she]370-june never make a friendship or take an interest in something that would be of real benefit to [her]370-june ? ' Taking up with a parcel of [foreigners]4138-foreigners , ' [he]167-young jolyon called it . [He]167-young jolyon often , however , brought home grapes or roses , and presented them to ' [Mam'zelle]397-mam'zelle ' with an ingratiating twinkle . Towards the end of September , in spite of [June]370-june 's disapproval , [Mademoiselle Vigor]398-mademoiselle vigor breathed [her]398-mademoiselle vigor last in [the little hotel at [St. Luc]138-st. luc , to which [they]4749-they had moved [her]398-mademoiselle vigor]4748-the little hotel at st. luc , to which they had moved her ; and [June]370-june took [her]398-mademoiselle vigor defeat so deeply to heart that [old Jolyon]370-june carried [her]370-june away to [Paris]99-paris . Here , in contemplation of the ' Venus de Milo ' and the ' [Madeleine]399-madeleine , ' [she]370-june shook off [her]370-june depression , and when , towards the middle of October , [they]4749-they returned to [town]656-town , [[her]370-june grandfather]3464-her grandfather believed that [he]3464-her grandfather had effected a cure . No sooner , however , had [they]4749-they established [themselves]4749-they in [Stanhope Gate]1-stanhope gate than [he]3464-her grandfather perceived to [his]3464-her grandfather dismay a return of [her]370-june old absorbed and brooding manner . [She]370-june would sit , staring in front of [her]370-june , [her]370-june chin on [her]370-june hand , like [a little Norse spirit]4752-a little norse spirit , grim and intent , while all around in the electric light , then just installed , shone [the great , drawing - room brocaded up to the frieze , full of furniture from [Baple]400-baple and Pullbred 's]4753-the great , drawing - room brocaded up to the frieze , full of furniture from baple and pullbred 's . And in the huge gilt mirror were reflected [those Dresden china groups of [young men in tight knee breeches , at the feet of full - bosomed ladies nursing on [their]4749-they laps pet lambs , which [old Jolyon]370-june had bought when [he]3464-her grandfather was [a bachelor]3920-a bachelor and thought so highly of in these days of degenerate taste]4755-young men in tight knee breeches , at the feet of full - bosomed ladies nursing on their laps pet lambs , which old jolyon had bought when he was a bachelor and thought so highly of in these days of degenerate taste . [He]3464-her grandfather was [a man of most open mind]4757-a man of most open mind , who , more than [any Forsyte of [them]4759-them all]4758-any forsyte of them all]4754-those dresden china groups of young men in tight knee breeches , at the feet of full - bosomed ladies nursing on their laps pet lambs , which old jolyon had bought when he was a bachelor and thought so highly of in these days of degenerate taste . he was a man of most open mind , who , more than any forsyte of them all , had moved with the times , but [he]3464-her grandfather could never forget that [he]3464-her grandfather had bought these groups at [Jobson]191-jobson 's , and given a lot of money for [them]2012-them . [He]3464-her grandfather often said to [June]370-june , with a sort of disillusioned contempt : "[2010-darling] [You]2011-you do n't care about [them]2012-them ! They 're not the gimcrack things [you]2011-you and [[your]2011-you friends]2013-your friends like , but they cost [me]0-i seventy pounds ! " [He]3464-her grandfather was not [a man who allowed [his]3464-her grandfather taste to be warped when [he]3464-her grandfather knew for solid reasons that it was sound]4760-a man who allowed his taste to be warped when he knew for solid reasons that it was sound . One of the first things that [June]370-june did on getting [home]436-home was to go round to [[Timothy]170-timothy 's]2927-timothy 's . [She]370-june persuaded [herself]370-june that it was [her]370-june duty to call [there]454-there , and cheer [him]170-timothy with an account of all [her]370-june travels ; but in reality [she]370-june went because [she]370-june knew of no other place where , by some random speech , or roundabout question , [she]370-june could glean news of [Bosinney]168-bosinney . [They]4764-they received [her]370-june most cordially : And how was [[her]370-june dear grandfather]4765-her dear grandfather ? [He]170-timothy had not been to see [them]4764-they since [May.]401-may. [Her]370-june Uncle [Timothy]170-timothy was very poorly , [he]170-timothy had had a lot of trouble with the chimney - sweep in [[his]170-timothy bedroom]2406-his bedroom ; [the stupid man]4767-the stupid man had let the soot down the chimney ! It had quite upset [[her]370-june uncle]4768-her uncle . [June]370-june sat there a long time , dreading , yet passionately hoping , that [they]4764-they would speak of [Bosinney]316-james . But paralyzed by unaccountable discretion , [Mrs. Septimus Small]177-soames let fall no word , neither did [she]177-soames question [June]370-june about [him]4768-her uncle . In desperation [the girl]595-the girl asked at last whether [Soames]177-soames and [Irene]186-irene were in [town]656-town - [she]595-the girl had not yet been to see [anyone]879-anyone . It was [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester who replied : Oh , yes , [they]4764-they were in [town]656-town , [they]4764-they had not been away at all . There was some little difficulty about [the house]2326-the house , [she]181-aunt hester believed . [June]370-june had heard , no doubt ! [She]370-june had better ask [her]370-june [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley ! [June]370-june turned to [Mrs. Small]177-soames , who sat upright in [her]177-soames chair , [her]177-soames hands clasped , [her]177-soames face covered with innumerable pouts . In answer to [the girl]595-the girl 's look [she]177-soames maintained a strange silence , and when [she]177-soames spoke it was to ask [June]370-june whether [she]370-june had worn night - socks up in [those high hotels]4775-those high hotels where it must be so cold of a night . [June]370-june answered that [she]370-june had not , [she]370-june hated the stuffy things ; and rose to leave . [Mrs. Small]177-soames 's infallibly chosen silence was far more ominous to [her]595-the girl than anything that could have been said . Before half an hour was over [she]595-the girl had dragged the truth from [Mrs. Baynes]203-mrs. baynes in [Lowndes Square]73-lowndes square , that [Soames]177-soames was bringing an action against [Bosinney]168-bosinney over the decoration of [the house]2326-the house . Instead of disturbing [her]595-the girl , the news had a strangely calming effect ; as though [she]595-the girl saw in the prospect of this struggle new hope for [herself]595-the girl . [She]595-the girl learnt that the case was expected to come on in about a month , and there seemed little or no prospect of [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's success . "[2014-he] And whatever [he]2014-he 'll do [I]0-i ca n't think , " said [Mrs. Baynes]203-mrs. baynes ; "[0-i] it 's very dreadful for [him]2014-he , [you]2015-you know - [he]2014-he 's got no money - [he]2014-he 's very hard up . And [we]2016-we ca n't help [him]2014-he , [I]0-i 'm sure . [I]0-i 'm told [the money - lenders]2017-the money - lenders wo n't lend if [you]2015-you have no security , and [he]2014-he has none - none at all . " [Her]595-the girl embonpoint had increased of late ; [she]595-the girl was in the full swing of autumn organization , [her]595-the girl writing - table literally strewn with the menus of charity functions . [She]595-the girl looked meaningly at [June]370-june , with [her]595-the girl round eyes of parrot - grey . The sudden flush that rose on [the girl]595-the girl 's intent young face - [she]595-the girl must have seen spring up before [her]595-the girl a great hope - the sudden sweetness of [her]595-the girl smile , often came back to [Lady Baynes]402-lady baynes in after years [Baynes]402-lady baynes was knighted when [he]2014-he built [that public Museum of Art]4778-that public museum of art which has given so much employment to [officials]4779-officials , and so little pleasure to [those working classes for whom [it]4778-that public museum of art was designed]4780-those working classes for whom it was designed . The memory of that change , vivid and touching , like the breaking open of a flower , or the first sun after long winter , the memory , too , of all that came after , often intruded itself , unaccountably , inopportunely on [Lady Baynes]402-lady baynes , when [her]595-the girl mind was set upon the most important things . This was the very afternoon of the day that [young Jolyon]370-june witnessed the meeting in [the Botanical Gardens]139-the botanical gardens , and on this day , too , [old Jolyon]370-june paid a visit to [[his]2014-he solicitors]4781-his solicitors , [Forsyte]171-soames , [Bustard]242-bustard , and [Forsyte]171-soames , in [the Poultry]3660-the poultry . [Soames]171-soames was not in , [he]171-soames had gone down to [Somerset House]140-somerset house ; [Bustard]242-bustard was buried up to the hilt in papers and [that inaccessible apartment]4783-that inaccessible apartment , where [he]242-bustard was judiciously placed , in order that [he]242-bustard might do as much work as possible ; but [James]173-james was in [the front office]4784-the front office , biting a finger , and lugubriously turning over the pleadings in Forsyte v. [Bosinney]168-bosinney . [This sound lawyer]4785-this sound lawyer had only a sort of luxurious dread of the ' nice point , ' enough to set up a pleasurable feeling of fuss ; for [his]4785-this sound lawyer good practical sense told [him]4785-this sound lawyer that if [he]4785-this sound lawyer [himself]4785-this sound lawyer were on [the Bench]4786-the bench [he]4785-this sound lawyer would not pay much attention to it . But [he]4785-this sound lawyer was afraid that [this Bosinney]168-bosinney would go bankrupt and [Soames]171-soames would have to find the money after all , and costs into the bargain . And behind this tangible dread there was always that intangible trouble , lurking in the background , intricate , dim , scandalous , like a bad dream , and of which this action was but an outward and visible sign . [He]0-i raised [his]0-i head as [old Jolyon]370-june came in , and muttered : "[2014-he] How are [you]2018-you , [Jolyon]370-june ? Have n't seen [you]2018-you for an age . [You]2018-you 've been to [Switzerland]135-switzerland , [they]2019-they tell [me]0-i . [This young Bosinney]168-bosinney , [he]168-bosinney 's got [himself]168-bosinney into a mess . [I]0-i knew how it would be ! " [He]0-i held out the papers , regarding [[his]0-i elder brother]4787-his elder brother with nervous gloom . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon read them in silence , and while [he]163-old jolyon read them [James]173-james looked at the floor , biting [his]168-bosinney fingers the while . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon pitched them down at last , and they fell with a thump amongst a mass of affidavits in 're [Buncombe]141-buncombe , deceased , ' one of the many branches of that parent and profitable tree , ' [Fryer v. Forsyte]385-fryer v. forsyte . ' "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know what [Soames]171-soames is about , " [he]0-i said , "[171-soames] to make a fuss over a few hundred pounds . [I]0-i thought [he]171-soames was [a man of property]2372-a man of property . " [James]173-james ' long upper lip twitched angrily ; [he]0-i could not bear [[his]0-i son]2441-his son to be attacked in such a spot . "[0-i] It 's not the money , " [he]0-i began , but meeting [[his]0-i brother]536-his brother 's glance , direct , shrewd , judicial , [he]0-i stopped . There was a silence . "[0-i] [I]0-i 've come in for [my]0-i Will , " said [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon at last , tugging at [his]0-i moustache . [James]173-james ' curiosity was roused at once . Perhaps nothing in this life was more stimulating to [him]0-i than a Will ; it was the supreme deal with property , the final inventory of [a man]515-a man 's belongings , the last word on what [he]515-a man was worth . [He]0-i sounded the bell . "[0-i] Bring in [Mr. Jolyon]165-old jolyon 's Will , " [he]0-i said to [an anxious , dark - haired clerk]4791-an anxious , dark - haired clerk . "[2021-you] [You]2021-you going to make some alterations ? " And through [his]0-i mind there flashed the thought : ' Now , am [I]2021-you worth as much as [he]515-a man ? ' [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon put the Will in [his]163-old jolyon breast pocket , and [James]173-james twisted [his]0-i long legs regretfully . "[2021-you] [You]2021-you 've made some nice purchases lately , [they]2022-they tell [me]0-i , " [he]0-i said . "[2022-they] [I]0-i do n't know where [you]2021-you get [your]2021-you information from , " answered [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon sharply . "[0-i] When 's this action coming on ? Next month ? [I]0-i ca n't tell what [you]2021-you 've got in [your]2021-you minds .
