" With a cold handshake [he]0-i was gone . [James]173-james , [his]0-i fixed grey - blue eye corkscrewing round some secret anxious image , began again to bite [his]0-i finger . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon took [his]163-old jolyon Will to [the offices of [the New Colliery Company]2601-the new colliery company]4792-the offices of the new colliery company , and sat down in [the empty Board Room]4794-the empty board room to read it through . [He]163-old jolyon answered ' Down - by - [the - starn ' Hemmings]323-hemmings so tartly when [the latter]2450-the latter , seeing [[his]163-old jolyon Chairman]4796-his chairman seated there , entered with [the new Superintendent]4797-the new superintendent 's first report , that [the Secretary]3671-the secretary withdrew with regretful dignity ; and sending for [the transfer clerk]4799-the transfer clerk , blew [him]163-old jolyon up till [the poor youth]4800-the poor youth knew not where to look . It was not - by [George]183-george - as [he]163-old jolyon Down - by - [the - starn]4801-the - starn would have [him]163-old jolyon know , for [a whippersnapper of [a young fellow like [him]163-old jolyon]4803-a young fellow like him]4802-a whippersnapper of a young fellow like him , to come down to [that office]4804-that office , and think that [he]163-old jolyon was [God Almighty]304-god . [He]163-old jolyon Down - by - [the - starn]4801-the - starn had been head of [that office]4804-that office for more years than [a boy like [him]163-old jolyon]4807-a boy like him could count , and if [he]163-old jolyon thought that when [he]163-old jolyon had finished all [his]163-old jolyon work , [he]163-old jolyon could sit there doing nothing , [he]163-old jolyon did not know [him]163-old jolyon , Hemmings Down - by - [the - starn]4801-the - starn , and so forth . On the other side of the green baize door [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon sat at the long , mahogany - and - leather board table , [his]163-old jolyon thick , loose - jointed , tortoiseshell eye - glasses perched on the bridge of [his]163-old jolyon nose , [his]163-old jolyon gold pencil moving down the clauses of [his]163-old jolyon Will . It was a simple affair , for there were none of those vexatious little legacies and donations to charities , which fritter away [a man]515-a man 's possessions , and damage the majestic effect of that little paragraph in the morning papers accorded to [Forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds]4810-forsytes who die with a hundred thousand pounds . A simple affair . Just a bequest to [[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son of twenty thousand , and ' as to the residue of [my]2024-my property of whatsoever kind whether realty or personalty , or partaking of the nature of either - upon trust to pay the proceeds rents annual produce dividends or interest thereof and thereon to [[my]2024-my said grand - daughter]4812-my said grand - daughter [June Forsyte]166-june or [her]166-june assigns during [her]166-june life to be for [her]166-june sole use and benefit and without , etc ... and from and after [her]166-june death or decease upon trust to convey assign transfer or make over the said last - mentioned lands hereditaments premises trust moneys stocks funds investments and securities or such as shall then stand for and represent the same unto [such person]4813-such person or persons whether one or more for such intents purposes and uses and generally in such manner way and form in all respects as [the said June Forsyte]166-june notwithstanding coverture shall by [her]166-june last Will and Testament or any writing or writings in the nature of a Will testament or testamentary disposition to be by [her]166-june duly made signed and published direct appoint or make over give and dispose of the same And in default etc .... Provided always ... ' and so on , in seven folios of brief and simple phraseology . The Will had been drawn by [James]173-james in [his]163-old jolyon palmy days . [He]163-old jolyon had foreseen almost every contingency . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon sat a long time reading this Will ; at last [he]163-old jolyon took half a sheet of paper from the rack , and made a prolonged pencil note ; then buttoning up the Will , [he]163-old jolyon caused [a cab]2536-a cab to be called and drove to [the offices of [Paramor]403-paramor and [Herring]208-jack herring]4815-the offices of paramor and herring , in [Lincoln 's Inn Fields]142-lincoln 's inn fields . [Jack Herring]208-jack herring was dead , but [[his]163-old jolyon nephew]3769-his nephew was still in [the firm]4817-the firm , and [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon was closeted with [him]163-old jolyon for half an hour . [He]163-old jolyon had kept the hansom , and on coming out , gave [the driver]2541-the driver the address - 3 , [Wistaria Avenue]34-wistaria avenue . [He]163-old jolyon felt a strange , slow satisfaction , as though [he]163-old jolyon had scored a victory over [James]173-james and [the man of property]1157-the man of property . [They]4820-their should not poke [their]4820-their noses into [his]163-old jolyon affairs any more ; [he]163-old jolyon had just cancelled [their]4820-their trusteeships of [his]163-old jolyon Will ; [he]163-old jolyon would take the whole of [his]163-old jolyon business out of [their]4820-their hands , and put it into the hands of [young Herring]208-jack herring , and [he]163-old jolyon would move the business of [[his]163-old jolyon Companies]4821-his companies too . If [that young Soames]4822-that young soames were such [a man of property]2372-a man of property , [he]163-old jolyon would never miss a thousand a year or so ; and under [his]163-old jolyon great white moustache [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon grimly smiled . [He]163-old jolyon felt that what [he]163-old jolyon was doing was in the nature of retributive justice , richly deserved . Slowly , surely , with the secret inner process that works the destruction of an old tree , the poison of the wounds to [his]163-old jolyon happiness , [his]163-old jolyon will , [his]163-old jolyon pride , had corroded the comely edifice of [his]163-old jolyon philosophy . Life had worn [him]163-old jolyon down on one side , till , like [that family of which [he]163-old jolyon was the head]4824-that family of which he was the head , [he]163-old jolyon had lost balance . To [him]163-old jolyon , borne northwards towards [[[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son 's house]4826-his son 's house , the thought of the new disposition of property , which [he]163-old jolyon had just set in motion , appeared vaguely in the light of a stroke of punishment , levelled at [that family]2924-that family and that Society , of which [James]173-james and [[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son seemed to [him]163-old jolyon the representatives . [He]163-old jolyon had made a restitution to [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon , and restitution to [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon satisfied [his]163-old jolyon secret craving for revenge - revenge against Time , sorrow , and interference , against all that incalculable sum of disapproval that had been bestowed by [the world]2286-the world for fifteen years on [[his]163-old jolyon only son]469-his only son . It presented itself as the one possible way of asserting once more the domination of [his]163-old jolyon will ; of forcing [James]173-james , and [Soames]171-soames , and [the family]450-the family , and all those hidden masses of [Forsytes]164-soames - a great stream rolling against [the single dam of [his]163-old jolyon obstinacy]4832-the single dam of his obstinacy - to recognise once and for all that [he]163-old jolyon would be [master]3857-master . It was sweet to think that at last [he]163-old jolyon was going to make [the boy]2442-the boy [a richer man]4835-a richer man by far than [that son of [James]173-james]4836-that son of james , [that ' man of property]4837-that ' man of property . ' And it was sweet to give to [Jo]190-jo , for [he]163-old jolyon loved [[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son . Neither [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon nor [[his]163-old jolyon wife]558-his wife were in [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon indeed was not back from [the Botanical]144-the botanical , but [the little maid]2994-the little maid told [him]163-old jolyon that [she]2994-the little maid expected [the master]4841-the master at any moment : "[2024-my] [He]2024-my 's always at ' ome to tea , [sir]730-sir , to play with [the children]3054-the children . " [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon said [he]163-old jolyon would wait ; and sat down patiently enough in [the faded , shabby drawing room]4842-the faded , shabby drawing room , where , now that the summer chintzes were removed , the old chairs and sofas revealed all their threadbare deficiencies . [He]163-old jolyon longed to send for [the children]3054-the children ; to have [them]3054-the children there beside [him]163-old jolyon , [their]3054-the children supple bodies against [his]163-old jolyon knees ; to hear [Jolly]218-jolly 's : "[2024-my] Hallo , [Gran]353-gran ! " and see [his]218-jolly rush ; and feel [Holly]220-holly 's soft little hand stealing up against [his]163-old jolyon cheek . But [he]163-old jolyon would not . There was solemnity in what [he]163-old jolyon had come to do , and until it was over [he]163-old jolyon would not play . [He]163-old jolyon amused [himself]163-old jolyon by thinking how with two strokes of [his]163-old jolyon pen [he]163-old jolyon was going to restore the look of caste so conspicuously absent from everything in [that little house]4844-that little house ; how [he]163-old jolyon could fill [these rooms]4845-these rooms , or others in [some larger mansion]4846-some larger mansion , with triumphs of art from [Baple]400-baple and [Pullbred]404-pullbred 's ; how [he]163-old jolyon could send [little Jolly]4847-little jolly to [Harrow]145-harrow and [Oxford]146-oxford [he]163-old jolyon no longer had faith in [Eton]35-eton and [Cambridge]36-cambridge , for [[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son had been [there]454-there ; how [he]163-old jolyon could procure little Holly the best musical instruction , [the child]4850-the child had a remarkable aptitude . As these visions crowded before [him]163-old jolyon , causing emotion to swell [his]163-old jolyon heart , [he]163-old jolyon rose , and stood at the window , looking down into the little walled strip of [garden]4851-garden , where the pear - tree , bare of leaves before its time , stood with gaunt branches in the slow - gathering mist of the autumn afternoon . The dog [Balthasar]267-balthasar , [his]267-balthasar tail curled tightly over a piebald , furry back , was walking at the farther end , sniffing at the plants , and at intervals placing [his]267-balthasar leg for support against the wall . And old [Jolyon]163-old jolyon mused . What pleasure was there left but to give ? It was pleasant to give , when [you]4852-you could find one who would be thankful for what [you]4852-you gave - one of [your]4852-you own flesh and blood ! There was no such satisfaction to be had out of giving to [those who did not belong to [you]4852-you , to those who had no claim on [you]4852-you]4853-those who did not belong to you , to those who had no claim on you ! Such giving as that was a betrayal of the individualistic convictions and actions of [his]163-old jolyon life , of all [his]163-old jolyon enterprise , [his]163-old jolyon labour , and [his]163-old jolyon moderation , of the great and proud fact that , like tens of thousands of Forsytes before [him]163-old jolyon , [tens of thousands in the present , tens of thousands in the future]4854-tens of thousands in the present , tens of thousands in the future , [he]163-old jolyon had always made [his]163-old jolyon own , and held [his]163-old jolyon own , in [the world]2286-the world . And , while [he]163-old jolyon stood there looking down on the smut - covered foliage of the laurels , the black - stained grass - plot , the progress of the dog [Balthasar]267-balthasar , all the suffering of the fifteen years during which [he]163-old jolyon had been baulked of legitimate enjoyment mingled its gall with the sweetness of the approaching moment . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon came at last , pleased with [his]167-young jolyon work , and fresh from long hours in the open air . On hearing that [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father was in [the drawing room]4857-the drawing room , [he]167-young jolyon inquired hurriedly whether [Mrs. Forsyte]189-nicholas was at [home]436-home , and being informed that [she]189-nicholas was not , heaved a sigh of relief . Then putting [his]167-young jolyon painting materials carefully in the little coat - closet out of sight , [he]167-young jolyon went in . With characteristic decision [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon came at once to the point . "[353-gran] [I]0-i 've been altering [my]0-i arrangements , [Jo]190-jo , " [he]0-i said . "[190-jo] [You]190-jo can cut [your]190-jo coat a bit longer in the future - [I]0-i 'm settling a thousand a year on [you]190-jo at once . [June]166-june will have fifty thousand at [my]0-i death ; and [you]190-jo the rest . That dog of [yours]190-jo is spoiling [the garden]1015-the garden . [I]0-i should n't keep a dog , if [I]0-i were [you]190-jo ! " The dog [Balthasar]267-balthasar , seated in the centre of [the lawn]3048-the lawn , was examining [his]267-balthasar tail . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon looked at the animal , but saw [him]267-balthasar dimly , for [his]0-i eyes were misty . "[190-jo] [Yours]190-jo wo n't come short of a hundred thousand , [[my]0-i boy]744-my boy , " said [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon ; "[190-jo] [I]0-i thought [you]190-jo 'd better know . [I]0-i have n't much longer to live at [my]0-i age . [I]0-i sha n't allude to it again . How 's [[your]190-jo wife]1092-your wife ? And - give [her]1092-your wife [my]0-i love . " [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon put [his]167-young jolyon hand on [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father 's shoulder , and , as [neither]4861-neither spoke , the episode closed . Having seen [[his]167-young jolyon father]559-his father into a hansom , [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon came back to [the drawing - room]849-the drawing - room and stood , where [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon had stood , looking down on [the little garden]3061-the little garden . [He]167-young jolyon tried to realize all that this meant to [him]167-young jolyon , and , [Forsyte]166-june that [he]167-young jolyon was , vistas of property were opened out in [his]167-young jolyon brain ; the years of half rations through which [he]167-young jolyon had passed had not sapped [his]167-young jolyon natural instincts . In extremely practical form , [he]167-young jolyon thought of travel , of [[his]167-young jolyon wife]558-his wife 's costume , [the children]3054-the children 's education , a pony for [Jolly]218-jolly , a thousand things ; but in the midst of all [he]167-young jolyon thought , too , of [Bosinney]168-bosinney and [[his]167-young jolyon mistress]4867-his mistress , and the broken song of the thrush . Joy - tragedy ! Which ? Which ? The old past - the poignant , suffering , passionate , wonderful past , that no money could buy , that nothing could restore in all its burning sweetness - had come back before [him]167-young jolyon . When [[his]167-young jolyon wife]558-his wife came in [he]167-young jolyon went straight up to [her]558-his wife and took [her]558-his wife in [his]167-young jolyon arms ; and for a long time [he]167-young jolyon stood without speaking , [his]167-young jolyon eyes closed , pressing [her]558-his wife to [him]167-young jolyon , while [she]558-his wife looked at [him]167-young jolyon with a wondering , adoring , doubting look in [her]558-his wife eyes . CHAPTER IV - VOYAGE INTO [THE INFERNO]4869-the inferno The morning after a certain night on which [Soames]171-soames at last asserted [his]171-soames rights and acted like [a man]515-a man , [he]171-soames breakfasted alone . [He]171-soames breakfasted by gaslight , the fog of late November wrapping [the town]1886-the town as in some monstrous blanket till [the trees of [the Square even]4873-the square even]4872-the trees of the square even were barely visible from the dining - room window . [He]171-soames ate steadily , but at times a sensation as though [he]171-soames could not swallow attacked [him]171-soames . Had [he]171-soames been right to yield to [his]171-soames overmastering hunger of the night before , and break down the resistance which [he]171-soames had suffered now too long from [this woman who was [[his]171-soames lawful and solemnly constituted helpmate]4875-his lawful and solemnly constituted helpmate]4874-this woman who was his lawful and solemnly constituted helpmate ? [He]171-soames was strangely haunted by the recollection of [her]558-his wife face , from before which , to soothe [her]558-his wife , [he]171-soames had tried to pull [her]558-his wife hands - of [her]558-his wife terrible smothered sobbing , the like of which [he]171-soames had never heard , and still seemed to hear ; and [he]171-soames was still haunted by the odd , intolerable feeling of remorse and shame [he]171-soames had felt , as [he]171-soames stood looking at [her]558-his wife by the flame of the single candle , before silently slinking away . And somehow , now that [he]171-soames had acted like this , [he]171-soames was surprised at [himself]171-soames . Two nights before , at [Winifred Dartie]187-dartie 's , [he]171-soames had taken [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander into dinner . [She]378-mrs. macander had said to [him]171-soames , looking in [his]171-soames face with [her]378-mrs. macander sharp , greenish eyes : "[0-i] And so [[your]2030-your wife]1092-your wife is [a great friend of [that Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney 's]2032-a great friend of that mr. bosinney 's ? " Not deigning to ask what [she]378-mrs. macander meant , [he]171-soames had brooded over [her]378-mrs. macander words . [They]4876-they had roused in [him]171-soames a fierce jealousy , which , with the peculiar perversion of this instinct , had turned to fiercer desire . Without the incentive of [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander 's words [he]171-soames might never have done what [he]171-soames had done . Without [their]4876-they incentive and the accident of finding [[his]171-soames wife]558-his wife 's door for once unlocked , which had enabled [him]171-soames to steal upon [her]378-mrs. macander asleep . Slumber had removed [his]171-soames doubts , but the morning brought them again . One thought comforted [him]171-soames : [No one]514-no one would know - it was not the sort of thing that [she]378-mrs. macander would speak about . And , indeed , when the vehicle of [his]171-soames daily business life , which needed so imperatively the grease of clear and practical thought , started rolling once more with the reading of [his]171-soames letters , those nightmare - like doubts began to assume less extravagant importance at the back of [his]171-soames mind . The incident was really not of great moment ; [women]817-women made a fuss about it in books ; but in the cool judgment of [right - thinking men]4880-right - thinking men , of [men of [the world]2286-the world]4881-men of the world , of such as [he]171-soames recollected often received praise in [the Divorce Court]4883-the divorce court , [he]171-soames had but done [his]171-soames best to sustain the sanctity of marriage , to prevent [her]378-mrs. macander from abandoning [her]378-mrs. macander duty , possibly , if [she]378-mrs. macander were still seeing [Bosinney]168-bosinney , from .... No , [he]171-soames did not regret it . Now that the first step towards reconciliation had been taken , the rest would be comparatively - comparatively .... [He]171-soames , rose and walked to the window . [His]171-soames nerve had been shaken . The sound of smothered sobbing was in [his]171-soames ears again . [He]171-soames could not get rid of it . [He]171-soames put on [his]171-soames fur coat , and went out into the fog ; having to go into [the City]2392-the city , [he]171-soames took [the underground railway from [Sloane Square station]147-sloane square station]4885-the underground railway from sloane square station . In [[his]171-soames corner of [the first - class compartment filled with [City men]4888-city men]4887-the first - class compartment filled with city men]4886-his corner of the first - class compartment filled with city men the smothered sobbing still haunted [him]171-soames , so [he]171-soames opened the Times with the rich crackle that drowns all lesser sounds , and , barricaded behind it , set [himself]171-soames steadily to con the news . [He]171-soames read that [a Recorder]4889-a recorder had charged [a grand jury]4890-a grand jury on the previous day with a more than usually long list of offences . [He]171-soames read of three murders , five manslaughters , seven arsons , and as many as eleven rapes - a surprisingly high number - in addition to many less conspicuous crimes , to be tried during a coming Sessions ; and from one piece of news [he]171-soames went on to another , keeping the paper well before [his]171-soames face . And still , inseparable from [his]171-soames reading , was the memory of [Irene]186-irene 's tear - stained face , and the sounds from [her]186-irene broken heart . The day was a busy one , including , in addition to the ordinary affairs of [his]171-soames practice , a visit to [[his]171-soames brokers]4891-his brokers , [Messrs. Grin]405-messrs. grin and [Grinning]406-grinning , to give [them]4891-his brokers instructions to sell [his]171-soames shares in [the New Colliery Co. , Ltd. , whose business [he]171-soames suspected , rather than knew , was stagnating this enterprise afterwards slowly declined , and was ultimately sold for a song to [an American syndicate]4893-an american syndicate]4892-the new colliery co. , ltd. , whose business he suspected , rather than knew , was stagnating this enterprise afterwards slowly declined , and was ultimately sold for a song to an american syndicate ; and a long conference at [Waterbuck]381-waterbuck , [[Q.C.]384-q.c. 's chambers]4894-q.c. 's chambers , attended by [Boulter]377-boulter , by [Fiske]407-fiske , [the junior counsel]4895-the junior counsel , and [Waterbuck]381-waterbuck , Q.C. , [himself]171-soames . The case of [Forsyte v. Bosinney]273-bosinney was expected to be reached on the morrow , before [Mr. Justice Bentham]408-mr. justice bentham . [Mr. Justice Bentham]408-mr. justice bentham , [a man of common - sense rather than too great legal knowledge]4896-a man of common - sense rather than too great legal knowledge , was considered to be about the best man [they]4897-they could have to try the action . [He]408-mr. justice bentham was [a ' strong ' Judge]4898-a ' strong ' judge . [Waterbuck]381-waterbuck , Q.C. , in pleasing conjunction with an almost rude neglect of [Boulter]377-boulter and [Fiske]407-fiske paid to [Soames]171-soames a good deal of attention , by instinct or the sounder evidence of rumour , feeling [him]171-soames to be [a man of property]2372-a man of property . [He]408-mr. justice bentham held with remarkable consistency to the opinion [he]408-mr. justice bentham had already expressed in writing , that the issue would depend to a great extent on the evidence given at the trial , and in a few well directed remarks [he]408-mr. justice bentham advised [Soames]171-soames not to be too careful in giving that evidence . "[168-bosinney] A little bluffness , [Mr. Forsyte]171-soames , " [he]408-mr. justice bentham said , "[171-soames] a little bluffness , " and after [he]408-mr. justice bentham had spoken [he]408-mr. justice bentham laughed firmly , closed [his]408-mr. justice bentham lips tight , and scratched [his]408-mr. justice bentham head just below where [he]408-mr. justice bentham had pushed [his]408-mr. justice bentham wig back , for all [the world]2286-the world like [the gentleman - farmer for whom [he]408-mr. justice bentham loved to be taken]4901-the gentleman - farmer for whom he loved to be taken . [He]171-soames was considered perhaps [the leading man in breach of promise cases]4902-the leading man in breach of promise cases . [Soames]171-soames used [the underground]4903-the underground again in going [home]436-home . The fog was worse than ever at [Sloane Square station]147-sloane square station . Through the still , thick blur , [men]550-men groped in and out ; [women]817-women , [very few]4907-very few , grasped [their]817-women reticules to [their]817-women bosoms and handkerchiefs to [their]817-women mouths ; crowned with the weird excrescence of [the driver]2541-the driver , haloed by a vague glow of lamp - light that seemed to drown in vapour before it reached [the pavement]2865-the pavement , [cabs]1678-cabs loomed dim - shaped ever and again , and [discharged citizens]4911-discharged citizens , bolting like rabbits to [[their]4911-discharged citizens burrows]4912-their burrows . And [these shadowy figures]4913-these shadowy figures , wrapped each in [his]171-soames own little shroud of fog , took no notice of [each other]2556-each other . In [the great warren]4915-the great warren , each rabbit for [himself]171-soames , especially those clothed in the more expensive fur , who , afraid of [carriages]3249-carriages on foggy days , are driven underground . [One figure]4917-one figure , however , not far from [Soames]171-soames , waited at [the station]2335-the station door . [Some buccaneer]4919-some buccaneer or lover , of whom [each Forsyte]4920-each forsyte thought : ' [Poor devil]4921-poor devil ! looks as if [he]4921-poor devil were having a bad time ! ' [Their]4919-some buccaneer kind hearts beat a stroke faster for [that poor , waiting , anxious lover in the fog]4922-that poor , waiting , anxious lover in the fog ; but [they]4919-some buccaneer hurried by , well knowing that [they]4919-some buccaneer had neither time nor money to spare for any suffering but [their]4919-some buccaneer own . [A hardened case , accustomed to long trysts , to anxiety , and fog , and cold]4928-a hardened case , accustomed to long trysts , to anxiety , and fog , and cold , if only [[his]4925-the waiting lover mistress]4867-his mistress came at last . [Foolish lover]4930-foolish lover ! Fogs last until the spring ; there is also snow and rain , no comfort anywhere ; gnawing fear if [you]4931-you bring [her]4867-his mistress out , gnawing fear if [you]4931-you bid [her]4867-his mistress stay at [home]436-home ! "[171-soames] Serve [him]2033-he right ; [he]2033-he should arrange [his]2033-he affairs better ! " So any respectable [Forsyte]171-soames . " [Soames]171-soames got into [[his]171-soames cab]2992-his cab , and , with the glass down , crept along [Sloane Street]56-sloane street , and so along [the Brompton Road]4936-the brompton road , and [home]436-home . [He]171-soames reached [[his]171-soames house]3383-his house at five . [[His]171-soames wife]558-his wife was not in . [She]558-his wife had gone out a quarter of an hour before . Out at such a time of night , into this terrible fog ! What was the meaning of that ? [He]171-soames sat by the dining - room fire , with the door open , disturbed to the soul , trying to read the evening paper . A book was no good - in daily papers alone was any narcotic to such worry as [his]171-soames . From the customary events recorded in the journal [he]171-soames drew some comfort . ' Suicide of [an actress]4522-an actress ' - ' Grave indisposition of [a Statesman]3765-a statesman ' [that chronic sufferer]4942-that chronic sufferer - ' Divorce of [an army officer]4943-an army officer ' - ' Fire in [a colliery]4944-a colliery ' - [he]171-soames read them all . [They]4945-they helped [him]171-soames a little - prescribed by the greatest of [all doctors]4946-all doctors , [our]4947-our natural taste . It was nearly seven when [he]171-soames heard [her]558-his wife come in . The incident of the night before had long lost its importance under stress of anxiety at [her]558-his wife strange sortie into the fog . But now that [Irene]186-irene was [home]436-home , the memory of [her]186-irene broken - hearted sobbing came back to [him]171-soames , and [he]171-soames felt nervous at the thought of facing [her]186-irene . [She]186-irene was already on the stairs ; [her]186-irene grey fur coat hung to [her]186-irene knees , its high collar almost hid [her]186-irene face , [she]186-irene wore a thick veil . [She]186-irene neither turned to look at [him]171-soames nor spoke . [No ghost or stranger]4949-no ghost or stranger could have passed more silently . [Bilson]296-bilson came to lay dinner , and told [him]171-soames that [Mrs. Forsyte]189-nicholas was not coming down ; [she]189-nicholas was having the soup in [[her]189-nicholas room]2872-her room . For once [Soames]171-soames did not ' change ' ; it was , perhaps , the first time in [his]171-soames life that [he]171-soames had sat down to dinner with soiled cuffs , and , not even noticing them , [he]171-soames brooded long over [his]171-soames wine . [He]171-soames sent [Bilson]296-bilson to light a fire in [[his]171-soames picture - room]4951-his picture - room , and presently went up [there]454-there [himself]171-soames . Turning on the gas , [he]171-soames heaved a deep sigh , as though amongst these treasures , the backs of which confronted [him]171-soames in [stacks]4953-stacks , around [the little room]4954-the little room , [he]171-soames had found at length [his]171-soames peace of mind . [He]171-soames went straight up to the greatest treasure of them all , [an undoubted Turner]4955-an undoubted turner , and , carrying [it]4955-an undoubted turner to the easel , turned [its]4955-an undoubted turner face to the light . There had been a movement in [Turners]409-turners , but [he]171-soames had not been able to make up [his]171-soames mind to part with it . [He]171-soames stood for a long time , [his]171-soames pale , clean - shaven face poked forward above [his]171-soames stand - up collar , looking at the picture as though [he]171-soames were adding it up ; a wistful expression came into [his]171-soames eyes ; [he]171-soames found , perhaps , that it came to too little . [He]171-soames took it down from the easel to put it back against the wall ; but , in crossing [the room]488-the room , stopped , for [he]171-soames seemed to hear sobbing . It was nothing - only the sort of thing that had been bothering [him]171-soames in the morning . And soon after , putting [the high guard]4957-the high guard before the blazing fire , [he]171-soames stole [downstairs]3086-downstairs . Fresh for the morrow ! was [his]171-soames thought . It was long before [he]171-soames went to sleep .... It is now to [George Forsyte]183-george that the mind must turn for light on the events of that fog - engulfed afternoon . [The wittiest and most sportsmanlike of [the Forsytes]164-soames]4959-the wittiest and most sportsmanlike of the forsytes had passed the day reading a novel in [the paternal mansion at [Princes ' Gardens]149-princes ' gardens]4960-the paternal mansion at princes ' gardens . ' Towards five o'clock [he]171-soames went out , and took train at [South Kensington Station]150-south kensington station for [everyone]3678-everyone to - day went [Underground]95-underground . On [the platform]4968-the platform [his]171-soames eyes - for in combination with a composed and fashionable appearance , [George]183-george had sharp eyes , and was always on the look - out for fillips to [his]171-soames sardonic humour - [his]171-soames eyes were attracted by [a man , who , leaping from [a first - class compartment]4970-a first - class compartment , staggered rather than walked towards the exit]4969-a man , who , leaping from a first - class compartment , staggered rather than walked towards the exit . ' So ho , [my]789-the buccaneer bird ! ' said [George]183-george to [himself]183-george ; ' why , it 's "[789-the buccaneer] [the Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer ! " ' and [he]171-soames put [his]171-soames big figure on the trail . Nothing afforded [him]171-soames greater amusement than [a drunken man]4971-a drunken man . [Bosinney]273-bosinney , who wore a slouch hat , stopped in front of [him]183-george , spun around , and rushed back towards [the carriage [he]183-george had just left]4972-the carriage he had just left . [He]183-george was too late . [A porter]4973-a porter caught [him]183-george by the coat ; [the train]2336-the train was already moving on . [George]183-george 's practised glance caught sight of the face of [a lady clad in a grey fur coat at the carriage window]4975-a lady clad in a grey fur coat at the carriage window . It was [Mrs. Soames]177-soames - and [George]183-george felt that this was interesting ! And now [he]183-george followed [Bosinney]273-bosinney more closely than ever - up [the stairs]4291-the stairs , past [the ticket collector into [the street]2964-the street]4977-the ticket collector into the street . In that progress , however , [his]183-george feelings underwent a change ; no longer merely curious and amused , [he]183-george felt sorry for [the poor fellow [he]183-george was shadowing]4979-the poor fellow he was shadowing . ' [The Buccaneer]279-the buccaneer ' was not drunk , but seemed to be acting under the stress of violent emotion ; [he]183-george was talking to [himself]183-george , and all that [George]183-george could catch were the words "[789-the buccaneer] Oh , [God]304-god ! " Nor did [he]183-george appear to know what [he]183-george was doing , or where going ; but stared , hesitated , moved like [a man]515-a man out of [his]183-george mind ; and from being merely [a joker in search of amusement]4981-a joker in search of amusement , [George]183-george felt that [he]183-george must see [the poor chap]4982-the poor chap through . [He]183-george had ' taken the knock ' - ' taken the knock ! ' And [he]183-george wondered what on earth [Mrs. Soames]177-soames had been saying , what on earth [she]177-soames had been telling [him]183-george in [the railway carriage]4983-the railway carriage . [She]177-soames had looked bad enough [herself]177-soames ! It made [George]183-george sorry to think of [her]177-soames travelling on with [her]177-soames trouble all alone . [He]183-george followed close behind [Bosinney]273-bosinney 's elbow - tall , burly figure , saying nothing , dodging warily - and shadowed [him]273-bosinney out into the fog . There was something here beyond a jest ! [He]183-george kept [his]183-george head admirably , in spite of some excitement , for in addition to compassion , the instincts of the chase were roused within [him]183-george . [Bosinney]273-bosinney walked right out into [the thoroughfare]4984-the thoroughfare - a vast muffled blackness , where [a man]515-a man could not see six paces before [him]273-bosinney ; where , all around , voices or whistles mocked the sense of direction ; and sudden shapes came rolling slow upon [them]4986-them ; and now and then a light showed like [a dim island in an infinite dark sea]4987-a dim island in an infinite dark sea . And fast into [this perilous gulf of night]4988-this perilous gulf of night walked [Bosinney]273-bosinney , and fast after [him]273-bosinney walked [George]183-george . If [the fellow]2355-the fellow meant to put [his]2355-the fellow ' twopenny ' under a ' bus , [he]2355-the fellow would stop it if [he]2355-the fellow could ! Across [the street]2964-the street and back [the hunted creature]4991-the hunted creature strode , not groping as [other men]1574-other men were groping in that gloom , but driven forward as though [the faithful George]4993-the faithful george behind wielded a knout ; and this chase after [a haunted man]4994-a haunted man began to have for [George]183-george the strangest fascination . But it was now that the affair developed in a way which ever afterwards caused it to remain green in [his]183-george mind . Brought to a stand - still in the fog , [he]183-george heard words which threw a sudden light on these proceedings . What [Mrs. Soames]177-soames had said to [Bosinney]273-bosinney in [the train]2336-the train was now no longer dark . [George]183-george understood from those mutterings that [Soames]177-soames had exercised [his]183-george rights over [an estranged and unwilling wife]4996-an estranged and unwilling wife in the greatest - the supreme act of property . [His]183-george fancy wandered in the fields of this situation ; it impressed [him]183-george ; [he]183-george guessed something of the anguish , the sexual confusion and horror in [Bosinney]273-bosinney 's heart . And [he]183-george thought : ' Yes , it 's a bit thick ! [I]789-the buccaneer do n't wonder [the poor fellow]4997-the poor fellow is half - cracked ! ' [He]183-george had run [his]183-george quarry to earth on a bench under one of the lions in [Trafalgar Square]155-trafalgar square , a monster sphynx astray like themselves in [that gulf of darkness]4998-that gulf of darkness . Here , rigid and silent , sat [Bosinney]273-bosinney , and [George]183-george , in whose patience was a touch of strange brotherliness , took [his]183-george stand behind . [He]183-george was not lacking in a certain delicacy - a sense of form - that did not permit [him]183-george to intrude upon this tragedy , and [he]183-george waited , quiet as the lion above , [his]183-george fur collar hitched above [his]183-george ears concealing the fleshy redness of [his]183-george cheeks , concealing all but [his]183-george eyes with [their]2036-you sardonic , compassionate stare . And [men]550-men kept passing back from business on the way to [[their]550-men clubs]5000-their clubs - [men whose figures shrouded in cocoons of fog]5001-men whose figures shrouded in cocoons of fog came into view like spectres , and like spectres vanished . Then even in [his]183-george compassion [George]183-george 's Quilpish humour broke forth in a sudden longing to pluck these spectres by the sleeve , and say : "[789-the buccaneer] Hi , [[you]2036-you [Johnnies]410-johnnies]2037-you johnnies ! [You]2036-you do n't often see a show like this !
