[He]2038-a poor devil whose mistress 's taken the knock , [you]2036-you see . " In fancy [he]183-george saw [them]5002-them gaping round [the tortured lover]5003-the tortured lover ; and grinned as [he]183-george thought of [some respectable , newly - married spectre enabled by the state of [his]183-george own affections]5004-some respectable , newly - married spectre enabled by the state of his own affections to catch an inkling of what was going on within [Bosinney]273-bosinney ; [he]183-george fancied [he]183-george could see [his]183-george mouth getting wider and wider , and the fog going down and down . For in [George]183-george was all that contempt of the of [the married middle - class]5005-the married middle - class - peculiar to [the wild and sportsmanlike spirits in its ranks]5006-the wild and sportsmanlike spirits in its ranks . But [he]183-george began to be bored . [Waiting]411-waiting was not what [he]183-george had bargained for . ' After all , ' [he]183-george thought , ' [the poor chap]4982-the poor chap will get over it ; not the first time such a thing has happened in [this little city]5008-this little city ! ' But now [[his]183-george quarry]5009-his quarry again began muttering words of violent hate and anger . And following a sudden impulse [George]183-george touched [him]5009-his quarry on the shoulder . [Bosinney]273-bosinney spun round . "[2038-a poor devil whose mistress] Who are [you]2041-you ? What do [you]2041-you want ? " [George]183-george could have stood it well enough in the light of the gas lamps , in the light of that everyday world of which [he]183-george was so hardy [a connoisseur]5010-a connoisseur ; but in this fog , where all was gloomy and unreal , where nothing had that matter - of - fact value associated by [Forsytes]164-soames with [earth]2773-earth , [he]183-george was a victim to strange qualms , and as [he]183-george tried to stare back into the eyes of [this maniac]5012-this maniac , [he]183-george thought : ' If [I]2041-you see [a bobby]5013-a bobby , [I]2041-you 'll hand [him]5013-a bobby over ; [he]5013-a bobby 's not fit to be at large . ' But waiting for no answer , [Bosinney]273-bosinney strode off into the fog , and [George]183-george followed , keeping perhaps a little further off , yet more than ever set on tracking [him]5009-his quarry down . ' [He]5009-his quarry ca n't go on long like this , ' [he]183-george thought . ' It 's [God]304-god 's own miracle [he]5009-his quarry 's not been run over already . ' [He]183-george brooded no more on [policemen]1599-policemen , [a sportsman]5015-a sportsman 's sacred fire alive again within [him]183-george . Into a denser gloom than ever [Bosinney]273-bosinney held on at a furious pace ; but [[his]273-bosinney pursuer]5016-his pursuer perceived more method in [his]273-bosinney madness - [he]273-bosinney was clearly making [his]273-bosinney way westwards . ' [He]5009-his quarry 's really going for [Soames]164-soames ! ' thought [George]183-george . The idea was attractive . It would be a sporting end to such a chase . [He]183-george had always disliked [[his]183-george cousin]470-his cousin . The shaft of [a passing cab]5018-a passing cab brushed against [his]183-george shoulder and made [him]183-george leap aside . [He]183-george did not intend to be killed for [the Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer , or [anyone]879-anyone . Yet , with hereditary tenacity , [he]183-george stuck to the trail through vapour that blotted out everything but the shadow of [the hunted man]5021-the hunted man and the dim moon of the nearest lamp . Then suddenly , with the instinct of [a town - stroller]5022-a town - stroller , [George]183-george knew [himself]183-george to be in [Piccadilly]67-piccadilly . Here [he]183-george could find [his]183-george way blindfold ; and freed from the strain of geographical uncertainty , [his]183-george mind returned to [Bosinney]273-bosinney 's trouble . Down [the long avenue of]5023-the long avenue of [his]183-george man - about - town experience , bursting , as it were , through a smirch of doubtful amours , there stalked to [him]183-george a memory of [his]183-george youth . A memory , poignant still , that brought the scent of hay , the gleam of moonlight , a summer magic , into the reek and blackness of this [London]2-london fog - the memory of a night when in the darkest shadow of [a lawn]5024-a lawn [he]183-george had overheard from [a woman]3436-a woman 's lips that [he]183-george was not [[her]3436-a woman sole possessor]5026-her sole possessor . And for a moment [George]183-george walked no longer in [black Piccadilly]67-piccadilly , but lay again , with hell in [his]183-george heart , and [his]183-george face to the sweet - smelling , dewy grass , in the long shadow of poplars that hid the moon . A longing seized [him]183-george to throw [his]183-george arm round [the Buccaneer]789-the buccaneer , and say , "[2041-you] Come , [old boy]2042-old boy . Time cures all . Let 's go and drink it off ! " But a voice yelled at [him]183-george , and [he]183-george started back . [A cab]2536-a cab rolled out of blackness , and into blackness disappeared . And suddenly [George]183-george perceived that [he]183-george had lost [Bosinney]273-bosinney . [He]183-george ran forward and back , felt [his]183-george heart clutched by a sickening fear , the dark fear which lives in the wings of the fog . Perspiration started out on [his]183-george brow . [He]183-george stood quite still , listening with all [his]183-george might . "[2043-him] And then , " as [he]183-george confided to [Dartie]187-dartie the same evening in the course of a game of billiards at [the Red Pottle]151-the red pottle , "[2043-him] [I]0-i lost [him]2043-him . " [Dartie]187-dartie twirled complacently at [his]187-dartie dark moustache . [He]187-dartie had just put together a neat break of twenty - three , - failing at a ' [Jenny]412-jenny . ' "[2043-him] And who was [she]2043-him ? " [he]183-george asked . [George]183-george looked slowly at [the ' man of [the world]2286-the world]5029-the ' man of the world 's ' fattish , sallow face , and a little grim smile lurked about the curves of [his]183-george cheeks and [his]183-george heavy - lidded eyes . ' No , no , [[my]2043-him fine fellow]5031-my fine fellow , ' [he]183-george thought , ' [I]2043-him 'm not going to tell [you]5031-my fine fellow . ' For though [he]183-george mixed with [Dartie]187-dartie a good deal , [he]183-george thought [him]187-dartie a bit of [a cad]5032-a cad . "[2043-him] Oh , [some little love - lady]2044-some little love - lady or other , " [he]183-george said , and chalked [his]183-george cue . "[2044-some little love - lady] [A love - lady]2045-a love - lady ! " exclaimed [Dartie]187-dartie - [he]187-dartie used a more figurative expression . "[0-i] [I]0-i made sure it was [[our]2046-our friend]1905-our friend Soa .... " "[0-i] Did [you]0-i ? " said [George]183-george curtly . "[0-i] Then damme [you]0-i 've made an error . " [He]183-george missed [his]183-george shot . [He]183-george was careful not to allude to the subject again till , towards eleven o'clock , having , in [his]183-george poetic phraseology , ' looked upon the drink when it was yellow , ' [he]183-george drew aside the blind , and gazed out into [the street]2964-the street . The murky blackness of the fog was but faintly broken by the lamps of the ' Red Pottle , ' and no shape of [mortal man]5034-mortal man or thing was in sight . "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't help thinking of [that poor Buccaneer]2048-that poor buccaneer , " [he]0-i said . "[0-i] [He]2048-that poor buccaneer may be wandering out there now in that fog . If [he]2048-that poor buccaneer 's not [a corpse]2049-a corpse , " [he]0-i added with strange dejection . "[2049-a corpse] Corpse ! " said [Dartie]187-dartie , in whom the recollection of [his]187-dartie defeat at [Richmond]24-richmond flared up . "[2048-that poor buccaneer] [He]2048-that poor buccaneer 's all right . Ten to one if [he]2048-that poor buccaneer was n't tight ! " [George]183-george turned on [him]187-dartie , looking really formidable , with a sort of savage gloom on [his]183-george big face . "[2048-that poor buccaneer] Dry up ! " [he]183-george said . "[2048-that poor buccaneer] Do n't [I]0-i tell [you]2050-you [he]2048-that poor buccaneer 's ' taken the knock ! " ' CHAPTER V - THE TRIAL In the morning of [his]2048-that poor buccaneer case , which was second in the list , [Soames]177-soames was again obliged to start without seeing [Irene]186-irene , and it was just as well , for [he]2048-that poor buccaneer had not as yet made up [his]2048-that poor buccaneer mind what attitude to adopt towards [her]186-irene . [He]2048-that poor buccaneer had been requested to be in [court]2023-court by half - past ten , to provide against the event of the first action a breach of promise collapsing , which however it did not , both sides showing a courage that afforded [Waterbuck]381-waterbuck , [Q.C.]384-q.c. , an opportunity for improving [his]2048-that poor buccaneer already great reputation in this class of case . [He]2048-that poor buccaneer was opposed by [Ram]413-ram , [the other celebrated breach of promise man]5036-the other celebrated breach of promise man . It was a battle of giants . [The court]1072-the court delivered judgment just before the luncheon interval . [The jury]5038-the jury left the box for good , and [Soames]177-soames went out to get something to eat . [He]2048-that poor buccaneer met [James]173-james standing at [the little luncheon - bar]5039-the little luncheon - bar , like a pelican in [the wilderness of [the galleries]5041-the galleries]5040-the wilderness of the galleries , bent over a sandwich with a glass of sherry before [him]2048-that poor buccaneer . The spacious emptiness of [the great central hall]5042-the great central hall , over which [father]695-father and [son]696-son brooded as [they]5045-their stood together , was marred now and then for a fleeting moment by [barristers in wig and gown]5046-barristers in wig and gown hurriedly bolting across , by [an occasional old lady or rusty - coated man]5047-an occasional old lady or rusty - coated man , looking up in a frightened way , and by [two persons , bolder than [their]5045-their generation]5048-two persons , bolder than their generation , seated in an embrasure arguing . The sound of [their]5045-their voices arose , together with a scent as of neglected wells , which , mingling with the odour of [the galleries]5041-the galleries , combined to form the savour , like nothing but the emanation of a refined cheese , so indissolubly connected with the administration of British Justice . It was not long before [James]173-james addressed [[his]0-i son]2441-his son . "[0-i] When 's [your]2051-your case coming on ? [I]0-i suppose it 'll be on directly . [I]0-i should n't wonder if [this Bosinney'd]414-this bosinney'd say anything ; [I]0-i should think [he]414-this bosinney'd 'd have to . [He]414-this bosinney'd 'll go bankrupt if it goes against [him]414-this bosinney'd . " [He]0-i took a large bite at [his]0-i sandwich and a mouthful of sherry . "[2307-your mother] [[Your]2051-your mother]2307-your mother , " [he]0-i said , "[2307-your mother] wants [you]2051-your and [Irene]186-irene to come and dine to - night . " A chill smile played round [Soames]177-soames ' lips ; [he]0-i looked back at [[his]0-i father]559-his father . [Anyone who had seen the look , cold and furtive , thus interchanged]5052-anyone who had seen the look , cold and furtive , thus interchanged , might have been pardoned for not appreciating the real understanding between [them]5053-them . [James]173-james finished [his]0-i sherry at a draught . "[2307-your mother] How much ? " [he]0-i asked . On returning to [the court]1072-the court [Soames]177-soames took at once [his]0-i rightful seat on the front bench beside [[his]0-i solicitor]5055-his solicitor . [He]0-i ascertained where [[his]0-i father]559-his father was seated with a glance so sidelong as to commit [nobody]2292-nobody . [James]173-james , sitting back with [his]0-i hands clasped over the handle of [his]0-i umbrella , was brooding on the end of the bench immediately behind [counsel]4447-counsel , whence [he]0-i could get away at once when the case was over . [He]0-i considered [Bosinney]273-bosinney 's conduct in every way outrageous , but [he]0-i did not wish to run up against [him]273-bosinney , feeling that the meeting would be awkward . Next to [the Divorce Court]4883-the divorce court , [this court]3171-this court was , perhaps , the favourite emporium of justice , libel , breach of promise , and other commercial actions being frequently decided there . Quite a sprinkling of [persons unconnected with the law]5061-persons unconnected with the law occupied the back benches , and the hat of [a woman or two]5062-a woman or two could be seen in [the gallery]4356-the gallery . The two rows of seats immediately in front of [James]173-james were gradually filled by barristers in wigs , who sat down to make pencil notes , chat , and attend to [their]5064-their teeth ; but [his]0-i interest was soon diverted from these lesser lights of justice by the entrance of [Waterbuck]381-waterbuck , [Q.C.]384-q.c. , with the wings of [his]381-waterbuck silk gown rustling , and [his]381-waterbuck red , capable face supported by two short , brown whiskers . [The famous Q.C.]5065-the famous q.c. looked , as [James]173-james freely admitted , the very picture of [a man who could heckle [a witness]5067-a witness]5066-a man who could heckle a witness . For all [his]0-i experience , it so happened that [he]0-i had never seen [Waterbuck]381-waterbuck , [Q.C.]384-q.c. , before , and , like [many Forsytes in the lower branch of the profession]5068-many forsytes in the lower branch of the profession , [he]0-i had an extreme admiration for [a good cross - examiner]5069-a good cross - examiner . The long , lugubrious folds in [his]0-i cheeks relaxed somewhat after seeing [him]381-waterbuck , especially as [he]0-i now perceived that [Soames]177-soames alone was represented by silk . [Waterbuck]381-waterbuck , [Q.C.]384-q.c. , had barely screwed round on [his]381-waterbuck elbow to chat with [[his]381-waterbuck Junior]5070-his junior before [Mr. Justice Bentham]408-mr. justice bentham [himself]408-mr. justice bentham appeared - [a thin , rather hen - like man]5071-a thin , rather hen - like man , with a little stoop , clean - shaven under [his]408-mr. justice bentham snowy wig . Like [all the rest of [the court]1072-the court]5072-all the rest of the court , [Waterbuck]381-waterbuck rose , and remained on [his]381-waterbuck feet until [the judge]5074-the judge was seated . [James]173-james rose but slightly ; [he]0-i was already comfortable , and had no opinion of [Bentham]408-mr. justice bentham , having sat next but one to [him]408-mr. justice bentham at dinner twice at the [Bumley Tomms]415-bumley tomms ' . [Bumley Tomm]416-bumley tomm was rather a poor thing , though [he]408-mr. justice bentham had been so successful . [James]173-james [himself]173-james had given [him]408-mr. justice bentham [his]0-i first brief . [He]0-i was excited , too , for [he]0-i had just found out that [Bosinney]273-bosinney was not in [court]2023-court . ' Now , what 's [he]5074-the judge mean by that ? ' [he]0-i kept on thinking . The case having been called on , [Waterbuck]381-waterbuck , Q.C. , pushing back [his]5074-the judge papers , hitched [his]5074-the judge gown on [his]5074-the judge shoulder , and , with a semi - circular look around [him]5074-the judge , like [a man who is going to bat]5076-a man who is going to bat , arose and addressed [the Court]1072-the court . The facts , [he]0-i said , were not in dispute , and all that [[his]0-i Lordship]5078-his lordship would be asked was to interpret the correspondence which had taken place between [[his]0-i client]3646-his client and [the defendant]5080-the defendant , [an architect]518-an architect , with reference to the decoration of [a house]689-a house . [He]0-i would , however , submit that this correspondence could only mean one very plain thing . After briefly reciting the history of [the house at [Robin Hill]53-robin hill , which [he]0-i described as [a mansion]5084-a mansion]5083-the house at robin hill , which he described as a mansion , and the actual facts of expenditure , [he]0-i went on as follows : "[2307-your mother] [[My]0-i client]2053-my client , [Mr. Soames Forsyte]171-soames , is [a gentleman]1029-a gentleman , [a man of property]2372-a man of property , who would be the last to dispute any legitimate claim that might be made against [him]2053-my client , but [he]2053-my client has met with such treatment from [[his]2053-my client architect]901-his architect in the matter of [this house]752-this house , over which [he]2053-my client has , as [[your]2058-your lordship]2059-your lordship has heard , already spent some twelve - some twelve thousand pounds , a sum considerably in advance of the amount [he]2053-my client had originally contemplated , that as a matter of principle - and this [I]0-i can not too strongly emphasize - as a matter of principle , and in the interests of [others]1283-others , [he]2053-my client has felt [himself]2053-my client compelled to bring this action . The point put forward in defence by [the architect]2700-the architect [I]0-i will suggest to [[your]2058-your lordship]2059-your lordship is not worthy of a moment 's serious consideration . " [He]0-i then read the correspondence . [[His]0-i client]3646-his client , "[0-i] [a man of recognised position]2063-a man of recognised position , " was prepared to go into the box , and to swear that [he]0-i never did authorize , that it was never in [his]0-i mind to authorize , the expenditure of any money beyond the extreme limit of twelve thousand and fifty pounds , which [he]0-i had clearly fixed ; and not further to waste the time of [the court]1072-the court , [he]0-i would at once call [Mr. Forsyte]171-soames . [Soames]171-soames then went into the box . [His]171-soames whole appearance was striking in its composure . [His]171-soames face , just supercilious enough , pale and clean - shaven , with a little line between the eyes , and compressed lips ; [his]171-soames dress in unostentatious order , one hand neatly gloved , the other bare . [He]171-soames answered the questions put to [him]171-soames in a somewhat low , but distinct voice . [His]171-soames evidence under cross - examination savoured of taciturnity . Had [he]171-soames not used the expression , "[2058-your] a free hand " ? No . "[2064-you] Come , come ! " The expression [he]171-soames had used was ' a free hand in the terms of this correspondence . ' "[2064-you] Would [you]2064-you tell [the Court]1072-the court that that was English ? " "[2064-you] Yes ! " "[2064-you] What do [you]2064-you say it means ? " "[2064-you] What it says ! " "[2064-you] Are [you]2064-you prepared to deny that it is a contradiction in terms ? " "[2064-you] Yes . " "[2064-you] [You]2064-you are not [an Irishman]2066-an irishman ? " "[2064-you] No . " "[2064-you] Are [you]2064-you [a well - educated man]2067-a well - educated man ? " "[2067-a well - educated man] Yes . " "[2067-a well - educated man] And yet [you]2064-you persist in that statement ? " "[2064-you] Yes . " Throughout this and much more cross - examination , which turned again and again around the ' nice point , ' [James]173-james sat with [his]171-soames hand behind [his]171-soames ear , [his]171-soames eyes fixed upon [[his]171-soames son]2441-his son . [He]171-soames was proud of [him]2441-his son ! [He]171-soames could not but feel that in similar circumstances [he]171-soames [himself]171-soames would have been tempted to enlarge [his]171-soames replies , but [his]171-soames instinct told [him]171-soames that this taciturnity was the very thing . [He]171-soames sighed with relief , however , when [Soames]171-soames , slowly turning , and without any change of expression , descended from the box . When it came to the turn of [[Bosinney]273-bosinney 's Counsel]5088-bosinney 's counsel to address [the Judge]5074-the judge , [James]173-james redoubled [his]171-soames attention , and [he]171-soames searched [the Court]1072-the court again and again to see if [Bosinney]273-bosinney were not somewhere concealed . [Young Chankery]379-young chankery began nervously ; [he]379-young chankery was placed by [Bosinney]273-bosinney 's absence in an awkward position . [He]379-young chankery therefore did [his]379-young chankery best to turn that absence to account . [He]379-young chankery could not but fear - [he]379-young chankery said - that [[his]379-young chankery client]3646-his client had met with an accident . [He]379-young chankery had fully expected [him]273-bosinney there to give evidence ; [they]5092-they had sent round that morning both to [[Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney 's office]5093-mr. bosinney 's office and to [[his]168-bosinney rooms]2613-his rooms though [he]379-young chankery knew [they]5092-they were one and the same , [he]379-young chankery thought it was as well not to say so , but it was not known where [he]168-bosinney was , and this [he]379-young chankery considered to be ominous , knowing how anxious [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney had been to give [his]168-bosinney evidence . [He]379-young chankery had not , however , been instructed to apply for an adjournment , and in default of such instruction [he]379-young chankery conceived it [his]379-young chankery duty to go on . The plea on which [he]379-young chankery somewhat confidently relied , and which [[his]379-young chankery client]3646-his client , had [he]379-young chankery not unfortunately been prevented in some way from attending , would have supported by [his]379-young chankery evidence , was that such an expression as a ' free hand ' could not be limited , fettered , and rendered unmeaning , by any verbiage which might follow it . [He]379-young chankery would go further and say that the correspondence showed that whatever [he]379-young chankery might have said in [his]379-young chankery evidence , [Mr. Forsyte]171-soames had in fact never contemplated repudiating liability on any of the work ordered or executed by [[his]379-young chankery architect]901-his architect . [The defendant]5080-the defendant had certainly never contemplated such a contingency , or , as was demonstrated by [his]5080-the defendant letters , [he]5080-the defendant would never have proceeded with the work - a work of extreme delicacy , carried out with great care and efficiency , to meet and satisfy the fastidious taste of [a connoisseur]5010-a connoisseur , [a rich man]1036-a rich man , [a man of property]2372-a man of property . [He]379-young chankery felt strongly on this point , and feeling strongly [he]379-young chankery used , perhaps , rather strong words when [he]379-young chankery said that this action was of a most unjustifiable , unexpected , indeed - unprecedented character . If [[his]379-young chankery Lordship]5078-his lordship had had the opportunity that [he]379-young chankery [himself]379-young chankery had made it [his]379-young chankery duty to take , to go over [this very fine house]5102-this very fine house and see the great delicacy and beauty of the decorations executed by [[his]379-young chankery client]3646-his client - [an artist in [his]379-young chankery most honourable profession]5104-an artist in his most honourable profession - [he]379-young chankery felt convinced that not for one moment would [[his]379-young chankery Lordship]5078-his lordship tolerate this , [he]379-young chankery would use no stronger word than daring attempt to evade legitimate responsibility . Taking the text of [Soames]171-soames ' letters , [he]379-young chankery lightly touched on ' [Boileau]383-boileau v. [The Blasted Cement Company , Limited]5106-the blasted cement company , limited . ' "[2064-you] It is doubtful , " [he]379-young chankery said , "[2064-you] what [that authority]2068-that authority has decided ; in any case [I]0-i would submit that it is just as much in [my]0-i favour as in [[my]0-i friend]1908-my friend 's . " [He]379-young chankery then argued the ' nice point ' closely . With all due deference [he]379-young chankery submitted that [Mr. Forsyte]171-soames 's expression nullified itself . [[His]379-young chankery client]3646-his client not being [a rich man]1036-a rich man , the matter was a serious one for [him]379-young chankery ; [he]379-young chankery was [a very talented architect , whose professional reputation was undoubtedly somewhat at stake]5109-a very talented architect , whose professional reputation was undoubtedly somewhat at stake . [He]379-young chankery concluded with a perhaps too personal appeal to [the Judge]5074-the judge , as [a lover of the arts]5111-a lover of the arts , to show [himself]379-young chankery [the protector of [artists]5113-artists]5112-the protector of artists , from what was occasionally - [he]379-young chankery said occasionally - the too iron hand of capital . "[0-i] What , " [he]379-young chankery said , "[0-i] will be the position of the artistic professions , if [men of property like this]2070-men of property like this [Mr. Forsyte]171-soames refuse , and are allowed to refuse , to carry out the obligations of the commissions which [they]2070-men of property like this have given . " [He]379-young chankery would now call [[his]379-young chankery client]3646-his client , in case [he]379-young chankery should at the last moment have found [himself]379-young chankery able to be present . The name [Philip Baynes Bosinney]274-baynes was called three times by [the Ushers]5115-the ushers , and the sound of the calling echoed with strange melancholy throughout [the Court and Galleries]5116-the court and galleries . The crying of this name , to which no answer was returned , had upon [James]173-james a curious effect : it was like calling for [your]173-james lost dog about [the streets]2464-the streets . And the creepy feeling that it gave [him]379-young chankery , of [a man missing]5118-a man missing , grated on [his]379-young chankery sense of comfort and security - on [his]379-young chankery cosiness . Though [he]379-young chankery could not have said why , it made [him]379-young chankery feel uneasy . [He]379-young chankery looked now at the clock - a quarter to three ! It would be all over in a quarter of an hour . Where could [the young fellow]3599-the young fellow be ? It was only when [Mr. Justice Bentham]408-mr. justice bentham delivered judgment that [he]379-young chankery got over the turn [he]379-young chankery had received . Behind the wooden erection , by which [he]379-young chankery was fenced from [more ordinary mortals]5120-more ordinary mortals , [the learned Judge]5121-the learned judge leaned forward . The electric light , just turned on above [his]379-young chankery head , fell on [his]379-young chankery face , and mellowed it to an orange hue beneath the snowy crown of [his]379-young chankery wig ; the amplitude of [his]379-young chankery robes grew before the eye ; [his]379-young chankery whole figure , facing the comparative dusk of [the Court]1072-the court , radiated like some majestic and sacred body . [He]379-young chankery cleared [his]379-young chankery throat , took a sip of water , broke the nib of a quill against the desk , and , folding [his]379-young chankery bony hands before [him]379-young chankery , began . To [James]173-james [he]379-young chankery suddenly loomed much larger than [he]379-young chankery had ever thought [Bentham]408-mr. justice bentham would loom . It was the majesty of the law ; and [a person endowed with a nature far less matter - of - fact than that of James]5123-a person endowed with a nature far less matter - of - fact than that of james might have been excused for failing to pierce this halo , and disinter therefrom [the somewhat ordinary Forsyte , who walked and talked in every - day life]5124-the somewhat ordinary forsyte , who walked and talked in every - day life under the name of [Sir Walter Bentham]417-sir walter bentham . [He]408-mr. justice bentham delivered judgment in the following words : "[0-i] The facts in this case are not in dispute . On May 15 last [the defendant]5080-the defendant wrote to [the plaintiff]2072-the plaintiff , requesting to be allowed to withdraw from [his]5080-the defendant professional position in regard to the decoration of [[the plaintiff]2072-the plaintiff 's house]2074-the plaintiff 's house , unless [he]5080-the defendant were given ' a free hand . ' [The plaintiff]2072-the plaintiff , on May 17 , wrote back as follows : ' In giving [you]2072-the plaintiff , in accordance with [your]2072-the plaintiff request , this free hand , [I]0-i wish [you]2072-the plaintiff to clearly understand that the total cost of [the house]2326-the house as handed over to [me]0-i completely decorated , inclusive of [your]2072-the plaintiff fee as arranged between [us]2077-us must not exceed twelve thousand pounds . ' To this letter [the defendant]5080-the defendant replied on May 18 : ' If [you]2072-the plaintiff think that in such a delicate matter as decoration [I]0-i can bind [myself]0-i to the exact pound , [I]0-i am afraid [you]2072-the plaintiff are mistaken . ' On May 19 [the plaintiff]2072-the plaintiff wrote as follows : ' [I]0-i did not mean to say that if [you]2072-the plaintiff should exceed the sum named in [my]0-i letter to [you]2072-the plaintiff by ten or twenty or even fifty pounds there would be any difficulty between [us]2077-us . [You]2072-the plaintiff have a free hand in the terms of this correspondence , and [I]0-i hope [you]2072-the plaintiff will see [your]2072-the plaintiff way to completing the decorations . ' On May 20 [the defendant]5080-the defendant replied thus shortly : ' Very well . ' " In completing these decorations , [the defendant]5080-the defendant incurred liabilities and expenses which brought the total cost of [this house]752-this house up to the sum of twelve thousand four hundred pounds , all of which expenditure has been defrayed by [the plaintiff]2072-the plaintiff . This action has been brought by [the plaintiff]2072-the plaintiff to recover from [the defendant]5080-the defendant the sum of three hundred and fifty pounds expended by [him]5080-the defendant in excess of a sum of twelve thousand and fifty pounds , alleged by [the plaintiff]2072-the plaintiff to have been fixed by this correspondence as the maximum sum that [the defendant]5080-the defendant had authority to expend . "[5080-the defendant] The question for [me]0-i to decide is whether or no [the defendant]5080-the defendant is liable to refund to [the plaintiff]2072-the plaintiff this sum . In [my]0-i judgment [he]5080-the defendant is so liable . " What in effect [the plaintiff]2072-the plaintiff has said is this ' [I]5080-the defendant give [you]2072-the plaintiff a free hand to complete these decorations , provided that [you]2072-the plaintiff keep within a total cost to [me]5080-the defendant of twelve thousand pounds . If [you]2072-the plaintiff exceed that sum by as much as fifty pounds , [I]5080-the defendant will not hold [you]2072-the plaintiff responsible ; beyond that point [you]2072-the plaintiff are [no agent of [mine]5080-the defendant]5133-no agent of mine , and [I]5080-the defendant shall repudiate liability . ' It is not quite clear to [me]5080-the defendant whether , had [the plaintiff]2072-the plaintiff in fact repudiated liability under [[his]2072-the plaintiff agent]5135-his agent 's contracts , [he]2072-the plaintiff would , under all the circumstances , have been successful in so doing ; but [he]2072-the plaintiff has not adopted this course . [He]2072-the plaintiff has accepted liability , and fallen back upon [his]2072-the plaintiff rights against [the defendant]5080-the defendant under the terms of [the latter]2450-the latter 's engagement . "[5080-the defendant] In [my]0-i judgment [the plaintiff]2072-the plaintiff is entitled to recover this sum from [the defendant]5080-the defendant . " It has been sought , on behalf of [the defendant]5080-the defendant , to show that no limit of expenditure was fixed or intended to be fixed by this correspondence . If this were so , [I]5080-the defendant can find no reason for [the plaintiff]2072-the plaintiff 's importation into the correspondence of the figures of twelve thousand pounds and subsequently of fifty pounds . [The defendant]5080-the defendant 's contention would render these figures meaningless . It is manifest to [me]5080-the defendant that by [his]5080-the defendant letter of May 20 [he]5080-the defendant assented to a very clear proposition , by the terms of which [he]5080-the defendant must be held to be bound . "[5080-the defendant] For these reasons there will be judgment for [the plaintiff]2072-the plaintiff for the amount claimed with costs . " [James]173-james sighed , and stooping , picked up [his]5080-the defendant umbrella which had fallen with a rattle at the words ' importation into this correspondence . ' Untangling [his]5080-the defendant legs , [he]5080-the defendant rapidly left [the Court]1072-the court ; without waiting for [[his]5080-the defendant son]2441-his son , [he]5080-the defendant snapped up a hansom cab it was a clear , grey afternoon and drove straight to [[Timothy]170-timothy 's where [he]5080-the defendant found [Swithin]233-swithin]5143-timothy 's where he found swithin ; and to [him]170-timothy , [Mrs. Septimus Small]177-soames , and [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester , [he]5080-the defendant recounted the whole proceedings , eating two muffins not altogether in the intervals of speech . "[177-soames] [Soames]177-soames did very well , " [he]5080-the defendant ended ; "[2086-he] [he]2086-he 's got [his]2086-he head screwed on the right way . This wo n't please [Jolyon]167-young jolyon . It 's a bad business for [that young Bosinney]2087-that young bosinney ; [he]2086-he 'll go bankrupt , [I]0-i should n't wonder , " and then after a long pause , during which [he]5080-the defendant had stared disquietly into the fire , [he]5080-the defendant added : "[2086-he] [He]2086-he was n't [there]454-there - now why ? " There was a sound of footsteps . The figure of [a thick - set man , with the ruddy brown face of robust health]5144-a thick - set man , with the ruddy brown face of robust health , was seen in [the back drawing - room]5145-the back drawing - room . The forefinger of [his]0-i upraised hand was outlined against the black of [his]0-i frock coat . [He]0-i spoke in a grudging voice . "[2086-he] Well , [James]173-james , " [he]0-i said , "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't - [I]0-i ca n't stop , " and turning round , [he]0-i walked out . It was [Timothy]170-timothy . [James]173-james rose from [his]0-i chair . "[0-i] There ! " [he]0-i said , "[0-i] there ! [I]0-i knew there was something wro .... " [He]0-i checked [himself]0-i , and was silent , staring before [him]0-i , as though [he]0-i had seen a portent . CHAPTER VI - SOAMES BREAKS THE NEWS In leaving [the Court Soames]5146-the court soames did not go straight [home]436-home . [He]5146-the court soames felt disinclined for [the City]2392-the city , and drawn by need for sympathy in [his]5146-the court soames triumph , [he]5146-the court soames , too , made [his]5146-the court soames way , but slowly and on foot , to [[Timothy]170-timothy 's in [the Bayswater Road]485-the bayswater road]1273-timothy 's in the bayswater road . [[His]5146-the court soames father]559-his father had just left ; [Mrs. Small]177-soames and [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester , in possession of the whole story , greeted [him]5146-the court soames warmly . [They]5152-they were sure [he]5146-the court soames was hungry after all that evidence . [Smither]259-smither should toast [him]5146-the court soames some more muffins , [[his]5146-the court soames dear father]5153-his dear father had eaten them all . [He]5146-the court soames must put [his]5146-the court soames legs up on the sofa ; and [he]5146-the court soames must have a glass of prune brandy too . It was so strengthening . [Swithin]233-swithin was still present , having lingered later than [his]233-swithin wo nt , for [he]233-swithin felt in want of exercise . On hearing this suggestion , [he]233-swithin ' pished . ' [A pretty pass young men]5154-a pretty pass young men were coming to ! [His]233-swithin own liver was out of order , and [he]233-swithin could not bear the thought of [anyone else]5155-anyone else drinking prune brandy . [He]233-swithin went away almost immediately , saying to [Soames]177-soames : "[1092-your wife] And how 's [[your]2089-your wife]1092-your wife ? [You]2089-your tell [her]1092-your wife from [me]0-i that if [she]1092-your wife 's dull , and likes to come and dine with [me]0-i quietly , [I]0-i 'll give [her]1092-your wife such a bottle of champagne as [she]1092-your wife does n't get every day . " Staring down from [his]233-swithin height on [Soames]177-soames [he]233-swithin contracted [his]233-swithin thick , puffy , yellow hand as though squeezing within it all this small fry , and throwing out [his]233-swithin chest [he]233-swithin waddled slowly away . [Mrs. Small]177-soames and [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester were left horrified . [Swithin]233-swithin was so droll ! [They]5156-they [themselves]5156-they were longing to ask [Soames]177-soames how [Irene]186-irene would take the result , yet knew that [they]5156-they must not ; [he]233-swithin would perhaps say something of [his]233-swithin own accord , to throw some light on this , the present burning question in [their]5156-they lives , the question that from necessity of silence tortured [them]5156-they almost beyond bearing ; for even [Timothy]170-timothy had now been told , and the effect on [his]170-timothy health was little short of alarming . And what , too , would [June]166-june do ? This , also , was a most exciting , if dangerous speculation ! [They]5156-they had never forgotten [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's visit , since when [he]167-young jolyon had not once been to see [them]5156-they ; [they]5156-they had never forgotten the feeling it gave [all who were present]5157-all who were present , that [the family]450-the family was no longer what it had been - that [the family]450-the family was breaking up . But [Soames]177-soames gave [them]5156-they no help , sitting with [his]233-swithin knees crossed , talking of [the Barbizon school of painters]5160-the barbizon school of painters , whom [he]233-swithin had just discovered . [These]5156-they were [the coming men]5161-the coming men , [he]233-swithin said ; [he]233-swithin should not wonder if a lot of money were made over [them]5156-they ; [he]233-swithin had [his]233-swithin eye on two pictures by [a man called [Corot]418-corot]5162-a man called corot , charming things ; if [he]233-swithin could get them at a reasonable price [he]233-swithin was going to buy them - they would , [he]233-swithin thought , fetch a big price some day . Interested as [they]5156-they could not but be , neither [Mrs. Septimus Small]177-soames nor [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester could entirely acquiesce in being thus put off . It was interesting - most interesting - and then [Soames]177-soames was so clever that [they]5156-they were sure [he]233-swithin would do something with those pictures if [anybody]2303-anybody could ; but what was [his]233-swithin plan now that [he]233-swithin had won [his]233-swithin case ; was [he]233-swithin going to leave [London]2-london at once , and live in [the country]2374-the country , or what was [he]233-swithin going to do ? [Soames]177-soames answered that [he]233-swithin did not know , [he]233-swithin thought [they]5156-they should be moving soon . [He]233-swithin rose and kissed [[his]233-swithin aunts]5165-his aunts . No sooner had [Aunt Juley]237-aunt juley received this emblem of departure than a change came over [her]237-aunt juley , as though [she]237-aunt juley were being visited by dreadful courage ; every little roll of flesh on [her]237-aunt juley face seemed trying to escape from an invisible , confining mask . [She]237-aunt juley rose to the full extent of [her]237-aunt juley more than medium height , and said : "[0-i] It has been on [my]0-i mind a long time , [dear]2284-dear , and if [nobody else]2294-nobody else will tell [you]2284-dear , [I]0-i have made up [my]0-i mind that .... " [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester interrupted [her]176-juley : "[0-i] Mind , [Julia]176-juley , [you]176-juley do it .... " [she]237-aunt juley gasped - "[176-juley] on [your]176-juley own responsibility ! " [Mrs. Small]177-soames went on as though [she]177-soames had not heard : "[0-i] [I]0-i think [you]2284-dear ought to know , [dear]2284-dear , that [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander saw [Irene]186-irene walking in [Richmond Park]113-richmond park with [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney . " [Aunt Hester , who had also risen]181-aunt hester , sank back in [her]181-aunt hester chair , and turned [her]181-aunt hester face away . [Really Juley]237-aunt juley was too - [she]237-aunt juley should not do such things when [she]181-aunt hester - [Aunt Hester]181-aunt hester , was in [the room]488-the room ; and , breathless with anticipation , [she]237-aunt juley waited for what [Soames]177-soames would answer . [He]168-bosinney had flushed the peculiar flush which always centred between [his]168-bosinney eyes ; lifting [his]168-bosinney hand , and , as it were , selecting a finger , [he]168-bosinney bit a nail delicately ; then , drawling it out between set lips , [he]168-bosinney said : "[378-mrs. macander] [Mrs. MacAnder]378-mrs. macander is a cat ! " Without waiting for any reply , [he]168-bosinney left [the room]488-the room . When [he]168-bosinney went into [Timothy]170-timothy 's [he]168-bosinney had made up [his]168-bosinney mind what course to pursue on getting [home]436-home . [He]168-bosinney would go up to [Irene]186-irene and say : "[378-mrs. macander] Well , [I]0-i 've won [my]0-i case , and there 's an end of it ! [I]0-i do n't want to be hard on [Bosinney]316-james ; [I]0-i 'll see if [we]2094-we ca n't come to some arrangement ; [he]316-james sha n't be pressed . And now let 's turn over a new leaf ! [We]2094-we 'll let [the house]2326-the house , and get out of these fogs . [We]2094-we 'll go down to [Robin Hill]53-robin hill at once . [I]0-i - [I]0-i never meant to be rough with [you]2096-you ! Let 's shake hands - and - " Perhaps [she]186-irene would let [him]168-bosinney kiss [her]186-irene , and forget ! When [he]168-bosinney came out of [Timothy]170-timothy 's [his]168-bosinney intentions were no longer so simple . The smouldering jealousy and suspicion of months blazed up within [him]168-bosinney . [He]168-bosinney would put an end to that sort of thing once and for all ; [he]168-bosinney would not have [her]186-irene drag [his]168-bosinney name in the dirt ! If [she]186-irene could not or would not love [him]168-bosinney , as was [her]186-irene duty and [his]168-bosinney right - [she]186-irene should not play [him]168-bosinney tricks with [anyone else]5155-anyone else ! [He]168-bosinney would tax [her]186-irene with it ; threaten to divorce [her]186-irene ! That would make [her]186-irene behave ; [she]186-irene would never face that . But - but - what if [she]186-irene did ? [He]168-bosinney was staggered ; this had not occurred to [him]168-bosinney . What if [she]186-irene did ? What if [she]186-irene made [him]168-bosinney a confession ? How would [he]168-bosinney stand then ? [He]168-bosinney would have to bring a divorce ! A divorce ! Thus close , the word was paralyzing , so utterly at variance with all the principles that had hitherto guided [his]168-bosinney life . Its lack of compromise appalled [him]168-bosinney ; [he]168-bosinney felt - like [the captain of [a ship]5171-a ship , going to the side of [[his]168-bosinney vessel]5172-his vessel]5170-the captain of a ship , going to the side of his vessel , and , with [his]168-bosinney own hands throwing over the most precious of [his]168-bosinney bales . This jettisoning of [[his]168-bosinney property]2604-his property with [his]168-bosinney own hand seemed uncanny to [Soames]177-soames . It would injure [him]168-bosinney in [his]168-bosinney profession : [He]168-bosinney would have to get rid of [the house at [Robin Hill]53-robin hill]3372-the house at robin hill , on which [he]168-bosinney had spent so much money , so much anticipation - and at a sacrifice . And [she]5175-her ! [She]5175-her would no longer belong to [him]168-bosinney , not even in name ! [She]5175-her would pass out of [his]168-bosinney life , and [he]168-bosinney - [he]168-bosinney should never see [her]5175-her again ! [He]168-bosinney traversed in the cab the length of [a street]5176-a street without getting beyond the thought that [he]168-bosinney should never see [her]5175-her again ! But perhaps there was nothing to confess , even now very likely there was nothing to confess . Was it wise to push things so far ? Was it wise to put [himself]168-bosinney into a position where [he]168-bosinney might have to eat [his]168-bosinney words ? The result of this case would ruin [Bosinney]168-bosinney ; [a ruined man]5177-a ruined man was desperate , but - what could [he]168-bosinney do ? [He]168-bosinney might go abroad , [ruined men]5178-ruined men always went [abroad]5179-abroad . What could [they]5178-ruined men do - if indeed it was ' [they]5178-ruined men ' - without money ? It would be better to wait and see how things turned out . If necessary , [he]168-bosinney could have [her]5175-her watched . The agony of [his]168-bosinney jealousy for all [the world]2286-the world like the crisis of an aching tooth came on again ; and [he]168-bosinney almost cried out . But [he]168-bosinney must decide , fix on some course of action before [he]168-bosinney got [home]436-home . When [the cab]2463-the cab drew up at the door , [he]168-bosinney had decided nothing . [He]168-bosinney entered , pale , [his]168-bosinney hands moist with perspiration , dreading to meet [her]5175-her , burning to meet [her]5175-her , ignorant of what [he]168-bosinney was to say or do . [The maid Bilson]296-bilson was in [the hall]2543-the hall , and in answer to [his]2097-his question : "[0-i] Where is [[your]2097-his mistress]2098-your mistress ? " told [him]2097-his that [Mrs. Forsyte]189-nicholas had left [the house]2326-the house about noon , taking with [her]189-nicholas a trunk and bag . Snatching the sleeve of [his]168-bosinney fur coat away from [her]296-bilson grasp , [he]168-bosinney confronted [her]296-bilson : "[2098-your mistress] What ? " [he]168-bosinney exclaimed ; "[2098-your mistress] what 's that [you]2098-your mistress said ? " Suddenly recollecting that [he]168-bosinney must not betray emotion , [he]168-bosinney added : "[2098-your mistress] What message did [she]2098-your mistress leave ? " and noticed with secret terror the startled look of [the maid]2855-the maid 's eyes . "[2098-your mistress] [Mrs. Forsyte]189-nicholas left no message , [sir]730-sir . " "[189-nicholas] No message ; very well , thank [you]730-sir , that will do . [I]0-i shall be dining out . " [The maid]2855-the maid went [downstairs]3086-downstairs , leaving [him]168-bosinney still in [his]168-bosinney fur coat , idly turning over the visiting cards in the porcelain bowl that stood on the carved oak rug chest in [the hall]2543-the hall . [Mr.]5189-mr. and [Mrs. Bareham Culcher]419-mrs. bareham culcher . [Mrs. Septimus Small]177-soames . [Mrs. Baynes]203-mrs. baynes . [Mr. Solomon Thornworthy]420-mr. solomon thornworthy . [Lady Bellis]421-lady bellis . [Miss Hermione Bellis]422-miss hermione bellis . [Miss Winifred Bellis]423-winifred . [Miss Ella Bellis]424-miss ella bellis . Who the devil were [all these people]5190-all these people ? [He]168-bosinney seemed to have forgotten all familiar things . The words ' no message - a trunk , and a bag , ' played a hide - and - seek in [his]168-bosinney brain . It was incredible that [she]2855-the maid had left no message , and , still in [his]168-bosinney fur coat , [he]168-bosinney ran [upstairs]2967-upstairs two steps at a time , as [a young married man]5192-a young married man when [he]168-bosinney comes [home]436-home will run up to [[[his]168-bosinney wife]558-his wife 's room]3044-his wife 's room . Everything was dainty , fresh , sweet - smelling ; everything in perfect order . On the great bed with [its]5196-its lilac silk quilt , was the bag [she]2855-the maid had made and embroidered with [her]2855-the maid own hands to hold [her]2855-the maid sleeping things ; [her]2855-the maid slippers ready at the foot ; the sheets even turned over at the head as though expecting [her]2855-the maid . On the table stood the silver - mounted brushes and bottles from [her]2855-the maid dressing bag , [his]168-bosinney own present . There must , then , be some mistake . What bag had [she]2855-the maid taken ? [He]168-bosinney went to the bell to summon [Bilson]296-bilson , but remembered in time that [he]168-bosinney must assume knowledge of where [Irene]186-irene had gone , take it all as a matter of course , and grope out the meaning for [himself]168-bosinney . [He]168-bosinney locked the doors , and tried to think , but felt [his]168-bosinney brain going round ; and suddenly tears forced themselves into [his]168-bosinney eyes . Hurriedly pulling off [his]168-bosinney coat , [he]168-bosinney looked at [himself]168-bosinney in the mirror . [He]168-bosinney was too pale , a greyish tinge all over [his]168-bosinney face ; [he]168-bosinney poured out water , and began feverishly washing . [Her]2855-the maid silver - mounted brushes smelt faintly of the perfumed lotion [she]2855-the maid used for [her]2855-the maid hair ; and at this scent the burning sickness of [his]168-bosinney jealousy seized [him]168-bosinney again . Struggling into [his]168-bosinney fur , [he]168-bosinney ran [downstairs]3086-downstairs and out into [the street]2964-the street . [He]168-bosinney had not lost all command of [himself]168-bosinney , however , and as [he]168-bosinney went down [Sloane Street]5199-sloane street [he]168-bosinney framed a story for use , in case [he]168-bosinney should not find [her]2855-the maid at [[Bosinney]168-bosinney 's]5200-bosinney 's . But if [he]168-bosinney should ? [His]168-bosinney power of decision again failed ; [he]168-bosinney reached [the house]2326-the house without knowing what [he]168-bosinney should do if [he]168-bosinney did find [her]2855-the maid [there]454-there . It was after office hours , and the street door was closed ; [the woman who opened it]5203-the woman who opened it could not say whether [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney were in or no ; [she]5203-the woman who opened it had not seen [him]168-bosinney that day , not for two or three days ; [she]5203-the woman who opened it did not attend to [him]168-bosinney now , [nobody]2292-nobody attended to [him]168-bosinney , [he]168-bosinney .... [Soames]177-soames interrupted [her]5203-the woman who opened it , [he]168-bosinney would go up and see for [himself]168-bosinney . [He]168-bosinney went up with a dogged , white face . [The top floor]3132-the top floor was unlighted , the door closed , [no one]514-no one answered [his]168-bosinney ringing , [he]168-bosinney could hear no sound . [He]168-bosinney was obliged to descend , shivering under [his]168-bosinney fur , a chill at [his]168-bosinney heart . Hailing [a cab]2536-a cab , [he]168-bosinney told [the man]2473-the man to drive to [Park Lane]14-park lane . On the way [he]168-bosinney tried to recollect when [he]168-bosinney had last given [her]5203-the woman who opened it a cheque ; [she]5203-the woman who opened it could not have more than three or four pounds , but there were [her]5203-the woman who opened it jewels ; and with exquisite torture [he]168-bosinney remembered how much money [she]5203-the woman who opened it could raise on these ; enough to take them abroad ; enough for [them]5209-them to live on for months ! [He]168-bosinney tried to calculate ; [the cab]2463-the cab stopped , and [he]168-bosinney got out with the calculation unmade . [The butler]542-the butler asked whether [Mrs. Soames]177-soames was in [the cab]2463-the cab , [the master]4841-the master had told [him]168-bosinney [they]5214-they were both expected to dinner . [Soames]177-soames answered : "[0-i] No . [Mrs. Forsyte]189-nicholas has a cold . " [The butler]542-the butler was sorry . [Soames]177-soames thought [he]542-the butler was looking at [him]542-the butler inquisitively , and remembering that [he]542-the butler was not in dress clothes , asked : "[189-nicholas] Anybody here to dinner , [Warmson]425-warmson ? " "[425-warmson] [Nobody]2292-nobody but [Mr.]2101-mr. and [Mrs. Dartie]362-dartie , [sir]730-sir . [Soames]177-soames walked [upstairs]2967-upstairs . [James]173-james , standing sideways , the concave lines of [his]695-father tall , lean figure displayed to advantage in shirt - sleeves and evening waistcoat , [his]695-father head bent , the end of [his]695-father white tie peeping askew from underneath one white Dundreary whisker , [his]695-father eyes peering with intense concentration , [his]695-father lips pouting , was hooking the top hooks of [[his]695-father wife]558-his wife 's bodice . [Soames]177-soames stopped ; [he]542-the butler felt half - choked , whether because [he]542-the butler had come [upstairs]2967-upstairs too fast , or for some other reason . " [He]542-the butler answered mechanically : "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm all right , " and looked at [them]5228-them , and it seemed impossible to bring out [his]542-the butler news . [James]173-james , quick to take alarm , began : "[0-i] [You]754-my dear boy do n't look well . [I]0-i expect [you]754-my dear boy 've taken a chill - it 's liver , [I]0-i should n't wonder . [[Your]754-my dear boy mother'll]2107-your mother'll give [you]754-my dear boy .... " But [Emily]173-james broke in quietly : "[754-my dear boy] Have [you]754-my dear boy brought [Irene]186-irene ?
