"[173-james] [Emily]173-james deserted the mirror before which [she]173-james was standing . [Her]173-james tall , full figure lost its majesty and became very human as [she]173-james came running over to [Soames]177-soames . " [[My]173-james dear boy]754-my dear boy ! [[My]173-james dear boy]754-my dear boy ! "[173-james] [She]173-james put [her]173-james lips to [his]754-my dear boy forehead , and stroked [his]754-my dear boy hand . [James]173-james , too , had turned full towards [[his]754-my dear boy son]2441-his son ; [his]754-my dear boy face looked older . " Left [you]2441-his son ? "[754-my dear boy] [he]754-my dear boy said . " What d'you mean - left [you]2441-his son ? [You]2441-his son never told [me]754-my dear boy [she]173-james was going to leave [you]2441-his son . "[754-my dear boy] [Soames]177-soames answered surlily : " How could [I]177-soames tell ? What 's to be done ? "[177-soames] [James]173-james began walking up and down ; [he]754-my dear boy looked strange and stork - like without a coat . " What 's to be done ! "[754-my dear boy] [he]754-my dear boy muttered . " How should [I]754-my dear boy know what 's to be done ? What 's the good of asking [me]754-my dear boy ? [Nobody]2292-nobody tells [me]754-my dear boy anything , and then [they]2292-nobody come and ask [me]754-my dear boy what 's to be done ; and [I]754-my dear boy should like to know how [I]754-my dear boy 'm to tell [them]2292-nobody ! Here 's [[your]2441-his son mother]2307-your mother , there [she]2307-your mother stands ; [she]2307-your mother does n't say anything . What [I]754-my dear boy should say [you]2441-his son 've got to do is to follow [her]2307-your mother .. "[754-my dear boy] [Soames]177-soames smiled ; [his]754-my dear boy peculiar , supercilious smile had never before looked pitiable . " [I]754-my dear boy do n't know where [she]2307-your mother 's gone , "[754-my dear boy] [he]754-my dear boy said . " Do n't know where [she]2307-your mother 's gone ! "[173-james] said [James]173-james . " How [d'you]2441-his son mean , do n't know where [she]2307-your mother 's gone ? Where [d'you]2441-his son suppose [she]2307-your mother 's gone ? [She]2307-your mother 's gone after [that young Bosinney]2087-that young bosinney , that 's where [she]2307-your mother 's gone . [I]173-james knew how it would be . "[173-james] [Soames]177-soames , in the long silence that followed , felt [[his]754-my dear boy mother]2511-his mother pressing [his]754-my dear boy hand . And all that passed seemed to pass as though [his]754-my dear boy own power of thinking or doing had gone to sleep . [[His]754-my dear boy father]559-his father 's face , dusky red , twitching as if [he]559-his father were going to cry , and words breaking out that seemed rent from [him]559-his father by some spasm in [his]559-his father soul . " There 'll be a scandal ; [I]514-no one always said so . "[514-no one] Then , [no one]514-no one saying anything : " And there [you]754-my dear boy stand , [you]754-my dear boy and [[your]754-my dear boy mother]2307-your mother ! "[514-no one] And [Emily]173-james 's voice , calm , rather contemptuous : " Come , now , [James]173-james ! [Soames]177-soames will do all that [he]559-his father can . "[173-james] And [James]173-james , staring at the floor , a little brokenly : " Well , [I]173-james ca n't help [you]754-my dear boy ; [I]173-james 'm getting old . Do n't [you]754-my dear boy be in too great a hurry , [[my]173-james boy]744-my boy . "[173-james] And [[his]559-his father mother]2511-his mother 's voice again : " [Soames]177-soames will do all [he]559-his father can to get [her]173-james back . [We]5236-we wo n't talk of it . It 'll all come right , [I]2511-his mother dare say . "[2511-his mother] And [James]173-james : " Well , [I]173-james ca n't see how it can come right . And if [she]173-james has n't gone off with [that young Bosinney]2087-that young bosinney , [my]173-james advice to [you]744-my boy is not to listen to [her]173-james , but to follow [her]173-james and get [her]173-james back . "[173-james] Once more [Soames]177-soames felt [[his]559-his father mother]2511-his mother stroking [his]559-his father hand , in token of [her]2511-his mother approval , and as though repeating some form of sacred oath , [he]559-his father muttered between [his]559-his father teeth : " [I]559-his father will ! "[559-his father] [All three]3567-all three went down to [the drawing - room]849-the drawing - room together . There , were gathered [the three girls]2116-the three girls and [Dartie]362-dartie ; had [Irene]186-irene been present , [the family]450-the family circle would have been complete . [James]173-james sank into [his]559-his father armchair , and except for a word of cold greeting to [Dartie]362-dartie , whom [he]559-his father both despised and dreaded , as [a man likely to be always in want of money]2118-a man likely to be always in want of money , [he]559-his father said nothing till dinner was announced . [Soames]177-soames , too , was silent ; [Emily]173-james alone , [a woman of cool courage]2119-a woman of cool courage , maintained a conversation with [Winifred]423-winifred on trivial subjects . [She]173-james was never more composed in [her]173-james manner and conversation than that evening . A decision having been come to not to speak of [Irene]186-irene 's flight , no view was expressed by [any other member of [the family]450-the family]2120-any other member of the family as to the right course to be pursued ; there can be little doubt , from the general tone adopted in relation to events as they afterwards turned out , that [James]173-james 's advice : " Do n't [you]5238-you listen to [her]186-irene , follow - [her]186-irene and get [her]186-irene back ! "[173-james] would , with here and there an exception , have been regarded as sound , not only in [Park Lane]14-park lane , but amongst [the Nicholases]313-the little nicholases , [the Rogers]2122-the rogers , and at [Timothy]170-timothy 's . Just as it would surely have been endorsed by [that wider body of Forsytes all over [London]2-london]2123-that wider body of forsytes all over london , who were merely excluded from judgment by ignorance of the story . In spite then of [Emily]173-james 's efforts , the dinner was served by [Warmson]425-warmson and [the footman]2124-the footman almost in silence . [Dartie]362-dartie was sulky , and drank all [he]2125-he could get ; [the girls]2719-the girls seldom talked to [each other]2556-each other at any time . [James]173-james asked once where [June]166-june was , and what [she]166-june was doing with [herself]166-june in these days . [No one]514-no one could tell [him]2129-he . [He]2129-he sank back into gloom . Only when [Winifred]423-winifred recounted how [little Publius]356-little publius had given [his]356-little publius bad penny to [a beggar]2130-a beggar , did [he]2129-he brighten up . " Ah ! "[2129-he] [he]2129-he said , " that 's [a clever little chap]5239-a clever little chap . [I]2129-he do n't know what 'll become of [him]5239-a clever little chap , if [he]5239-a clever little chap goes on like this . [An intelligent little chap]5240-an intelligent little chap , [I]2129-he call [him]5239-a clever little chap ! "[2129-he] But it was only a flash . The courses succeeded one another solemnly , under the electric light , which glared down onto the table , but barely reached the principal ornament of the walls , a so - called ' Sea Piece by [Turner]427-turner , ' almost entirely composed of [cordage and drowning men]2131-cordage and drowning men . Champagne was handed , and then a bottle of [James]173-james ' prehistoric port , but as by the chill hand of [some skeleton]2132-some skeleton . At ten o'clock [Soames]177-soames left ; twice in reply to questions , [he]2129-he had said that [Irene]186-irene was not well ; [he]2129-he felt [he]2129-he could no longer trust [himself]2129-he . [[His]2129-he mother]2511-his mother kissed [him]2129-he with [her]2511-his mother large soft kiss , and [he]2129-he pressed [her]2511-his mother hand , a flush of warmth in [his]2129-he cheeks . [He]2129-he walked away in the cold wind , which whistled desolately round the corners of [the streets]2464-the streets , under a sky of clear steel - blue , alive with stars ; [he]2129-he noticed neither [their]2135-their frosty greeting , nor the crackle of the curled - up plane - leaves , nor the night - women hurrying in [their]2135-their shabby furs , nor the pinched faces of vagabonds at [street corners]2136-street corners . Winter was come ! But [Soames]177-soames hastened [home]436-home , oblivious ; [his]2129-he hands trembled as [he]2129-he took the late letters from the gilt wire cage into which [they]2135-their had been thrust through the slit in the door . ' None from [Irene]186-irene ! [He]2129-he went into [the dining - room]2449-the dining - room ; the fire was bright there , [his]2129-he chair drawn up to it , slippers ready , spirit case , and carven cigarette box on the table ; but after staring at it all for a minute or two , [he]2129-he turned out the light and went [upstairs]2967-upstairs . There was a fire too in [[his]2129-he dressing - room]3164-his dressing - room , but [[her]186-irene room]2872-her room was dark and cold . It was into [this room]2350-this room that [Soames]177-soames went . [He]2129-he made a great illumination with candles , and for a long time continued pacing up and down between the bed and the door . [He]2129-he could not get used to the thought that [she]186-irene had really left [him]2129-he , and as though still searching for some message , some reason , some reading of all the mystery of [his]2129-he married life , [he]2129-he began opening every recess and drawer . There were [her]186-irene dresses ; [he]2129-he had always liked , indeed insisted , that [she]186-irene should be well - dressed - [she]186-irene had taken very few ; two or three at most , and drawer after drawer ; full of linen and silk things , was untouched . Perhaps after all it was only a freak , and [she]186-irene had gone to [the seaside]1660-the seaside for a few days ' change . If only that were so , and [she]186-irene were really coming back , [he]2129-he would never again do as [he]2129-he had done that fatal night before last , never again run that risk - though it was [her]186-irene duty , [her]186-irene duty as [a wife]2821-a wife ; though [she]186-irene did belong to [him]2129-he - [he]2129-he would never again run that risk ; [she]186-irene was evidently not quite right in [her]186-irene head ! [He]2129-he stooped over the drawer where [she]186-irene kept [her]186-irene jewels ; it was not locked , and came open as [he]2129-he pulled ; the jewel box had the key in it . This surprised [him]2129-he until [he]2129-he remembered that it was sure to be empty . [He]2129-he opened it . It was far from empty . Divided , in little green velvet compartments , were all the things [he]2129-he had given [her]186-irene , even [her]186-irene watch , and stuck into the recess that contained - the watch was a three - cornered note addressed ' [Soames Forsyte]171-soames , ' in [Irene]186-irene 's handwriting : ' [I]0-i think [I]0-i have taken nothing that [you]2129-he or [[your]2129-he people]946-your people have given [me]0-i . ' And that was all . [He]2129-he looked at the clasps and bracelets of diamonds and pearls , at the little flat gold watch with a great diamond set in sapphires , at the chains and rings , each in its nest , and the tears rushed up in [his]2129-he eyes and dropped upon them . Nothing that [she]186-irene could have done , nothing that [she]186-irene had done , brought home to [him]2129-he like this the inner significance of [her]186-irene act . For the moment , perhaps , [he]2129-he understood nearly all there was to understand - understood that [she]186-irene loathed [him]2129-he , that [she]186-irene had loathed [him]2129-he for years , that for all intents and purposes [they]2146-they were like [people living in different worlds]2147-people living in different worlds , that there was no hope for [him]2129-he , never had been ; even , that [she]186-irene had suffered - that [she]186-irene was to be pitied . In that moment of emotion [he]2129-he betrayed [the Forsyte]171-soames in [him]2129-he - forgot [himself]2129-he , [his]2129-he interests , [his]2129-he property - was capable of almost anything ; was lifted into the pure ether of the selfless and unpractical . Such moments pass quickly . And as though with the tears [he]2129-he had purged [himself]2129-he of weakness , [he]2129-he got up , locked the box , and slowly , almost trembling , carried it with [him]2129-he into [the other room]2148-the other room . CHAPTER VII - JUNE 'S VICTORY [June]166-june had waited for [her]166-june chance , scanning the duller columns of the journals , morning and evening with an assiduity which at first puzzled [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon ; and when [her]166-june chance came , [she]166-june took it with all the promptitude and resolute tenacity of [her]166-june character . [She]166-june will always remember best in [her]166-june life that morning when at last [she]166-june saw amongst the reliable Cause List of the Times newspaper , under the heading of Court XIII , [Mr. Justice Bentham]408-mr. justice bentham , the case of [Forsyte v. Bosinney]273-bosinney . Like [a gambler who stakes [his]2149-a gambler who stakes his last piece of money last piece of money]2149-a gambler who stakes his last piece of money , [she]166-june had prepared to hazard [her]166-june all upon this throw ; it was not [her]166-june nature to contemplate defeat . How , unless with the instinct of [a woman in love]2150-a woman in love , [she]166-june knew that [Bosinney]273-bosinney 's discomfiture in this action was assured , can not be told - on this assumption , however , [she]166-june laid [her]166-june plans , as upon a certainty . Half past eleven found [her]166-june at watch in [the gallery of Court XIII]2151-the gallery of court xiii . , and there [she]166-june remained till the case of Forsyte v. [Bosinney]273-bosinney was over . [Bosinney]273-bosinney 's absence did not disquiet [her]166-june ; [she]166-june had felt instinctively that [he]273-bosinney would not defend [himself]273-bosinney . At the end of the judgment [she]166-june hastened down , and took a cab to [[his]273-bosinney rooms]2613-his rooms . [She]166-june passed the open street - door and [the offices]2153-the offices on [the three lower floors]2154-the three lower floors without attracting notice ; not till [she]166-june reached the top did [her]166-june difficulties begin . [Her]166-june ring was not answered ; [she]166-june had now to make up [her]166-june mind whether [she]166-june would go down and ask [the caretaker in [the basement]2579-the basement]2155-the caretaker in the basement to let [her]166-june in to await [Mr. Bosinney]168-bosinney 's return , or remain patiently outside the door , trusting that [no one]514-no one would , come up . [She]166-june decided on the latter course . A quarter of an hour had passed in freezing vigil on [the landing]4176-the landing , before it occurred to [her]166-june that [Bosinney]168-bosinney had been used to leave the key of [[his]273-bosinney rooms]2613-his rooms under the door - mat . [She]166-june looked and found it there . For some minutes [she]166-june could not decide to make use of it ; at last [she]166-june let [herself]166-june in and left the door open that [anyone who came]2160-anyone who came might see [she]166-june was there on business . This was not [the same June who had paid the trembling visit five months ago]2161-the same june who had paid the trembling visit five months ago ; those months of suffering and restraint had made [her]166-june less sensitive ; [she]166-june had dwelt on this visit so long , with such minuteness , that its terrors were discounted beforehand . [She]166-june was not there to fail this time , for if [she]166-june failed [no one]514-no one could help [her]166-june . Like [some mother beast on the watch over [[her]166-june young]2164-her young]2163-some mother beast on the watch over her young , [her]166-june little quick figure never stood still in [that room]2165-that room , but wandered from wall to wall , from window to door , fingering now one thing , now another . There was dust everywhere , [the room]488-the room could not have been cleaned for weeks , and [June]166-june , quick to catch at anything that should buoy up [her]166-june hope , saw in it a sign that [he]2167-his had been obliged , for economy 's sake , to give up [[his]2167-his servant]2168-his servant . [She]166-june looked into [the bedroom]2971-the bedroom ; the bed was roughly made , as though by the hand of [man]956-man . Listening intently , [she]166-june darted in , and peered into [his]2167-his cupboards . A few shirts and collars , a pair of muddy boots - [the room]488-the room was bare even of garments . [She]166-june stole back to [the sitting - room]2172-the sitting - room , and now [she]166-june noticed the absence of all the little things [he]2167-his had set store by . The clock that had been [[his]2167-his mother]2511-his mother 's , the field - glasses that had hung over the sofa ; two really valuable old prints of [Harrow]145-harrow , where [[his]2167-his father]559-his father had been at [school]2520-school , and last , not least , the piece of Japanese pottery [she]166-june [herself]166-june had given [him]2167-his . All were gone ; and in spite of the rage roused within [her]166-june championing soul at the thought that [the world]2286-the world should treat [him]2167-his thus , [their]2177-their disappearance augured happily for the success of [her]166-june plan . It was while looking at the spot where the piece of Japanese pottery had stood that [she]166-june felt a strange certainty of being watched , and , turning , saw [Irene]186-irene in the open doorway . [The two]2453-the two stood gazing at [each other]2556-each other for a minute in silence ; then [June]166-june walked forward and held out [her]166-june hand . [Irene]186-irene did not take it . When [her]186-irene hand was refused , [June]166-june put it behind [her]186-irene . [Her]186-irene eyes grew steady with anger ; [she]186-irene waited for [Irene]186-irene to speak ; and thus waiting , took in , with who - knows - what rage of jealousy , suspicion , and curiosity , every detail of [[her]186-irene friend]2861-her friend 's face and dress and figure . [Irene]186-irene was clothed in [her]186-irene long grey fur ; the travelling cap on [her]186-irene head left a wave of gold hair visible above [her]186-irene forehead . The soft fullness of the coat made [her]186-irene face as small as [a child]2366-a child 's . Unlike [June]166-june 's cheeks , [her]186-irene cheeks had no colour in them , but were ivory white and pinched as if with cold . Dark circles lay round [her]186-irene eyes . In one hand [she]186-irene held a bunch of violets . [She]186-irene looked back at [June]166-june , no smile on [her]186-irene lips ; and with those great dark eyes fastened on [her]186-irene , [the girl]595-the girl , for all [her]595-the girl startled anger , felt something of the old spell . [She]186-irene spoke first , after all . " What have [you]166-june come for ? "[186-irene] But the feeling that [she]186-irene [herself]186-irene was being asked the same question , made [her]186-irene add : " This horrible case . [I]186-irene came to tell [him]5241-him - [he]5241-him has lost it . "[186-irene] [Irene]186-irene did not speak , [her]186-irene eyes never moved from [June]166-june 's face , and [the girl]595-the girl cried : " Do n't stand there as if [you]166-june were made of stone ! "[595-the girl] [Irene]186-irene laughed : " [I]186-irene wish to [God]304-god [I]186-irene were ! "[186-irene] But [June]166-june turned away : " Stop ! "[166-june] [she]166-june cried , " do n't tell [me]166-june ! [I]166-june do n't want to hear ! [I]166-june do n't want to hear what [you]166-june 've come for . [I]166-june do n't want to hear ! "[166-june] And like some uneasy spirit , [she]166-june began swiftly walking to and fro . Suddenly [she]166-june broke out : " [I]166-june was here first . [We]5242-we ca n't both stay here together ! "[166-june] On [Irene]186-irene 's face a smile wandered up , and died out like a flicker of firelight . [She]186-irene did not move . And then it was that [June]166-june perceived under the softness and immobility of this figure something desperate and resolved ; something not to be turned away , something dangerous . [She]186-irene tore off [her]186-irene hat , and , putting both hands to [her]186-irene brow , pressed back the bronze mass of [her]186-irene hair . " [You]166-june have no right here ! "[186-irene] [she]186-irene cried defiantly . [Irene]186-irene answered : " [I]186-irene have no right anywhere ! "[186-irene] What do [you]186-irene mean ? " "[186-irene] [I]0-i have left [Soames]164-soames . [You]186-irene always wanted [me]0-i to ! " [June]166-june put [her]166-june hands over [her]166-june ears . "[186-irene] Do n't ! [I]0-i do n't want to hear anything - [I]0-i do n't want to know anything . It 's impossible to fight with [you]186-irene ! What makes [you]186-irene stand like that ? Why do n't [you]186-irene go ? " [Irene]186-irene 's lips moved ; [she]186-irene seemed to be saying : "[186-irene] Where should [I]0-i go ? " [June]166-june turned to the window . [She]166-june could see the face of a clock down in [the street]2964-the street . It was nearly four . At any moment [he]0-i might come ! [She]166-june looked back across [her]166-june shoulder , and [her]166-june face was distorted with anger . But [Irene]186-irene had not moved ; in [her]186-irene gloved hands [she]186-irene ceaselessly turned and twisted the little bunch of violets . The tears of rage and disappointment rolled down [June]166-june 's cheeks . "[186-irene] How could [you]186-irene come ? " [she]186-irene said . "[186-irene] [You]186-irene have been [a false friend to [me]0-i]2184-a false friend to me ! " Again [Irene]186-irene laughed . [June]166-june saw that [she]186-irene had played a wrong card , and broke down . "[186-irene] Why have [you]186-irene come ? " [she]186-irene sobbed . "[186-irene] [You]186-irene 've ruined [my]0-i life , and now [you]186-irene want to ruin [his]2185-his ! " [Irene]186-irene 's mouth quivered ; [her]186-irene eyes met [June]166-june 's with a look so mournful that [the girl]595-the girl cried out in the midst of [her]595-the girl sobbing , "[186-irene] No , no ! " But [Irene]186-irene 's head bent till it touched [her]186-irene breast . [She]186-irene turned , and went quickly out , hiding [her]186-irene lips with the little bunch of violets . [June]166-june ran to the door . [She]166-june heard the footsteps going down and down . [She]166-june called out : "[186-irene] Come back , [Irene]186-irene ! Come back ! " The footsteps died away .... Bewildered and torn , [the girl]595-the girl stood at the top of the stairs . Why had [Irene]186-irene gone , leaving [[her]186-irene mistress of [the field]524-the field]5246-her mistress of the field ? What did it mean ? Had [she]186-irene really given [him]2185-his up to [her]186-irene ? Or had [she]186-irene ... ? And [she]186-irene was the prey of a gnawing uncertainty [.... Bosinney]168-bosinney did not come .... About six o'clock that afternoon [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon returned from [Wistaria Avenue]34-wistaria avenue , where now almost every day [he]167-young jolyon spent some hours , and asked if [[his]167-young jolyon grand - daughter]3889-his grand - daughter were [upstairs]2967-upstairs . On being told that [she]3889-his grand - daughter had just come in , [he]167-young jolyon sent up to [[her]3889-his grand - daughter room]2872-her room to request [her]3889-his grand - daughter to come down and speak to [him]167-young jolyon . [He]167-young jolyon had made up [his]167-young jolyon mind to tell [her]3889-his grand - daughter that [he]167-young jolyon was reconciled with [[her]3889-his grand - daughter father]712-her father . In future bygones must be bygones . [He]167-young jolyon would no longer live alone , or practically alone , in [this great house]5252-this great house ; [he]167-young jolyon was going to give it up , and take one in [the country]2374-the country for [[his]167-young jolyon son]2441-his son , where [they]5255-they could all go and live together . If [June]166-june did not like this , [she]166-june could have an allowance and live by [herself]166-june . It would n't make much difference to [her]166-june , for it was a long time since [she]166-june had shown [him]167-young jolyon any affection . But when [June]166-june came down , [her]166-june face was pinched and piteous ; there was a strained , pathetic look in [her]166-june eyes . [She]3889-his grand - daughter snuggled up in [her]3889-his grand - daughter old attitude on the arm of [his]167-young jolyon chair , and what [he]167-young jolyon said compared but poorly with the clear , authoritative , injured statement [he]167-young jolyon had thought out with much care . [His]167-young jolyon heart felt sore , as the great heart of a mother - bird feels sore when its youngling flies and bruises its wing . [His]167-young jolyon words halted , as though [he]167-young jolyon were apologizing for having at last deviated from the path of virtue , and succumbed , in defiance of sounder principles , to [his]167-young jolyon more natural instincts . [He]167-young jolyon seemed nervous lest , in thus announcing [his]167-young jolyon intentions , [he]167-young jolyon should be setting [[his]167-young jolyon granddaughter]2363-his granddaughter a bad example ; and now that [he]167-young jolyon came to the point , [his]167-young jolyon way of putting the suggestion that , if [she]2363-his granddaughter did n't like it , [she]2363-his granddaughter could live by [herself]2363-his granddaughter and lump it , was delicate in the extreme . ' "[186-irene] And if , by any chance , [[my]0-i darling]1160-my darling , " [he]0-i said , "[1160-my darling] [you]1160-my darling found [you]1160-my darling did n't get on - with [them]2187-them , why , [I]0-i could make that all right . [You]1160-my darling could have what [you]1160-my darling liked . [We]2188-we could find [a little flat in [London]2-london where [you]1160-my darling could set up]2189-a little flat in london where you could set up , and [I]0-i could be running to continually . But [the children]3054-the children , " [he]0-i added , "[3054-the children] are dear little things ! " Then , in the midst of this grave , rather transparent , explanation of changed policy , [his]0-i eyes twinkled . "[3054-the children] This 'll astonish [Timothy]170-timothy 's weak nerves . [That precious young thing]2191-that precious young thing will have something to say about this , or [I]0-i 'm [a Dutchman]2192-a dutchman ! " [June]166-june had not yet spoken . Perched thus on the arm of [his]0-i chair , with [her]166-june head above [him]0-i , [her]166-june face was invisible . But presently [he]0-i felt [her]166-june warm cheek against [his]0-i own , and knew that , at all events , there was nothing very alarming in [her]166-june attitude towards [his]0-i news . [He]0-i began to take courage . "[1160-my darling] [You]1160-my darling 'll like [[your]1160-my darling father]3641-your father , " [he]0-i said - "[2497-an amiable chap] [an amiable chap]2497-an amiable chap . " [June]166-june slid down to [his]0-i knee , and [she]166-june in [her]166-june turn began [her]166-june tale . [She]166-june thought it would all go splendidly ; [she]166-june did not see any difficulty , and [she]166-june did not care a bit what [people]600-people thought . "[2195-your stepmother] No " - [June]166-june said - "[2198-he] [he]2198-he was not ; [she]2199-she knew that [he]2198-he was not ! " How did [she]166-june know ? CHAPTER VIII - [BOSINNEY]316-james 'S [DEPARTURE Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon was not given to hasty decisions ; it is probable that [he]163-old jolyon would have continued to think over the purchase of [the house]2326-the house at [Robin Hill]53-robin hill , had not [June]166-june 's face told [him]163-old jolyon that [he]163-old jolyon would have no peace until [he]163-old jolyon acted . At breakfast next morning [she]166-june asked [him]163-old jolyon what time [she]166-june should order [the carriage]2416-the carriage . "[0-i] Carriage ! " [he]163-old jolyon said , with some appearance of innocence ; "[0-i] what for ? [I]0-i 'm not going out ! " [She]166-june answered : "[0-i] If [you]0-i do n't go early , [you]0-i wo n't catch [Uncle James]241-james before [he]241-james goes into [the City]2392-the city . " "[241-james] [James]241-james ! what about [[your]0-i Uncle [James]241-james]1058-your uncle james ? " "[241-james] [The house]2326-the house , " [she]166-june replied , in such a voice that [he]0-i no longer pretended ignorance . "[241-james] [I]0-i 've not made up [my]0-i mind , " [he]0-i said . "[0-i] [You]0-i must ! [You]0-i must ! Oh ! [Gran]353-gran - think of [me]0-i ! " [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon grumbled out : "[353-gran] Think of [you]353-gran - [I]0-i 'm always thinking of [you]353-gran , but [you]353-gran do n't think of [yourself]353-gran ; [you]353-gran do n't think what [you]353-gran 're letting [yourself]353-gran in for . Well , order [the carriage]2416-the carriage at ten ! " At a quarter past [he]0-i was placing [his]0-i umbrella in the stand at [Park Lane]14-park lane - [he]0-i did not choose to relinquish [his]0-i hat and coat ; telling [Warmson]425-warmson that [he]0-i wanted to see [[his]0-i master]3096-his master , [he]0-i went , without being announced , into [the study]5293-the study , and sat down . [James]241-james was still in [the dining - room]2449-the dining - room talking to [Soames]164-soames , who had come round again before breakfast . On hearing who [[his]0-i visitor]5295-his visitor was , [he]0-i muttered nervously : "[2214-he] Now , what 's [he]2214-he want , [I]0-i wonder ? " [He]0-i then got up . "[0-i] Well , " [he]0-i said to [Soames]164-soames , "[0-i] do n't [you]2215-you go doing anything in a hurry . " And suddenly moved to strange softness , [he]0-i muttered to [himself]0-i , "[2219-poor little thing] [Poor little thing]2219-poor little thing , [I]0-i ca n't tell what [she]2216-she was thinking about ! " and went out blowing [his]0-i nose . [We]2221-we do n't see much of [you]2220-you nowadays ! " [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon paid no attention to the remark . "[2221-we] How 's [Emily]173-james ? " [he]0-i asked ; and waiting for no reply , went on "[173-james] [I]0-i 've come to see [you]2220-you about this affair of [young Bosinney]168-bosinney 's . At the end of ten minutes [old Jolyon]271-old jolyon came in . [He]271-old jolyon walked up to the table , and stood there perfectly silent pulling at [his]271-old jolyon long white moustaches . [James]173-james gazed up at [him]271-old jolyon with opening mouth ; [he]2239-my brother had never seen [[his]2239-my brother brother]536-his brother look like this . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon raised [his]163-old jolyon hand , and said slowly : "[0-i] [Young Bosinney]168-bosinney has been run over in the fog and killed . " Then standing above [[his]163-old jolyon brother]536-his brother and [[his]163-old jolyon nephew]3769-his nephew , and looking down at [him]271-old jolyon with [his]163-old jolyon deep eyes : "[168-bosinney] There 's - some - talk - of - suicide , " [he]163-old jolyon said . [James]173-james ' jaw dropped . "[168-bosinney] Suicide ! What should [he]168-bosinney do that for ? " [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon answered sternly : "[168-bosinney] God knows , if [you]2246-you and [[your]2246-you son]2229-your son do n't ! " But [James]173-james did not reply . For [all men of great age]5314-all men of great age , even for all [Forsytes]164-soames , life has had bitter experiences . [The passer - by]5315-the passer - by , who sees [them]5314-all men of great age wrapped in cloaks of custom , wealth , and comfort , would never suspect that such black shadows had fallen on [[their]5314-all men of great age roads]5316-their roads . To [every man of great age]5317-every man of great age - to [Sir Walter Bentham]417-sir walter bentham [himself]417-sir walter bentham - the idea of suicide has once at least been present in [the ante - room of [his]417-sir walter bentham soul]5318-the ante - room of his soul ; on the threshold , waiting to enter , held out from [the inmost chamber]5319-the inmost chamber by some chance reality , some vague fear , some painful hope . To [Forsytes]164-soames that final renunciation of property is hard . Oh ! it is hard ! Seldom - perhaps never - can [they]2248-they achieve , it ; and yet , how near have [they]2248-they not sometimes been ! So even with [James]173-james ! Then in the medley of [his]0-i thoughts , [he]0-i broke out : "[168-bosinney] Why [I]0-i saw it in the paper yesterday : ' Run over in the fog ! ' [They]2248-they did n't know [his]0-i name ! " [He]0-i turned from one face to the other in [his]0-i confusion of soul ; but instinctively all the time [he]0-i was rejecting that rumour of suicide . [He]0-i dared not entertain this thought , so against [his]0-i interest , against the interest of [[his]0-i son]2441-his son , of every Forsyte . [He]0-i strove against it ; and as [his]0-i nature ever unconsciously rejected that which it could not with safety accept , so gradually [he]0-i overcame this fear . It was an accident ! It must have been ! [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon broke in on [his]0-i reverie . "[433-death] [Death]433-death was instantaneous . [He]0-i lay all day yesterday at [the hospital]2249-the hospital . There was nothing to tell [them]2248-they who [he]0-i was . [I]0-i am going [there]454-there now ; [you]2251-you and [[your]2251-you son]2229-your son had better come too . " [No one]514-no one opposing this command [he]163-old jolyon led the way from [the room]488-the room . The day was still and clear and bright , and driving over to [Park Lane]14-park lane from [Stanhope Gate]1-stanhope gate , [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon had had [the carriage]2416-the carriage open . Sitting back on the padded cushions , finishing [his]163-old jolyon cigar , [he]163-old jolyon had noticed with pleasure the keen crispness of the air , the bustle of [the cabs]5324-the cabs and [people]600-people ; the strange , almost Parisian , alacrity that the first fine day will bring into [[London]2-london streets]5326-london streets after a spell of fog or rain . And [he]163-old jolyon had felt so happy ; [he]163-old jolyon had not felt like it for months . [His]163-old jolyon confession to [June]166-june was off [his]163-old jolyon mind ; [he]163-old jolyon had the prospect of [[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son 's , above all , of [[his]163-old jolyon grandchildren]3018-his grandchildren 's company in the future - [he]163-old jolyon had appointed to meet [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon at [the Hotch Potch]217-hotch potch that very manning to - discuss it again ; and there was the pleasurable excitement of a coming encounter , a coming victory , over [James]173-james and [the ' man of property ']2224-the ' man of property ' in the matter of [the house]2326-the house . [He]163-old jolyon had [the carriage]2416-the carriage closed now ; [he]163-old jolyon had no heart to look on gaiety ; nor was it right that [Forsytes]164-soames should be seen driving with [an Inspector of Police]5306-an inspector of police . In [that carriage]5333-that carriage [the Inspector]5308-the inspector spoke again of the death : "[2251-you] It was not so very thick - Just there . [The driver]2541-the driver says [the gentleman]2254-the gentleman must have had time to see what [he]2254-the gentleman was about , [he]2254-the gentleman seemed to walk right into it . It appears that [he]2254-the gentleman was very hard up , [we]2255-we found several pawn tickets at [[his]2254-the gentleman rooms]2613-his rooms , [his]2254-the gentleman account at [the bank]2257-the bank is overdrawn , and there 's this case in to - day 's papers ; " [his]163-old jolyon cold blue eyes travelled from one to another of the three Forsytes in [the carriage]2416-the carriage . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon watching from [his]163-old jolyon corner saw [[his]163-old jolyon brother]536-his brother 's face change , and the brooding , worried , look deepen on it . At [the Inspector]5308-the inspector 's words , indeed , all [James]173-james ' doubts and fears revived . Hard - up - pawn - tickets - an overdrawn account ! These words that had all [his]163-old jolyon life been a far - off nightmare to [him]163-old jolyon , seemed to make uncannily real that suspicion of suicide which must on no account be entertained . [He]163-old jolyon sought [[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son 's eye ; but lynx - eyed , taciturn , immovable , [Soames]164-soames gave no answering look . And to [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon watching , divining the league of mutual defence between [them]2255-we , there came an overmastering desire to have [[his]163-old jolyon own son]3000-his own son at [his]163-old jolyon side , as though this visit to [the dead man]5340-the dead man 's body was a battle in which otherwise [he]163-old jolyon must single - handed meet [those two]1666-those two . And the thought of how to keep [June]166-june 's name out of the business kept whirring in [his]163-old jolyon brain . [James]173-james had [[his]163-old jolyon son]2441-his son to support [him]163-old jolyon ! Why should [he]163-old jolyon not send for [Jo]190-jo ? Taking out [his]163-old jolyon card - case , [he]163-old jolyon pencilled the following message : ' Come round at once . [I]2254-the gentleman 've sent [the carriage]2416-the carriage for [you]190-jo . ' On getting out [he]163-old jolyon gave this card to [[his]163-old jolyon coachman]3523-his coachman , telling [him]3523-his coachman to drive - as fast as possible to [the Hotch Potch Club]5345-the hotch potch club , and if [Mr. Jolyon Forsyte]165-old jolyon were there to give [him]163-old jolyon the card and bring [him]163-old jolyon at once . If not there yet , [he]163-old jolyon was to wait till [he]163-old jolyon came . [He]163-old jolyon followed [the others]2691-the others slowly up the steps , leaning on [his]163-old jolyon umbrella , and stood a moment to get [his]163-old jolyon breath . [The Inspector]5308-the inspector said : "[2254-the gentleman] This is [the mortuary]2258-the mortuary , [sir]730-sir . But take [your]730-sir time . " In [the bare , white - walled room]5348-the bare , white - walled room , empty of all but a streak of sunshine smeared along the dustless floor , lay a form covered by a sheet . With a huge steady hand [the Inspector]5308-the inspector took the hem and turned it back . A sightless face gazed up at [them]2691-the others , and on either side of that sightless defiant face [the three Forsytes]164-soames gazed down ; in each one of [them]2691-the others the secret emotions , fears , and pity of [his]163-old jolyon own nature rose and fell like the rising , falling waves of life , whose wish those white walls barred out now for ever from [Bosinney]316-james . And in each one of [them]2691-the others the trend of [his]163-old jolyon nature , the odd essential spring , which moved [him]163-old jolyon in fashions minutely , unalterably different from those of [every other human being]5350-every other human being , forced [him]163-old jolyon to a different attitude of thought . Far from the others , yet inscrutably close , [each]509-each stood thus , alone with death , silent , [his]163-old jolyon eyes lowered . [The Inspector]5308-the inspector asked softly : "[730-sir] [You]730-sir identify [the gentleman]2254-the gentleman , [sir]730-sir ? " [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon raised [his]163-old jolyon head and nodded . [He]163-old jolyon looked at [[his]163-old jolyon brother]536-his brother opposite , at that long lean figure brooding over [the dead man , with face dusky red , and strained grey eyes]5354-the dead man , with face dusky red , and strained grey eyes ; and at the figure of [Soames]164-soames white and still by [[his]163-old jolyon father]559-his father 's side . And all that [he]163-old jolyon had felt against [those two]1666-those two was gone like smoke in the long white presence of [Death]433-death . Whence comes it , how comes it - [Death]433-death ? Sudden reverse of all that goes before ; blind setting forth on a path that leads to where ? Dark quenching of the fire ! The heavy , brutal crushing - out that [all men]5357-all men must go through , keeping [their]5357-all men eyes clear and brave unto the end ! Small and of no import , insects though [they]5357-all men are ! And across [old Jolyon]163-old jolyon 's face there flitted a gleam , for [Soames]164-soames , murmuring to [the Inspector]5308-the inspector , crept noiselessly away . Then suddenly [James]173-james raised [his]2262-his eyes . There was a queer appeal in that suspicious troubled look : "[730-sir] [I]0-i know [I]0-i 'm no match for [you]2262-his , " it seemed to say . And , hunting for handkerchief [he]2262-his wiped [his]2262-his brow ; then , bending sorrowful and lank over [the dead man]5340-the dead man , [he]2262-his too turned and hurried out . [Old Jolyon]163-old jolyon stood , still as death , [his]163-old jolyon eyes fixed on the body . Who shall tell of what [he]163-old jolyon was thinking ? Of [himself]163-old jolyon , when [his]163-old jolyon hair was brown like the hair of [that young fellow dead before [him]163-old jolyon]5360-that young fellow dead before him ? Of [himself]163-old jolyon , with [his]163-old jolyon battle just beginning , the long , long battle [he]163-old jolyon had loved ; the battle that was over for [this young man almost before it had begun]5361-this young man almost before it had begun ? Of [[his]163-old jolyon grand - daughter]3889-his grand - daughter , with [her]3889-his grand - daughter broken hopes ? Of [that other woman]5363-that other woman ? Of the strangeness , and the pity of it ? And the irony , inscrutable , and bitter of that end ? Justice ! There was no justice for [men]550-men , for [they]550-men were ever in the dark ! Or perhaps in [his]163-old jolyon philosophy [he]163-old jolyon thought : Better to be out of , it all ! Better to have done with it , like [this poor youth]5365-this poor youth .... [Some one]5366-some one touched [him]163-old jolyon on the arm . A tear started up and wetted [his]163-old jolyon eyelash . "[0-i] Well , " [he]0-i said , "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm no good here . [I]0-i 'd better be going . [You]2263-you 'll come to [me]0-i as soon as [you]2263-you can , [Jo]190-jo , " and with [his]0-i head bowed [he]0-i went away . It was [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon 's turn to take [his]163-old jolyon stand beside [the dead man]5340-the dead man , round whose fallen body [he]163-old jolyon seemed to see all the Forsytes breathless , and prostrated . The stroke had fallen too swiftly . The forces underlying every tragedy - forces that take no denial , working through cross currents to their ironical end , had met and fused with a thunder - clap , flung out [the victim]5368-the victim , and flattened to the ground all those that stood around . Or so at all events [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon seemed to see [them]5369-them , lying around [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's body . [He]163-old jolyon asked [the Inspector]5308-the inspector to tell [him]163-old jolyon what had happened , and [the latter]2450-the latter , like [a man who does not every day get such a chance]5372-a man who does not every day get such a chance , again detailed such facts as were known . "[2263-you] There 's more here , [sir]730-sir , however , " [he]0-i said , "[730-sir] than meets the eye . [I]0-i do n't believe in suicide , nor in pure accident , [myself]0-i . It 's more likely [I]0-i think that [he]2265-he was suffering under great stress of mind , and took no notice of things about [him]2265-he . Perhaps [you]730-sir can throw some light on these . " [He]163-old jolyon took from [his]163-old jolyon pocket a little packet and laid it on the table . Carefully undoing it , [he]163-old jolyon revealed [a lady]3518-a lady 's handkerchief , pinned through the folds with a pin of discoloured Venetian gold , the stone of which had fallen from the socket . A scent of dried violets rose to [young Jolyon]163-old jolyon 's nostrils . "[730-sir] Found in [his]2265-he breast pocket , " said [the Inspector]5308-the inspector ; "[730-sir] the name has been cut away ! " [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon with difficulty answered : "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm afraid [I]0-i can not help [you]730-sir ! " But vividly there rose before [him]163-old jolyon the face [he]163-old jolyon had seen light up , so tremulous and glad , at [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's coming ! Of [her]3518-a lady [he]163-old jolyon thought more than of [[his]163-old jolyon own daughter]2583-his own daughter , more than of [them]5376-them all - of [her]3518-a lady with the dark , soft glance , the delicate passive face , waiting for [the dead man , waiting even at that moment , perhaps , still and patient in the sunlight]5377-the dead man , waiting even at that moment , perhaps , still and patient in the sunlight . [He]163-old jolyon walked sorrowfully away from [the hospital]2249-the hospital towards [[[his]163-old jolyon father]559-his father 's house]5380-his father 's house , reflecting that this death would break up [the Forsyte family]532-the forsyte family . The stroke had indeed slipped past [their]532-the forsyte family defences into the very wood of [their]532-the forsyte family tree . [They]532-the forsyte family might flourish to all appearance as before , preserving a brave show before the eyes of [London]2-london , but the trunk was dead , withered by the same flash that had stricken down [Bosinney]168-bosinney . And now the saplings would take its place , [each one]5382-each one [a new custodian of the sense of property]5383-a new custodian of the sense of property . [Good forest of [Forsytes]164-soames]5384-good forest of forsytes ! thought [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon - soundest timber of [[our]532-the forsyte family land]5385-our land ! Concerning the cause of this death - [[his]163-old jolyon family]2527-his family would doubtless reject with vigour the suspicion of suicide , which was so compromising ! [They]2527-his family would take it as an accident , a stroke of fate . In [their]2527-his family hearts [they]2527-his family would even feel it an intervention of Providence , a retribution - had not [Bosinney]168-bosinney endangered [their]2527-his family two most priceless possessions , the pocket and the hearth ? And [they]2527-his family would talk of ' that unfortunate accident of [young Bosinney]168-bosinney 's , ' but perhaps [they]2527-his family would not talk - silence might be better ! As for [himself]163-old jolyon , [he]163-old jolyon regarded [the bus - driver]5387-the bus - driver 's account of the accident as of very little value . For [no one so madly in love]5388-no one so madly in love committed suicide for want of money ; nor was [Bosinney]168-bosinney [the sort of fellow to set much store by a financial crisis]5389-the sort of fellow to set much store by a financial crisis . And so [he]163-old jolyon too rejected this theory of suicide , [the dead man]5340-the dead man 's face rose too clearly before [him]163-old jolyon . Gone in the heyday of [his]163-old jolyon summer - and to believe thus that an accident had cut [Bosinney]168-bosinney off in the full sweep of [his]163-old jolyon passion was more than ever pitiful to [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon . Then came a vision of [[Soames]164-soames ' home]5391-soames ' home as it now was , and must be hereafter . The streak of lightning had flashed its clear uncanny gleam on bare bones with grinning spaces between , the disguising flesh was gone .... In [the dining - room at [Stanhope Gate]1-stanhope gate]5392-the dining - room at stanhope gate [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon was sitting alone when [[his]167-young jolyon son]2441-his son came in . [He]167-young jolyon looked very wan in [his]167-young jolyon great armchair . And [his]167-young jolyon eyes travelling round the walls with [their]5394-their pictures of still life , and the masterpiece ' Dutch fishing - boats at Sunset ' seemed as though passing [their]5394-their gaze over [his]167-young jolyon life with its hopes , its gains , its achievements . "[190-jo] Ah ! [Jo]190-jo ! " [he]0-i said , "[190-jo] is that [you]190-jo ? [I]0-i 've told poor [little June]166-june . But that 's not all of it . Are [you]190-jo going to [Soames]164-soames ' ? [She]166-june 's brought it on [herself]166-june , [I]0-i suppose ; but somehow [I]0-i ca n't bear to think of [her]166-june , shut up there - and all alone . " And holding up [his]167-young jolyon thin , veined hand , [he]167-young jolyon clenched it . CHAPTER IX - IRENE 'S RETURN After leaving [James]173-james and [old Jolyon]167-young jolyon in [the mortuary of [the hospital]2249-the hospital]5395-the mortuary of the hospital , [Soames]164-soames hurried aimlessly along [the streets]2464-the streets . The tragic event of [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's death altered the complexion of everything . There was no longer the same feeling that to lose a minute would be fatal , nor would [he]0-i now risk communicating the fact of [[his]0-i wife]558-his wife 's flight to [anyone]879-anyone till the inquest was over . That morning [he]0-i had risen early , before [the postman]5400-the postman came , had taken the first - post letters from the box [himself]0-i , and , though there had been none from [Irene]186-irene , [he]0-i had made an opportunity of telling [Bilson]296-bilson that [[her]296-bilson mistress]2876-her mistress was at [the sea]2321-the sea ; [he]0-i would probably , [he]0-i said , be going down [himself]0-i from Saturday to Monday . This had given [him]0-i time to breathe , time to leave no stone unturned to find [her]186-irene . But now , cut off from taking steps by [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's death - that strange death , to think of which was like putting a hot iron to [his]0-i heart , like lifting a great weight from it - [he]0-i did not know how to pass [his]0-i day ; and [he]0-i wandered here and there through [the streets]2464-the streets , looking at every face [he]0-i met , devoured by a hundred anxieties . And as [he]0-i wandered , [he]0-i thought of [him]0-i who had finished [his]0-i wandering , [his]0-i prowling , and would never haunt [[his]0-i house]3383-his house again . Already in the afternoon [he]0-i passed posters announcing the identity of [the dead man]5340-the dead man , and bought the papers to see what [they]5406-they said . [He]0-i would stop [their]5406-they mouths if [he]0-i could , and [he]0-i went into [the City]2392-the city , and was closeted with [Boulter]377-boulter for a long time . On [his]0-i way [home]436-home , passing the steps of [Jobson 's]191-jobson about half past four , [he]0-i met [George Forsyte]183-george , who held out an evening paper to [Soames]164-soames , saying : "[0-i] Here ! Have [you]2266-you seen this about [the poor Buccaneer]279-the buccaneer ? " [Soames]164-soames answered stonily : "[2266-you] Yes . " [George]183-george stared at [him]164-soames . [He]183-george had never liked [Soames]164-soames ; [he]183-george now held [him]164-soames responsible for [Bosinney]168-bosinney 's death . [Soames]164-soames had done for [him]164-soames - done for [him]164-soames by that act of property that had sent [the Buccaneer]279-the buccaneer to run amok that fatal afternoon . ' [The poor fellow]4997-the poor fellow , ' [he]183-george was thinking , ' was so cracked with jealousy , so cracked for [his]4997-the poor fellow vengeance , that [he]4997-the poor fellow heard nothing of the omnibus in that infernal fog . ' [Soames]164-soames had done for [him]164-soames ! And this judgment was in [George]183-george 's eyes . "[2266-you] [They]2267-they talk of suicide here , " [he]183-george said at last . "[2267-they] That cat wo n't jump . " [Soames]164-soames shook [his]164-soames head . "[2267-they] An accident , " [he]164-soames muttered . Clenching [his]183-george fist on the paper , [George]183-george crammed it into [his]183-george pocket . [He]183-george could not resist a parting shot . "[2267-they] H'mm ! All flourishing at [home]436-home ? Any little [Soameses]434-soameses yet ? " With a face as white as the steps of [Jobson]191-jobson 's , and a lip raised as if snarling , [Soames]164-soames brushed past [him]183-george and was gone .... On reaching [home]436-home , and entering [the little lighted hall]5411-the little lighted hall with [his]183-george latchkey , the first thing that caught [his]183-george eye was [[his]183-george wife]558-his wife 's gold - mounted umbrella lying on the rug chest . Flinging off [his]183-george fur coat , [he]183-george hurried to [the drawing - room]849-the drawing - room . The curtains were drawn for the night , a bright fire of cedar - logs burned in the grate , and by its light [he]183-george saw [Irene]186-irene sitting in [her]186-irene usual corner on the sofa . [He]183-george shut the door softly , and went towards [her]186-irene . [She]186-irene did not move , and did not seem to see [him]183-george . "[434-soameses] So [you]2269-you 've come back ? " [he]183-george said . "[2269-you] Why are [you]2269-you sitting here in the dark ? " Then [he]183-george caught sight of [her]186-irene face , so white and motionless that it seemed as though the blood must have stopped flowing in [her]186-irene veins ; and [her]186-irene eyes , that looked enormous , like the great , wide , startled brown eyes of an owl . Huddled in [her]186-irene grey fur against the sofa cushions , [she]186-irene had a strange resemblance to a captive owl , bunched fir its soft feathers against the wires of a cage . The supple erectness of [her]186-irene figure was gone , as though [she]186-irene had been broken by cruel exercise ; as though there were no longer any reason for being beautiful , and supple , and erect . "[2269-you] So [you]2269-you 've come back , " [he]183-george repeated . [She]186-irene never looked up , and never spoke , the firelight playing over [her]186-irene motionless figure . Suddenly [she]186-irene tried to rise , but [he]183-george prevented [her]186-irene ; it was then that [he]183-george understood . [She]186-irene had come back like an animal wounded to death , not knowing where to turn , not knowing what [she]186-irene was doing . The sight of [her]186-irene figure , huddled in the fur , was enough . [He]183-george knew then for certain that [Bosinney]168-bosinney had been [[her]186-irene lover]554-her lover ; knew that [she]186-irene had seen the report of [his]168-bosinney death - perhaps , like [himself]183-george , had bought a paper at [the draughty corner of [a street]5176-a street]5415-the draughty corner of a street , and read it . [She]186-irene had come back then of [her]186-irene own accord , to the cage [she]186-irene had pined to be free of - and taking in all the tremendous significance of this , [he]183-george longed to cry : "[2269-you] Take [your]2270-your hated body , that [I]0-i love , out of [[my]0-i house]4175-my house ! Take away that pitiful white face , so cruel and soft - before [I]0-i crush it . Get out of [my]0-i sight ; never let [me]0-i see [you]2270-your again ! " And , at those unspoken words , [he]183-george seemed to see [her]186-irene rise and move away , like [a woman in a terrible dream]5417-a woman in a terrible dream , from which [she]186-irene was fighting to awake - rise and go out into the dark and cold , without a thought of [him]183-george , without so much as the knowledge of [his]183-george presence . Then [he]183-george cried , contradicting what [he]183-george had not yet spoken , "[2269-you] No ; stay there ! " And turning away from [her]186-irene , [he]183-george sat down in [his]183-george accustomed chair on the other side of the hearth . [They]5418-they sat in silence . And [Soames]164-soames thought : ' Why is all this ? Why should [I]2269-you suffer so ? What have [I]2269-you done ? It is not [my]2269-you fault ! ' Again [he]183-george looked at [her]186-irene , huddled like a bird that is shot and dying , whose poor breast [you]5419-you see panting as the air is taken from it , whose poor eyes look at [you]5419-you who have shot it , with a slow , soft , unseeing look , taking farewell of all that is good - of the sun , and the air , and its mate . So [they]5418-they sat , by the firelight , in the silence , one on each side of the hearth . And the fume of the burning cedar logs , that [he]183-george loved so well , seemed to grip [Soames]164-soames by the throat till [he]183-george could bear it no longer . And going out into [the hall]2543-the hall [he]183-george flung the door wide , to gulp down the cold air that came in ; then without hat or overcoat went out into [the Square]846-the square . Along [the garden]1015-the garden rails a half - starved cat came rubbing [her]5423-her way towards [him]183-george , and [Soames]164-soames thought : ' Suffering ! when will it cease , [my]2269-you suffering ? ' At a front door across the way was [a man of [his]164-soames acquaintance]5424-a man of his acquaintance named [Rutter]435-rutter , scraping [his]5424-a man of his acquaintance boots , with an air of ' [I]2269-you am [master]3857-master here . ' And [Soames]164-soames walked on . From far in the clear air the bells of [the church]4112-the church where [he]183-george and [Irene]186-irene had been married were pealing in ' practice ' for the advent of [Christ]195-christ , the chimes ringing out above the sound of traffic . [He]164-soames felt a craving for strong drink , to lull [him]164-soames to indifference , or rouse [him]164-soames to fury . If only [he]164-soames could burst out of [himself]164-soames , out of this web that for the first time in [his]164-soames life [he]164-soames felt around [him]164-soames . If only [he]164-soames could surrender to the thought : ' Divorce [her]186-irene - turn [her]186-irene out ! [She]186-irene has forgotten [you]164-soames . Forget [her]186-irene ! ' If only [he]164-soames could surrender to the thought : ' Let [her]186-irene go - [she]186-irene has suffered enough ! ' If only [he]164-soames could surrender to the desire : ' Make [a slave of [her]186-irene]5427-a slave of her - [she]186-irene is in [your]164-soames power ! ' If only even [he]164-soames could surrender to the sudden vision : ' What does it all matter ? ' Forget [himself]164-soames for a minute , forget that it mattered what [he]164-soames did , forget that whatever [he]164-soames did [he]164-soames must sacrifice something . If only [he]164-soames could act on an impulse ! [He]164-soames could forget nothing ; surrender to no thought , vision , or desire ; it was all too serious ; too close around [him]164-soames , an unbreakable cage . On the far side of [the Square]846-the square [newspaper boys]5429-newspaper boys were calling [their]5429-newspaper boys evening wares , and the ghoulish cries mingled and jangled with the sound of those church bells . [Soames]164-soames covered [his]164-soames ears . The thought flashed across [him]164-soames that but for a chance , [he]164-soames [himself]164-soames , and not [Bosinney]168-bosinney , might be lying dead , and [she]186-irene , instead of crouching there like a shot bird with those dying eyes .... Something soft touched [his]164-soames legs , the cat was rubbing [herself]186-irene against them . And a sob that shook [him]164-soames from head to foot burst from [Soames]164-soames ' chest . Then all was still again in the dark , where [the houses]2332-the houses seemed to stare at [him]164-soames , each with [a master]5431-a master and [mistress of its own]5432-mistress of its own , and a secret story of happiness or sorrow . And suddenly [he]164-soames saw that [his]164-soames own door was open , and black against the light from [the hall]2543-the hall [a man]515-a man standing with [his]515-a man back turned . Something slid too in [his]164-soames breast , and [he]164-soames stole up close behind . [He]164-soames could see [his]164-soames own fur coat flung across the carved oak chair ; the Persian rugs ; the silver bowls , the rows of porcelain plates arranged along the walls , and [this unknown man who was standing there]5435-this unknown man who was standing there . And sharply [he]164-soames asked : "[2269-you] What is it [you]2272-you want , [sir]730-sir ? " [The visitor]5436-the visitor turned . [It]5436-the visitor was [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon . "[730-sir] The door was open , " [he]164-soames said . "[730-sir] Might [I]0-i see [[your]730-sir wife]1092-your wife for a minute , [I]0-i have a message for [her]1092-your wife ? " [Soames]164-soames gave [him]164-soames a strange , sidelong stare . "[0-i] [[My]0-i wife]1017-my wife can see [no one]514-no one , " [he]0-i muttered doggedly . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon answered gently : "[0-i] [I]0-i should n't keep [her]1092-your wife a minute . " [Soames]164-soames brushed by [him]164-soames and barred the way . "[1092-your wife] [She]1092-your wife can see [no one]514-no one , " [he]164-soames said again . [Young Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's glance shot past [him]164-soames into [the hall]2543-the hall , and [Soames]164-soames turned . There in [the drawing - room]849-the drawing - room doorway stood [Irene]186-irene , [her]186-irene eyes were wild and eager , [her]186-irene lips were parted , [her]186-irene hands outstretched . In the sight of [both men]3377-both men that light vanished from [her]186-irene face ; [her]186-irene hands dropped to [her]186-irene sides ; [she]186-irene stood like stone . [Soames]164-soames spun round , and met [[his]164-soames visitor]5295-his visitor 's eyes , and at the look [he]164-soames saw in [them]5441-them , a sound like a snarl escaped [him]164-soames . [He]164-soames drew [his]164-soames lips back in the ghost of a smile . "[1092-your wife] This is [[my]0-i house]4175-my house , " [he]0-i said ; "[0-i] [I]0-i manage [my]0-i own affairs . [I]0-i 've told [you]2279-you once - [I]0-i tell [you]2279-you again ; [we]2280-we are not at [home]436-home . " And in [young Jolyon]167-young jolyon 's face [he]0-i slammed the door . 213
